##

2018-01-19 01:24:49
Semanti Paul
42843175
4.5
Peter Cat, located bang in the heart of Park Street, just along the alley beside Flurys, is one of the most famous restaurants in Park Street. Known for its unique Chelo Kabab, which no other restaurant has been quite able to reproduce, the place attracts a number of foodies all day long. And so there is always a queue to get in as bookings are not taken. But I must say, the wait is worth it.
The inside is dimly lit. There are two floors and the overall seating capacity must go well over a hundred. We were a group of nine people and so we ordered Chelo Kababs (Classic) for each one of us, a Vegetable Steak Sizzler and Fresh Lime Sodas.
The quality of the Chelo Kabab well justifies the hype surrounding it. The soft pieces of meat, the buttered rice, the fried egg on top, all of the items were beautifully cooked. It was a gastronomical delight. The sizzler was tasty as well, but the Chelo Kabab is what Park Street is famous for, and that is what people should always eat here.
The prices are on the higher end, obviously, but that cannot be complained about when we take into consideration the legacy of the restaurant and the amazing food.
Definitely coming back!

2018-01-18 21:57:15

4.0
Peter Cat has been around for decades & that speaks a lot. For people from Kolkata, Peter Cat food is as favorite as mom made food. That is the kind of love they have for this place. They enjoy every aspect of the restaurant - From the food, to the guard at the entrance, to the silver mugs they serve beer in to the old furniture, the carpet and the lighting. It takes years of dedication by a brand to get to this level that people love it beyond reason. For culinary freaks and hardcore foodies with an exposure to the ‚Äòreal thing‚Äô, Peter Cat might not appeal as much.

So, I wanted to celebrate my first anniversary with my boyfriend in some place that would be affordable for a college student, is cozy & calm, food is promising & quantity should also be enough for two. The thing that surprised me was the wait time because I didn't have to wait & that also on a Sunday afternoon. 
We ordered three things : 
The original Chelo Kebab - 375/- 
Chicken sweet corn soup - 150/- 
Roasted Chicken sizzler - 285/-
We couldn't finish it off so we packed the rest of it & that costed us only 4 rupees. 
Including taxes it costed us 855. 
Personal opinion - Apart from the soup which was lacking flavours a bit, both the other items were A class. Order was served in no time & the environment was lovely.

##

2018-01-13 22:11:37
Satyam Dey
42504816
5.0
What we ordered :-
Chelo Kebab. House Special Sizzler.

Ambience :- 5.0
Noone expects any less than 5 from Peter Cat's ambience. Comfortable seating. Cozy atmosphere. Exactly what a restaurant of this reputation and history should be.

Food :- 5.0
So those who dont know, Peter Cat is the pioneer of the famous Chelo Kebabs (its a platter), a speciality of Kolkata (West Bengal to be honest). As expected, the Chelo Kebab was heavenly. It was a lot better than what we had in Trinca's. The sizzler was good too but a bit sweet.

Service :-
Thr service was prompt. The waiters were eager to help and were friendly. There's always a waiting list in Peter Cat(Thanks to its popularity). However you only need to wait for like 15-20 mins and not more than that.

Recommendation :- 
Obviously, you have to visit this restaurant if you havent yet. You'll enjoy anything you order. Do try the Chelo Kebabs

Finally I ended up going to this place after many many years. This place serves excellent food and that is why it is crowded throughout the year and never would you go there and get a seat without waiting. After years of trial, this is the first time we got the chance to go inside after a waiting time of 30 mins that too because we went for dinner at 6 o clock in the evening. We ordered the signature chelo kabab and the mutton hamburger steak. 
The chelo kabab was heavenly. The kababs were delicious and the rice tasted amazing with the generous amount of butter. So the wait of all these years was worth it.  And the mutton hamburger steak was amazing as well. 
So if you have the patience, I'd tell you all to go there if you haven't already been there.

##

2018-01-07 22:10:36
Sagar Roy
5270371
4.5
Peter Cat needs no prior introduction. It has been a benchmark for all restaurants in Kolkata for a long time now. Situated on Russell Street, this is "The" restaurant of Kolkata.

People standing in queue outside the restaurant just to get in is a very common sight in case of Peter Cat. Fortunately enough, on my latest visit, I did not have to stand in the queue. 

Once you enter, the dark environment and dim red lighting hits you which gives it a very old yet classy vibes. 

The service was quite pleasing. The waiters we're very responsive and our orders arrived fairly quick which when taking into consideration that the restaurant was quite full, does speak volumes about their service.

We ordered :

üçπ Screwdriver
üçé Tandoori Chicken
üçé Chello kebab
üçéHouse special Chicken steak sizzler @ with sausages
üçÆ Souffle 

üçπ The first order was a cocktail named Screwdriver which was a combination of orange juice and vodka. A good cocktail indeed. (4/5)

üçΩÔ∏è Tandoori Chicken was the second order which was very tasty. The meet had retained nice amount of moisture inspire of being cooked in the tandoor. The tender meat came off the bones very easily and was very delicious. One plate of the dish contained 4 pieces of Chicken. (4.5/5) for this.

üçΩÔ∏èNext in line was the famous Chello kebab. It did live up to all the hype. The kebabs are very tasty, the egg poach and and the rice with butter just makes it a complete dish. Peter cat is the pioneer of this Chello kebab and you can easily tell why. Their chello kebab is on a different level than what you find in other eateries. (5/5)

üçΩÔ∏è The next order was the Chicken Steak with sausages. It was a good dish. The meat, again, was very nicely cooked. The sausages were very tasty. The veggies we're nicely cooked as well. (4/5) for this.

üçÆü•Ñ Last came the dessert which our server suggested. The souffle did not impress me. It had a good texture but I felt something was lacking. (3/5) for the dessert.

Overall, Peter Cat did infact live up to our expectations and it was a very good dining experience. Highly Recommend!! :)

2018-01-07 16:49:27
Somasree Sengupta
46996571
4.5
Peter Cat can be a safe try for anyone, whoever has been to Kolkata once and wanted to tryout Kolkata restaurants.
It still carries a heritage and legacy of old Kolkata and the crowd just adds to it.
Chello kebab, as is famously known, is a religious food of this place. - go for the chicken one, the mutton platter, doesn't fit into the concept and taste for this.
It's tastes better than however good you have heard about it.
It's a multiple visited for Calcutta food lovers - and hopefully remain to be so

We went for the recommended piece of dish that Peter cat is famous for . The original Chelo kebab, which arrived after half an hour of munching on a tasty chicken appetizer, looked quite appealing and raised my hopes up, but was soon dashed after a minute into the dish. The dish was quite bland , nothing out of the ordinary, and typically overrated. With the side items on the plate doing nothing to complement it's flavours I opted for a zeera drink so that it might act like a palette cleanser . However that was a bad choice, it was infinitely worse than a normal jeera sarbat which a child can make at home. Overall, a very sad experience and the bill didn't help it either.

##

2017-12-31 15:27:43
Siddhant Das
1806057
3.5
Although Peter Cat is supposed to be one of the most iconic and legendary joints in the city,it failed to live up to its hype on my visit. The food I was served was a little cold and I felt that the waiters were a little snobbish. That being said, I thought that the interiors and ambience of the place was wonderful. The entire place is really rustic and I loved the overall vibe. 

Now coming to the food, I ordered the iconic ‚ÄòChelo Kabab‚Äô. The dish as a whole was pretty good but it did have a few problems. I thought the seekh kabab(which was a part of the dish)was really dry; especially when I judge it in comparison to some of the seekh‚Äôs I have had for 1/10th of the price in the alley‚Äôs of old delhi. But the other components of the dish were superb. I really loved the flavor of the butter rice and the reshmi kabab on the plate. Both of these components (along with the veggies) were cooked to perfection and were charred just enough to lend some smokiness to the dish which complemented the taste of the spices quite beautifully. 

The service was quick and professional but not friendly by any stretch of the imagination. All in all, I did enjoy my visit to Peter Cat but would recommend Mocambo over this place.

Extremely snobbish staff, sub standard food, where is that old Calcutta charm Peter Cat? Let me begin this review by saying I'm a generous person. I never critique a place based on one visit alone. But over the last four-five visits to Peter Cat, I have noticed the service ( read - cocky doorman, callous staff) couldn't care less about their visitors, and the food, dear lord has been magnificently average. Our last visit- when I decided to order *shudder* a vegetarian chello kebab as I was in the mood to try something different came stone cold. The *paneer* was sweeter than the rum balls being sold next street. I thought about drowning my disappointment in an ice-cream cola but they refused to serve it with any other ice-cream apart from vanilla (I obviously, requested that I would pay extra for a scoop of another flavor). Okay, to be fair to the readers I have been regularly trying the non vegetarian chello kebabs for a while now and the contents have been bland, cold and chewy at times. The waiter asked me more than a couple of times if this is all I would be ordering. Yes, old man, for a two seater right next to the spoon, lemon, onion stand (regulars would know what I'm talking about) and the cold food, and the chilly vibes, this would be all.

2017-12-27 12:34:59
Sreeshtig1998
39989020
3.5
Peter Cat is one of the most well known and oldest restaurants in the Park Street Area.I have been to this restaurant for quite a number of times now.I have a special place for this restaurant in my heart.Previously I used to absolutely love the place but the last time I went there, I ordered the legendary Grilled Fish and To my utter disgust I found that the fish was rotten and it was smelling horrible.It was an absolute disappointment.
But none the less I found their Indian Cuisine really sumptuous Since I tried them for the first time.I ordered for Butter Naan,Chicken Reshmi Butter Masala,Pea Paulao and Mutton Rogan Josh and I found them really delicious.The taste and quantity for these dishes is quite generous.Also their chelo kebab is to die for and a must try.
I would specially recommend you all to try out their House Special if you haven‚Äôt tried the dish yet coz you would definitely love that.It‚Äôs ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS.
The only con is since this place is located just in the heart of the city it is always flooded with people so if you are planning to dine in there then be an early bird to catch your seats otherwise you will have to wait in the queue for a long time.
I find the ambience of the place quite soothing on normal days but during festive times when there is a huge rush you will find this place to be a bit noisy.The decor,The seating arrangement and the lights are pretty relaxing and eye soothing.

##

2017-12-24 20:33:24
Antara Dam
37698238
3.0
Despite having the rush of Christmas eve, we get our call quite faster than expected. The staffs are really polite and humble. The decor is grand and ambiance is, I found, of retro style.
Disappointments : I called them two days prior the visit and asked if they have hiked in the prices. The staff denied it totally saying that the prize is exactly same as in zomato plus 5% tax. However, their menu card says a completely different story.
Now coming to the dishes : we have ordered their famous chelo kabab and roast chicken sizzler. Both the dishes, I found over-rated, not bad but not mouth-lingering either, but overpriced definitely. The sizzler was of average taste, just want to mention that they don't saut√© the vegetables, they just boil them and add them to the sizzler platter, thus making it completely blant in taste. I found the dominance of soya sauce too much in the syrup of the sizzler. In the whole platter I only could eat the chicken with ease.
Now, the chelo kebab : the minced chicken kabab is prepared with too much of pepper. You fail to enjoy the very essence of kababs. However, the sikh kabab was better than the minced part, but nothing extraordinary. Overall a decent platter, but failed to leave any mouth-smacking impression.
One thing that I love the most, is the pickle that they serve as complimentary, that actually stole the show.
Overall, not as expected comparing to the reviews and rating in zomato but a decent experience.

##

2017-12-24 10:44:40
Sukanya Nag
32820816
3.5
Visited this place day before yesterday. It's located between Flurys and Barbeque Nation, just at the beginning of a lane. We had to wait for 40 mins to get a table, even if it was a weekday, due to Christmas maybe. 
It was a treat from my bestie. We had ordered Chelo Kebab(‚Çπ395) and Biryani Ala Nawabi(‚Çπ270). The chelo kebab had 6pcs of chicken kebab and 2pcs mutton kebab served along with buttered rice, topped with a poached egg. The chicken kebabs were delicious and succulent. Mutton kebabs were worse than the opposite, they didn't even taste like mutton. Rest was fine, though it was nothing special compared to the price charged. Biryani Ala Nawabi had 3pcs of mutton, a small egg and 2pcs potato. Quantity was okay for two people with average appetite. Mutton pieces were either bony or fibrous. I couldn't even have one. Potato wasn't well boiled. Otherwise, the biryani tasted nice. 
Service is fine. Ambience is quite good. Only GST is charged (no extra service charges).

##

2017-12-24 04:34:56
Dwaipayan Chakraborty
35453470
4.0
Another Iconic Eatery of Park street

Ambience: Two storied restaurant with seating area in both floors. Personally I prefer the upper floor to sit on. The ambience is perfect for romantic couples as well as chatting friend groups or even a family eating out. The seating arrangements, to the lighting and even the attire of waiters speaks volumes about the elite culture of Kolkata that this reasturant was a part of since long. The place also serves alcohol. 

Food: Mostly famous for chello kebab and their set of cocktail offerings. The chello kebab was pretty good. We also ordered a chicken sizzler which somehow seemed pretty substandard. The wine menu was very witty and the sunset cocktail that we ordered was awesome. The quantity of food provided was really enough for two people.

Service: Cash and card accepted. Waiters were prompt in service. The price was really less as compared to the other places of similar standard. Parking available for two wheelers right in front of the restaurant. 

Overall, definitely recommended for a single visit at least.

2017-12-15 18:32:20
Priasha Lama

4.0
This is one of the most legendary restaurant in Kolkata which was opened back in 1960' s. Once you enter the restaurant you will be wowed by the tiffany lamps shades and dim lights and the stewards in their pathani uniform and turbans will give you the feeling of being in some different epoch.
I definitely had to try out their speciality-"Chello Kabab" which was so much talked about.
I had placed an order for chicken chello kabab and a mocktail.
The chello kabab which was served with rice and blob of butter, the tender pieces of chicken kabab,veggies and perfectly poached runny egg.I liked the food no doubt but I think their signature dish chello kabab is overhyped.

I Would definitely visit again and try out other dishes.

##

2017-12-04 14:25:45
Devi Poojari
2787802
4.0
There is a reason why some places are touted as legends; this one more than ever. I had always been fascinated by the aura this place has because I'd always heard people raving about 'Chello Kebab this' and 'Chello Kebab that'. Usually, I'm the sort that has never been impressed by anything that is hyped too much and I was skeptical at first when my friend put this on our food itenary as part of our Kolkata getaway last month.
When you first walk into Peter Cat, it makes you feel like you've walked into the den of an 80s villain in a Bollywood film. The previous reviews this place has have always mentioned it's long waiting before you can manage to get a table but I guess we got lucky as we waltzed in straight and found ourselves a sweet spot on the first level. We placed our orders for cocktails; my dinner companion for a Whiskey Sour and me, a Bloody Mary, both of which had alcohol right at the top without being mixed into the concoction as is the case in most restaurants I've been to. When we took the first sip, it was extremely strong and we had the taste of alcohol numb our tastebuds momentarily, only to discover at the end of our meal that the mixing was to be done by those who drink the cocktail. This was before our order of the Chello Kebabs reached the table. The aroma was enough to transport me to the gates of heaven and back as the server began to divide the treasure between the two of us. Most people would rave about the meat, which of course deserves to be praised for its well-spiced, well-flavoured chicken and mutton kebabs which were so delicate, they melted into the rice, egg and butter.
For me, the real star of the show was the beautifully flavoured rice which felt like I was dining with the Mughals. I'm the kind of person that loves the punch of chilli or any strong flavour in my food but I was amazed at how addicted I had gotten to eating the bits of grain covered in butter and runny egg. Despite the rather generous portion, our hunger did not seem to evade us and we called for the most amazing Fish Makhmali Kebab and the Chicken Biryani. If melt-in-the-mouth needed an example to present, these gorgeous kebabs of betki would be it. However, the Biryani was a major disappointment in the name of Biryani with its stodgy pieces of chicken breast ruining the joy one can experience during biryani-eating. 
Overall, this goes down the alley of one of the many memorable meals I will fondly remember when I'm 80 years old. I highly recommend this place for those looking to indulge in the highest mark munchies can make. When in Kolkata, do as the Bongs and devour a plate of these delectable kebabs!

##

2017-12-04 00:34:51
Sourabh
48524733
3.5
Peter cat has greeted many a celebrity in the recent past because its famous cuisine because it caters to both vegetarian and non-vegetarian clients and the most celebrated dish of this place is the Chelo¬†kabab which is unparallel in taste and Peter cat is proud to be the sole restaurant to serve this delicacy

2017-11-28 03:03:03
Sumana Mandal
4644921
4.0
A Legendary institution and one of my absolute favourite diners of all times!
‚óè Ambience: very dimly lit. A little bit of more lighting would have worked better though. Comfy seating arrangements divided into two floors. Very spacious. Courteous & helpful waiters. 
‚óè Food:
* Love Love Love the mutton Chelo kebab over the chicken one.
The Mutton chelo kebab consists of a plate of buttered rice topped with a sunny side up and accompanied with two mutton sheekh kebabs, six mutton tikkas and a roasted tomato. This platter is a piece of heaven! MUST MUST TRY!

* Sizzlers:
‚Ä¢ The house special sizzler is my all time fav. It comprises of a massive chicken steak which is accompanied by sausages, chicken liver and sone veggies
‚Ä¢ Mixed Grill Tandoori is another fav.

* A pint of beer is the best accompaniment with the sizzlers. 

It's been some time that i have given it a visit. Need to plan a visit real soon as the party season is here!

2017-11-25 18:36:52
Satyaki Dutta

4.5
A very popular destination for food lovers. There is always a queue outside on weekends or special days. We went little earlier to avoid that. The upstairs us more spacious than downstairs. The ambience is awesome with dressed waiters at your service. But those suited persons always passing infront of my table and keeping eyes on everything irritated me. Now let me clear one thing CHELLO KEBABS ARE NOT AT ALL THAT MUCH SPECIAL. Yes that's right its too much overrated. Only the amount of food you get on that price might attract people so they order that thing. Please try fish makhmali kebab, its delicious. I liked the afgani chicken also. The gravy was very tasty. Kashmiri biriyani is a Hyderabadi style biriyani so if you want kolkata's one then don't order that, though they provide a potato in the biriyani. But a very good place to visit with your loved one because@ of the ambience mainly.

2017-11-23 17:22:34
Dev Ghosh
48303996
5.0
If you are looking for a 5* ambiance please look for other choices in Zomato, the decor is at least 25 years Old, the staff attire also reminds me of the British Era and the prices on the Menu Card appear to be a decade Old. 

DO NOT order continental combined with Indian, make up your mind on any 1

Must Try's - 

Fusion dishes - Chelo Kebab & Tandoori Mixed Grill Sizzler

Indian - Mutton Dum ki Raan / Various Indian breads and gravy

Continental everything is good (the bit of fusion touch tastes great to me)

Quantity is HUGE though price is very low, so order judiciously.

For me anytime favourite, only drawback NO Reservations so be ready to queue up

2017-11-22 16:07:47
Abhramita Sen
9188691
3.5
I know there's this craze for Chelo kabab and rice. And frankly, that's what took me and my friend to this famous joint.

Unlike other times, when there's a long queue, we were ushered in to a table on the ground floor. I did find a bit of a space crunch as the family next to us had kids...and they were jumping about the place. And the tables are situated close together so we were quite worried the kids might topple something on their table or ours!!

Coming down to food, we ordered chello kabab and the person waiting on us was extremely disinterested in offering any input. We had asked if sides were required with the platter, and were basically forced into ordering a gravy dish for lack of input from the staff.

The chelo kabab is quite a platter in itself, and you do not need to order sides. Ours was wasted, much to our disappointment.

The hype I understand, but whether they live up to it is another thing altogether. Not sure i will be going back ...

2017-11-19 22:40:40
Tanmoy180
1639109
1.0
Ordered Chelo kabab, Dum ki raan, afghan Chicken, chicken bharta and Naan. Also had warm brownie with vanilla ice cream and hot chocolate sauce for dessert 
Chelo Kabab was just ok to taste. Would have been better if it was warmer.
Afghan chicken as well as Chicken Bharta was below average with both tasting the same with just chicken bharta containing egg and smaller pieces of chicken. Basically same bland gravy was  used. No salt, no spice more of cream making it look light yellowish.
Dum ki raan was good in taste but here comes the worst part of the restaurant:
Peter Cat is horrible when it comes to service. The waiter was idiotic nonsense guy who served the raan and the onion scattering them all over the plate and the people sitting near.  A 5 year old can do better. 
Staff is not courteous at all and does not take order or serve properly. 
For the desert they served the warm brownie and vanilla ice cream with the hot chocolate sauce missing. When asked about it the staff said that its just warm brownie with vanilla ice cream. Hot chocolate sauce does not come in the menu. 
When the bill came hot chocolate sauce was mentioned for the dessert and I enquired again and they said that they missed it and would bring it if i want. I told them that I was already done and was leaving so it was of no use now.
After the bill payment the staff were too eager to get the tips for their lousy service and were standing eagerly with their tounge out.
If u genuinely want good hospitality and want to have a good time with friends and family then I would strongly recommend not to visit this place!

2017-11-19 16:34:11

1.0
Had the iconic Chelo Kababs at Peter Cat off Park Street. It was as if time had stood still for 25 years as nothing had changed since my last visit in 1992. Sadly the wait is now an hour long and in their hurry to serve everyone, they have started precooking the Kababs so by the time they get to you, they are no longer hot and melt in your mouth soft. I ordered and my plate arrived in less than 5 minutes and everything on the plate was hard and cold. If you do visit, insist on waiting 30 minutes to get hot and fresh Kababs.Even the staff has grown completely indifferent, sad!!!

##

2017-11-11 19:27:33
Amol Nayak
2483738
4.5
I would say this is the perfect example of a restaurant serving a Anglo Indian menu. I consider an Anglo Indian dish one that has a perfect blend of Indian food influenced by the Raj. The chelo kebab platter is the perfect example. I tried the mutton one which is basically two mutton seekh kebabs and a few chicken kebabs served with a bed of buttered rice with a sunny side up egg on the top. A combination you would only find in a restaurant serving true Anglo Indian cuisine. The cocktails are old world the Bloody Mary was good! The dessert at the end the caramel custard was also traditional like you would encounter at any Raj era Club. Overall I like Peter Car with its charming old world interior that has evolved over the years and atmosphere that you will never find in any modern joint! Don‚Äôt miss it if you visit Kolkata!

##

2017-11-08 22:32:41
Adrija Basu
32521919
4.0
Once you step inside this place, you feel like you're now a part of the Indian colonial period. This place even today preserve that old world charm amidst the most modern corner of Kolkata i.e. Park Street. For so many years Peter Cat has become the part and parcel of every foodie Kolkatans. The dimly lit hanging lights, the carpets, the wooden stairs, the wooden furniture, the waiters dressed up in turbans and white kurta-payjama creates some kind of an old-school trance. 
Coming to the food, we ordered the very famous chelo kebab, beckty muniere, grilled chicken sizzler and for a bit of freshness, the fresh lime soda. Though chelo kebab sounds synonymous with Peter Cat what really took my breathe away was the beckty muniere. The creamy, soft and fleshy fish was 'oh-so-heavenly'. The sizzler was great. The chelo kebab was yummy too and it is a full meal. The service is real quick. 
Peter Cat never goes out of a foodie's list but it becomes more and more close to the heart.

2017-11-02 19:51:17
Atanu Maulik
412195
4.0
Been to this restaurant numerous times but never got around to writing a review. Always though that since so much is already written about this place, do I have anything new to add ? Anyways, just for the record, here is my take.

Every major city has a few restaurants which become much more than normal eateries, they become institutions. They become part of its social and cultural fabric, they become part of its history. This is one such place. The decor of this place which exudes a quiet elegance, the servers dressed in kurtas and turbans displaying a bit of an attitude, all are a throwback to the colonial times. When a restaurant has built up such a large fan base, when a restaurant fills all its tables day in and day out for decades, you know that they are doing something right. You know that they have hit a sweet spot and is delivering food of a certain standard at a price point which is just right for the city. I have tried a large number of items from the menu including the famed chelo kebab. This one dish with its mix of chicken and mutton kebabs served along with rice with a dollop of butter and a fried egg on top¬† exemplifies what I said about this restaurant.¬† It offers a wholesome meal at a reasonable price point. It offers a great value for money. This is the reason why the guests keep coming back again and again.

2017-10-30 15:50:55
Kritika Panjiar
2653826
4.5
Peter Cat belongs in the Legendary Collection of Kolkata. It's been here for so long now and is still one of the best restaurants in Kolkata. Peter Cat is my constant whenever I visit Kolkata. The Chelo Kebab reminds me of home. The succulent Chicken Malai Tikka and the juicy Mutton Keema Kebab. The buttered rice with egg - it all reminds me of my childhood. 
If anyone is ever visiting Kolkata and wants to go out for dinner. This is the the go to place. 
The waiiting line has never decreased in this place. And never will ! 
The food ofcourse is legendary , the Chelo Kebab, the Irani Kebab, sizzlers and the Indian Main course. Everything shines. The service is top knot. 
But this time when I visited , I was disappointed with the cold dishes served to me. They were replaced soon enough with hot fresh ones, but yes I was disappointed. 
The ambiance is iconic- the dim lights, the low lying lamps - nothing has changed over the years. 
Highly recommended to anyone in Kolkata!

Rs 550-600 per person.

Visiting the food heaven called Kolkata for just one day, your torn between the myriad choices - which famous place or which cuisine to prioritise over the other. So for my first meal in the city, I chose Peter Cat - such a unique name for a place famous for serving kebabs!

Unfortunately I was alone and couldn't try all the different dishes on the menu. So ordered what they are most famous for, the Chello kebabs.... And were they delicious. 2017-10-18 15:08:47
Saurav Gupta
324369
3.5
4 of us had a wonderful lunch today  of chello kebabs...from my previous teen daughter to my mother, all loved it including me. I'd visited this place last, perhaps 25 years back, and the food still tastes wonderful. What brought the rating down we're primarily 2 things - the wait time for a naan (almost 15 mins) which we ordered in between and seekh kebab (another 15 odd mins), which was a takeaway... But the real dampener was when the gentleman waiting our table reminded me that he was expecting a tip as 'service charge is not included in the Bill'. While the service chg not being included was indeed a welcome, but the blatant asking for money was a big let down, unbecoming of an August institution of the city. I hope the owners take cognizant of this. However, this is a highly recommended place for food, and should be on the radar of tourists and locals

##

2017-10-16 14:34:12
Archi C
1693592
3.5
Extremely crowded on a Sunday evening and it's surprising that despite its age old legacy, the staff are just not prepared to handle such crowds. We were led up the stairs by a staff who suddenly disappeared leaving us standing in the middle of nowhere. Another person gave us a seat, only minutes later a different waiter asked us to get up and took us to another table. Once we were settled in we ordered a mojito, pineapple blossom and mutton shammi kabab. We also ordered the mandatory Chelo kabab and the house special Sizzler. Zero complaints about the food- the place totally lives up to its reputation. However it was the first time in my life that a waiter refused to serve the sizzler on our plates when we requested him to do so saying that the rule was "self-service". So, though the staff behavior was not appealing, wait time was awful, ambience was noisy and decor was worn out, would still recommend it because of the reasonable pricing and the marvellous food.

##

2017-10-15 16:42:02
Reshmi Mukherjee
39850236
4.0
This is one of the oldest restaurant in kolkata. It's a very crowded restaurant irrespective of weekday or weekend. It's easyly locatable being situated adjacent to Fluris. In the weekend it is suggested to go for it by booking a table as because the rush is unthinkable. The service is very quick.
We order their signature dish chelo kebab,fish makhmali, chicken steek sizzler.
Chelo kebab : it has got motton and chicken kebabs,one egg poach,salad, one grilled tomato and basmati rice with butter cubes. One plate is enough for one.
Fish makhmali : it contains 5 pieces of fish kebab with some salad.The item is solid but melt in mouth immediately and it's not spicy at all. I love the dish.
Chicken steek sizzler : it comes with some salad,veggies,one egg poach, two piece of chicken, some french fries deeped in red sauce. It's served on a hot tawa.

Last not the least, the taste of their food are really awesomely delicious. I will recommend, whosoever, is reading this review to try their chelo kebab at once. It is a must try one.

##

2017-10-09 21:58:46
Rajen Maji
34458689
4.5
Finally a visit to peter cat!

Shifted recently to Hyderabad, I regretted not tryng this gem. So this post pujo, a visit to peter cat.

Centrally located in park street opppsite to park street KFC, this place serves Indian and Continental cuisines.
@
When you enter the restaurant, you get that authentic feeling. The staffs are very courteous.

We were two, got a good place view wise. The lampshades were eyecatching.

Now coming to the food, ordered chello kebab and chicken steak sizzler.

Chello kebab: Awesomeness served. You get kebabs, egg, buttered riceand veggies. One can hardly eat the whole thing.

Chicken Steak Sizzler: it was perfectly served to the table with the steam coming out of the dish. The chicken breasts were tendered , the carrots were well cooked and the beans melted in the mouth.

We were so full, that we didn't order anything in desert.

Ambience:5/5
Food:4.5/5
Staffs:5/5

If you are in Kolkata, leave everything go and try this place.

#Kolkata #foodgasm #foodporn #kolkatafoodie #foodlove #chellokebab #sizzler

##

2017-10-08 11:50:36
Kannu Amarjeet Singh
1108502
3.0
This old school restaurant in the heart of park street is very hyped, cause I found the place to be at best 3/5.
You are greeted to a fine dining ambiance with decked up waiting staff and the furniture is pristine, but where the wow factor is missing is in the food.
The sweet corn soup lacked taste and was bland at best.
We ordered vegetable kabab which were well cooled but had too much garam masala in them. The fish mankhanwala was bland and not juicy, no taste as such.
Main course was veg and non veg chelo kabab which was the saving grace. It was really yum. Everything on the platter was good, from the rice to the paneer and filled potato on top.
So, if anyone wants to go to peter cat, order the chelo kababs and thats about it.

##

2017-10-04 21:01:02
Sj.nalir
1495601
4.0
It was my first experience with peters cat. The dim light ambience was very calm and good.
I have ordered their flagship menu Chelo kebab and their Peter cats special dessert. Hospitality was great despite a 20mins delay between the orders.

Chelo kebab:
It was served with two chicken sheekh and a kebab served on top of the steamed rice with a fried egg and three cubes of butter on top with a grilled tomato.
The texture of the kebab was really good. It would have been a kickass with some mashed potato.

Peterscat special:
The dessert had multiple layres. With an chocolate ice cream (first layer) topping under some fresh fruits and starberry sauce followed by dry fruits and strawberry icream with an vanilla ice cream on the last bottom layer.
It is worth a try.

Overall experience: Very Good despite few extra penny.

2017-10-03 21:53:32
Pratiti Datta
37857763
3.5
Located just at the Park Street 7 way crossing not very difficult to locate, this place has been like a heritage restaurant selling their specialty "Chello kababs"
The place is dimly lit giving a taste of Old Calcutta.
We obviously went for the chello kabab, grilled chicken sizzler, tandoor rooti and a mutton item which I can't find on the menu now apparently.
Chello kabab: Has to be the show stealer as always. Tender pieces of chicken and mutton kababs with poached egg and buttered rice.
Grilled Chicken Sizzler: Was a bit disappointed with this. It only had two chicken pieces in some kind of a tangy sauce with 4 pieces of potatoes and vegetables. I expected something better from the dish compared to the price.
Tandoori roti: Was toooo stiff.
Mutton item: It was a good bit of quantity. Tasted much like home made mutton preparation.
Maybe because of the Pujo rush they were not up to the mark but I expected a bit more from such a restaurant. 
Would surely visit again, after the Pujo.
Anyway people,
Happy fooding ‚úå

2017-10-03 07:17:15
Rahul Dasgupta
1300965
3.0
I have heard so much about Peter Cat, and so many people swear by this place. We visited this place on a Saturday, and were seated after a brief wait. I decided to order the famous Chelo kebab, which is served on a bed of rice and generous servings of butter as well as some fried eggs. My wife, a vegetarian, ordered a Kulcha with chana masala. The kebab could not honestly live up to the hype. There was nothing wrong with it, but I have had so much better kebabs that this did not simply hit the spot. The kulcha that my wife ordered was really good. However, the chana masala that she ordered was actually more of a chana chat with no hint of gravy. Ideally, the waiter should have warned her since one can't really have Kulcha with a dry sabji, but he did not.

All in all, still good value for money. However, would not want to go back for more.

2017-10-01 02:46:13
Nayan Aswal
516918
5.0
If Peter Cat does not deserve a 5 on 5, I don't know what would!

This place is just legendary to say the least. Food quality over my few visits over the past 7-8 months has been consistently impeccable. The waiting time does seem to bother at times, but it's all worth it once you're seated and waiting for your favourite food to arrive!!

Our favourites here have been Chelo Kebab (which is a dish so amazing, famous and filling that you will find it being served at each table), Fish Makhmali and Fresh cut mangoes dessert. 

You can go here at any time and you will find a queue. Such is the attraction of this place. Old timers and tourists alike seem to love everything about its food at the very first bite. 

If you are in Kolkata, even if for just a day, this is a MUST VISIT!!

2017-09-13 01:16:20
Aritra Biswas
34815181
1.0
Peter Cat is not worth it anymore.
Been to Peter Cat a numerous times.. But this visit after about a. Couple of years is simply disappointing.
Took my entire family for dinner but trust me it's not worth at all. We were six heads so we thought of trying out a few different dishes available.
We thought of trying the Indian dished  rather than trying their signature dish Chello Kabab.

Starters-
We ordered Irani Chicken kabab and Chicken Tikka Kabab as starters. The chicken Piece were very very small.. it's like the size of kabab used in chicken roll, and most of the pieces were burnt.
Mutton Seekh Kabab was stiff and very dry.
Fish Makhmali was better that the others.
No Green Chatney with any of the Kababs.

Main Course-
Tandoori Roti were mostly burned.
Garlic Naan was ok.
Malai Kofta was awful.
Chicken Reshmi Butter Masala - Extremely small pieces, tastes wise very blant.
Mutton Nawabi- Extremely small pieces. No marination. Stiff, tastes awful.
Grilled Fish Sizzler- taste ok. Piece Moderate. Potatoes tastes really nice.
Mutton Hamburger Steak- ok ok.excess use of Soya Sauce.

I am not going back again as it's just a Brand with below average food.

##

2017-09-10 19:20:53
Ishani Pramanik.
32831403
4.0
Date: 10/09/2017.
Location: Park street.
Order type: Dine in.
Item:. 1 original chello kebab, 1 chicken bharta and 1 makhan naan.
Price: ‚Çπ805.00/-
Description: For our sunday lunch we choose this place. Had to wait for 10 minutes for our table. But the food was extremely tasty.
Ambiance: This restaurant has huge seating area. Each table has it's own lamp which is decorated in red fabric. They have different types of tablets according to different number of people.
Staff and service: Staff is friendly and well behaved. But we had to wait for 30 minutes for our food.
Food description: 
1. Chello kebab: White rice served with chicken kebab, mutton kebab, egg poach, grilled tomato, and some cubes of salted butter on top of rice. This plate also comes with cucumber and tomato as salad. The chicken kebab had pieces of chicken, onion, capsicum and tomato in it. The mutton kebab was made of minced mutton and it had dominant fragrance of garam masala. The water poach was very soft and extremely tasty. 
2. Makhan naan: 2 pieces of naan coated with good quantity of butter.
3. Chicken bharta: The chicken pieces in it were moderate in size. The gravy was thick. It also had 1 hard boiled egg like usual chicken bharta.

2017-09-10 15:38:13
Umme H Faisal
32883308
4.0
The Location : Located in Park Street, this place is easily accessible by cab or by metro.
The Ambience : From the moment you enter the restaurant, the wooden interior and the waiters dressed in suit and Pagri, will make you feel like you're walking into a distant bygone era in history. I love this kind of feeling. So, this is a big thumbs up for me.
The service was polite and prompt.
The Food :
Cream of chicken and Dinner Roll : Spot on. Very balanced taste.
I ordered the very hyped Chello Kebabs. And I kid you not, they deserve all the hype they get. The taste was incredible.
My absolute special was the House Special Sizzler with Chicken Sausages.  It was very tasty.  And worth the money.  
Pocket Pinch: Slightly over priced. But its worth the food.
Recommendations : A definite yes. Apt for a nice romantic date or for a family time out with loved ones.

4.0
An old restaurant at park street, awesome ambience. Foods are delicious. Courtesious staffs. Have to wait for a long time if you visit in peak hours. Ordered Tandoori chicken full plate and an authentic dish named chelo kebab and a cocktail Mojito. Tandoori chicken was well prepared and soft n juicy. There were 4 large pcs in a plate. The chelo kebab can be a complete meal. The platter contains a portion of butter rice topped with an egg poach, two mutton kebab sticks, one stick of chicken, paneer and chicken liver alongwith slices of cappcicum onioin and tomato. The total bill was 1531 including GST for 2 plates of chelo kebab, 1 mojito, 1 full tandoori chicken which was quite reasonable as they are still maintaining food quality and quantity as well. Everyone will suggest chelo kebab but im gonna suggest Tandoori chicken. A variety of sizzlers and cocktails are also available. Gonna visit soon to taste the other dishes one after one.

##

2017-09-03 11:23:28
Siddharth Bose
2585484
5.0
There's nothing much to review about a restaurant that I have been visiting since a young child; a place that has really been iconic to our city. 
I recently visited Peter Cat after a gap of a few years along with my brothers. Immediately after entering the restaurant was a moment of nostalgia as the smell of the sizzlers and certain spices used to make   our appetite go few notches higher than usual. I've always appreciated the overall ambiance of Peter Cat, because visually the dim lit atmosphere used to be very appealing.
We had ordered for Chelo Kebabs, and some naans along with black dal and a vegetable dish. As always, the food was outstanding. The Chelo Kebab should now be considered as the greatest dish of Kolkata due to it's taste being consistent throughout all these years. The rice along with the fried egg and butter was something I really missed. It was succulent and just melted in my mouth, made me feel relaxed. Overall it was a great experience, and I hope to come back soon as possible.

##

2017-09-03 02:26:09
Jit Das
3192545
4.0
In Kolkata, it would be highly impossible to call yourself a foodie if you haven't visited the legendary restaurants one of which is this. They've been here for ages and you still have to stand in a queue even on  random evening waiting to get a table.
The service is a very traditional classic one with "not so serious about you" staff and a classic and popular menu. Though the quality of the food has degraded compared to what they used to be but still worth the reputation.

Anyone who's heard of this place knows and will recommend the "Chello Kebab" which isn't anything special but not bad for a try. The sizzlers are beautifully made as well though almost all of them taste the same with minor changes. We mistakenly ordered this Tandoori kebab which by chance tasted amazing. I would surely recommend it. Other than these, there's loads of continental options in fishes and chicken; they're all worth a try depending on your taste.

##

2017-09-02 22:38:09
Debosree Acharjee
2472476
4.0
Very famous and renowned Food Joints like Peter Cat doesn't need reviews to attract foodies!!!
          Located exactly opposite to The Park Hotel in Park Street, this restaurant offers the best Chelo kebabs and sizzlers in Kolkata. 
We visited this place on the occasion of Christmas last year. Though I am bit late in writing the review but it's like "better late than never ".

In the food we ordered their Signature dishes:-
1. Chicken Steak Sizzler- Chicken Steak served with little baby potatoes and yummy creamy brown tangy sauce poured into it.Taste was average, not that wow factor.
2. Grilled Fish Sizzler- Grilled fish served with some boiled vegetables and a poached egg. This dish was quite good and well prepared 
3. Chicken Chelo kabab- The best dish of the day, Peter Cat's Signature Dish. It was served with aromatic butter rice with chicken, mutton kebabs and perfectly done poached egg on top. A complete meal in itself and awesome in taste. Every bite of it melted into our mouth like pure bliss.
4.Chocolate Brownie:- Last but not the least we ordered this dish for dessert. It was also good in taste.
A must try place for all kebab and steak lovers...
Note:- Be prepared to stand in a queue for an hour or so for getting the table if visiting on any weekends.

##

2017-09-02 21:24:43
Prateeti Pradhan
3187492
2.5
This is a highly overrated place.I honestly did not find anything special about the food.Yes it is one of the oldest heritage place providing a very well known dish and for that a one time experience for me was enough.There is nothing which will attract me to go to this place again.Moreover the floor manager dealt with us with a very rude attitude because we shifted seats(after asking a waiter who nodded in affermative) to a place with better lighting.He eaid that we could not change seats without 'permission'.Coming to the food,we ordered two special sizzlers and two chello kebab.The sizzler sauce was basically drowned in Soya Sauce and it was not at all a pleasant experience having it.The chello kebab was far better,the chicken kebabs were the winner for me.Rice,butter,kebab and poaced eggs, there is nothing that can taste bad.The service was very quick as these too are the most popular dishes there.

The overall experience for us was below average considering both the food and the attitude of the managers of this place.

##

2017-09-01 14:56:02
Agnimitra Roy
2899822
2.5
Reputed for its Chellow Kabab and clad with an aura of 'sophistication', this place is one of the heavy-hitters near Park Street, and that's saying something. From the uniformed usher to the turbanned staff inside, this place imitates nawabi charm and tries to live upto the expectations built by the tales of previous visitors.

After waiting outside for quite some time, we were finally accommodated. Strolling past the outer dining area, we entered the inner chamber, so to speak, with more of a private feel to it. We ordered the fabled Chellow Kababs, served with rice, vegetables, butter and an egg. The dish, indeed, was cooked decently and tries to live upto the tales but the price felt way steeper for the quantity...chalk it upto the price of ambience. The kebabs were a bit dry and the rice was a bit bland with a dollop of plain butter moonlighting over it but not making a difference in anyway. It wasn't the Chellow Kabab that was the star of the day...it was the Mocha Souffl√©(souffle of the day). Costly? Yes! Worth it? Hell yes! The lightness of the souffl√© was nailed aptly and the sweetness was appropriate, although the satisfaction in watching a souffl√© rise up the ramekin as a testament to its quality and technical flawlessness isn't present here since it isn't served in its original container!

The staff was either utterly professional or can be said to be verging on passive aggressive in nature. Their preference for customers with deeper pockets, judged on the basis of attire and conversational medium, is the definition of elitism and classism lurking in the society. All in all, one must keep their expectations in check and the experience will be accordingly 'rewarding'... Not disastrous, not heavenly.

##

2017-09-01 00:34:52
Jyotsna Lakhmani
2291630
4.5

Also, the service is amazing and so is the ambience.

We ordered chelo kebab, chicken kasturi kebab ( from today's special), strawberry shake. Chello kebab was super tasty. Specially the rice was fresh and nicely cooked. I love their strawberry shake. Want to visit it again .

2017-08-30 11:44:31
Shubham Tayal
1046741
4.0
Well the ambience of this place is vintage and classy. You have waitors dressed in suits to welcome you and you have waitors dressed in traditional indian wear to serve you. Its the best of both worlds.

Being a vegetarian and bored of Paneer dishes, we wanted to try something different. We ordered Rajma Galauti Kabab and boy, wasn't it good. It was one of the best that i have ever had and for the reataurant to deliver such a taste considering the fact that very few people would go for it, is bound to earn your respect. 

You can only complain of the quantity as they serve only 4 pieces at Rs. 195. But then, very few people would care about the money if they are visitng this place. If you are in Kolkata, this is the place to enjoy your meals regularly.

2017-08-30 01:41:41

Now coming to review part:
--Ambience, Behaviour, Waiting time : Ambience is just like old 80s posh restaurant. Behaviour of attendants are anyday very good. If you are going for lunch or dinner, either reach early before the pick lunch or dinner time, if not then take ur time n keep patience while standing in queue waiting  for ur turn. This part is very annoying. 
-- Food quality, quantity and taste:
1. Soup was nice n taste was off bit than served in other restaurants. Very good in taste and yummy.
2. Reshmi kebab was good and prawn cocktail was outstanding in taste and quality.
3. Chelo kebab I don't have to say anything.
4. Chicken steak sizzler just yummy.

If u live in kol or came from outside n not visited this place, please visit and taste their cuisines. 

And i will go many times.

I mean whyyyyy ???? Some one who is ordering chicken it's obvious he/she wants chicken and not mutton ! Then why mutton and chicken together in chicken platter ?

2017-08-19 10:34:00
Sujata Thaker
30203195
3.5
A legendary restaurant that has withstood the onslaught of the new age entries. This place has retained its old ways....seen in the dim lighting, the menu and good presentation and even in the uniforms of the servers. All old school and so nostalgic for most of us. Having said that , it is irritating to always have to wait outside, especially in the heat. But it probably is good news for the management!! They have their loyal clientele. My friend had the chicken roast sizzler which she liked. I wanted to try their famous chelo kebab,but being a vegetarian thought that wouldn't be possible. But, lo and behold, it was possible as they had a veg version of it also. Though according to my friend it was a sacrilege to have a veg chelo kebab??üòÇ
I was happy with my experience, liked the dish, served with buttered rice were three types of veg kebab, hara Bharat seekh kebab, paneer tikka kebab and a potato one together with a few pieces of salad
 I felt they could have been a little more generous by giving more pieces of the fresh veggies. Overall good.

It's a shame that I could never visit this place in my 24 years of spending time in Calcutta (read born n brought up). Only during my nth visit to the city of joy, I had the joy of visiting this place.¬†
I have been hearing about Chelo Kebab since my childhood and no one makes them like PeterCat and alas I had missed this all along. My vegetarian friends also rebuked me for not trying (and how!).
But after a long wait of 1.3 hours in the queue my friend and I managed to get a table after much ruckus. Ordered the famous dish and of course beer, I was greeted by a plate full of meat and delicious and aromatic butter rice. Instantly I started drooling. One bite of the tender juicy meat the the spoon of the butter rice makes you forget all hatred in the world and catapults you the inner realms of heaven where angels made their abode and where there is peace and serenity.¬†
I can go on with the adjectives, but dont want to make it a tiring read :)
Over all the waiting was worth it. Needless to say a must visit place.

2017-08-12 13:05:07
Sanjana B

4.0
If i was to rate this place only on its food i would have given it a 5 but service plays an important role in making up a good restaurant and that is something which this place seriously lacks. Most of the service staff is rude and they behave like they are doing you a favour by serving you.

Ambiance - Classic decor with beautiful night lamps hanging above your table. You may call the place kind of romantic basis the decor but since its alwayssss crowded, you cannot get much of personal time. Its more about the food.

Food - Must try list has thr all time favourite Chelo Kebab. If you are a mutton lover then the Mutton Raan is to die for. Best Raan prepration in Kolkata i have seen. Prawn cocktail is another recommend. Sizzlers i wouldn't say are great but decently ok. Do ask them on the portion of dish bcoz most of the items only suffice one person. For Desserts you can try the caramel custard.

Price - It's a tad on the expensive side but the food quality is worth the money.

Overall if you are someone whoz travelling to Kolkata then the place is a must try. If you are a local then try going on weekdays as weekends have longggg waiting queues.

##

2017-08-11 15:52:53
Eshita Banerjee
35887859
4.5
Peter cat is a very renowned place located in Park Street and it has been there for decades. It is one the Biggest Heritage Kolkata restaurants. ‚ù§üôÇ
A friend of mine took us there for her birthday lunch and it was my first time there. I basically loved the experience once we got to enter the restaurant. But we had to wait for 45 mins before we could enter. There was a long waiting line that day I don't know why. But once we went in, it was all worth the wait.

LOCATION- Peter cat isn't very hard to locate. It's just a few minutes of walking distance from the park street metro station and its located just to the opposite of KFC.

AMBIANCE AND DECOR- This place is a hit. It is a sophisticated and a dimly lit place which has got that warm feeling to it. Once you seat in one of their couch you kinda just sunk in it. üòç ( Not kidding)
Seriously the ambiance is way too good. 

STAFF- The staff was polite and humble enough. They waited patiently as kept on changing our orders. Sorry about that.

FOOD- Now coming to the food. The speciality of them "THE ORIGINAL CHELLO KEBABS". Chello Kebab is an Iranian dish in which freshly made kebabs are served on a bed of basmati rice. They had two choices of CHELLO KEBAB. One consists of Juicy and tender chicken kebabs and two mutton seekh kebabs with basmati rice along with dollops of butter and salad and the other dish contains of all the kebabs but made of mutton. So we decided to try the original CHELLO KEBAB. And along with that we also ordered CHICKEN SIZZLER and BIRIYANI NAINTARA.
BIRIYANI NAINTARA is a vegetarian biriyani. 
Now coming to the quality of the CHELLO KEBAB it was awesome. The Chicken kebabs were juicy,tender,moist and with all spices in the right places. The mutton seekh Kebab was also very juicy and tender. The rice was steamed rice and as I am a  Bengali nothing can go wrong with hot basmati rice and dollops of amul butter with little sprinkles of salt over it. So for me is was oh-so-delicious ‚ù§‚ù§.
The chicken sizzler also tasted very good. But I guess the sugar in the preparation was a bit high. Other than that it was fantastic.
I am so mesmerized with this place I am surely gonna visit this place again anytime soon. ‚ù§
CIAO ü§ò

##

2017-08-07 15:40:35
Nikhil Bazaz
10873681
4.5
I heard so much about this place that I decided whenever I am in Kolkata next I'll be visiting it for sure. 

After visiting it I have mixed feelings, the food is awesome, out of the world and whatever you say will be less but the ambience is bit dingy and staff is impolite (not the serving staff).

Food: 10/10
Being a vegetation when I go to a place famous for non veg, I feel a bit apprehensive. But after eating here I am completely a fan of their food.

Veg chelo kebab - Amazing platter having paneer tikka, seekh kebab, tandoori aloo and rice. Each and every item in the platter is delicious. A platter is good enough for 1 person.

Veg Marrakech kebab - We ordered it on the recommendation of our server and we were delighted. Contents of this platter is same as chelo kebab platter, just preparation is different. Equally good.

Dal Makhani - Very good

Butter Nan - Different and very nice, loved it.

Ambience: 6/10
The red lampshades on every table and red sofa covers reminded me of Chinatown. Can't understand why the owners have decided to go with this color theme. 
Lighting is minimal and overall is quite dull.
Entire flooring is covered with carpet which looks worn out and should be replaced.

Service:
Serving staff is very well trained and helpful. 
Food takes a lot of time to come, 20-25 minutes waiting time is minimum after you place the order, which is understandable considering the number of people and preparing kebabs take little time.
Major setback is the person who writes name of the people standing in the que outside, waiting for their turn to get in. His name is Mr. Manish and he was quite rude and impolite with everyone. He needs to take some classes on hospitality.

Ignoring everything visit this place for amazing kebabs and food will not disappoint you.

PS: For lunch come before 1 or post 2:30 to avoid waiting and for dinner come before 8.

##

2017-08-02 15:28:51
Avishek Gupta
38865889
5.0
If you are in Kolkata, and want to have a taste of the city, you must visit Peter Cat. Well, for a start, their menu card is shaped like a cat's head and it can remind you of the Chessire Cat from Alice in Wonderland!
When it comes to Peter Cat, everything's a big wow, be it the food, location or ambiance. Located in the heart of Park Street, this is comfortable dining at it's best. You will keep licking your fingers and smacking your lips when the soft Kababs will melt in your mouth, when the splendid sizzlers will flirt with your taste buds, and when the wonderful drinks will take your soul to the seventh heaven.¬†
The menu card has a lot of wit and humor in it, look out for catchy headlines, such as Aphrodisiacs from the Harem!
I am mentioning my top five favorite Peter Cat goodies here:

Chello Kabab - The best, the Baap of all Kababs. Peter Cat's Chello Kabab is a must have food before you die. The splendid varities of Kababs, the softness of rice and butter, the egg poach, yumm!!!

Chicken Stake Sizzler - This babe will just announce herself to your table. Your teeth will slowly delve into the soft chicken pieces, and if you close your eyes you might see an oasis.

Mutton Rang - Almost a whole goat! If you are with a big group, this dish is an essential. It's one of the best mutton preparations.

Prawn Cocktail - Just enjoy the rich taste. You gotta be flamboyant to like it. Lolz!

Fresh Lime Soda Sweet - Traditional as it might sound, watch out for this surprise. When they make it in Peter Cat, they ensure it's the best. The nimboo, the sweetness, the taste, unparallel!

The ambiance is great. Perfect proportion of light and darkness. It's a centrally air conditioned restaurant. Hard drinks are also available. A separate family section is functional in the first floor. Waiters are very well mannered and patient. The only negative part is the huge crowd gathering here, normally in weekends. So if you don't have a prior booking, sometimes you might have to wait for 10-20 minutes.

##

2017-08-02 14:15:55

1081472
5.0
One of the giants of Park Street area. The ambience is great with dim lighting and two floors of sitting. The place has a tint of orange almost everywhere, which might remind you of the orange pumpkin head of Halloween. Just kidding. Love this place.
Their signature Chelo Kebab is great, indeed.

2017-08-02 13:00:10

4.0
My first visit to this legendary restaurant in the crossing of Middleton row and park street was as a child with parents. Have visited this place umpteen number of times at different stages of life. Like all Calcuttan, I too have adulation for this place. Their Chelo Kebab or Marakesh Kebab originating from Iran is as famous as the city itself. I love the upstairs. The uniqueness is the metal mug in which they serve beer. Those tables and sofas know so many tales of Kolkata. If you don't mind to queue up, well this is the restaurant to set you feet in. Enjoy the ambience and the naughty cat staring straight into your eyes from the table mat till the plate covers it all.

2017-07-31 23:59:43
The Moody Foodie
29786998
4.5
LOCATION: It is one of the oldest & most prestigious restaurants in Kolkata. Situated in Park Street just beside fluries & au bon pain; it is known to almost every human living in Kolkata.
AMBIENCE: The ambience is classic Park Street, with low red lightings & red coloured walls. It is reminiscent of Kolkata during the British age. Only the temperature of the ac was too cold for me.
SERVICE: Service is very efficient & the behaviour of the staff was really pleasant. But the time taken to deliver the food was a little slow. Also they messed up my dessert order claiming it was unavailable but then again served me the same unavailable dish.
MENU: The menu covers mostly Indianised continental dishes along with the regular North Indian fare. There are a lot of their specialities including sizzlers & the most famous chelo kebabs.
FOOD: The chelo kebab was perfect with the scented aroma of the rice, the accurately‚Äã done egg poach. The kebabs were just melt in the mouth. Lastly the mango souffle stole all the limelight. It was fluffy , creamy & nobody can ever have enough of it. It was just a bite of heaven

##

2017-07-30 20:54:58
Manish Mehrotra
29130567
4.0
A meal in Calcutta at Park street is incomplete without visiting to the popular restaurant Peter Cat,which alongwith Mocambo(having the same owner) remains the most popular dining option in this part of Kolkata.
Peter Cat is arguably the most popular place in town for Sizzlers, and also serves Indian cuisine alongwith continental food.
The popular place has waiting on weekends and we had to wait for sometime to get the table.
We ordered a vegetarian mixed grill sizzler. It was neatly done with thick gravy topping on the vegetable patty. The taste was excellent and the quantity really filling for a person. Apart from it we ordered there a Non vegetarian Chelo Kabab Platter ,which is the signature dish there. The chelo kabab is a fusion of Irani dish in Kolkata style.There was a butter rice bed in centre with sticks of mutton seekh and chicken tikka with vegetables. The mutton seekh was good but the chicken tikka stick was awesome. The dish is very different from any combo I had and enjoyed it.
The place is quite cosy and even though very popular,is reasonably priced as compared to too restaurants in Gurgaon,New Delhi,Mumbai and Bangalore.
Another Calcutta flavour which will remain intact for a long time!!!

I was not happy with the table and ask for alternative the manager told us all the other tables wear 7 or 8 seaters. but surprisingly our table was also a 7 seater table so I asked for a corner table which was a six seater but my manager and the other floor stuffs were hesitant. sometime later they told that it is reserved but I did not see any reservation card on the table hence I asked them to give us another corner table and unwillingly they agreed. there itself my mood went bit off. I started ordering food I was wanting some expert suggestion but floor manager was not very  willingly or happily ready to help us explaining the different items they have on menu rather they were showing busy and putting up attitude of not willing to help. I thought they might be very busy hence completed the order with whatever I understood but the result was horrible the food was not good and my family did not like it. now came the real surprise when a rich family wearing good clothes speaking English language carrying expensive accessories came in and all the managers and staffs rushed to greet and welcome them. they made them sit on the table which was booked apparently. they started chit chatting with the family and suggesting them different combination and fusion of foods. ##

2017-07-16 20:14:48
Namratatvd
43358138
3.5
So we came to this place on a Saturday night and needless to say, it was jam packed! Since they do not take any reservations, you will have to come down to this place and well, wait. We had to wait for almost 40 minutes to get a table and that is usually how long it takes on any given day apparently. So be prepared!
 
Coming to the interiors of the place, it was pretty dimly lit with red being the central theme of the place. Probably like a 3/5 for the interiors!

We ordered the Tandoori chicken as a starter and hands down it was the best tandoori chicken I have ever had! It was so succulent and fresh and yummy! It was jam packed with flavours and was absolutely delightful! I will highly recommend this to anyone who's looking for a good starter to begin with.  

We then had the Chelo kebab, which is probably the most famous dish of this place. It's basically a big platter consisting of two pieces of mutton seekh kebab, malai chicken kebabs, aromatic rice with some char grilled capsicum and tomatoes and some butter on the side. It also had a poached egg on top of the rice. The best things on the plate were the chicken kebabs and the rice and the egg. The mutton was dry and wasn't succulent enough. Overall the platter was good but wasn't worth all the hype and I definitely won't be having it again. It's worth having once just to see what all the fuss is about, but that's about it.
  
We then had the Mutton biryani, and for someone who's a hardcore fan of the Hyderabadi style of biryani preparation, it was quite a disappointment. It was basically mutton curry and rice and had potatoes as well, which was quite unusual ( but that's how the Kolkata style biryani is made, so no surprises actually). The mutton was quite dry and wasn't succulent like the chicken was. It wasn't spicy enough and didn't have the flavours an authentic biryani should have. 

Overall, I would rate the food 3.5/5 (adding that extra .5 solely because of the tandoori chicken). It's definitely worth going once, but that's about it!

Went there on 11/07/2017  around 2pm and sat on Table Number 28. Well talking of look and feel the restaurant is old and has a old school kind of charm but the sofa was perky enough to cause discomfort but somehow managed it. Both of us who went there didn't consume alcohol and thus the bill amount was sufficiently less. Now coming to food quality, each and every item was probably the worst in taste and quality. The taste and quality of food items dissapointed me beyond words. How can a restaurant like this serve that kind of food? There are restaurants who serve better Chelo Kabab Platter (trust me much better than the Sh** they served) and at a lower price.

Then comes the attitude of the staffs, well never felt so insulted in my life, may be the bill amount was less, or may be we were too ordinary looking (although the dress we wore that day was normal and sober nothing fancy) or may be I ordered foods in pure Bengali (which is my mother tongue and I am not at all ashamed of using it) they simply wanted to get rid of us. as soon as our food was finished they were in a huge rush in "onek hoeche dada ebar beron toh"-type of attitude ("enough of you two, get lost now"). We were neither given hot water wash bowls nor mouth refreshments and all, I don't know why. A staff simply brought the bill and gave it to me (like they do in small road side eateries, not in a fine dine restaurant of course). We were thinking of ordering some more but none of the staffs attended us during our stay so we put down the idea of ordering anything else. On top of that after I paid my bill they were lurking around me for tips (don't know why because none of the staffs took care of us which they are supposed to, although I gave them a tip because we both wanted to get out of there and staying more was getting more insulting)

There are times when the food might be bad but went to that restaurant again just because of their impeccable behavior. but here the staffs were simply RUDE and committed to serve the tables where the bill was bound to go beyond 5k. 

The experience was simply shattering and disappointing.

Oh one thing more the packing quality is worse than street side vendors. simple aluminium foil packs in a cardboard box. I requested them to pack the food in two containers and two different boxes as the packed food was bound for two different destination. And guess what PETER CAT STAFFS gracefully did not oblige my request, as result I faced some difficulty afterwards but they did not care. Only well behaved staf was their security guard. He atleast wished me while entering and exiting as well as offered us umbrella to cab as it was raining cats and dogs.

I conclusion I would say that I would NEVER EVER visit Peter Cat again although they don't care cause losing 1 customer doesn't hit their business but this kind of attitude of staffs will definitely bring down the name in future.

And yes won't recommend anyone I know to visit here as I don't want my family members, relatives, friends  go through such a horrifying insulting experience.

A sudden plan to taste the quintessential chelo kababs had taken me to this place but this ended to an unceremonious proceeding.¬†

For reference, please check the what is represented in red rectangle.

Despite a loud and clear declaration from govt that on MRP (nothing can be put over and above MRP value), they're still belting out to the customers - rewording the item and adding service charge to it. ##

2017-07-13 08:37:27
Oishik Sarkar
3119605
4.0
One of the most legendary restaurant of Kolkata that needs no introduction at all. Peter Cat located at Park Street has earned enough reputation from years to make this place an all time favourite for everyone.

Doesn't matter what time you visit its very common to wait outside to get a sit inside over here. So we also waited but our call came within few minutes only. Weekday simple evening it was, still 7-8 people were in the queue.

After getting into Peter Cat the ambience pleased us very well. Its dark environment & focused lights on tables is one of the kind of this place. Suddenly I noticed most of the tables were empty inside. So I thought why they aren't allowing outside people waiting to have a sit inside. Well I don't know, but seems purely marketing scheme to show the increased demand.

I was willing to visit this place for a long so the order was already decided. But their fast & excellent service surprised me. The order was...

The Legendary Chelo Kabab : Someone couldn't  just come here & go without trying their legendary dish. This place is known because of this dish & famous for its taste. What we could've ordered without this. High quality rice to grilled vegetables & kebabs everything was cooked so perfectly in this dish. But the main flavour of this dish was hidden into 2 qubes of butter. These butter qubes tasted just brilliant & its flavour was completely different than any other butter present in the market. Mixing it up with the rice & having the Kebabs with it tasted just brilliant. This is a perfect meal you can expect & get satisfied from a place like Peter Cat.

Burned Chicken Steak Sizzler : I saw every other table nearby ordering this dish so I ordered the same. This one is another speciality dish by Peter Cat. However adding burned infront of the name is what it was. Letus or cabbage whatever it was it was burned & felt really bad in taste. Boiled vegitables tasted very basic. Big chicken pieces dipped into deep soya wasn't of my taste. We also ordered bread rolls with it  that came with their awesome butter that we enjoyed.

Fresh Lime Soda : It was very basic lemon soda but refreshes the mood after main dishes.

Mixed Fruit Sundae : And at the end we ordered this sundae. It was nothing but 2 in 1 strawberry & vanilla ice cream with fine cut fruits inside. Talking about fruits it was mainly filled with papaya but mango & cherries felt nice. It was served in old class steel base & tasted very average.

Quite unexpectedly all the above mentioned items costs us Rs. 1153. I was expecting much more billed amount but they have kept the balance very well. Peter Cat is a place that is hard to ignore.

2017-07-13 08:20:34

5.0
This review was long overdue. Went there for lunch during winter. We had to wait for around 15 mins before we got a table. They have 2 floors of dining space. We chose to sit on the first floor though there is'nt much difference. The place is dimly lit with well dressed staffs( kurtas and pagdi). 
Food ordered were Chello kabab(original) & chicken Marrakesh with lemonades to wash it down. Both dish came with rice and cubes of butter, chicken kebabs and inhouse sausages. The taste was really good. While the former comes with a poached egg and has a smoky flavour the latter has a cheesy after taste. Next time I want to try their sizzlers.

2017-07-08 11:55:55
Anurag
311505
4.0
Well, Patience is the key and you'll need exceptional patience here at times to wait for your turn. The rush hour wait further excerbates your hunger pangs.Marvel fans would find it less discomforting, considering their track record of being patient till the end credits ;). After almost 45 mins of wait we were able to find our way in. The place is crowded and compact but very lively. We came here for the very famous Indo Persian cuisine Chelo kebab and ordered it along with a pint of beer. Everything was so yummy on the platter from poached eggs to butter on steamed rice. The minced meat was perfectly rolled into cylindrical shape with the right amount of spice. A small bite and one could realize their culinary perfection. The tomato was baked really well and the aroma of basmati rice made me devour till the last morsel. I look forward to visit this place whenever I am in Kolkata.

Located in the heart of Park Street and In the heart of the people of Kolkata is this place and the street is filled with slow hushes of people passing by with a common point of discussion CHELO KEBAB.

All in all a good place to enjoy food any day of the week. Definitely a thumbs up to this one

##

2017-07-02 02:14:10
Saayan Sengupta
35034148
4.5
We went there on 30th June on the occasion of my birthday. We reached there around 8:20 in the evening and were quite amazed to see a long queue as it was a Friday. Nevertheless we registered our names with the staff at the entrance and were requested to wait for half an hour. We were called upon at around 8:50 and we went inside and took our seats. The place was buzzing with people and was totally full. The ambience was excellent and the decor with the dim lights hanging form the ceiling added to the mood. Coming to the food we ordered chello kebab, grilled chicken sizzler and fresh lime soda. Considering the crowd the food came very fast,within 10 mins. The chello kebab was excellent with all the items, from the rice to the kebabs and the vegetables cooked to perfection. The butter made the rice even more tastier. The grilled chicken sizzler was also exquisite. The staff were courteous although they were a little slow perhaps for the purpose of the huge crowd. Overall an excellent birthday dinner. Looking forward to visit soon again.

During my visit to Kolkata I stopped by Peter Cat with my mom and dad. We reached there at 11:30 am so it was completely empty. But as soon as it was 12 it started to get filled really quick.

We ordered:

1.Chelo kebab (as it was the most hyped dish we went for it, must say it lived up to it)

2. Chicken Marakesh ( this was similar to the chelo kebab but had different kebabs. Also I must say the kebabs in this dish tasted better than the ones in chelo kebab)

3. Tandoori mixed grill (it had a ordinary gravy with chicken lamb and prawns. It was okay. Nothing exciting)

4. Naan ( so this was definitely the highlight of the day. It was one of the best naan I have even had. Must try)

5. Sweet lime soda ( it's was okay, the quantity was less than expected)

One of the let down was the staff of the restaurant who where talking loudly right across our table which was disturbing

Altogether it was a good experience will definitely visit Peter Cat when I am in Kolkata.

2017-06-29 17:37:30
Pooja Mukherjee
31911440
1.0
I am marking it 1, because I can't mark 0. We entered one fine evening, and the first thing which irked us was late service. It was almost over 15 mins, but no one even served us water. After we complained about this to the manager, he apologized and took our order. We ordered Mutton Chello Kabab, Chicken Pakora and Chicken and Cheese Sandwich. Now we had very high hopes for the food of Peter Cat, because of its heritage and name. The Chello Kabab was what I was very excited about, but i was hugely disappointed. The mutton tasted bad, it was nothing but charred onion pieces and small pieces of undercooked mutton. The pieces were so dry and the rice had no distinct taste other than a huge blob of Butter and one egg poach on top of it. The Pakoras were nothing but a small piece of chicken wrapped in thousands of coating of flour. The fries were cold, the sandwich was cold, the pakoras were cold, and we had the worst food experiences ever. 
Lastly, it was quite funny but it was expected, we paid the bill, plus tipped the waiter. Now we were wait for the bill. But he wondered why we were bot getting up from the table. Like seriously ? Got the tip, that's why won't even bother giving us the bill back ? He asked us " Bill lagbe aapnader?", (translate : " Do you want the bill ? " ) Like, of course WE WANT IT ! WHY WON'T WE ? Was so relieved after we got out. 

If you have time and money to waste, and even your taste buds, then go for Peter Cat :) Any other restaurant would be more appetising for me.
