##

2017-06-29 14:05:09
Shreya Chakraborty/tinkering_tastebuds
4607741
2.0
Peter Cat is probably one of the most successful restaurants in Kolkata. There have been few times when I didn't see a long queue waiting outside the place to get a taste of the famous Chelo Kebab, be it weekdays or weekends. Of the legends in Park Street, I won't be very wrong to place this one at the top, just because of the sheer crowd it manages to pull. 

However, if you ask my opinion, I think the place is a little overhyped. Or, to put it better, the Chelo Kebab is. Almost every alternate table can be found to order one, the mutton kebabs have lost their taste over the years (or probably because of such bulk production everyday!) Some of the other dishes that still never fails to impress me are the:
1. Chicken Steak Sizzler
2. Fish Meringue
3. Chicken Irani Kabab
4. Nalli Ghosht
The Chocolate Souffle here is nothing special if you compare it to the newer places who specialise in tickling your tastebuds, but among the options available, this one is the best.

However, my last visit was particularly unpleasant because of the poor management. First of all, they made us seat in a shady corner, even though tables of four were available and we asked for one (and people before AND after us could avail those, but not us!). There was delay in taking orders, with everytime someone asking us to refer to the other person for such things. We ordered a Chocolate Souffle, someone came and said it was unavailable and instead took the order for Mango Souffle(we weren't given this option beforehand, because according to the first person, only Chocolate Souffle was available among desserts!) The manager came later to say that the Chocolate Souffle has already been prepared! I mean, what kind of a management is this, where your staff doesn't even know what is there in the menu??? Also, the staffs were extremely rude when asked to clean the table, and when I was adjusting the light to click pictures of the food, the manager came and WARNED (yes, you read that right!) me not to do it again! I am not sure if our age played a factor in their improper behaviour, but if it is so, they surely need to widen their thoughts!

They may be one of the legendary and happening restaurants in the city, but there is a dire need to look into the management. Sheer nostalgia will not make people visit it everytime, you need to treat your customers well to maintain that.

Need to make it more dashing for the new generation.

2017-06-26 18:50:56
Sparsh Jain
36664032
1.5
Hearing this name for nearly two decades had increased my hopes enormously. Alas, it turned out to be quite the opposite upon visiting!
The first thing that disheartened me was the behavior and attitude of the one of the 'floor managers' who 'greeted' us on the upper floor. Seeing us as a young couple, he made us sit in a shabby corner table which was too tiny and dark. Our requests to shift to a slight better table were turned down citing reasons which soon turned out to be untrue. The service was extremely slow and inefficient. The manager without a shred of doubt behaved with hostility throughout the two-hour nightmare. We got a feeling that he wasn't interested in diners unless they appeared to be very rich. In fact, ten minutes after us, another couple arrived and they were made to sit in the lavish couch in the main dining area, which the manager had claimed to be out of service when we asked to be shifted there.
For starters, we ordered Chicken Afghani kabab. I used to think that kababs can never go wrong, but I was wrong. They tasted horrible. Tasteless, brittle and stale.
We also ordered a milk shake which was good.

Next, we ordered Beckty Meunier and Chicken Steak. The fish was amazing!!!!! The steak was average.

We decided to end the lunch with desserts, and the server said that only Chocolate Souffle was available in the day's special menu. However, we came to know that there were four more options which he didn't convey to us. Shortly after, the manager came to us saying that chocolate souffle was over, but then he refused to cancel the order saying that it was ready. The irritating part is that we had to wait for twenty more minutes by the clock before it was finally brought to us. The souffle was plainly disgusting. Literally the worst souffle I've had the misfortune of tasting.The same confusion arose with chicken steak. The manager was very impolite and antipathetic, and fed us shabby excuses for everything that we complained about.¬†
We had to wait for another fifteen minutes just to get the bill, and were rudely hasted out of the area by the same person.
Altogether, we spent a little over two hours there and a hefty bill for less-than-acceptable behavior and average food. I hope the management takes this as a wake-up call and chastens the staff for their boorish treatment of diners. Especially the part where they openly discriminate based on their assumption of the revenue that a particular group is going to generate for the restaurant.¬†
The 1.5 rating is given solely for the Beckty and the shake. So much for hospitality, Peter Cat!

2017-06-14 16:58:50
Chaitali Mandal
32990409
4.5
This heritage food place selling it's signature kebab platter under the name 'chelo kebabs' for Rs 355(in chicken) probably makes it's way to the top 10 dishes that anyone in Kolkata would definitely like to try!
The platter comes with a decent portion of warm rice with 3 cubes of butter, topped with thepst perfectly poached egg, a side of 2 soft chicken seekh kebabs and 5 pieces of chicken tikka kebabs along with roasted bell peppers and onions which are perfectly seasoned. 
Note - Since the waiting time is about 20 minutes, it's advisable that you pre book the seats here! Pocket pinch would be 1000 for two people.

2017-06-13 23:00:10
Diptesh Datta
1301001
4.5
Serves the best sizzlers in town and famous for their Chelo kabab. The ambience and decor gives a typical 90's feeling of a top class restaurants that we see in movies with dim lighting, the crockery and the staff. Now coming back to the food it is the best available in town and is the benchmark. The only negative is after having the kabab your calorimeter will rise exponentially with so many butter cubes in the plate which is intrinsic to the kabab platter and is thus unavoidable. The kababs are soft, juicy and perfectly cooked with the right blend of spices and herbs. Apart from the food you need to experience the ambience, the crowd and the coziness of the place which is why it is Peter Cat.

##

2017-06-13 00:57:12
Samriddhi Sinha
36419444
4.0
Before I rate this place, I want to clear out something. I am not the kind of person who will trash a restaurant's ratings because of factors like service and ambience. I might give it less than what I would based on their dishes. Some people feel that dining at a restaurant is an experience and factors other than the delicacies, like ambience, service would equally contribute to the overall experience. This is something I agree with, what I don't agree with is considering the entire experience a failure, just because one of those two failed to deliver. Hence Read on...

Over the last year I have visited Peter Cat a total of 6 times. For a person who spends eight months away from Calcutta that is a lot! I have slowly started realizing a few things about their service.
Firstly they will treat you according to the potential bill amount! They discriminate on the basis of clothes, jewellery and accessories. An excessive and overtly display of wealth is sure to get you a good service.¬†

I visited Peter Cat today, the 12th of June 2017 with a close friend. Firstly there are two types of service personnel in Peter Cat, one is for taking order another is for delivering food, looking after needs etc. The former wears a suit and the latter kurta-pyjama. I have always seen a suit-wearing guy take an order. Today however, sensing that we are students, a suit-wearing guy sent one of the kurta clad waiters to take our orders. I had no problems with that. He was a young guy and I liked him.¬†But he was not even allowed to serve us properly. The same suit wearing guy interrupted him while he was serving us and sent him to fetch the orders for more "wealthy customers" from the Kitchen. What is even more amusing, he didn't even offer to serve it himself in the absence of the kurta clad ¬†guy. Instead he went a safe distance back and proceeded to eavesdrop on our conversation.¬†
The total bill amount was 1.9 thousand and I don't think it's possible for two people to bring up a bill amount higher than that unless they order alcoholic beverages.¬†
Coming to ambience even though I like the small halogen-lit lanterns focusing on the table, a lot of people including my friend found it dark and gloomy. We had occupied a table meant for two and not only did the chairs creak a lot but the table oscillated vigorously at the slightest disturbance. They badly need to replace them.¬†

Then comes the food. We had ordered Chicken Cocktail Sausages, Dum Ki Raan, Chicken Steak, Chelo Kebab Platter, and Fresh Lime Soda.
There is a huge problem with the consistency of cooking. While the sunny-side-up on my friend's Chelo Kebab platter was completely fine, mine had an overdose of salt! And you can literally feel the difference in each of the sausages! One is stiff, another is extra soft, one is overcooked while another is under-cooked! The chef couldn't even cook the Sausages in an even manner?¬†
The reason why foreign brands like Chilli's and TGI Friday's are making a mark in the city's food landscape is because they ensure a hospitable staff. The staff is trained to be welcoming, polite and most importantly non-judgemental. They ensure that people, irrespective of their economic status are treated well!¬†

So why am I rating this place four ? Firstly the food is genuinely great here. Apart from one or two stray incidents you are bound to enjoy the food. Secondly this is a heritage landmark in Calcutta's food map. I wish them all the best in continuing that legacy. Thirdly they are a part of a lotof my childhood memories and hence I am going to be soft on them despite facing a poor treatment at their hands.Signing off hoping for a better experience in the future!

2017-06-12 16:19:23

Yes , it is a legendary restaurant and it has also managed to keep its consistency in everything good and bad. Be it the taste or the crockery, it is still what it was donkey years back. It seems time has stopped for this place . No change in taste is an excellent thing , but no change of the plates and glasses, is taking the 'consistency'  thing a little too far. 
The waiters also seem to be the ones who were hired  when the restaurant had opened , they are old , slow and arrogant . 
It definitely does serve one of the best sizzler  but the age old, dirty crockery and the rude, unfriendly staff is what is pulling the standard down .
Overall the place has zero class and standard but does serve the best sizzler and chelo kebab which is the only reason the place is jam packed at any given time and probably that's the reason the owners are not bothered to make changes because they know that people are going to flock in for their legendary dishes .

2017-06-10 18:54:33
Soumi Mazumdar
36622718
4.5
This legendary restaurant situated at heart of Park Street has maintained all its glory through the years. Known widely for it's signature Chelo Kebab, it doesn't disappoint when it comes to the other dishes in the menu. Having already tried Chelo Kebab previously (which we found to be average), we decided to go with Chicken Marakesh, a variant of the Chelo Kebab. We also ordered Butter naan and Chicken Korma. I found Chicken Marakesh to be much more delicious than its more popular counterpart. This dish has half a stuffed roasted potato instead of the fried egg, which by the way tasted amazing. Both the kebabs were delicious and the herb rice served with cubes of butter had a nice fragrance to it. The naan was nice and fluffy, and a good accompaniment to the excellent Chicken Korma. The ambience is good, it's cosy and comfortable and a gives an old world vibe. Service too was good. Might be a little heavier on the pocket when it comes to the Indian dishes compared to other places.

2017-06-10 01:18:28
Shobhan Das
36860119
2.0
We went there with lots of expectation for a fine dining experience but unfortunately we were disappointed.
We went there in the evening and it was almost empty.
Firstly there were two of us (teenagers) so the manager showed us to a two sitter which had a very small table that too at the far end corner of the room.
There was barley any space for two big plates.
So we requested that if we can shift to a bigger table as it was problematic for us.
The manager stated that those tables are for three and four sitters and we cannot shift there, while two people (elder) occupied a four sitter just in front of us and the rest of the four sitters were empty as it wasnt during the rush hour.
I requested the manager once again saying the table is too small but the manager started arguing that two sitter tables are small and its the standard size.
Then we ordered for strawberry blossom, chello kebab and chicken steak sizzler. The blossom was decent and the chello kebab and sizzler were average nothing extra ordinary. There are places who provide more delicious Chello kebabs.
Anyway when our food arrived there was no place to shift the plates even a little.
I dropped my fork twice as there was no place at all to keep them while im not using it and asked to replace it but the second time they said they cannot replace it anymore.
Then I had to eat without a fork.
Then I wanted to order another pineapple blossom but like I said earlier our table was at the far end no one was attending our table they were standing far away and I literally had to shout in the restaurant to get their attention.
This thing happened twice while ordering the dessert as well.
Finally we ordered chocolate brownie with vanilla ice cream and hot chocolate sauce.
The dessert was the only item I really liked so I gave 2/5 instead of 1/5.
I am hugely disappointed with their service.
Just cause we are less in number and that our bill will be less compared to larger groups or families,doesnt mean that you can ignore our hospitality and treat us as if you are doing a huge favour by serving us.
There are far better places at park street with lesser expense.

2017-06-07 23:22:53
Soumik
41177330
4.5
The aroma, aspect and savour of the Chelo Kebab says it all.
Peter Cat takes you retrograde to the world of restaurants.
The ambience is evocative and adorned with dim bulbs that give you ample light to just focus on food.
The turban wearing waiters also remind of the olden era.

The Chelo Kebab is appetizing in every aspect.
The Buttered Rice perfectly complements the tenderly cooked Mutton Kebabs and nicely done Chicken Kebabs. The poached egg is the cherry on the top.
The Chelo is a complete meal in itself and a single portion is adequate for an adult to feed his(or her) hunger.

**And yes there is extra scoop of butter just in case you think your meal is less buttery.

Food - 5/5
Service - 4/5
Ambience - 4/5

##

2017-06-07 01:58:55
Abhishek Sabat
34195379
3.0
Unarguably the most hyped/famous restaurant in Kolkata and Arguably the best In Kolkata.

No matter what day you choose to go to this place , you will need to consider a 30min - 1 hour of waiting time. So its better not to even think of this place when you are damn hungry. Usually a place frequented by people who come to celebrate some occasion or a pre planned visit.

Service and Hospitality at this place is amazing which is a rarity in Kolkata's restaurants. In here , its top notch...

Coming to the food quality. The most famous thing served at this place is Chelo kababs. Now its good , no doubt. But there is nothing to go all guns blazing telling everyone how awesome it was. The kababs served here are good..period...nothing extra ordinary. More than the kababs , i liked the aroma of the properly cooked rice that was served along with the kababs and the basil and parsley flavor within it. ¬†Talking about other dishes on the menu , practically tasted all kinds of kababs , tandoori items and platters and frankly they were a bit heavy on the pockets.

I have been to this place quite a few times mostly on some or the other kind of celebration , be it someone's birthday or anniversary and frankly if you have bong friends and relatives , you have to come over to this place whether you like it or not...Based on my frequent visits , i would say the taste of most their dishes , and the famous chelo kababs even are inconsistent....A good eating joint / restaurant always maintains consistency and standard....¬†

Well India is a place of lot of over hyped things.....More so in Kolkata i have found. This is one such place. The hospitality is fine....the service is great...VM , Look and Ambiance all ok(which any good restaurant would have or should have in the first place anyways) , taste is good(nothing great or which can be proclaimed a hallmark of this place) , and a bit expensive.

Calcutta), and the odd biriyani. And some standard Punjabi food, which is just about acceptable in one or two places. Period.

##

2017-05-28 13:42:45
Abu Sahabuddin
429434
4.0
I have grown up in this locality and anyone born and brought up in this locality of Kolkata would surely be a foodie by nature!

You get the best of continental, Muglai, Indian and Chinese to say the least, around Park Street!

Coming back to Peter Cat! A restaurant owned by Nitin Kothari (His elder bro Baba Kothari owns opposite lane of restaurants, except Oasis and the Mantoshs)! 

It is known for its signature dish, Chelo Kabab! Every food has a story:  What happened is that the kebab sales picked up much more and this particular dish, Chelo Kebab, started dominating. The owner had to get a second tandoor, then a third and a fourth to take the load. 

Traditionally, kebabs are north Indian dishes and eaten with naan. No one eats kebab with rice; it‚Äôs just not done! But we the people in Calcutta like rice too, so the combination of rice with kebabs with poached egg or fried egg. A combination of chicken and mutton kebabs, rice, eggs‚Ä¶ and who doesn‚Äôt like butter? So that went in too. And that‚Äôs how the Chelo Kebab came about. 

Ever since it became popular, many other restaurants have tried to copy it but the original still beats all by a mile!

The only thing I loved in Peter Cat was the drinks I ordered. The Cocktails were yummy.

2017-05-27 17:50:04
Raktim Ray
981466
4.5
An iconic restaurant since long time of Kolkata, Peter Cat needs no introduction to the elite group of foodies.
Located opposite to The KFC outlet in Park Street, rarely a time goes by when u don't find people awaiting in the long queue.We had to wait for 30mins to book a table of 4.
The orders consisted of the Iconic ChickenChelow kabab , Veg chelo kabab, chilli Baby corn and Veg Biriyani(due to a friend being veg).
The chelo kabab consisted of Rice in butter, salads ,Fish kabab and chicken kabab which were all heavenly in taste.
The Veg kabab consisted of Paneer kabab,veg kabab rice in butter and salad. The amounts were sufficient for one.
However the only disappointment was we ordered Grilled chicken platter and we were served Fish platter which was not at all upto the mark as the fish tasted raw and a bit smelly.
Being too full we had no space left for any dessert which we plan to devour in the next time we visit ..

2017-05-25 18:55:31
Priya Ray Chaudhuri
250288
4.0
Ever since the Mocambo debacle, Peter Cat has enjoyed higher foot-falls and the saga continues till date. Expect to saunter in at or after 8 in the evening and you will be asked to wait for a minimum of 15 minutes. ¬†
The restaurant has maintained the quintessential posh Park Street eatery ambiance since it's very inception and it is this that warrants repeat customers.¬†They were the first to introduce the Chello Kebab to the scene and it is this dish that people order the most, of course. I remember, it was the dish we had ordered on my first visit to the newly opened Peter Cat with my parents as a kid and it is the same dish that I ordered last week when I went there to give a treat to a friend.¬†Some things don't change and that is the beauty of this place. The buttery rice, the succulent kebabs the slightly oily bull's eye egg are all the same on the plate of chello! There are other items on the menu, of course, but this is a paean to the signature dish.

##

2017-05-20 17:45:09
Asad Chaturvedi
477713
4.0
I must have eaten umpteen times at Peter Cat when I used to live in Kolkata but never reviewed them as Zomato was a non entity. Things have since changed and hence here goes a review. The ambience is pretty similar to its cousin across the road Mocambo. The seating arrangement though is a mite different.

This afternoon meal was a total chello kebab bonanza. We tried both the chicken and the mutton chello kebab offerings. For the uninitiated chello kebab is a dish unique to Peter Cat which is an offering of seekh kebabs and the Reshmi variety served on a bed of white rice with butter, a fried egg and some veggies. If that hasn't got you licking your chops then I suggest you make your way to Peter Cat and try one of these dishes. Guaranteed to bring a satisfied sigh out of you.

Thanks to the management for maintaining the standards of food and service although the washroom needs serious maintenance and in my book that counts for a half point deduction but I have let it go as I absolutely loved my food. Trust the feedback will be taken care of.

Cheers,

After a long wait, we finally visited the place. It has an amazing aura with its unique Pathani grandeur. The waiters who were also dressed in long Pathani tunics and impressive turbans, appeared to be very energetic and courteous. 

The interior was dim and entire place smelled of excellent flavours. Our table had a nice little lantern that helped set up an awesome ambience. 

We had ordered for Chicken Cream of Asparagus soup, Chicken Irani Kabab and Chelo Kabab-The Originals. Everything was mindblowing and each dish had a distinct tinge of exclusivity. The Chelo was absolutely fit for king. The various kababs and the rice with butter won our hearts and tickled our hungry soul. 

A definite try in my list. However note that, if you are visiting the place during weekends, do expect some waiting time outside the restaurant.

2017-05-18 22:17:57

10074451
4.5
Had visited this place a long time ago.. tasted their chelo kebab and chicken marakesh.. Both of which are their signature dishes... so would review about my latest visit to this legendary restaurant...

Decided to revisit this place after a long time on the eve of my birthday celebration on 17th May 2017.. The ambience of this place is as usual very classy.. those dim red lights hanging over the tables.. With those chairs and the simple yet elegant walls will mesmerise you apart from their delicious lipsmacking foods..

Coming to the food.. Had a couple of budweiser pints to start our meal with.. those were served with complimentary snacks... 

Then came the show stopper dish the "Tandoori mixed sizzler".. actually I am a die hard fan of sizzlers.. be it veg or non veg the aroma and the sizzling sound of the dish just drives me crazy... It was just delicious.. I still can feel that aroma while reviewing it after 24 hrs..üòÄ it was a combination of prawn.. A slice of paneer.. Two small lamb steaks.. One large chicken breast piece.. and a medium lamb piece.. The gravy was just heavenly.. you will just smack ur tongue and lips for a long time... 

Then ordered the biriyani ala nawabi.. ie the mutton biriyani... though it was quite different from the normal kolkata style with some fried onions less spicy and a diifernt aroma... but it was good.. and after having the sizzler it's more than enough for two... With 3 small pieces of mutton which was soft and juicy.. 

Was thinking of having some dessert but trust me you won't have a bit of space left after having the two dishes... 

P.S the prices have increased not the same as shown in menu.. A difference of maybe 40 ro 50 rs in each dish..

The most important thing is that we didn't have to wait this time..üòÄ  maybe my birthday special...

2017-05-10 22:24:13

36619194
3.5
Peter cat is one of Kolkata's best known restaurants famous for its cello kebab. However over the years their standard has deteriorated. While they always have a full house thanks to the name they've made for themselves, their interior is slightly dirty, with visible dirt on their air conditioners and even the tables. Their service is above average, and the food is still worth it, but definitely has lost it's charm. There are better options available at similar prices for the food they serve.

##

2017-05-08 20:42:12
Amarjit Biswas
30923646
5.0
The journey towards salvation for a foodie in Kolkata is incomplete without a visit to Peter Cat. As rightfully listed by many connoisseurs, this place truly lives up to its tag as being a "Legendary" outlet. I am a frequent visitor to this restaurant for one thing and one thing only, the famous Chicken Chello Kebab.

Well, I now have two reasons to visit this place, the second being the Mutton Chello Kebab.

Pros -
i. The chello kebab - wether it is a mutton or chicken variant, one thing you can be sure that the pieces of meats are extremely well cooked and will satisfy all your meat-loving tastebuds.
ii. The ambience - It is as intoxicating as can be. In the dimmed light, nothing to distract you from your food.
iii. The drinks - this thing is sometimes overlooked by people, but the bartenders here literally create magic. Must try the bloody mary and whiskey with pineapple juice.

Cons -
Absolutely none

Verdict -
One of the few places, I can dare to rate a big old 5, without any second thought. My message to all foodies around the globe would be to try the chello kebab atleast once in their lives.

4.0
Many a time I have visited there. Many Visits - hmm that phrase actually gives the snippet of my entire review of this place.

Location: 5min walking distance from the Parkstreet Metro station. Just a building away in the right side of the previous location of the Music World store.

** During the peak hours of lunch and dinner, the ques extends to a huge. So be prepare for that. ** ¬†

#Ambiance : As this restaurant is running from decades here, so ambiance wise once what was unique for them, is now just a regular thing in many restaurants here. That reddish dim lights hanging on every table, which spoils the photographs taken there, small compact sized tables, not much loud, overall a comfortable atmosphere.
¬†
#Food : Price of the food is easy available in their menu snippet available in zomato, so I'm not getting into that part. Though they offer Continental and even north-indian dishes, but I always prefer Continental whenever I visit this place as I think good North-Indian cuisine I can get in many other place, but good continental is rare. I have tried many dishes, though names of all of them is not in mind entirely, still some of them are: Crispy Baby Corn, Irani Kabab, Mutton Seekh Kabab, ¬†Chicken Cutlet, Chelo Kabab, Sizzlers with different items like Chicken Steak, Grilled Fish, etc. They also serve Cocktails & Mocktails, so together everything it becomes a nice experience visiting this place.

1.0
Arrived at 7:30 pm, waited for 30 minutes to get a table, understandable. Seated right next to the entrance and creating an obstacle for entering the restaurant. When trying to move the cover to a more convenient side of the table, the manager told us,"the table set-up cannot be changed and if you don't like the table, you can leave the table and wait for another one". Food service was delayed and took another 30 minutes for their most selling item, Chelo kebab. Highly disappointing and disheartening service for the standard expected from this restaurant. In fact, QSRs like KFC and McDonald's have better guest management standards and don't treat their customers with such disrespect. Just because you've hit the big leagues does not mean you treat the people who got you there, like crap.
Please work on getting customer feedback and actually being concerned about your customers and clients. Once again, disappointed.

Life hacks for such 1st timers:

Chapter 1

Dinner/Lunch time?? The end result ?!¬†

CHELO KEBAB ~ The traditional dish of Iran > brought by Peter the Cat to Calcutta ‚ñ∂ they fell in love with the City of Joy ‚ñ∂ and made Park Street¬†their second home.

The plate consists of chicken kebabs, herbed rice with some butter cubes melting slow and easy,¬†some veggies by the side,¬†2 skewed mutton kebabs (the way we like),¬† and to top it with a sunny-side-up.¬†

##

2017-05-03 15:06:28
Achyuta Ayan Misra
37893560
4.0
Ambience: Beautifully unique. The reddish orange lights on each table is pleasing to the eye. The waiters are dressed in a traditional Pathan attire, which adds up to the uniqueness. The outside of the restaurant is a busy street and the broken pavement is not a good place to wait.

Service: We went in the afternoon at around 1 PM. It was not very crowded. We got a seat and were attended immediately and got the food in 20 mins.

Food: Classic and traditional Chello Kebabs, just awesome. The rice could have been a bit more done. Dum ki rann was just awesome. Perfect. We took a butter naan, which was a disaster. It was as fat as a pizza base,  just softer. That is not a naan!! 

Overall: It is a great place for a unique experience and delicious traditonal food.

2017-05-02 14:24:57
SANDIPAN MANNA
10074
3.0
The most overrated and overhyped restaurant in Park street. We went to this restaurant on Friday night around 9pm. We are given 45 minutes waiting time,usually when restaurants know they get large customers for waiting atleast give a bench to sit the older and young guests, but you do not get anything out here. Just sit along the footpath. This was the first turnoff. After 50 minutes we got the table. We quickly ordered 2 chelo kababs, one sizzler and 4 lemon soda. The lemon soda came quickly but sizzler took its own time around 20 minutes to come to the table. I also saw guests with alcoholic drinks were attended more frequently then the non alcoholic tables. We asked for the chelo's quickly but it also took another 10 mins. The chicken kabab were just tasteless and Tikka ones were cold inside, truly showing that the it came just from cold storage. The rice was just plain rice dipped with butter. The veg chelo contains were same as veg sizzler which was really surprising to have same items again and the waiter didn't inform us. To cut short, really long wait, over expensive food and really sad service. You can skip this restaurant from your list next time you visit Park street.

##

2017-05-02 12:07:22
ChocOholic
290563
4.0
I came to know from Zomato that this is the only place in Kolkata which can serve a very different dish "Chelo Kababs". The ambiance is dark there and small lamps are mounted on your table which gives a unique feeling and the staff here wears the traditional attire which gives you a heritage kind of feeling about this place. 
Well, we don't have any reservations here but still the restaurant manager was so kind that he allowed us to sit and got the taste of their famous Chelo Kababs. 
Regarding the food, they take some time to prepare your dish when you order it but when it comes on your table it's a worth of waiting to enjoy this dish. 
Well, this dish have mutton seekh kababs, chicken tikkas tossed with some secret spices and sauces, complimented with steamed rice, salad and a portion of butter. 
Believe me, I have never tried such a tasty dish in my life. I couldn't figure out that which thing gives that dish a unique taste in my plate. Everything was perfect there, service was good as well. 
The most interesting part is if you visit late there then may be you will have to wait for 15-20 mins there. So, in my opinion best time to visit there is between 6.30-7.30 pm when you will get the space very easily there due to less crowd at this time.

2017-04-18 13:05:10

4.5
What come in your mind when you think of Peter Cat ??¬†
Prawn Cocktail, Mix Grill Sizzlers, Chelo Kebab and Brownie with Hot Fudge Sauce - That's the Meal to order when you visit Peter Cat.

And they nail it each time. Same great taste, melt in you mouth pieces of succulent meat, the best quality of Fish, Prawn and Meat.

A Kolkatan's love for Peter Cat have remained unchanged over the decades. That's why at any point of time, on any day, you will find a queue at the entrance and a Captain courteously takes down your name & number and assigns you a waiting time. All I can say is that the food is always worth the wait.

##

2017-04-17 19:35:21
Elora Sil Roy
31435041
4.0
The most famous Chelo Kebab Restaurant in Kolkata. This place has long queues always no matter what! People are always willing to wait just to grab a plate of chelo kebab. But I feel this place is so much more than just Chelo Kebab. They have an extensive Indian and Continental menu. On my first visit I had the Tandoori Prawns, Biryani-ala-Kashmiri and the original Chelo kebab. Though it serves authentic Chelo Kebab, I enjoyed the other dishes much more! 
On my subsequent visits, I have had their Fish Makhmali and their various Sizzlers. The fish makhmali is just melting in the mouth and they use fish which is very fresh and of good quality. The Tandoor Mixed Grilled sizzler has various meat mixes-chicken, mutton, prawns, fish, paneer and egg- with an indian based gravy. The House Special sizzler is full of chicken livers and has chicken breasts and sausages too! 
I have also had their baked chicken, which is delicious! 
Its my earnest request to please try dishes other than just Chelo Kebab! Trust me, you will love it even more!

2017-04-17 15:07:15
Debapriya Paul

4.0
Park Street and its amazing restaurants make each visit a memorable one. And, when it comes to Peter Cat, it's more of a nostalgia for most of the Kolkatans. It is one such restaurant in Kolkata that we recommend to every visitor who loves food. Be it midday or dinnertime, you better expect a queue outside the restaurant. Their d√©cor, cordial waiters and sumptuous food hardly fail to impress you every time you visit them. Their stewards are so courteous and nice that when I burnt my finger in the hot stone placed below the fish platter, they readily brought a glass of water to dip my burnt finger in it. Their special dish Chelo Kebab is a must try. Guys, their Grilled Fish will simply sweep you off your feet if you love having fish just as I do. Do try it! The Chicken Steak Sizzler is also yummy. But too many pieces of potato in this dish might disappoint you a bit! Overall, a big thumbs up to Peter Cat! Cheers to life! Cheers to food!
Pocket pinch: Around Rs. 1300

The wait was finally over when me and my friend checked this place off from our bucket list.

Date of Visit : 8.04.2017

Food : Chelo Kababs (The Original), House Special (sizzler) and Fresh Lime Sodas

Ambience : The ambience is great with dim lighting.

Service : The staff was courteous and attentive to our needs.

Overall, it was a great experience and the place was buzzing since it was a Saturday. It was a perfect Saturday lunch. However, we had to wait for around 30 mins before getting a table. The only turn off was our neighbours in the opposite booth!

##

2017-04-15 11:11:52
Abhishek Ghosh
7821901
4.5
Peter Cat is one of the oldest restaurant establishments in Kolkata and has probably been there for decades. It is a two floor, Iranian, Inter-Continental restaurant known for their ‚ÄòChelo Kebab‚Äô and sizzlers. I went there around 3:00 pm on a weekday and had a waiting, which was very usual for anyone coming to Peter Cat. The first thing which I ordered was a plate of Chicken Irani kebab along with a mug of beer which was an extreme necessity considering the weather. The kebab pieces were juicy, tender and soft, a sign of perfectly cooked kebab. Followed it was the famous ‚ÄòChelo Kebab‚Äô, a dish serving sheik and reshmi kebabs cooked in rare spices blended with Persian herbs and served on a bed of rice with butter and egg. After that, I ordered for the Chicken Sizzler which is one of my favorite dishes there since the first time I visited when I was small. I also had prawn cocktail, prawns dipped in a sweet, tangy and spicy sauce. The interior is still the same as it has been since I went there for the first time, a mildly lit place with big lamp shades over each table. The staff was dressed like those that of the pre-independence period and are as courteous as ever. Overall I had a great experience, the one which I had longed for since ages.I must say they have maintained the quality of the place and the food.

##

2017-04-15 10:11:22
Subhranil Dutta
36004951
5.0
There's a saying that "First impressions last. You start behind the eight ball, you're never gonna get in front." Well, Peter Cat took it way too seriously. If I had to pick the best restaurant in Park Street from an overall point of view, I'd pick this one. Again and again. Everything about this place is so perfect. The staff, the professionalism, the hospitality, the food, the quality, the service time, the privacy, the ambience. I have recommended this place to many of my friends and family and it's an unanimous decision that Peter Cat is perfect. So, stop wasting your time and dine in  this place, if you haven't already.

##

2017-04-14 22:55:02
Protik Mukerjee
1488527
3.5
Well, located just next to au-bon-pain is peter cat the famous park street eatery, well known for its chelo kebabs.
This place is almost fully reserved on weekends,so make sure you have made your bookings before you turn up, otherwise u might have to wait before u get a table
As u enter the place u find it very dimly lit. The seating is quite comfortable with chinese lanterns hanging above each table..the waiters are dressed in the traditional colonial attire which the indian waiters wore when they served the british.(Though this place isnt that old,it started catering customers from 1970 and the name peter cat comes from the famous chesire cat that lives at lords stadium in england)
We ordered for:-

1. Chelo kebabs- this is the speciality of peter cat the signature dish which has been attracting generations of foodies from different parts of the country.
Served with buttered rice,2portions of mutton seekh kebab,1 poached egg and barbqued chicken nd vegetables.
The rice is very aromatic nd the kebabs are beautifully. This will definitely make u visit this place again and again

2. Mixed tandoori grill- This is a tandoori sizzler platter topped with thick  gravy this is" passionately recommended" in the menu.
By golly!! This beauty tastes awesome the grilled chicken,pranwn,paneer,liver and muttom seekh are tenderly grilled and the gravy is very tangy nd lip smackingly delicious.
The only thing that irked me here was the very non- chalant and rude behaviour of the staff, they are not even considerate about the customers problems.

All in all,for the foodies out there chelo kebab is a MUST try and do try the tandoori mixed grill my personal suggestion :-p

‡¶ö‡ßá‡¶≤‡ßã ‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶¨- ‡¶è‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶Ü‡¶¶‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶Ø (‡¶á‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶®‡¶ø‡ßü‡¶æ‡¶®) ‡¶°‡¶ø‡¶∂‡•§  ‡¶¨‡ßà‡¶∂‡¶ø‡¶∑‡ßç‡¶ü‡ßç‡¶Ø  ‡¶ü‡¶æ‡¶ü‡¶ï‡¶æ ‡¶∏‡ßÅ‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßÅ  ‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶¨ ‡¶Ü‡¶∞ ‡¶ó‡¶®‡ßç‡¶ß‡¶Ø‡ßÅ‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶§¬†

‡¶∏‡¶∞‡ßÅ‡¶¶‡¶æ‡¶®‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶ö‡¶æ‡¶≤‡•§

‡¶ï‡¶ø‡¶®‡ßç‡¶§‡ßÅ  ‡¶è‡¶ñ‡¶æ‡¶®‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶∞, "‡¶Ö‡¶∞‡¶ø‡¶ú‡¶ø‡¶®‡¶æ‡¶≤ ‡¶ö‡ßá‡¶≤‡ßã ‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶¨ " ‡¶è ‡¶∏‡¶∞‡ßÅ ‡¶ö‡¶æ‡¶≤ ‡¶õ‡¶æ‡ßú‡¶æ‡¶ì ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ú‡ßã‡ßú‡¶æ ‡¶ö‡¶ø‡¶ï‡ßá‡¶® ‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶¨, ‡¶¶‡ßÅ‡¶ü‡ßã ‡¶Æ‡¶ü‡¶®¬†

‡¶∂‡¶ø‡¶ï ‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶¨ ‡¶Ü‡¶∞ ‡¶§‡¶ø‡¶® ‡¶´‡ßã‡¶ü‡¶æ ‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶∂‡ßÅ‡¶¶‡ßç‡¶ß  ‡¶Ü‡¶Æ‡ßÅ‡¶≤‡ßá‡¶∞ ‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶ñ‡¶® ‡¶¨‡¶∞‡ßç‡¶§‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶®‡•§

‡¶™‡ßç‡¶∞‡¶§‡ßç‡¶Ø‡ßá‡¶ï ‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶Æ‡ßú‡ßá ‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶¨‡¶™‡ßç‡¶®‡¶™‡ßÇ‡¶∞‡¶®‡•§

" ‡¶™‡ßç‡¶∞‡¶•‡¶Æ ‡¶™‡ßç‡¶∞‡ßá‡¶Æ‡ßá‡¶∞ ‡¶â‡¶§‡ßç‡¶§‡¶æ‡¶™‡ßá ‡¶ó‡¶≤‡ßá ‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶ì‡ßü‡¶æ...
‡¶™‡ßç‡¶∞‡¶•‡¶Æ ‡¶§‡ßã‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶ï‡ßá ‡¶è ‡¶¨‡ßÅ‡¶ï‡ßá ‡¶ï‡¶æ‡¶õ‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶æ‡¶ì‡ßü‡¶æ..‡•§

‡¶´‡¶ø‡¶∂ ‡¶Æ‡¶∂‡¶≤‡¶æ-‡¶Ö‡¶∏‡¶æ‡¶ß‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶®‡•§  ‡¶¶‡ßÅ‡¶ü‡ßã ‡¶¨‡ßú ‡¶¨‡ßú ‡¶∏‡ßÅ‡¶∏‡ßç‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶¶‡ßÅ ‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶õ..‡¶ò‡¶® ‡¶Æ‡¶∂‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶Æ‡¶ß‡ßç‡¶Ø‡ßá ‡¶™‡¶∞‡¶Æ ‡¶§‡ßç‡¶∞‡¶ø‡¶™‡ßç‡¶§‡¶ø‡¶§‡ßá ‡¶∂‡¶æ‡ßü‡¶ø‡¶§‡•§ ‡¶Ö‡¶§‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶®‡ßç‡¶§¬†

‡¶Æ‡ßÅ‡¶ñ‡¶∞‡ßã‡¶ö‡¶ï ‡¶ì ‡¶∞‡¶∏‡¶∏‡¶ø‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶§‡•§

‡¶¨‡¶ø‡¶∞‡¶ø‡ßü‡¶æ‡¶®‡¶ø ‡¶®‡ßá‡¶®‡¶§‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶æ-‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶ú‡¶™‡ßÅ‡¶§ ‡¶ò‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶®‡¶æ‡ßü ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßç‡¶®‡¶æ‡•§ ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶ü‡ßÅ ‡¶§‡ßà‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶ï‡ßç‡¶§  ‡¶ì ‡¶Æ‡¶∂‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶¶‡¶æ‡¶∞‡•§ ‡¶≠‡¶æ‡¶∞‡¶ø  ‡¶ß‡¶∞‡¶®‡ßá‡¶∞‡•§

‡¶´‡¶ø‡¶∂ ‡¶∏‡¶ø‡¶ú‡¶≤‡¶æ‡¶∞- ‡¶¶‡¶≤‡ßá‡¶∞ ‡ß´‡ß¶‡ß¶ ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßá‡¶∞ ‡¶á‡¶®‡¶ø‡¶Ç‡¶∂‡ßá ‡¶è ‡¶∂‡ßÇ‡¶®‡ßç‡¶Ø  ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶® ‡¶ï‡¶∞‡¶æ ‡¶π‡¶§‡¶≠‡¶æ‡¶ó‡ßç‡¶Ø  ‡¶¨‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶ü‡¶∏‡¶Æ‡ßç‡¶Ø‡¶æ‡¶®‡•§ ‡¶∏‡¶†‡¶ø‡¶ï ‡¶∞‡¶æ‡¶®‡ßç‡¶®‡¶æ‡¶∞ ‡¶Ö‡¶≠‡¶æ‡¶¨‡ßá¬†

‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶õ‡ßá‡¶∞ ‡¶Ü‡¶Å‡¶∂‡¶ü‡ßá  ‡¶ó‡¶®‡ßç‡¶ß ‡¶¨‡¶∞‡ßç‡¶§‡¶Æ‡¶æ‡¶®‡•§ ‡¶è‡¶ï‡¶¶‡¶Æ ‡¶°‡¶æ‡¶π‡¶æ  ‡¶´‡ßá‡¶≤‡•§

2017-03-31 20:19:44
Bhawini Singh
33016005
4.5
One of the oldest fine dining restaurant in kolkata, located in the heart of the city, Park street. I have been to this place many times and everytime its a fab experience. Peter cat is synonyms to chello kebeb and it is a must have if you go there. A wholesome meal itself. And yes they do not compromise with either the quality or quantity. Sizzlers are a good options too. Coming to the decor, it has the old world charm with dim lights low lights. The staffs are courteous ¬†and they don't leave anyone unattended as far as my experience goes. Though the price is on a higher side, its worth it.

##

Not much to say....if you are in Kolkata, Peter Cat is a must. It is one of the oldest and finest dining out in Kolkata. Chelo kababs and their sizzlers are out of this world and probably because of which they are always crowded. Weekends are not a good option to go and if so reservations are highly recommended.

Chello kebab is a kind of platter which includes 'melt in mouth' mutton and chicken, rice topped with butter.

It's one of its kind and tastes awesome. Reservation is recommended as this place is always crowded.

Aboywithafork says it's a must have.

Thank you petercat for such an amazing delight :)

2017-03-25 08:29:03
Sandipan Bhattacharya
1062867
4.5
Well this place has literally become synonymous with the Chelo Kabab... So much so that you invariably tend to skip the menu and overlook the vast array of dishes on offer... This place serves great sizzlers too, but frankly, not too many people care... You go to Park Street, make your way to Peter Cat, stand in a queue for some time, go in and order Chelo Kabab... It has really become sort of robotic and even after so many days, you can swear by their Chelo Kabab... It is still the best in the business... Best avoided on weekends and during festivals, since the waiting time just keeps shooting up... Go in late on quieter weekdays, or non-festival weekends, and eat to your heart's delight...

##

2017-03-23 11:15:13
The Kolkata Foodie
38380894
4.5
The love of the people of the City of Joy is undying with Park Street and its string of restaurants. From Flurys to Barbeque Nation to Mocambo to Tung Fong, this place has been always one of the favourites of foodies from the city. And when we talk about food at Park Street we just cannot miss out on probably the most popular one here, Peter Cat.
Peter Cat is a place that oozes class and quality. One of the oldest restaurants here, Peter Cat has a romantic corner in Kolkatan hearts for a very long time. It‚Äôs really hard to come by a person who loves food and hasn't been to Peter Cat in this city. From ambience to decor to food and staff it‚Äôs definitely one of those places for fine dining that is always in vogue. We bring here a detailed review of their two most famous dishes.
Chelo Kabab:
The Chelo Kabab is something that has its name going hand in hand with Peter Cat. A mixed platter of chicken and mutton kebabs along with butter rice and little bit of seasoned veggies makes a beautiful delicious plate of food. On one side you have a couple of mutton seekh kababs, soft and tender, prepared to perfection.
On the other side you have chicken kababs along with grilled onions and tomatoes. In the middle you have the rice with a generous topping of butter and poached egg on top. It‚Äôs served with two pieces of bread(on order).This dish is simply perfection on a plate.
House Special Sizzler:
Two large portions of juicy steaks accompanied by two smoked sausages with a beautiful poached  egg, sunny side up on top. It‚Äôs a served on a bed of grilled lettuce and covered with a savoury sauce on top along with grilled veggies on the side. One of the high points of this dish is you will find a small piece of grilled liver in it and surprisingly that appeals to non-liver lovers too.
Peter Cat is a place you should definitely try out if you haven‚Äôt already. It‚Äôs one of the places that you will want to come back again and again.
Price for two: Rs700 - Rs1000 (without alcohol)

Please "LIKE" our page if you find our reviews and recommendations helpful. 
Please recommend it to your friends

2017-03-23 08:40:13
FoodieSinceDay0
105841
4.0
Overall verdict
Ambience - 3.5 / 5
Food - 4 / 5
Service - 4.5 / 5
Value for money - 4.5 / 5

Very famous restaurant in Kolkata. We visited to have the Chelo Kebab. Ordered for One Chelo Kebab and one chicken sizzler. 

The Chelo Kebab was good. A different concept that I tried. With 2 kinds of Kebabs served with rice and egg. The sizzler was different from the usual ones I've had. This had potato fries, the chicken in it was covered with a batter and the veggies were as usual. 

 Both dishes were topped with one whole egg. Egg is like aloo, it is served with everything. ;)

2017-03-18 22:50:04
Ipsha Ghosh

4.5
We went here for Sunday lunching - just to check all the popularity surrounding this place around the corner. 
We ordered from their recommended menu option on zomato :
Prawns cocktail (which tasted like a bit too much ketchup for some reason) 
Chello kebab (which seemed very basic) 

We went away from the standards and ordered shah nauz - and that was pretty brilliant. 

The place has a different charm to it. All the red lights, the theme based dressing and good service gets them the added brownie points.

2017-03-04 08:59:19
Abhishek Biswas
33075417
5.0
Heritage restaurant of Park Street for over decades. May it be a weekday or weekend, queue is a must. The popularity stays behind the taste n flavour of the food. The waiters dressed as serve men of the Maharaja gharana...the ambience is very sophisticated. This place is known for the sizzling sizzlers they serve. Of the variety menu we had the following:

#House special sizzler- the smoky hot plate was served with fresh beans n carrots boiled, two chicken sausages, mutton liver n two heavy chicken breast pieces fluffied in egg n then all tossed in an exotic unique brown sauce which is sweetish. Just excellent!

#Fish makhmali kebab- smoked fish which justifies its name "makhmali" is creamy n very soft with the flavour of different herbs. Nice texture n too good!

#Chellokebab- the signature dish of this place. On the plate they serve buttered rice with meat kakori kebabs n a whole chicken roasted kebab with a poached egg n tomato on top. Another mouth-watering speciality! 

Overall, a must visit place of Kolkata which still keeps the standard of food the same as it was decades before.

##

2017-03-01 18:30:27
Shreya Acharya
36189281
4.5
As any Bengali whose roots lie in Kolkata, I have a long standing loyalty towards Peter Cat, as do they with their failproof quality in food. Went there after a long time yesterday for my birthday dinner and here's what we ordered-
- Black label beer - not for the faint hearted, just saying. Also the metallic mug is cute.
- fresh lime soda - I like how they serve these without frills like fancy glasses and cherries and all. To the point :P
- Dry chilli chicken - Best chilli chicken I've had in a while. No useless thick cornflour covering. Meaty pieces with just the right amount of chilli. Ended up ordering multiple plates and ruining our appetite but worth it.
-Tandoori mixed grill sizzler - Usually we go for the chello kebab but this time we felt like some drama so the sizzlers came, amped with fish, chicken, mutton, egg and prawn. If the chilli chicken didn't satiate the non veg lover in us, this surely did.

The service was pretty great this time, which is something I observe here less because of the rush and the huge footfall. We were served fast and hot and the AC was adjusted when asked. Would've loved to order more but the quantity was huge. Nice to see these guys maintain the old tradition of generosity and no nonsense food.

I don't know if they have changed the chef or it was just rush hour because pretty much everything was under seasoned and not worth the wait. People wait to get into this joint because the food is usually worth it. Sadly, not the case this time.

5.0
I have been a patron here since I was a child. Their fabled Chelo kabab is a tribute to all meat lovers. I have tried their sizzlers and marakesh too but the chelo kabab has not ceased to amaze me. I have ordered it everytime I have been there in the last 20 years and it was 120 rupees when I first ordered it. The price might have increased keeping with the times but it is still a complete meal in itself so you don't need to order anything else but a drink to go with it. Quality, service and reasonable pricing still make Peter Cat my go to restaurant whenever I am back in the City of Joy. I consider it a pilgrimage for foodies like me.

##

2017-02-12 11:36:26
Rusa Bhowmik
35359933
4.5
Yes, the one and only CHELO KABAB. It renders me speechless...
Chicken Marakesh is also good. Among the sizzlers specialities, Grilled Chicken and Grilled Fish seem to be a non-vegetarian's delight, so I have felt. But I like the Chicken Steak best among the Sizzlers.
Fish Makhmali would satiate one. In soups, I would recommend Cream of Spring Chicken, Cream of Sweet Corn.
The service is remarkable. I would even say the standard of service is pretty much better than most restaurants.
Last but not the least is the lovely ambience. The decor is old school with dim orange lights hanging just above the table. There are two floors, I prefer the downstairs when I'm with family. I love the big round table for 7-8 people when we feast on upstairs.
I think I will never get tired of this place.
N.B.- During festivals and Sundays, please ensure your reservation as this is a popular place and one might not get a table immediately.

##

2017-02-05 00:07:20
Shounak Biswas
16103445
4.0
Peter Cat, one of the legendary restaurants of Kolkata, never fails to impress an individual right from the entry to the restuarant to the last bite of the food. Dimly lit interiors and its location adds a sophisticated feel to this place. Famous for its Chello Kebabs and Chicken Steak Sizzlers, I tried them both on my last visit to this place few days back on Saraswati Puja day. Though I've visited earlier too, but I will share my last experience only.

We reached there at nearly 1pm, and only two tables were left to be occupied. The waiters had a dress code, which seems to take back in time to the kings' era. Each and every detail adds to it's sophisticated feel. However, when it comes to the food, the first item that I tasted was Chello Kebab. The kebabs were perfect. It simply melted in my mouth. The rice with it was good too. Now coming to the House Special Chicken Steak Sizzler, it was good, but not the best. I've tasted better Chicken Steak. In fact, it was better when I last visited this place. Next we ordered Tutti Fruti Ice cream. It was again Ok-ish.

So in conclusion, Peter Cat was once one of the best restaurants in the city, but the quality is not the best anymore. Reason may be:
1. The quality they offer has degraded.
2. Other options have come into picture which are of similar quality, or sometimes even better.

There is a certain ambiguity to the whole place. The name, the decor and the food just don't add up. The Ambience is more of dingy than warm and sophisticated. But you can sense that nobody cares because the food probably has been so consistent and delicious. I instantly fall in love with a restaurant that serves free snacks with drinks. The old school mixture in a bowl was served with beer. And the beer came in a big brass mug. Wanted to steal it! And then ordered the Chelo kebab. But truth be told, it's all about the delicate butter rice that is served along with the mutton seekh and chicken tikka type kebabs. There's nothing special about the grilled stuff but the rice just lifts everything up. The vegetable sizzler was not the best though. All in all a place one must step into but not expect too much. Though the chelo kebab  and sizzlers are the signature dishes, but I would also recommend tandoori lovers to try their chicken tandoori and other north kebabs too.. ##

2017-01-27 22:08:59
Madhurima Bhattacharya
125817
4.0
So this was our first encounter with the infamous restaurant that Kolkata is literally known for. We were a group of eight people and went there last year in the Christmas week. Luckily we didn't have to wait long. As for the ambience, it's got dim lighting and a soothing music but was too crowded and looked cramped, maybe due to Christmas. The larger groups are accommodated upstairs.
The service was prompt and the waiters were well aware of the menu. Coming to the food, we ordered prawn cocktails and their special kebabs (chicken reshmi, that day). The prawn cocktails were not the the bona fid√© ones, just a bunch of prawns flooded in a cheesy dip- yummy but not appealing. For the mains we ordered the much raved chellos- the rice was soft and buttery but the chicken seekh majorly lacked seasoning. Then we went for the Dum ki Rann, which was the best we tried there- a Must for everyone! Then we'd the chicken steak which comes with two steaks, sausages, livers and veggies; a full dish in itself. But it's better to be missed. The food turned out kinda disappointing, will have to give it a try without occasions though.
For desert, we ordered the brownie with hot sauce and the tutti-fruity ice cream; both were commendable. In all it amounted to around 5.2k along with a couple beers. Giving it 4 stars only for the Dum ki Rann, deserts and the service. But petercat, with all its charms, failed to impress me.

##

2017-01-26 22:50:24
Romi
84590
5.0
The only place in Kolkata that is synonymous with Chelo Kabab. They have perfected the national dish of Iran like none other. But Peter Cat offers much more than just that. Their Tandoori Chicken is at par with the best Mughlai restaurants in town (if not better). The sizzlers are popular too. Their kababs are a must-have. Succulent meat is something you will find in all their dishes. 
Peter Cat always has a long queue of people outside regardless of the day of the week. If it is a weekend or a holiday, be prepared to wait for an hour to taste the amazing food waiting inside. 
Being one of the heritage restaurants in Park Street, Peter Cat still retains that old world charm with its dim lighting and antique furniture. There is not much in terms of decor. But what it lacks in decor and ambience, it makes up in food.

2017-01-21 18:04:39
Sukanya Saha (Entr√©e To Dessert)
34406957
4.0
If people ask me to recommend restraunts they should visit when they come to Kolkata, Peter Cat always makes it to the suggestion list. Located at the heart of the city, Park Street, this place is a classic. There are two dishes I'd recommend, and I have them alternately each time I go:

1. Non veg Chelo Kebab
(Delicious, aromatic chicken reshmi kebab, mutton sheikh kebab served in a bed of rice with dollops of butter and a fried egg on top. It's delicious.)

2. Chicken steak sizzler

The only drawback of this place is the huge queues (minimum one hour waiting time during peak hours). Reach there before 1pm for lunch and before 7:30pm for dinner and you should be good.

2017-01-20 03:17:43
Ankur Biswas
33051451
2.5
Came here at 6;30 PM on a weekday with a couple of friends. We were seated promptly and given menus but the waiters took forever to come take our order. 

We ordered 2 drinks, the tandoori broccoli, the chelo kebab and a chicken sizzler. 

The drinks took about 10 mins but the food took over 40 mins to come! The drink I got was called 'The Wedding Night' and it was one of the most bland and tasteless cocktails I've ever had. 
When we requested a steak knife for the sizzler the waiter just said they didn't give steak knives and walked away rather rudely. Nobody asked us if we liked the food or wanted anything else.
The tandoori broccoli and chelo were tasty, but I'm not sure if they were worth the wait. The chicken sizzler was quite average. 

Giving it 3.5/5 for the quality of food and ambience but a definite 1/5 for the service.

A good place to be..
The restaurant situated in the heart of the city so being there is quite easy. As you enter the place you are welcomed by warm smiles. The ambiance is dark and some old classy touch, and the staffs are polite. But the waiting area is very excruciating as they don't book a table for us. As the restaurant is very much popular so there was too much crowded. We wait there for around 10 minutes as we were 2.

It is a complete meal for one. There was two types of Kababs, one is chicken kabab and another is mutton kabab. There was soft and extremely delicious pulao like rice and a perfectly poached egg. With it there was a baked tomato which compliment the platter gracefully. It all followed by a delicious a ice-cream which is average. The products were quite fresh and warm. Chelo Kabab is their speciality so I would highly recommend to try it once. You don't need anything else. I will be there again to try their other dishes. :-D :-)

2017-01-13 19:29:46
Debarun Chatterjee
36153110
5.0
The legen-wait for it-dary restaurant gets almost everything right when it comes to serving the perfect meal. Awesome food, affordable prices, great ambience, friendly staff and the list goes on. Even though people love the Chelo Kebab and the Chicken Sizzler, I personally found the Grilled Fish Sizzler to be their best dish. The desserts are delicious too. Especially the Brownie. The chocolate sauce they serve has a distinct egg-like taste which makes it more tasty. I'd choose this restaurant any day over any other restaurant in the city (even Mocambo). The only downside is the queue you have to be in to get a table even on weekday afternoons. But isn't that the proof of how great this place is?
P.S. A useful tip for first timers is to avoid all the passionately recommended dishes. Do this and you'll come out with an amazing experience of a mind blowing meal.

There is no masala and that's the best part about the dish.

2017-01-07 20:27:03
Tilak Mukhopadhyay
1453190
4.0
Finally visited the ever popular Peter Cat this weekend and we arrived at around 12:45pm and immediately got a seat here. By then, the restaurant was almost packed with only a few seats remaining empty.

Coming to the food, we ordered¬†
1. Chicken Irani Kabab
2. Chelo Kabab (Chicken)

The Irani Kabab was delicious and the chicken pieces were tender but a bit cold when served. Also, the chicken pieces were smaller compared to what you get in Arsalan and Aminia.¬†But like I said, it tasted really good coupled with the salad.

The Chelo Kabab met my expectations and it was delicious. The portion looked average at first but at the end, I really struggled a little to finish it. There are a couple of mutton sausages included with the dish and in my opinion, it tasted really good with the rice, else average when eaten as a standalone item.

Wasn't able to have the sizzlers this time but I am hoping to go back once more to taste them as well. All in all, it was a good experience and the bill came around Rs 3100 for five people which is a bit higher than average.

One of the oldest restaurants which has successfully maintained its position as one of the top among the leading food joints. The ambience is very nice with dim lights and nicely decorated lanterns. The service is commendable and they try to serve your order as fast as possible. You have not tasted anything if you have not had the world famous Chelo Kebab at Peter Cat. Whenever I have visited this place, Chelo kebab and Sizzlers are a must. North Indian food is their speciality and I love their kebab dishes. The chef's special dishes are a must try. They serve various cocktails and beverages as well. The price is also reasonable. This restaurant at the heart of the city is a must visit for everyone.

##

2017-01-03 23:43:37
Monidipa Chatterjee
37369741
5.0
One of the most sought after and coveted restaurants of the 90's Peter Cat has been the hub of cult dining for generations.You would be considered really lucky if you managed to get a seat here on weekends and many times we had to settle¬†for other restaurants because of the heavy rush of diners outside ethe joint.I am talking of the 90's when Park Street was symbolic of good food and booze.
I have been to this place many times with my peeps, my last visit was on a Saturday in December¬†2016 with a bunch of my colleagues.As I was the first to arrive at the venue I placed a request for a table for 8 and they happily told me it was available.We started with two rounds of chicken kebabs, "Irani Kebab" and "Today's Special kebab".Service time could have been better(I cannot wait long at my table after the order has been placed).The kebabs were soft, delicious and perfectly cooked though I felt that they are diminishing in size over the years.
Chelo Kebab was the popular choice for six of the gang, the dish which Peter Cat has been a pioneer of.I ordered my favorite "Grilled Chicken Sizzler"(though I was determined to try the Chelo too).While the sizzler was taking time, I saw the familiar white plates arrive with boiled long-grained rice, topped with a dollop of butter melting in the rice, with a poached egg on top, sunny side up, and embellished with strings of kebabs on either side. As the others dug into the platter and we all chatted about our work-lives , I managed to get a few kebabs from their plates and it was lip-smacking with the familiar taste of the Persian herbs.The sizzler arrived with fumes and the customary buzz, and as I savored the soft chicken with pieces of the baked vegetables and specially the golden brown coloured potatotes¬†which exude a sweet taste as you bite in, I felt ecstacy.
But then I missed the friendly staff people and the service which Peter Cat once offered.Everything else was the same, the taste, the aroma, the buzz, the dim secretive lighting and the famous golden cat with hollow black eyes on the menu card!If you love your kebabs, find your way to this place.

2017-01-01 20:52:49
Sugata Gupta
1413701
3.0
For nearly 20 years I have been visiting this place religiously. However lately I don't see the good old peter cat anymore. Their quality of the food has deteriorated quite a lot be it their steaks or their chelo kebab. I feel they are lacking infrastructure greatly and for some crazy reason they don't want to expand. They feel along with their unique food they have found a unique marketing channel ie whenever you go there is a swarm of people waiting patiently outside and thinking when will they grab their chelo or their sizzler. 
I hope the old patrons of this restaurant would also share the same view.

##

2016-12-31 03:15:06
Suhail Ghosh
261123
3.5
One of the legendary restaurants of Kolkata, Peter Cat lies in the famous Park Street. You would be able to recognize Peter Cat by the pretty long queue of people waiting outside the restaurant for their turn. Coming to the meals, this place is famous for two major dishes. First, the chelo kebab, second, the sizzler. The chelo kebab is a beautiful dish with two types of kebabs, buttery rice and a fried egg on top of it. During my recent visits, I felt that the kebabs are made from frozen kebabs, which, if true, would be very disappointing for any food lover. I switched to the sizzler, which has been the top dish for me. The ambience is a dimly lit, cozy place, which is a beautiful setting for a romantic meal, but not really great for large groups planning on 'adda'.
All in all, one must visit Peter Cat at least once, when in Kolkata. But, please plan ahead and avoid weekends to avoid the queue.

##

2016-12-26 00:26:12
Sirsendu Sarkar
1685874
3.5
Right on the heart of Park Street, Peter Cat is a place known to every Calcutta Connoisseurs. There is long queue during weekends and holidays. Hence my expectation was on the higher side when I visited this restaurant on the Christmas week.
It's a well decorated place with reddish hue. Some might say that the partial darkness adds to the grandeur of the place. Their menu cards are a bit different with the picture and cut of a cat, keeping up with the name, I guess. They have a respectable collection of liquor too.
We ordered Fish Makhmali kebab for starters and Chelo Kabab & Chicken Marakesh platter for the main course. The fish item was okayish, nothing so special about it, but it goes well with whiskey for sure.
Despite being their torch bearer, the Chelo Kabab was disappointing. It was hardly warm, hot would be over exaggerating. It might be that due to the high demand, they keep the item ready but I was fairly disappointed. A suggestion to the management that the kebabs can be served right from the kebab sticks on fire. No one likes a cold meal, specially from such a fancy place. Virgin Mary cocktail is not recommended. It tastes like poorly processed tomato puree. 
The staffs are exceptionally courteous. I would come back to this place, may be on weekdays with the hope that I get to enjoy my Chelo Kebab hot and steamy.
Happy dining! üòä

2016-12-21 18:55:59
Suparna Roy Banerjee
2452778
4.5
We were in Kolkata for couple of days and we were puting up in a hotel nearby Park Street. Our friend had told us a lot about this place. We did cross this place a few times and noticed it was crowded all the time.¬†

After a few drinks in nearby pubs we thought of trying out this place for its famous Chelo Kebabs. So we ordered drinks and the much hyped Chelo Kebabs. The restaurant was very simple but was under renovation on the outside. However when our order arrived we were pleasently surprised as we got more than we expected. It was a beautifully presented with a combo of chicken and mutton seekh kebabs, prepared in Persian herbs and rare spices, grilled veggies, salad, half poached egg and butter cubes served on a bed of steamed rice. The experience can't simply be put into words but simply mind blowing.

We loved it and it was worth it.

##

2016-12-19 22:28:52
Anushka Bose /Onooshka
5363841
5.0
Have been visiting this place for n number of times since I started growing the sense and taste of food. One of the heritage places in Kolkata, park street. 
Famous for the sizzlers and chelo kebab. 
I have always been a fan of chicken steak sizzler and fascinated by the neon table mats they gave. The slightly tangy sauce and buttered veggies add a freshness to the rich steak. Absolutely love love it.

Chelo kebab is in itself a one man army ! Loaded with chicken and mutton sheekh and grilled kebabs served with buttered rice and poached egg. 
Also the prawn cocktail here is a speciality. Cold and subtle, you will enjoy if you are a continental food lover. 
Chicken cold salad, is also a must bhabe every time I visit. Solid chicken wedges with light mayo and lettuce. Perfect with a slider and beer !

##

2016-12-18 12:41:09
Vivek Saini
113381
3.5
It was Christmas season and the waiting outside the restaurant was unbelievable. I had recently heard of Peter cat and the chelo kebabs from a friend and hence decided to visit it this time upon my visit to Kolkata. There's an extensive hype surrounding this place. The crowd is extravagant and you literally have celebrities coming in every once in a while. Despite the crowd,  the staff manages everything pretty smoothly and in a polite manner. We were promptly seated on the first floor and offered the menu. The seating arrangement is aptly spaced out and there's no cramping. Without much ado,  we promptly decided to go for the famous chelo kebabs. The food came in,  in about 15-20 mins. The presentation of the kebabs is impressive. The central part is occupied with steamed rice topped with fried egg. The kebabs and the veggies occupy the periphery. Much like an English breakfast. Having said that that,  the taste isn't really something to die for. Frankly,  the taste is pretty ordinary. One platter is sufficient for one person. The sizzlers looked pretty tempting as well though I couldn't taste them. One chelo kebab and 2 Pepsi,  we got a bill of Rs. 700 approx. Even though I'd love to try some more options from their menu,  I'm just curious about all the hype around this place. Perhaps ,  just because it's been there for a long time?

The worst part was the guy wearing a turban who got the cheque. He just stood there stubbornly until I paid the bill almost making it obvious that I have to tip. This extortion attitude and the pathetic service earlier pissed me off enough and I closed the bill folder without any tips. As I got up to leave the turbaned guy actually opened the bill folder back at me. I gave him a cold stare and he stared right back as if a tip was his birth right. 
As part of my order was a takeaway I decided to wait outside the restaurant for a bit while they prepared and packed it. When I entered again, another suited guy very courteously asked me what I was looking for. I told him about my takeaway. He asked me to wait as he went to figure it out. I saw him talk to the turbaned waiter and once he came back his attitude towards me was suddenly different. He was now very patronising and curt, pointing me to a corner where I should wait. 
All in all the entire service staff works like a cartel where they feel entitled to tips. And have the audacity to belittle people who don't tip. They give an iconic restaurant a bad name and spoil evenings for people wanting to have a good time with friends/family.

2016-12-12 02:25:09
Sanghamitra Gupta
1831164
5.0
I am currently in kolkata , annual vacation. Hence you will all see, posts from my favourite food hangouts in this city.
Today I visited two of my favourite places , Peter cat being one of them. I cannot think of a Calcutta visit (by the way, I still prefer calling this ) without entering this place. The wait time can be long, hence be prepared for that.
The moment you enter, the aroma will add to your hunger. I usually stick to 2 dishes - Marrakesh or chelo kebab, they are a meal in itself, complete meal and you don't need to order anything else after this. One Marrakesh or one chelo kebab is sufficient for one person.if you are in a huge gang order one or two less and will still be sufficient .
This time in addition to this I also tried the Afghani kebab and the Persian rice (its rice with butter and paneer crumbs).
This place never fails , its tried and tasted for years.

##

2016-12-06 13:03:18
Upasana Ghosh
29226983
4.0
This is one of the city's oldest culinary establishments, dazzling with it's own charm in the 'Food Street' of Calcutta. The one Place without which the 'food map' of kolkata would be incomplete, has been flaunting it's distinct vibe since it's early days which not only from young to old of the city but also the tourists and celebrities from far and abroad have failed to ignore.
The dining room embrace an atmosphere that harkens back to it's early days in the 70's. It has got a very old school but a classy decor with Tiffany - style lamps and soft lighting.The staffs are very amicable and always trying to serve you to the best of their ability.
I have visited this place several times before as it has become my family's patent restaurant on any sort of family get togethers.
After repeated complains, that I have never tried sizzler, my father again decided to take me to Peter Cat. Although now a days sizzler is available in many restaurants but my father is a big fan of the originality of this place. So basically this was again a family dinner.
Coming to the food, we ordered -
Tandoori Mixed Grill Sizzler (passionately recomended by them) - which was one of a kind, a star dish according to me, regardless my father's dissatisfaction regarding its deterioration in taste, he as usual ordered his all time favourite Chelo kabab, however, I have never found this dish a very enchanting one, Nawabi Mutton -which was simply finger licking, Afgani Chicken - it was not at all satisfactory in comparison to Peter Cat standar and Tandoori Roti.
Pocket pinch is okay according to the quality of food and service they provide.

2016-11-28 12:37:08
Komal Rane
35484569
4.5
Restaurant details : The restaurant located just besides au bon pain patisserie is one of the famous continental and north indian food leisure in park street kolkata! If you are looking to dine-in, I will recommend making a reservation prior because you wont really like waiting to get those scrumptious dishes in your mouth. 
Food : The food here has its own peculiar taste. The dishes wont ever let you down! I have tried their baked chicken and chelo kebab which is one of the recommended dishes. The chelo kebab is anything one would not want to miss. I will recommend trying it from here rather than any other place, if you dont wanna get disappointed with that mouth watering love. Baked chicken from peter cat is another dish i get hunger panks sitting back in mumbai. The quantity and quality just weight right and what else can one look for? 
Ambience and Hygiene : The ambience is simple with a royal touch! The place is quiet big equated with a royal staircase which takes you to a larger sitting area on the top! The minimal pink hanging lights for each table inturns makes it romantic for a budget friendly fine dine-in for those cupid cuties! The staff is really friendly and the service is real quick! 
Also, if you are someone who likes ordering a lot and looks to take it back home, you can do that here. 
You cannot miss not getting on those lovely meals accompanied with sucha lovely ambience.

Well what to say about the food when all Calcuttans love it and there is a queue in front of this restaurant specially on Sundays to try the Chelo Kebab.

So Chelo Kebab is really a gorgeous and heavy dish and it will surely made one's day! The kebabs were pretty good and the buttery rice with that yummy egg poach is like heaven in your mouth. We were soo full that we did not think of ordering anything else and sipped on fresh lime soda and bloody mary to refresh up.
Being in Calcutta if you have not been to this place yet then you are really missing out some good food. So give a visit and I also hope to drop by there with my friends gang anyday soon.

2016-11-27 16:16:20
Xerxes The Ravenous
2894638
4.0
Located literally next door to Flurrys on Park Street, Peter Cat is as much a Calcutta culinary landmark as its famous neighbour. But it doesn‚Äôt, as many believe, date back to the Swinging Sixties. Peter Cat originally opened in the middle of the Super Seventies, before which it was known as Omar Khayyam. Is that where the Persian connection came from? I can only wonder. Because there certainly is a connection; how else could Peter Cat‚Äôs famous Chelow Kabab be so close to the Persian original?
                                                                ...

##

2016-11-27 11:03:01
Monami Basu
30342916
4.5
An old school restaurant. I had visited it earlier a decade back. In fact, this is the place where I had my first alchoholic drink. But I refrained from making any review earlier as my visit was a decade back. 

I revisited it last week in order to have lunch with a friend. Last time I had prawn cocktail, and I loved it. I had read about its famous chelo kebab and wanted to try it this time.

The restaurant remains the same when I last tried it. No change in decore, but it is well maintained. The sofa were comfy, and so were the chairs, unlike in other restaurants.

The food appeared. It is a wonderful concoction of rice, kebabs,  tikkas and poached egg and roasted tomato. Not very much quantity wise, but extremely delicious.

The waiters bustled around us having numbers pinned to their uniform. No. 11 served us. I appreciated their practiced ways.

Parking space depends upon your luck.

##

2016-11-25 18:12:31
Shilpa Mahapatra
402111
4.0
This place came highly recommended and it did not disappoint. Very old school feel with red couches and red lamps setting a dark ambience but the food lights up in every aspect. We had original chello kebab and chicken steak sizzler. The chicken steak sizzler had fried chicken in a smooth barbeque sauce served with potatoes, ans vegetables, we ordered a side of dinner roll as well. The chicken was cooked really well and the sauce rich and smooth. The chello kebab waa however the highlight of our meal, two mutton seekh kebabs on one side, chicken skewer kebab on the other, served on a bed of white rice which had a dollop of butter on top. Mix the butter into the rice and have with the egg and meat, just melt in your mouth. Although the chicken skewer was just ok, it was the mutton seekh that was hero of this dish, juicy succulent and mildly spiced, it made a delicious combination with the rice. We also had two cocktail here and they too were very well made. It doesn't burn a hole in your pocket and food is absolutely value for money. Two cocktails, and two mains costed us 1300 rs. They don't add service charge so do leave around some tip.

2016-11-13 12:41:19
Suhash Chakraborty
2789048
1.0
Firstly, to clarify, this rating of 1.0 is NOT pertaining to the quality/taste of food for which it easily deserves a 5.0! However, being in the "foodservice" industry, if "service" is the least thing a restaurant is bothered about, it DEFINITELY calls for corrective actions (and a bad review). First instance of "service": my sister, who reached there first n was waiting fr us to join, was asked to wait outside inspite of table available inside - she was made to sit inside once but again was asked to step out soon thereafter - she was ready to order food but wasn't even given an option (with rude behaviour from the guard on duty outside). Second instance: the waiter who came to return the card post payment, lingered on shamelessly for tip - when questioned about the same, had the audacity to say the bill included 'service tax' n not 'service charge' indirectly emphasizing that he still deserved a tip n when refused, was quite grumpy about it rudely! Even the staff taking the order seemed like they are doing u a favor!! No doubt it can be one of the best places to eat at Park Street when it comes to food, but if u enter it expecting even a standard level of service, u will b in for a rude awakening! Just by suiting up n wearing uniforms doesn't make u fit for this industry if u don't know the basic courtesy of customer "service"!
