##

2016-11-12 13:19:17
Mouli Bose
3033962
4.5
This place doesn't need a review. It's older than me, wiser than me and of course famous than me. XD
I have been going there since my childhood, my dad has been going there since his teen, and my Dadu from...I don't know when.
It has become an integral part of Calcutta's rich heritage, which managed to survive the passage of time. The dining room is intimate, with white stucco walls, Tiffany-style lamps, soft lighting; The waiting staff look grand, with their sherwani suits, flamboyant headgear & pointed shoes - Everything still preserves the old world charm of the restaurant.

The menu is an eclectic mixture Continental and Indian dishes, especially tandoori fare.

üî∏The Chelo Kabab is a Persian delicacy where mutton and chicken kebab are served with salty butter flavoured rice topped with a fried egg, butter and a poached tomato. It's an absolute delicacy. So is Chicken Marrakesh.

üî∏The Prawn Cocktail is basically shrimp served in a cocktail of mayonnaise, tomato ketchup and a few herbs.

üî∏The House Special Chicken Steak Sizzler is served with chicken liver, sausages, potato wedges, veggies and a fried egg. I don't usually like chicken liver, but when it comes with the sizzler you can't help but love it! If you haven't tried it yet, go, try.

üî∏Beckty Meunier is batter fried fish served with white creamy sauce in such a way that the crunchiness of the batter is gone, it forms a rather even interesting texture. Along with the fish they serve spicy half potatoes ‚Äì which taste excellent as well.

üî∏Apart from these their Dum ki Raan, Fish Makhmali, Afgani Chicken are mind blowing as well.

But just so you know, the waiting stuff might not be as warm and welcoming as you expect them to be.
Most likely you'll HAVE to wait for a table for atleast 30mins, unless you are damn lucky.
They sometimes, actually a lot of times screw up the bill somehow, so, do check it before you pay.

Bon Appetit!

##

2016-11-05 14:30:07
The Calcutta Foodie
36569739
4.0
What can I possibly say about Peter cat that hasn't been said in the myriad reviews given above? 

Peter Cat is one of the three legendary outlets of park street. The food here is mostly of the Indian and middle eastern cuisine. I'll mention items which I've eaten here the most

Tandoori broccoli - I am a hardcore non vegetarian, so if I'm suggesting a vegetarian dish, trust me, it'll be worth it. The size is huge, the tandoor is succulent and tasty, it's just amazing! 

Chello kebab - the non veg chello kebab, 6 pieces of soft, melt in the mouth chicken tikka, 2 pieces of melt in the mouth mutton seekh kebab, buttered rice with a sunny side up egg, if that doesn't make your mouth water, I honestly don't know what will. 

Fish in chefs special sauce with bread rolls - the perfect dish if what you're looking for sea food, I personally only take the chello kebab and occasionally make a friend take this dish so I can have a bite or two of this, it's the perfect crime. 

Meringue with vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce - a legendary and classic dessert, just beat in mind that meringues are made from egg whites, so if you're a vegetarian you'll have to miss out on this.

Follow us on Instagram for photos of places we frequent. :D

There is nothing special about this place except tye chelo kababs to some extent where u get rice with butter, poached egg and one whole baked tomato (not grilled as they claim), minus these items its just any usual tikka and 2 sticks of kabab.

2016-11-05 00:36:22
Ankit Jairaj
2268594
4.0
After withstanding an absurd amount of incessant mockery from my colleagues for not having visited Peter Cat, I finally gave in one day and thus started my journey to this fabled restaurant. Peter Cat has been around for more than 30 years now and despite that, it hasn't lost its sheen or vigour to serve its patrons. People flock to this place in numbers and that alone tells us about the charm this restaurant exudes.¬†

I tried their signature Chicken Steak sizzler, Chelo Kebab, and a Strawberry blossom to appease my taste buds. Unequivocally, their sizzler is a gem of a dish. Brilliant presentation, amazing taste, the perfect package. The Kebabs surprised me. I hadn't expected anything from the good ole' Kebabs but the sheer depth of the taste was overwhelming. Nicely done. The drink too was good, however, I wish that they keep more mocktails on their menu.¬†

The ambience inside was quite good. For a large place such as this, it was rather quiet when I visited it. The place at once resembles a modern restaurant while maintaining a sense of history.
I was satisfied by this restaurant. Contrary to my previous prejudices, this place was a nice eatery to have some quality food. A must visit place if you are in the city.

##

2016-11-03 18:30:56
Poush Chakra
14623831
4.0
MEAWO MUNCHING!

" The Naming of Cats is a difficult matter,
It isn't just one of your holiday games;
You may think at first I'm as mad as a hatter
When I tell you, a cat must have THREE DIFFERENT NAMES.
First of all, there's the name that the family use daily,
Such as Peter, Augustus, Alonzo or James, Such as Victor or Jonathan, George or Bill Bailey--
All of them sensible everyday names."

I begin with a prelude with Eliot's famous poem on THE NAMING OF CATS... And out of this poem comes out Peter Cat, catwalking...
My first introduction to this place was an episode in our initial married years when my friend and life partner, a proud Xaverian and Professor of English Literature, insisted to bring me here on a Christmas Night. We had wine and beer but also a revelation named Chello Kabab. It was also for the first time, ten years back, when I understood what a sizzler is... A Sizzler is Love on Fire !

##

2016-11-03 17:42:50
Akash Mallick
31284557
4.5
Well I dont know where to start really . It is one of those legendary restaurant where each and every bite of food is delightful, and each and every dish is special one way or another. They have an soothing ambience and very polite and friendly staff. Good hospitality even though we had to wait for couple of minutes as its very hard to get an seat even on a regular day. We ordered their extremely famous Chello Kabab and Chicken Steak Sizzler. Not the fastest service but cant really complain. The Chicken Sizzler was one of a kind and I can use all the synonym of the word tasty and still can't express how good it was. Chicken was tender and the vegetables were juicy. Hands down one of the best Chicken sizzler you can get in Kolkata . Now coming to the prominent Chello Kabab which I personally found very conventional. Don't get me wrong its not bad and probably better than any other restaurant can do but it doesn't blow your mind. Anyway this restaurant is definitely one of the top ones out there and gonna visit again and again ..

2016-10-26 12:40:02

2131808
1.0
First and foremost, the attitude of the staff is very bad. They are arrogant, rude, do not cooperate and are utterly unprofessional. I mean, such old people who don't have a sense of hospitality and etiquette are slowly drowning this historical place.¬†

First off, we ordered Tandoori Broccoli which was colder than a cucumber. When we told the waiter about it, he started making up stories(he didn't want to serve a fresh plate). After repeated requests, he took it back, saying we will be served a newly made batch. Turns out, when he came back, that it was the same serving we had been given before(I could see the displaced pieces and the gravy on the rim which had happened when we took some in our plates). The only difference was that it was not hotter than the surface of the sun i.e. it was merely microwaved. I was irritated and disgusted. We ordered Veg Chelo Kebab which was quite normal, nothing worthy of such an expensive and old place. The worst thing I ever had in my life came next - Veg Sizzler. Well, basically, it was boiled veggies dipped into a terrible marinade and fried, then covered into a terrible gravy and served over a sizzler plate. It was absolutely hideous to look and eating it was like eating prison food. When we asked them, they refused to cooperate and told that that's what they do. The staff was so rude and uncooperative that I immediately left the place.

##

2016-10-16 17:31:50
Debarun
31276408
3.5
The legendary Peter Cat.Most of the people who are reading this review, must have already heard about this joint from friends/media, so what I'd like to write about today is: "Does it live up to the expectations?" The answer is mostly Yes, but there are aspects which can be improved. 

To start with, the ambiance doesn't have the plush and pomp of modern restaurants, but is pleasantly antique. There is a vibrant buzz of talkative Bongs as opposed to classical music and hushed tones, which is commonplace in places, such as these. I liked it!

The drinks however disappointed me. The cocktail spread was limited to say the least. Though the Whiskey sour and fruit cup we ordered, were decent in taste, they could have been much better!

As per diligent research, we ordered bekti muniere, chicken tikka kebab and fish makhmali kebab for starters. They were delicious. Period. 

You know, during Diwali,  you get a 500 bucks rocket firecracker because you have heard, how majestic it looks when it soars into the dark sky and explodes multiple times into flowery patterns of light!  Well the Chelo Kebab fizzled out a couple of feet into the air at best and left me wondering, whether people will believe when I tell them this!

Chicken Marrakesh, like Rahul Dravid in ODIs, pleasantly surprised with it's effort to prove it's authenticity. The meat was succulent, the sauces were vivacious and the helpings were generous.

We ordered the Peter Cat Special, and Meringue in choco sauce. The first one was an honest effort to make a fruit based layered ice cream. The Meringue( a biscuit) was far to hard and sticky to be enjoyable.

Overall, it was a fair outing but from an establishment as old and popular as Peter Cat, one would expect more consistency. It surely has the potential to be far better than this!

##

2016-10-16 14:46:16
Nikhil Kamath
8292911
4.0
First restaurant I visited in Kolkata on my first visit to the city. Located in the Park Street Area, this restaurant is bustling with customers at any time of the day. So we had to wait for almost 30 minutes to get a table and it was worth it. We visited this restaurant only to have the famous "Chelo Kebab". The Chelo Kebab is a full meal in itself and consists of 2 Seekh Kebabs, a generous portion of Chickeb Tikka, Rice, Fried Egg, Butter and Vegetables. The Chicken Tikka is really creamy and juicy and the Seekh Kebabs ate also very flavorful.
The ambiance of the restaurant is amazing and the service is quick. The staff is experienced and cooperative. I will definitely visit this place again on my next trip to Kolkata

2016-10-15 13:31:51
Anisha Pal
35321131
4.5
Peter Cat, a legend in itself. Though one has to wait for a long time before getting a seat, be it on any day, the wait is worth it. The restaurant is very spacious. The dim lighting and the red lamp shades hanging on top of each table adds a whole new level of excitement to one's meal. The seating arranement is very comfortable and elite. The service is very good and the staff is always ready to sort out any problem that you might face while in there. The quality of food has remained excellent over these years and i have been here numerous times. I always go back to indulge in their filling chelo kebab. The kebabs are prepared to perfection. The tandoori mixed grill should be tried by all meat lovers, but the chicken was a bit tough the last time i visited Peter Cat. the fried beckti with tartar sauce is also delicious. This place is a must visit if one is in Kolkata and wants to try legendary food.

##

2016-10-14 22:43:39
Suchismita Sarkar
2875100
4.5
I always found dining in Peter Cat to be an accomplishment of sorts because of all the hype and popularity of this place. It's legendary indeed! I haven't experimented very much with the menu items here, hence have stuck to having the chello kebab and the house special or chicken sizzler. There is a reason why these dishes are so famous...it's because of their sheer deliciousness...!! The chicken is always tasty and soft. The other items on your plate like the veggies,buttered rice etc are also well cooked. I really like the ambience with the dimly lit lamps which cover the restaurant in a warm orange tint. The service doesn't lag much even though the place is filled with diners very often :-)

4.5
We had reached the place just in time to avoid a queue. We were seated at the ground floor and the place has a very afghani charm about it with the dressed up waiters and table decoration, lights etc. Very charming.The food is "Wallah". We had ordered for House Special sizzlers and THE Chelo Kababs. Amazing food! You know there are certain kinds of food that bring peace to your mind and soul, the sight of it and the whole table goes quiet because all you want to do is dig in and eat. Just that kind of food. Quality, quantity no complaints. Price may be slightly high but its worth it. The only drawback is, after having a hearty meal you might want to sit back and relax because while eating you did not realize how much you have eaten but you can not do that since there is a queue waiting outside this small yet cozy place to indulge in their tasty treats.

##

2016-10-13 19:53:53
Hena Sarkar
33062137
4.0
For me, this restaurant has lived up to its reputation as one of the topnotch eating places in the city, minus the wait for an excruciating 1.5 hours. It was Nobomi, so that's forgivable.

What we ordered: Prawn Cocktail, Chelo Kebab, House Special Sizzler

When the Prawn Cocktail arrived, we were horrified by the amount served. The dish would fill a teacup, that's about it. But it's tasty, like, really. The House Special Sizzler was also lip-smacking, served with two tandoori chicken breasts, two sausages, omelette, potatoes and salad. But the taste that would linger in your mouth is the Chelo Kebab, Peter Cat's specialty. Especially the buttered rice - it's to die for!

Ambience: A dark space with minimal lighting and bright lanterns hanging above every table - you won't be disappointed.

Staff: They are always at your service, courteous and quick. You'll hardly be kept waiting once you're at your table.

Tasty food. Like they say "old is gold". This veteran restaurant has maintained a very high standard of food. 

They never disappoint you in terms of quality and flavour of the dishes served. It still has the old world charm in its menu which is a welcome change against other restaurants that are competing in the market with new dishes. 
Ordered my favourites today, cream of sweet corn and chicken soup, chicken bharta ,peas polao and butter naan. 

NO OTHER restaurant makes chicken bharta like Peter Cat does. Absolutely heavenly. Also their creamy soups are to die for. 
My constant when it comes to dining out.

Ironical fact is they bring the bottle itself n place it on ur table. I orderred a brownie with ice cream too. It was good .. again.. as usual as u get else where. Total bill of the above items was 1309 including tax. Summary- GOOD but of course OVERHYPED and OVERPRICED. Still a must visit for once .. for d ambience.. for the name.. and to stop repenting when others say "Tui peter cat e jashni? Seki re! "

##

2016-10-12 15:13:26
Dr. Shrayan Pal
35467501
3.0
Review: Peter Cat

Location - 4.5/5
Situated at Park Street, finding it is very easy. Only problem is the one-way system of the area, that may leave you confused about when to enter from which direction, if you are not well-versed with the traffic system of the area. Fairly easy to reach via metro/ surface transport, being located at central part of the city.

Facilities - 2/5
Well, parking can be a mess in that part of Kolkata, not only during weekends, but on weekdays too. Expect to walk about 500 meters after parking unless you get lucky to find a nearby spot to park. No dedicated facility of takeaway.

Ambiance - 3.5/5
The feeling of the old calcutta will touch you once you enter. The smooth, dim lights are ideal for a romantic evening to old friends gatherings. Sitting arrangements does not have much of variations, but comfortable none the less.

Food & Drinks - 4/5
Costly, but tasty - in a nutshell. No, you won't find anything cheap in this place, and a dinner for to even without drinks may cost you north of Rs. 1000. But, Chelo kababs, both veg & non-veg are very tasty. Same goes with the sizzlers. All major drinks are also available. Your Kolkata food trip won't be complete without this restaurant.

Service - 1/5
Well, mostly they are polite, but I find them too arrogant in the matter of serving alcohol. One of my junior (aged above 21) forgot her id proof (who really carries one when going for a party?), they didn't allow her to have a drink, even when I was willing to personally certify her age being a doctor (what should they really want beyond that?). Moreover they were playing moral police when someone offered her a sip from his drink. Really?!

Overall - 3/5
One thing, if you are throwing a party at this place ask everyone to bring their id card with age proof (Seriously, these guys are pretty awful in this matter) Food & drinks are fine, albeit with a premium they charge, that said not a cheap place to eat by any means. Some dishes they offer are worth having.

Its a food heaven for any non-vegetarian. If you are in Kolkata visiting this food-outlet is a must thing.
Ambience :Waiting in the queue for over an hour will be worth it as soon as you enter the place. The smell of the food and the film lights and the old-world charm will mesmerise your hungry soul. The waiters are courteous. And they were all dressed in proper Bengali attire.
Food : They are excellent at the craft of making food. The foods are finger licking good there.
For our starter we ordered
Sikar- a mutton based bonless kabab which was highly tender and testy.
For main course we ordered their signature dish ‚Ä¢"Chello - Kabab" which tasted divine.
‚Ä¢Chicken biriyani- Okay. Probably you should not be here to have biriyani any time. Its only for the biriyani the scale got down to 4.0 .
‚Ä¢ Baked fish - an okayish dish.
‚Ä¢ Chicken steak kabab - its their house special sizzler. Highly recommended.
We ended our lunch with a chocolate dessert.
Overall its a posh dine area with sophisticated ambience. And each bite is delightful, provided you have enough patience to wait in the queue.

2016-10-02 21:30:27
Anjali Williams
33311924
4.5
It is a very famous restaurant in park street which my family and I have been visiting for atleast a decade now. The food is great. They are known for its sizzlers and chelo kababs. I personally prefer the sizzler especially the sound of it when it is coming to you. It's the happiest moment for a foodie. You will not find such great chelo or sizzler anywhere else in the whole of kolkata. One cannot complain about anything when it comes to their food.
 The ambience is great. Park street is a posh area so you expect them to cater to a certain kind of crowd. They are judgmental if you do not fit that category and in that casethe waiters could become extremely rude.
The thing is that because it is such a big high-fi place the waiters have a lot of attitude and aren't helpful. They aren't friendly and are definitely snobbish.

The place is a must visit if you want to experience Kolkata..no I don't say this, I was told. With a lot of enthusiasm I waited outside the always-waiting-is-on restaurant. Finally when I entered, the smell of the food, the dim lighting made me feel I was going to have an experience if it's kind. Couldn't wait to get started
The tandoori aloo I ordered for Starters was very nice, however whatever followed - Dal Makhani, Paneer tikka masala, Tandoori roti, Laccha paratha were all what I would say Average or little below. The paneer vegetable was too dry, no spices to justify it as paneer tikka masala.. laccha paratha was white, thick, heavy and not tasteful. Dal Makhani was a sheer let down. 
The prices are low and total bill was below what I had expected. Other than taste of the food, other let downs for me were-
1. Choice of Cocktails is hardly there. No Mojito,Caprioshka.. they call mixing just vodka and pineapple juice as a cocktail üòû
2. The staff is snooty and not warm at all.. I tried asking for a plug point to charge my phone for few mins as I was a visitor in the city and phone battery had died completely. To this the manager coldly refused and said they didn't allow phone charging. The small pan shop outside the restaurant allowed me to charge my phone so I could call for Uber. I was aghast at this cold attitude of the staff especially with someone who is a tourist.

##

2016-09-23 04:29:36
Srijon Bardhan
486675
4.0
Food: 5/5
Decor: 4/5
Service: 4/5
One of the oldest and most elite places to eat in the city- Peter Cat hosts a relatively small but interesting variety of dishes to offer. The drinks served here are amazing and one would be a loser if they don't have their cocktails. The Peter Cat cooler tastes funny and you've been warned.
The vintage ambience will set you in with a warm and cozy feeling and you'll have a great time here no matter if you're alone or in a group. Although amazing I won't recommend you to bring your date here. Not exactly a romantic place. The service here is okay. Nothing great! Being one of the posh restaurants in the city you'd have to write your name and wait in a que, unless you're born lucky, before they take you to your table. And the waiting time varies from 15mins to even hours.
Chello Kebab(both mutton and chicken) is their signature dish and tastes heavenly. Another great option for main course is Shah Nauz. You can start with Dum ki Raan and Fish Makhmali. The quantity they serve is a lot for a normal person so don't feed yourself much on appetizers. If you've never visited here, you haven't been much around the beautiful city of Kolkata.

2016-09-22 18:19:24
Valentine Ganesh
935806
3.5
This a very old and famous restro in kolkata .Park street area.
Pros

Inexpensive.

Convenient central location.

Serves excellent continental and Indian food.

Unique atmosphere.

Fascinating history.

Cons

Not a lot of space. Feels cramped when it gets busy.

Phone reservations are not accepted.

Extremely popular, so expect to wait for a table during peak times (especially on weekends and holidays). It can take up to an hour, although 30 minutes is more common.

Probably most people in the city of Joy who love food have been to this place at least once. Such is the reputation of Peter Cat, a true legend it is. So let's speak of the dish almost as famous as Sourav Ganguly over here.... the Chello Kebab. See, others have tried and tested with chello kebab. But no one comes even miles close to the genuine one over here. The aroma, the texture, the mix of flavours in your mouth are enough to give you instant joy. Cooked to perfection, the rice, butter, the meat complement each other exquisitely. An then, if you haven't had the house special sizzler, well then you've missed something really special. Also try the chicken Irani Kebab. Each bite is delightful. A place definitely worth a visit. If you have the patience to wait in the queue, just go for it

##

2016-09-18 11:08:12
Ashish Pareek
1557781
1.0
Peter Cat Reveiw (We dont care for Pregnant Women)
--------------------

Few days ago, there was a lot of furore over how a driver was not allowed by the "Oldest Fine Dining Restaurant of Kolkata"

I was really annoyed by that and wondered how could THEY!!

Our group was a bit sceptical of getting a table at Peter Cat on a Saturday evening..but still tried our luck anyway considering it was 10.15pm on 17th September, 2016. The people outside were around 10 or 12 and the person managing the waiting patrons (Mr. Sonu Kumar) said it would take 20 mins tops.

I requested to provide the table a bit faster as a pregnant friend was within our group. He said with a reassuring smile "please wait and I will call your name soon"

After 10 mins I requested for a spare chair to be provided for the pregnant lady, Mr. Sonu Kumar said "No chairs are available".

For a moment I thought he was blind and I insisted that there were two tables occupied by only 1 person at each table (See Pic below) and a chair could be provided..

Sonu kumar, replied "no Sir we cant give as per Management Rules."

I personally do not know the Management of Peter Cat, but in which book it is written that "Thou shalt not provide a chair to a lady in need"

We were patiently waiting for our turn, and I only requested for a spare chair for the pregnant lady as it was over 20 mins she was standing. Last time I checked, Customer Service and satisfaction was utmost and the only way to keep the customers coming back.

After a good 25 mins had gone by, few of us started to lose patience at Mr. Sonu Kumar's rhetorical answers of waiting time and not being able to provide a chair for the Pregnant Lady, and so we raised our voices. We demanded the available chair to be provided. At this juncture Sonu Kumar felt the heat but in reply his only stand was

"Sorry sir the management doesnt allow a chair for pregnant lady"

This moron and staff like him provide a bad name and leave a bad taste. Frankly there are restaurants like Barbeque, Flury's and Hakunama Tata, which are more than considerate for such a demand.

For Instance another friend of mine who went to Flury's during her pregnancy was sitting outside those iconic pillars of Flury's. The Manager upon seeing a pregnant lady wait outside his restaurant for a table, immediately provided a chair and said "Madam,you should have told us the moment you came here. Why should you wait outside". I had observed a similar instance at Barbeque restaurant as well.

This talks about the human connect and talks volumes and creates a lasting brand inpression.

Today our group felt that 'These Restaurants' really do not bother for customer staisfaction and all they care about is Money..

We were more than happy to spend our 8 grands at the other eatery nearby which catered to our special need.

Thank you Peter Car Management, for showing what 'Fine Dining' means

P.S. The Management at Peter Cat lives under a rock, which is oblivious to the impact of Social Media.

##

2016-09-17 13:23:54
Anish Malakar
16493722
1.0
My brother and me went here one rainy afternoon in order to try out the famous Chelo Kebab. Had heard a lot about this place (mostly good things), so we had high hopes, but were sadly disappointed.

There was quite a crowd at the entrance when we arrived, so we were not surprised to hear it would take about 20 minutes to get a table. Not wanting to wait right in front of the door, we stepped off to the side of the portico, and returned about 5-7 minutes later. The guy at the door announced in an irritated voice that he had already called for us once! We were finally seated 2-3 minutes later and ordered our food.

Food arrived quite late, which was expected in such a busy joint. Surprisingly, the famous Chelo Kebab was almost cold when served. However we said nothing and concentrated on the food. Halfway through, the server asked if we would need anything else. We replied that we would decide after finishing. Strangely, the guy returned twice in the next 15 minutes with the same query. It seemed as if they were trying to make us leave! We indicated we would decide and call him. Not sure how the guy interpreted this, but the next moment, we see a bill on our table. I called the server for an explanation, he apologized and took away the bill, but by then, we were more than ready to leave.

So basically, food is OK, ambiance is OK, service is complete shit. Overall, not a good experience and certainly not one that I would be repeating in the near future.

2016-09-14 15:20:09
Souvik Ghosh
7522121
3.5
Peter Cat! A name when pronounced gives us an image of a posh Dine in with fine wine and sophisticated ambiance.You are correct the image is exactly the same till there. What happens there after is a different story.Service is moderate. A slight hint of aristocratic arrogance if you will. Well lets get to the broader story. The guard outside scans you from the tip of your hair till the tip of ¬†toe scanning like K10's infrared scanner.
Once you are in the ambiance really will please you, I mean 10/10 for the ambiance on any given day.
Want some special care taken towards you, make sure you have pretty ladies around and trust me a swish of your hand will fetch you 2-3 greedy staff members at your disposal. Coming to the food(being the main reason why the rating goes up to 3.5) CHELO KEBAB.. Pure bliss of a dish, specially the dice of butter on the rice just tingles your olfactory senses. Mutton rogan josh is another worth while mention. Tender meat very well cooked. Me and my family also had chicken tandoori and it was a good buy. Price of the dishes are a bit on the higher side. But hey you are in peter cat mate that is expected.
Good dine will definitely visit more because of the food and ambiance.

2016-09-13 19:14:53
Udit Bhatia
11608631
2.5
Not legendary

The hype about the place landed me here and to my dismay, it was only the hype and hardly any substance. I am not a hard core fan of bengali cuisine where the use of egg with rice is considered a usual practice. I ordered the famed Chelo Kebab platter and it was ordinary. I didn't find it spectacular. My friends ordered sizzlers which were mundane too. To add to the negative experience, the service is slow. Also, do not visit on wekends as there are serpentine queues outside, for those hardcore buffs to are driven by the hype or the past legacy.The place seems to have lost its glory and with a plethora of fine dining options in Park St., a serious revamp needs to be done to sustain their customers.Food- 2/5
Ambience- 5/5 (yes, it is soothing and chic)
Service- 2/5
Value for money- 3/5

2016-09-13 18:11:25
Somdyuti Mukherjee
2292586
4.5
The experience I had at this place was quite a nice one. 
We ordered for the legendary Chelo Kebab and the Chicken Sizzler. I was absolutely mesmerised by the taste of the Chelo Kebabs! It was one of the most finely cooked pieces of meat I've tried. 
The sizzler was also amazing, to say the least.
Coming to the ambience and the staff. The seating was a little uncomfortable, as we both were tall and didn't seem to manage to fit our legs comfortably.
The staff were efficient but they were kind of rude. They even expected a tip after all the heavy service tax. I always believe in leaving a tip but I didn't like how they waited for us to actually give it to them, even though they didn't even bother to refill our glasses of water.
I would go back there for the amazing food nonetheless.

##

2016-09-13 16:46:59
Rituparna M
35261850
4.5
Had an amazing dinner with my family on my birthday last Sunday. This is the first time I had been there on a Sunday so had no clue about the rush we'd face and the fact that we'd have to wait in a queue for over an hour to get a seat at the dining table. However, it was worth the wait. The Fish Makhmali which we ordered as a starter was perfection. Had heard a lot of nice things about this dish at Peter Cat so we had to try it. It was mouth-watering! After this we ordered the Chicken Chelo Kebab (the original). It was delicious and was full and wholesome. The chicken kebabs were scrumptious and the egg was yummy to the core. I simply fell in love with the butter rice. The veggies in this dish jelled perfectly with the non veg items. It is advisable to people like my family for whom this dish was a bit excess that they should order two plates for 3 people. For dessert(which is a what I closely watch-out for in all restaurants and food places) we ordered the Meringue with Vanilla Ice cream and Hot Chocolate. And yes it tastes as good as it sounds. The hot chocolate which they serve separately in a small metal beaker is so so delicious. The vanilla ice cream was perfect too. And it must be added to every spoon of meringue you take in as the meringue has a tendency of hardening after a while. This hardening cause it to become caramelised-like and makes it difficult to scoop put with a spoon. Initially this is the condition on the top of the dish, however the meringue is perfect and crunchy with no difficulty of scooping with a spoon at the bottom of the dessert. I loved the way the dessert was served. My mom who has a sweet-tooth simply loved it. Thank you Peter Cat for the welcome and the great food experience and to all the people there who made our dining experience worthwhile and memorable.

2016-09-13 11:48:30
Sourin Sutradhar
6910741
2.0
I have been to this restaurant. I will begin with my experience and then describe the restaurant in general.First I came to this place on a Sunday night, and not to my surprise, it was overcrowded. We had to wait for 1.5 - 2 hrs before we got our name called. The restaurant is dark and ¬†has a weirdly trying-to-be-classy atmosphere. The furnitures were not in a very good condition, not sure whether lack of proper care or inability to afford. Anyway, the service was good.
Now coming to the food. Firstly, it was over hyped. I have been to very good restaurants in Mumbai and Bangalore and this is no way a match to them. Even small cafes in Bangalore, like Cafe Max, has better cooks than this place. Anyway, since in Kolkata people have limited access to good restaurants, I guess this has been able to stand¬†as a catch among rookies. ¬†Secondly, its over priced also. I paid 4.5k for 4 people, without any alcoholic drinks. Even Taj Bengal provides a better price to people ratio for non-alcoholic orders. By the way, the chello¬†kababs are good, but nothing special. You can get those kinds of kabab in normal restaurants like Tunday¬†Kabab. I was trying so hard to find atleast one rememberable thing from this restaurant, but could not.¬†
Overally, the atmosphere is questionable and the¬†food is okayish and prices are high compared to the service offered. Won't be coming back to this place for some time until I run out of options in Kolkata. Will keep on looking for better places.

##

2016-09-09 23:22:26
Indranil Roy
1786371
4.5
I guess I am late in providing a feedback / review for this resturant which has served generations together. I came with my family first in 1986 and till now nothing has changed. Even the quality. There hospitality and quality of food has withstood time and all odds.

They are an example to others to show quality rides over anything. I can go on with each one of their dishes. But I guess, what is required is paying tribute to some of their signatures like Chelos, sizzlers and Tandoor which gets the least recognition. I guess their tandoor is one of the best at Kolkata.

What makes this resturant different from others is their entire solution, team, ambience, delicious dishes and value for money. You cannot ignore anyone of them. If I am to identify some of their starters / appetisers, tandoori chicken comes to my mind or chicken miayonnese or chicken cold salad. Even the kabaabs are fantastic. Cold beeer with tandoori chicken or chicken miayonnese will set the tone for evening and a lunch. Their indian cusine is as good as their continental dishes. A special mention about prawn cocktail...... even if you are not a big fan of appetizers i guess, you should have it. I bet you will change your opinion !!

To end with caramel custard or even the other cold desserts are good to end your meal..!!

Enjoy your food with them !! They are awesome ;-)

Cheers..

Peter Cat is a legendary restaurant and is one of my favorites in the city. I've been to this place numerous times - so much so that I've actually lost count. Peter Cat is my one-stop shop for chello kebabs and sizzlers. Whenever I'm there, the only things that I order are chello kebabs and sizzlers. Both their sizzlers and chello kebabs are unparalleled in taste as well as presentation. I've tried 3-4 of their sizzlers - out of which the house special and the tandoori mixed grill are my personal favorites. I've also had the opportunity to try out both the original chello kebab as well as the mutton chelo kebab. Needless to say, both of them tasted very rich and authentic. The ambience too is a major plus point for them. I also remember having ordered a banana split once. The dessert was a poor effort, at the very least. Since I had had that particular dessert before at an ice cream parlour, I could easily make out the difference. My mother had ordered a souffl√© and was not satisfied as well. They could stand to improve the quality of the desserts I think. Apart from that little glitch in an otherwise flawless management and quality, this place will make you come back for more, time and again.

##

2016-09-08 22:10:06
Anchita D
5981211
3.5
Unlike wine, everything does not age well. Peter Cat, a legendary destination has lost its glory big time. Though the restaurant along with ambience and the food is not very disappointing but nonetheless it's not as it was. The flooring has worn out and the table lights have become dusty. The staff too seems to be aware of the lost sheen. They care less both about the place and the customers. You have to keep them reminding to fill your glasses and to clean your table. Coming to the food-the Chelo Kebab was mediocre with both the chicken and mutton kebabs being overcooked. The chefs do have a tendency to overcook meats, even the mutton steak sizzler was tough and disappointing. The best part of today's meal was the appetizer-Fish Muniere,two crumb coated pieces of bhekti with generous coating of mayonnaise on top was a happy beginning of the meal. The sides were more impressive than the mains especially the roasted potatoes. I would not return for the meat dishes ever but one should go there for the old-world charm and the fish starters.

##

2016-09-08 13:22:15
Dilashi Hemnani
35517533
4.5
After constant brag about the Chelo kabab at this place by friends and family . Finally decided to try this out on my visit to Kolkata ,just next to flury's on Park Street . 

This place with a beautiful red lights will please your taste buds . We ordered for chicken Chelo kabab , brownie with icecream and a cocktail called the wedding night . 

Chelo kabab is the national dish of Iran . Peter cat's Chelo kabab version has steamed basmati rice topped with home made butter , poached egg , mutton seekh kabab and chicken tikka with capsicum , onion and tomatoes and all of it was perfect to the T . The brownie was also soft and fluffy with vanilla ice cream and a waft biscuit topped with hot chocolate sauce .

My local friends from Kolkata tell me that this place is generally full and on weekends there is a huge Que but we went on a Tuesday early evening so we're lucky to get a seat in 5 minutes .

Food -4.5/5
Ambience -4.5/5
Service - 4/5

Definitely want to visit again :)

2016-09-05 15:20:46
Anwesha Saha
35549764
4.0
This place is famous for their chelo kebab. Its one of extremely popular restaurant . Evn i can say petercat is a shining star of kolkata.

Location: this is located in park Street. Just Opposite to the parkstrt Kfc.

About restro : ambiance was good with classy decor. Food quality and quantity both was pretty good. They have quick sevice.The stuffs are always on a run to meet the  expectations. There are two floors which are decorated with dim lights and comfortable sitting arrangements. 


Fish fry:  for starters we ordered fish fry. It was really good. Fish lovers can go for this and it will never disappoint u. it was really impressive.

Chelo kebab: this one comes with flavored rice with butter cubes,grilled chicken,mutton kebabs,salad and topped with a egg poach. It was delicious and quantity was more than enough for one prsn. The entire platter is just yum!!

Tutti-frutti icecrm : it was good. Nothing special. Served wth Mixed fruits and strawberry and vanilla scoops with one wafer slice.

I can't say its a pocket friendly restro but the prices are moderate. if u want to go for this restro u need to take some time in ur hand,because its always full.  Continental food lovers will definitely enjoy their extremely tasty dishes..
Highly recommended!!

2016-08-30 19:52:41
Sukanya Ghosh
589490
4.0
So finally visited Peter Cat- one of the iconic restaurants of Kolkata. Dim lights, great ambience, good service and amazing food is all you need to fall for this place. Had their iconic dish- Chhelo Kabab, and for reasons well known to everyone, this dish is actually very good and will make sure that you come back craving to this place again and again. We ordered a veg chhelo kabab and a non veg chhelo kabab. the veg chhelo kabab comes with hot white rice served with a dollop of butter, paneer kababs,  veg seekh kababs and a veg cutlet mind of a thing. The non veg chhelo kabab comes with same hot rice served with butter, chicken kababs, mutton seekh kabab and topped with a poached egg. To our surprise , even the veg chhelo kabab was good to eat, but sheer delight was the non veg chhelo kabab. Everything was cooked to perfection and it was a complete meal in itself.

Do visit :)

What can you say about such an iconic place which hasn't already been said or written.  It still has the charm of the English Era and takes you back onto that timeline. This place is famous for its sizzles as well as its Chelo kebab. But the Indian spread available here is also very good.  The food menu has enough options for everyone and none of the items disappoint. 
We always order a mix grilled sizzler and a house special sizzler.  The quantity is sufficient for one person and the taste is brilliant.  The sizzle,  the look the generous quantity...everything's great. For starters we have tried the seekh kebab,  tandoori broccoli, raja gaulati kebab,  fish makhmali and all have been great.  The fish lovers can also go for fish meunier and it will not disappoint you. The north Indians can try the shah nauz or Afghani chicken with any variety of Naan (this place serves one of the softest Naan's on Kolkata). 
The only drawback is the waiting period even on weekdays for dinner. 
Overall an excellent place which serves great food and good ambience and it's not very expensive. A definite must visit for everyone.

Whenever am in Park street this place a must for me...it has a different charm for me. Chelo kebab an all time favourite for me in this place. Word of caution if you are visiting the place during weekends be prepared to wait for at least 30-40 mins.

The drinks are reasonably priced with a good variety. The table lamp is lit well enough to make you feel cozy and comfortable. If you are heading to Kolkata, I would strongly recommend you to give Peter Cat a shot.

4.0
Located in the heart of the city, this legendary restaurant is still one of the most popular restaurants in Kolkata. On arrival, you need to always wait for at least 15 minutes before you get a place inside.¬†
The restaurant is extremely packed and noisy, but the food makes up for the noise and the wait.I have been there several times and always without fail ordered the non-veg Chello Kebabs.¬†
Chello Kebab is an Iranian dish which consists of buttered rice served with two different kinds of Kebabs- one is a lamb sheek kebab and the other one is chicken reshmi kebab. This meal is enough for one person, and in my opinion you need not order anything else.¬†In short,¬†1. Great food
2. Noisy and crowded.
3. Need to wait for 15 minutes + before you get a table.

##

2016-08-15 17:15:13
Samonway Duttagupta
48302
5.0
Peter Cat is that one place for which I can review a 100 times over. What a place to be! Although I haven't had a meal here for years, but I am sure it's the same old amazing place it used to be when I was growing up in the City Of Joy.

For me, this restaurant is more of a nostalgia. I remember waiting in the queue for at least 30 minutes to an hour every year during the Durga Puja and the Christmas for getting a table in this restaurant. After all, those are the times the city of Kolkata is on the streets and want to sample the best flavours on offer.

I haven't really explored every part of the menu, because I used to have two of the things that everyone comes to eat here. Chello Kebab and the Sizzlers.¬†

As a travel writer, I have travelled to many parts of the country and have eaten in several places. But no place in this country can serve better sizzlers.¬†

And I don't think I can say much about the Chello Kebab. I would say it's a heritage dish of Kolkata and one that can never be explained, but only experienced. No wonder, actor Rishi Kapoor once got it packed and take it back to Mumbai.

In fact, I am so much in love with this place that I can recommend somebody to travel to Kolkata just to have a meal in this restaurant.

To the Peter Cat management, I would just like to say one thing: thank you for being one of the most beautiful parts of my childhood. For me, you will always be the best.

As the Vulcans say, "Live long and prosper!"

Cheers!

2016-08-15 02:28:57
Ayan Bhattacharya

4.0
If you are visiting Peter Cat, you should go for the chello kebab before anything else.
It is simply heavenly here and their speciality dish.

For sizzlers,I once had the House speciality sizzler here and believe me it was nothing special.
On the contrary that is the worst sizzler I have had in my entire life. On top of which me and my friend had to order two large pegs of vodka just to gobble that miserable thing down.

The ambience is great and being one of the most famous restaurants in the city, you can expect the prices to be what you may expect at Park Street restaurants but nothing too unreasonable or too OTT.

Food quality is also great but a single plate of chello kebab might just fill more than half of your tummy if you are a mediocre level eater.

For sizzlers I would suggest Mocambo but Peter Cat is too legendary a restaurant to skip in Kolkata.

Peter Cat is one of those extremely popular family restaurants in Park Street which is almost full to bursting on any day of the month. With beautiful dim lights and a two storeyed dining zone, Peter Cat resonates elegance and heritage. Renowned for their Sizzlers, their signature Chelo Kabab and Mixed Sizzlers are a people favourite. Their Indian cuisine too boasts of good flavours. What more, you get decent cocktails to wash down your food with. The cost is reasonable considering its popularity and it still remains a go to place for many a family looking for a Sunday lunch together.

2016-08-11 18:08:21
Arkaprabha Mukherjee
224624
4.5
LAST REVIEW -- 2 months ago -- "I've been a regular here for many years now, but sad to see that the quality and the quantity has gone down just a little bit. No offence to the management or the great chefs on board - may be my visit was on a bad day, but whatever the case might be, it was a bit unsatisfactory. Buck up guys. I want to be able to bring my kids here in the future and tell them that this is where their parents used to date. There is always room for improvement, so it's time to change gears. Don't worry about prices - if you provide quality, you will get what you deserve. In my 6 years of being a house special sizzler and chello kabab lover, this is my first review. So, will update this if I notice improvements. :-)

To other food lovers who haven't been here: - Don't worry. This is still Peter Cat. They can still surprise you. So step in, and prepare to be surprised.
" -- LAST SCORE GIVEN -- 4.0

UPDATE -- 11.08.2016

My last review sure seems to have worked, because today I had perhaps the finest and most well prepared house special sizzler I've had in my 4 years of being a "Petercatian". My girlfriend ordered her usual Chello Kabab original, which was as usual perfection personified, or rather foodiefied. (no pun intended). These were clubbed with our usual Fresh lime soda, and the entire thing was topped of with Large tutti fruti, which was spectacularly fruity, and definitely tasty. ¬†Now for some special announcement. Today was the first time i ordered alcohol at a restaurant. I chose Peter Cat because this place has given me some of the best memories in the last one year. We ordered Tuborg pints, which were served in those metal mugs which I was sooo in love with. The entire experience was wonderful. The staff was its usual courteous special, and we finally found a sit on the upper level, which I actually prefer more than the ground floor. The price was as usual affordable. I am increasing 0.5 points due to the obvious improvements I noticed today. Thank you for a wonderful meal.

2016-08-10 02:19:36
Urmimala Nath
1675714
4.5
If you prefer privacy and dim light then you'll love it... The place had a decent service. We ordered the very clich√©d chelo kebab and grilled chicken sizzler for main course and one iced coffee with cream , maringue and vanilla ice cream with hot chocolate and brownie vanilla ice cream with hot chocolate as dessert. The sizzler is sweet and mellowed....I know this would sound weird bt try the cabbage of the sizzler...god they are really tasty... Coming to the chelo , it has butter rice, a reshmi kebab two mutton tikka sticks sprinkled with some salad. The items we chose were in general not at all spicey....rather buttery and creamy. The ice cream was my favourite. The maringue vanilla with hot chocolate has a crunchy sweet muffin above a square chunk of vanilla ice cream. The chocolate sauce is not the typical hershey sauce ... Its a thick gooey sauce , low on sweet yet very yummy. The dessert is what I seriously enjoyed. If you like continental or Ondian you should definitely check it out.

2016-08-04 00:53:54
Debangana
1059696
5.0
When in doubt,go to peter cat! This restaurant never disappoints. Be it their sizzlers or chelo kebab or irani kebab or salad or dessert..every dish I've tried to so far has only made me fall a little more for this place!

Being a strict anti-healthy food person, the name salad manages to make my soul shiver with fear. However, the cold chicken salad at peter cat is something that managed to tickle my taste buds in a good way! 
The mixed tandoori grill sizzler is something that you absolutely must try! It has chicken,mutton,egg,liver,prawn and what not! It's essentially every non-vegetarian foodie's dream come true. 

You know that extra space that your stomach secretly  has stashed away? The one that's available only for that extra plate of your favourite food? I'd never come to know of it if not for Peter Cat. 
This one time,after having a tummy-full of their delicious food when I think I'm about to burst and there's no way that I could eat anything more,my friend decided to order us this dessert(Chocolate brownie with vanilla icecream and hot chocolate sauce). The journey from "I'll have just one spoon" to eating the entire dessert was something I'll remember forever. Even as I pen this down,I can hear my tummy gurgling for some more of that dessert. You cannot go peter cat and not have that dessert,that'd be a cardinal sin! 
Here's hoping you love this place as much as I do. Highly recommended. Bon apetite! :D

2016-07-31 10:38:08
Kayfabe
426584
4.0
Mention chelo kebabs to any Calcuttan (there will never be a true Kolkatan) and they will send you packing to Peter Cat. Don't go by appearances, most vintage joints on Park Street will look rundown when compared to their peers in other metros.

Step in and get immersed in the wonderful world of Anglo-Indian cuisine. Chelo kebabs are always a treat here (though I have had better Iranian fare elsewhere). Baked Chicken and Beckty Meunier are absolute delights.

Come in all ye doubters, walk out with a far better outlook on life.

2016-07-26 21:07:13
Anit Sen
30458165
4.5
Was here 2 weeks ago. This place was always in my bucket-list. "Chelo-Kebabs at Peter Cat" - yeah I had longed for them since I had first heard abt the dish around 5-6 years back. Finally I urged our group to go and have lunch here. The decoration and the theme is unique, to say the least. Quite a palatial feel abt this place, with all the getup the waiters have, I'm sure anyone would want to be here. The food is served pretty fast after the order is given, unlike many places. The hospitality is gentle and nice. The ambience is top-class. The main problem is the tax that comes with the bill - it includes all the hospitality and well-being the place provides. Let that amount be a surprise. We ordered 2 chelos and 2 chicken sizzlers - which were delicious and suited our appetite quite well. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone. Go on, have a nice meal with your loved ones. :)

##

2016-07-25 23:52:36
Santashri
2484808
4.0
Peter Cat is one of the iconic restaurants of Kolkata. It's been here for almost half a century and you know it's here to stay. Located on Park Street among many other restaurants, this place would still almost always have a waiting, weekday, weekend, lunch, dinner.

It is an out an out family restaurant with ample seating, mellow lights with the iconic shades over each table and good food. The chelo kebab is the most famous dish here and it is a favourite order and every table has one. It's a complete meal with steamed rice served with more than a dollop of butter, a sunny side up and the kebabs with salad. It's pretty heavy though. Apart from the chelo kebab the menu has a lot to offer too. It is a mix of Indian dished and foods with the middle east and European influence. With the sizzlers and steaks and cutlets and roast, one would never run out of options. We also tried the chicken steak. Among the desserts, the brownie with ice cream is a must try. The brownie here has the perfect texture, its crisp, brittle but still hold itself and just spreads in your mouth.

The prices are moderate. The privacy is a bit low but then would not exactly mind it, it's a merry place. The service can be better but then the food makes up for it.

Being in Kolkata, Peter Cat must be on your list. 

Happy eating!!!

2016-07-24 15:17:05
Aritra Chatterjee
29624833
5.0
A legendary restaurant of Kolkata, this is one of the landmark places to eat in this city. On most days it is very difficult to get a seat during peak hours as it is always teeming with people. But the wait is worth its weight in gold....I can assure you that. The Chelo Kebab is the signature dish here, so also the sizzlers. Other items like Biryanis, mutton Rogan Josh etc. are pretty good too. Service is very quick and highly hospitable staff are there, who attentively attend to the customers. The ambience is a class of its own with dim orange lights and comfortable old school seating arrangements. If you plan to visit Peter Cat....do so with some time in your hands cause there is always a waiting time before you get a seat. Just love being here....every nook and corner of this restaurant screams HERITAGE and there is a strange romance to it.
The romance with Peter Cat will always continue.....

Peter Cat, is of course, one of the most distinguished restaurants in Kolkata. We had ordered for their most popular dish - Chelo Kebab. Rice, served with 2 types of kebabs, 1 egg poch, and half a tomato n a cube of half melted butter on top of the rice, this dish is absolute love. Sufficient quantity at the price of Rs.325. Next we had this Chicken Steak Sizzler which was also topped with an egg poch, and was also mouth watering. Apart from these, we ordered fresh lime soda and a cocktail named Long Time-Brandy Collins. The ambience here is posh. Courteous staff. I love their outfit, they wear a traditional outfit with a turban. Pocket friendly place. Altogether, I had an amazing experience at Peter Cat.

##

2016-07-21 01:57:17
Farhan Ahmad
29640700
4.0
Looks and feels amazing, food average!
Almost everyone, especially a Kolkatan, who has seen or heard of the place has wanted to have food here. And my much anticipated visit with my friends happened to be a parting dinner treat for my veggie friend.
The entry beckons you with curiosity to step inside, and when you do your awed. Pure class and warmth by the looks and feel of it. The dark atmosphere is well matched by the subtle light from the lampshades, cosy enough to have some good time with loved ones. Seating comfortable.A look on the table as you are seated may disappoint you. I do feel the cutlery used(glasses,bowls,handkerchiefs) are quite old and needs a change. It just doesn't match up to all that's out of the table.

The order for 3 ppl was nonveg Chelo kebab for me and veg Grilled sizzler and Veg chelo for the others. A chelo or a sizzler is huge in quantity and both together can be shared easily by two. I was the lone nonveg, so had to be content with just the chelo. Coming to my nonveg chelo, the seekh kebab was excellent(lovely flavour of spices) but the chicken kebab was not upto the mark. It lacked some spice and had to be complimented by some lemon juice. The rice and egg simple. Although its their signature, it was satisfactory for us but nothing exemplary. The tandoori alu was the best in veg chelo. The sizzler was decent. The sauce poured over the kebabs was tasty. We just wish the sizzler was accompanied with its own rice. Would have been great then.

Service is prompt. Dishes are expertly explained and orders served well. The price is reasonable for Park Street. The ambience was overwhelming but the taste (though satisfactory) didn't live up to the hype. Other dishes to be tried soon...

One of the best restaurants in Kolkata. Located in the flamboyant area of Park Street, Peter Cat is the epitome of class. The restaurant has a beautiful ambience and visitors are hosted very well. 

The food is excellent in quality as well as quantity. The Chelo Kebab is just too yummy and perhaps the best in Kolkata. The Biriyani Ala Nawabi and Chicken Bharta are also good. The price is reasonable if not on the lower side. 

Enjoyed the lunch at Peter Cat. A nice and cozy place to have lunch or dinner with family and friends over chats.

2016-07-18 13:50:30
Sayantan Paul
4019911
4.5
Peter cat. Somehow it always has a queue whenever I visit. The decor is very much Continental infact it's pretty similar to mocambo which is also of the same owner. The settings are very intimate and cozy. Take a date and this place will do wonders . What I really like is the upstairs section , climbing up the staircase with the wooden railings. Now to the food. The menu cat resembles the place as it is of a cat most possibly named peter. If you come here, order sizzlers and then a chelo kebab. They make chelo kebabs like no other and it's one of their signature dishes. Try their keema nan too along with indian gravies. Just absolutely delicious. The service is fast and warm.  Must visit if you haven't yet. And the pocket pinch is high. But worth it.

##

2016-07-17 15:19:28
Sumit Surai
11641
3.0
This is a legendary restaurant in Park Street known for its arrogant stuff, decent sizzlers and overhyped Chelo Kebab. Expect long queue, especially on weekends and some rude behavior from the stuff. Ambiance is pretty basic with dim lighting and comfortable seating.

I like the prawn cocktail here. Creamy and full of flavours. The Bloody Mary I ordered couldn't impress me. Badly made. The Chicken Sizzler was good. But their signature dish, Chelo Kebab, was a complete disaster. To begin with, this actually is a very simple dish. Buttered rice along with kebabs. Add to that grilled tomato and a fried egg. Hence, any restaurant serving good kebabs could make a great Chelo Kebab. Unfortunately, the best places for kebabs in this city don't have this item in their menu, and Peter Cat is not known for it's kebabs. The result is rice, topped with hard butter (another negative), and served along with an average chicken kebab and bad mutton sheek kebabs. The fried egg was overdone and too oily. 

If you must, visit this place for the prawn cocktail and sizzlers. Not the overhyped Chelo Kebab.

If you are a foodie and happen to be in Kolkata, this eatery should be a must visit.

##

2016-07-13 13:00:42
Amitava Mallick
10570681
2.0
Had been to this place, on an occasion of 4 college buddies "get-together", and we were ushered straight to the ground floor's end, which can be described as below -beside the staircase . ¬†Let's go to the food, rather than drinks

Ordered the Fish Fingers, Tandoori Mixed Grill, 2 plates Chelo Kebabs and Chicken Reshmi kebab

Fish Fingers - Pretty good, served with fries and mayo. Had never tasted the Fish Fingers in Peter cat before, so cannot say whether the taste has deteriorated or not

Chicken Reshmi Kebab - Ok. Nothing great about it. There was absolutely no juicyness in the meat. Full dry inside. Pretty obvious, that the meat had been cooked for a long time and kept over and over

Chelo Kebab - I wonder sometimes, what is the hype all about in this food. Rice is half cooked, covered in oil, and with another dollop of butter. Served with sides of grilled tomato, some salad, poached egg, seekh kebab and tandoor kebabs

Last but not the least, coming to the most "disgusting" food item in the list

Tandoor Mixed Grill - This food item has been listed under "Peter Cat's Sizzler Specalities". I Have eaten sizzlers at Kobe Sizzlers¬†, Yana Sizzlers, and some other places, but never in my life have I seen a "sizzler" covered in a "gooey" gravy, which is somewhat near to peanut sauce, but is not. And yes, neither does this sizzler come with any sides. No rice, no noodles

The last food item, just made the whole experience worst

2016-07-09 18:14:39
Harsh Mahendru
3939461
3.5
Peter Cat is one of the most famous restaurants in Kolkata and it was my first visit to this place. Let's directly come to the point.
Ambience is OK. There was too much noise from one of the tables which we expected the Manager to lower it down but nothing was taken care of and it was very disturbing. I hope for future the management will take care of it.
We ordered Chelo Kabab ( Original ) and HOUSE Chicken House Platter.

Chelo Kabab is one dish I had heard about a lot and even read it in online blogs. And this dish stands to its name with its quantity and quality. The only Drawback for me was the tomato wasn't grilled enough and it was raw from the other side. But overall a very good dish.

Coming to House Platter. House platter has Chicken strips, Chicken Sausages and Chicken Liver accompanied with Carrots and Peas. The sauce of the platter was very tasty. I definetely felt the raw carrots needed some kind of pickling like the peas.

Service was fast and waiters were responsive.
Peter Cat has its own name and it definetely stands upto it.

Thank You for a lovely lunch.

2016-07-07 21:49:18
Satarupa Saha
786793
4.5
After a long wait finally had the chance to visit this legendary place.  Almost lives upto its name. Ordered chelo kebab and when i asked the person taking our order to suggest a good sizzler, he was not very helpful. Ended up ordering roast chicken sizzler. Chelo kebab has minced mutton kebab( seekh kebab), chicken reshmi kebab, flavored rice generously topped with butter and poached egg. Roast chicken sizzler has one chicken breast n one leg roast. Chicken was so soft, it came off its bones with a slight touch of the fork. It was accompanied with potato wedges and boiled veggies. Overall happy with the main course. Then came dessert meringue with vanilla ice cream and hot chocolate sauce. I was so happy to see we could add as much hot chocolate sauce as we want :p
As i dug into my dessert i found myself in heaven. That oddly shaped meringue had an amazing fluffy biscuity texture. Loved it!

2016-07-03 18:25:19

4.0
When ever I pass by this legendary eatery, I get to see a long queue outside the entrance.
A drizzling Sunday afternoon, we saw that the place was quite empty and hence decided to stop by.
We were given a nice and cozy place.
Ordered for a cocktail that had vodka as the base and pineapple juice. I loved this cocktail.
We order for a beer and was given chakhna in a large wooden bowl.
From food we ordered the famous chelo kebab and the fish makhmali kebab.
The fish makhmali kebab was fantastic.
The Bhetki was soft and melted in my mouth. They served a special sauted onion with it. It had a tangy taste and to enhance the flavours ajwain was used.
The chelo kebab was lip smacking as usual. The rice was long and fine. The kebab had all the right flavours. The sausages however could have been made a little bit succulent. I felt it was a bit over fried.

2016-06-25 12:27:02
Akash
29069086
4.0
There are some authenticate restaurant present in Kolkata which doesn‚Äôt need any kinda intro, Peter Cat is a such kinda restaurant that doesn‚Äôt need any kinda intro.

Located at Park Street near Flury‚Äôs, very easy to find. We didn‚Äôt get any kinda trouble to find this restaurant.

Ambiance is super traditional, almost dark inside and hanging lamp on table makes this place a perfect place for dining with family or your special one. There is two floor there for sitting. Very neat and clean and no question is left to its hygiene level.

Well now come to food,.Peter Cat is famous for its Signature Chelo Kabab and Sizzler and we order the same.

Chelo kabab: In one word, it is awesome. Super fine rice served with an egg omelet, butter scoop on the top of rice, sausages and kabab obviously make this dish one of the best Chelo Kabab of town. Super juiciness of this item can‚Äôt be felt unless you try this, Super recommended!

Chicken Steak Sizzler: Comes in a wooden plate and lettuce leaf on the base and the sizzler is placed on it. Served with gravy potato, egg on top and some steamed vegetables like beans, carrot etc, Damn tasty and the chicken is really out of world, this is also highly recommended too.

Price was a little high obviously, with two dishes and two lemon soda it cost around 900INR, which is fair enough I think with respect to food they offered. Overall a good dining experience we had.

1587245
4.0
From the crossing of Mirza Ghalib Street towards St. Thomas Church on the right side opposite KFC lies Peter Cat. Whenever you go you are always in a que to enter this prestigious restaurant. Below Stephen court this old building restructured but keeping the same essence of British era. 2 floors with wooden stairs big hall size restaurant. Dim lights. This restaurant is famous for it's sizzlers and Chelo kebab. Chelo kebab is the signature dish here it contains baked tomatoes with 2 kind of kebabs. A small amount of butter rice with a poached egg. Deliciously presented on a single plate. This dish is light but filling costs around 400 including tax. Have it for dinner or lunch it equally tastes good. We went for a lunch started with 2 cocktails one of whiskey another of white rum. With some snacks and fish makhmali kebab. The fish was original Bhetki and it was cooked to perfection. Then we ordered chicken stake sizzler and Chelo kebab. Sizzlers here r generally served with cabbage leaves, boiled potatoes, boiled beans & carrots with chicken or mutton whatever you want and all these mixed in creamy soya sauce. Cooking is good but I felt it tasted better before, may b the chefs got changed. Service was bit slow but that can be excused. But everything else is fine. For first timers these dishes will be heavenly but those who tasted before may find it bit disappointing. Rates r bit high so keep ur pockets ready. Must come place for foodies.

##

2016-06-24 02:12:48
Sayantika Dutta
1340482
3.5
Peter Cat has been the quintessential dinner destination for the 'Shaheb at heart' Bangalis and for good reasons too. The place offered the best and only chello kebabs in town teamed with beautiful spicy north Indian dishes  and the most lavish continental spread. While the nostalgia connected to this place still soars, the charm of the food is on a slow yet steady dip. 

All that been said and putting aside my recent disappointment with the mutton chello kebab platter, there are some pretty good dishes on the menu still that do not fail to impress. Some of these dishes are- nalli gosht, fish makhmali, chicken irani, fried bhetki with tartare sauce, and the fish meunier. Do  try them on your next visit. The service remains prompt and proper.

##

2016-06-22 23:59:46
W. Saha
15708047
4.5
Have heard and seen so much about Peter Cat and it's culture on social websites that our group decided to give this a visit.

We decided to strategically visit it on a fine Tuesday afternoon (around 1pm) to avoid standing in a queue to just get a table there . We were lucky even though by the time we finished (around 3pm) a noticeable amount of people lined up outside to eat.

Anyway, the restaurant has two floors and it's really really dimly lit. I can assure you, for newbies , that ambience has a class of it's own. The staff is sharp and to point as they don't want us to fiddle with the menu much. The waiters are all dressed up with ethnic wear of some sort.

Moving on to food. Dishes are served from moderate to "the starters have digested" delays and I suggest you order proper salads and starters to keep you occupied (along with drinks) while they cook your main course.

We ordered Tandoori Chicken, A Grilled Chicken and well the Chelo Kebabs. This was my first try at the authentic original kebabs and boy It lived upto the hype.

The food was excellent and I loved it. As a matter of fact the dishes aren't even that costly either. My suggestion would be to order a Chelo Kebab and something along with it.

I am really happy with the place. Definitely would love to visit over and over again.

The chello tasted heavenly and worth the waiting up in queue.The tandoori mix sizzler was also good.
Waiters were helpful and the ambience was also decent with spacious sitting arrangements.
Overall an awesome experience. 
If you are in kolkata do give it a shot.

2016-06-18 22:15:44
Panchali Kar
31717365
3.5
One of the most popular restaurants in Park Street which always has a queue of the waiting diners in front of the entrance, round the year. The decor and service are fine. The menu is within the pocket pinch, both for food and alcohol.

Have been a fan of this place for a very long time. The food quality however have deteriorated to some extent in the recent times. Chelo kebabs, the signature dish of Peter Cat, is not  up to the mark, these days. The mutton sheikhs are a bit too dry and smells of green coriander. The second most popular dish, tandoori mixed grill sizzler contains too much of liver on the platter. The items that are still lip smacking good are the cocktail sausages and the hamburger steak.

I really wish this place comes back to It's full glory so that I can rate it 4.5/5. As of now, it's a 3.5/5

##

2016-06-18 21:27:15
Chayan Rui
1359699
4.0
This heritage of Calcutta has probably been in wish list of every foodie living and visiting Calcutta and for all the right reasons....located in the very heart of Park Street.....this restaurant has been the mixing bowl of European sophistication with Persian deliciousness... Went there with 3 of my friends...
Ambience: Great lighting,decor...sitting arrangement seemed a bit crowded but you can forgive that considering its popularity

Food-we ordered 2 of their popular dishes dishes...their signature dish Chelo Kebab and Raan ki Dan.
Chelo kebab is a platter comprising 2 varieties of kebab and rice with butter cubes and poached egg...simple, light ,yet delicious... though I feel the rice should have been warmer...
Now about Raan ki Dan..consuming 1 spoonful of this delicacy was like attaining Nirvana...it's basically a dish of minced meat with fine balance of Persian spices...deliciousness at its best..
Staff: Polite,courteous and ready to help out with the menu and choices...
Pocket Pinch: On the higher side but the food and ambience makes up for it...
This restaurant has been serving the Eurasian flavours to Calcutta since the British Raj...though many elders tell the quality has become somewhat low....but I thoroughly enjoyed the experience...looking forward for my next visit and more dishes to try...definitely worth a go..

##

2016-06-10 17:52:20
Dipankar Saha
2920398
3.5
Once upon a time , if peter cat doesnt want its tagline to change from always the best.
waiting time at peter cat is another reason to always think twice before heading here.

Why then go for peter cat , why. The answer needs to be simple yummy food. You would find everything from the old days. Cutlery , waiters uniform but talking about food it has taken new strides towards becoming pale shadow of its past.
Coming to food ,
We had simple cocktail john collins , it tasted very near to frsh lime soda.
The saver was the simplest of the starter chicken tandoori , very nicely done tandoor , marination near to perfect.
Next our very own, chelo kabab. On of the dish which made peter cat what it is, would surely be losing its way out of diners plate soon. The mutton kabab was so bad , was hard no taste, the plating had one half baked tomato and another sliced tomato. 
It made me avoid placing order for another sizzler. 
This place has been always my favourites but dont know who going to bell the cat to get its work together.
Its for all the food lovers to decide....

##

2016-06-10 15:29:54
Mukulita Ganguly
207896
4.5
There is a reason why some places are legendary and remain so for ages. Peter Cat is one such exalted place and the reason becomes quite evident once a person dines over here. 
Fridays and weekends are naturally busy business days for restaurants, more so for this place and one needs to be prepared for a long wait outside. We weren't, and after a wait of almost an hour, our family of six finally occupied the farthest corner table for dinner last Friday night. 

Firstly we ordered our drinks with Nalli Gosht Dry as the starter. We ordered for two Pineapple Blossoms, while two of us had the Planter's Punch and another two had a cocktail of pineapple juice and vodka (the name of which I forgot). The pineapple blossom was the best I have ever tasted. It was extremely smooth without the sting from the pineapple and tasted heavenly. The planter's punch had orange, pineapple, lemon and dark rum in it. This concoction was a nice and subtle blend of multiple flavors and felt pretty refreshing. The pineapple vodka was extremely light with just the right amount of a fruity undertone. 

The plate of Nalli Gosht had two huge leg-pieces of mutton, with the nicely marinated meat being extremely soft and juicy. 
For the mains, our group was divided between Chelo Kebab and the Bhetki Muniere. The chelo kebab platter had the most deliciously made rice which had the slightest hint of clove and exuberantly exuded the flavor of butter. I liked the softer chicken kebabs better than the mutton ones. 
What won my heart was the Bhetki Muniere. Starting from the boiled carrots and beans to the exquisite texture of the fish, it was a dish made in heaven. The flesh is soft, buttery and melts as soon as you put it in your mouth. The white sauce with herbs had a well balanced seasoning but isn't too rich. The potatoes however felt unimportant and lacked in taste, and seemed to be not at par with the rest of the dish.

Quality and quantity of food deserves to be lauded over and over again. Service was highly commendable and the person who took our orders helped us in choosing our drinks and starter wisely. 
This is definitely a place made for revisits and mulling over the aftertaste left by their food long into the night. :)

2016-06-10 07:33:04
Srimoi Bhattacharyya
125581
4.0
One of the oldest restaurants of Kolkata, this place is as popular as it gets. They don't have a reservation facility and have crowds piling up, but everyone is willing to wait, because the food in Peter cat is worth the wait. Service is prompt (it has to be considering the crowd they have to cater to). On this particular occasion I ordered tandoori chicken and their famous chello kebab. The pieces of chicken were soft, succulent, and the mutton was as tasty as it gets. What's even more wonderful is the generous blob of butter which they add. If you're in the mood for good food (read sizzlers and chello kebab), and you don't mind waiting for it, Peter cat is the place to be.

Now I would expect the waiter to guide his customers while talk order. It felt like I ate the same dish for starters and main course. How stupid can this be...
Then I asked for some warm water for my sore throat. And I had to continue asking 4 times till it finally came. And it wasn't warm. It was hot. For a restaurant, they should know the difference between hot, warm and lukewarm...
And finally, during billing, they ignored giving us the mouth freshner. I had to finally ask for it.
So finally, thumbs down to Peter Cat.

Finally got the chance to visit the most renowned and heritage restaurant of Kolkata Peter Cat last Saturday after trying couple of times. The place with the shades of dim orange light just flabbergasted me. One will always get oneself in the queue while visiting Peter Cat which is worth waiting. 
Coming to the food the most and obvious dish to order was Chelo kabab. It is the restaurant special dish. It consists of both chicken and mutton kababs with 3/4 cubes of butter as toppings on rice and an omelette. Along with it we took Chicken Marakesh, Mutton Nawabi and Tandoori Mixed Grill Sizzler. All the dishes were unique and delicious in their own way.
We opted for Vanilla ice cream with Hot chocolate sauce in desserts which was also good.
Love the place love the ambience and overall love the food. Will surely visit it soon.

2016-06-06 12:31:01
Payel Rakshit
378152
3.0
Somehow. I do not get the craze about Peter Cat. Though I agree that it s a heritage restaurant and it has a lot of history to offer, i still do not get waiting in line for 30-45mins just to get in. The food is good, but not mind blowing. The interiors are sober and classy. The Chelo Kabab that all of Kolkata drools over is undoubtedly delicious, but not drool worthy. I frankly do not understand what is all that great about buttered rice and kababs. Moreover the kababs are not that great either. Their another specialty are the sizzlers. I agree that the sizzlers taste really yummy and are one of the best that the city has to offer. The staff are bossy, well I understand that because that's the culture of Park Street(the retro charm). 

Try this place not because of anything else, but because this place has shaped kolkata and its restaurant culture; try this place for its history; try this place for its shear brand value.
