##

2016-06-06 03:15:16
Apurba Adhikary
33431775
2.0
For years, I had seen the huge line in front of Peter Cat and had wondered how brilliant their food would have been which had caused the masses to line-up and wait for hours at a stretch to just eat. History knows somehow, whenever my friends and I planned to dine there, we never got seats. So, finally after an entire week of planning, I went to Peter Cat for the first time on Sunday, 5th June with my brother and sister-in-law. All 3 of us are huge foodies and went there to experience some great food that had made Peter Cat what it is today. However, little did we know that awaiting us was an array of bad experiences waiting to happen. And all of it boiled down to one simple fact - EXTREMELY BAD SERVICE.

First of all, they would not let enter until the other 2 members of our group arrived. Neither would they give us a 3-seater nor a 5-seater, even when the place was semi-empty and both seating options were readily available. However, once we finally got in, the real fun started.

We had ordered their famous Chelo Kabab and the egg poach in mine had egg shells in it. So, quite a few times when I chewed, I felt the crunch of the shells (imagine my horror). Also, my sister-in-law found a chilli stem on her plate. We had also ordered the Today's Special Chicken Kabab and honestly this one tasted beter than the Chelo kabab. However, the special kabab dish had a hair in it which we only discovered after taking the last piece off the plate. Now imagine the amount of disgust that we felt knowing that we just ate an entire plate of kabab which had a hair in it. This was the last straw as we had lost all patience and hence we finally complained to the manager, who to my utter disbelieve did nothing at all.

So, basically by the end of the night, we had got a lot more than we had asked for including egg shells, a chilli stem, a hair, very bad service and an even worse experience. In complete honesty, I did not understand what the hype about Peter Cat was all about. I don't think I would like to re-visit anytime soon as I had left the place feeling utterly dis-satisfied and disgruntled.

2016-06-04 18:36:13
Samarpita Banerjee
30173944
4.0
Peter Cat had been on my 'have to go there' list for a long, long time. And everytime I would plan a visit to the legendary Park Street restaurant, something would happen and the plan won't materialise. Anyway finally I managed to go to PC recently. Firstly, the location is so amazing. I have always loved Park Street and have been to other places like Mocambo and flurrys numerous times. However nothing compares to the fan following of PCs chelo kebab. This dish is the national dish of Iran and comprises rice along with dollops of butter, two kinds of kababs and omelette. The dish is a meal in itself. I loved the rice and the flavour of the Persian herbs. We also ordered a chicken steak sizzler and screwdrivers to go with the food. The sizzler pretty good too, the steak very soft and juicy. A great experience. For people who go there for the first time, do order the chelo kabab. You won't be disappointed.

##

2016-06-04 17:45:58
Sohini Sarkar
33862921
3.0
This review is going to be based on my personal choice and working of flavour combination. Ergo, please do not entirely take into account my critical analysis of THE CHELLO KEBAB. Peter Cat has been around since ages, and most people have a different understanding and likeability towards certain type of food and sadly enough, Peter Cat did not do that for me.

This restaurant is located opposite to the lane of The Park hotel. You enter the lane, and on your right you will find your destination.

Coming to the food, obviously Chello Kebab was the choice of the hour given its popular reputation. 
            This dish is constructed of chicken, egg and mutton, in terms of protein. They serve you two big pieces of mutton kebab and six hot pieces of chicken kebab. The poultry was nothing out of the ordinary. In fact, in my personal opinion it lacked a of kick to it. The mutton pieces were alright.
              The poultry is complemented with capsicum and roasted onion in between. It was also served with a half piece of raw tomato. I do not remember any seasoning on that. So, that was a disappointment.
                They topped the dishes of with a beautifully done poached egg on plain rice. The egg was good, but lacked salt and pepper. Rice was ordinary. And they served this with cubes of butter that failed to melt on the rice, because it was not hot enough (as you can see in the picture below).

Management: Peter Cat as I have always seen is packed with people, weekdays or weekends. The staff in that perspective, manage everything impressively. Service is average. Restaurant is kept more or less clean. It is also easy on the pocket!

##

2016-06-03 22:27:55
Rohit  Deb Mookerjea
34713821
5.0
The legendary Peter Cat. One of the wonders of this city , a visit to Kolkata is incomplete without dropping in at this culinary paradise. Situated at the crossing of Park Street and Middleton Street , there is a perpetual queue outside this place whether its noon or night. The decor is slightly colonial , with the dark wood panelling and the low orange lamps giving a pseudo-romantic feel.¬†

The food is , to put it blandly , fabulous. In my opinion , the Cello Kebab served here is the zenith of food pleasure. Rice topped with butter and egg, along with Chicken Tikka Kebab and Mutton Seekh Kebab -- damn, my mouth is watering as I write this. Also renowned for its Sizzlers ,which I find slightly below par , Peter Cat offers a wide range of Continental high-class dishes. Beckty Munierre is a succulent preparation of fish that will tickle your taste buds pleasurably. For starters,the ¬†Prawn Cocktail is an absolute delight. Add to that the well-behaved staff and prompt service ; and you have a winner on your hands. Here's to many more wonderful meals at PC :)

2016-06-03 10:59:45
Shayak Das

4.5
Peter Cat is located at the heart of Park Street... But whether it is weekend or weekdays, you will never find this place without queue in front... We went there for lunch and had to wait for 30 minutes untill we got our table... though the ambience was worth watching... the two floors of sitting with nice decor and the dim light will definitely give you a luxury feeling... We ordered
Virgin Mary
Chelo Kebab (original)
Beckty Meunier
Peter Cat's Special Dessert

Chelo Kebab had chicken kebabs, mutton seekh kebabs, veggies, Rice with butter and the whole dish was tasty ...this is one of the signature items of peter cat...
Beckty Meunier literally won my heart... probably the best dish for me... it had soft fish pieces with mayonnaise on top and served with veggies... the dish was too scrumptious...
Virgin Mary was sort of tomato juice... may be healthy but not so good in taste...
And the peter cat special dessert was a really special one... it has three layers (chocolate and wafers on top, then tutti frutti in middle, and strawberry-vanila ice cream with choco chips in bottom)... it was yummy...
Service was fast...
I just have one complaint and that is about waiters... I don't wanna generalise this but I am just saying what I felt... no doubt management clearly takes care about the appearance of the waiters ... but I found the waiter who served us that day (1st june) was not so polite and sweet mouthed... while serving food he was murmuring something and we felt that very disturbing...Again I am not saying about all the waiters there... A legendary restaurant like this , they should also look after these little things...
But I can't deny the taste and legacy of the place... it was a good experience there ...
#"Peter Cat" -Famous for a reason...

2016-05-28 22:19:27

4.5
One of the landmark food joints of the city of joy Kolkata. It is located on the Park Street Flury's crossing. One would have to be really lucky to get a place without the usual waiting time of 30 min or else you can do with an early dinner or lunch. But it is well worth the wait.

The d√©cor of the restaurant has been the same for years and I guess we all love the hanging table top lights with an orange lamp shade.

Known for their continental cuisine and Indian cuisine, it is a must visit for a foodie.

Visited the place a week back with my sister in law and her son. We went for chello kabab, fried fish in tarter sauce, fried prawns, fish fingers and baked chicken. We loved every dish as their standard has remained the same for ages. I would not recommend their Biriyani but as for the rest you can try everything you will not be disappointed.

 I have been to this place a hundred times and will keep on coming back. All their kababs are lovely and succulent and their mocktail like bloody mary, zam zam, screwdriver etc is a must try.

2016-05-28 14:05:55

4.5
This place is a legend and needs no brownie points but after many visits I finally choose to pen down a review! Fabulous is the word. All their sizzlers are terrific. And other forms of cuisine and food ranging from Tandoori to baked dishes to European stuff are all as good as they come. The Chello Kebabs are a true testimony to the legend this place holds in the heart of the city of joy. Long queues outside every night and especially on weekends speak volumes about what Peter Cat is. Another prolific food item is their Dum ki Raan, a leg of mutton that is slow cooked with aromatic spices and served boneless with pickled salad. Do keep in mind that it is a restaurant first and then a bar so table etiquettes and quality of conversations do matter here. In short, order anything from their menu, and be all set to get delighted!

##

2016-05-27 20:40:33
Abhirup Ghosh
33758420
4.5
Peter Cat is one of Calcutta's oldest restaurants with an atmosphere that goes way back to the 1960s. Legend has it that the restaurant was named after a famous cat (named Peter) whose residence was the Lord's Cricket Ground in London from 1952 to 1964. Surely, a precious gift for a city that is completely crazy about cricket. The decor and the dimly-lit interiors speak of history. The waiters in their red and white Rajasthani outfits seem similar to the lighting inside the place. The menu that comes in the shape of a cat's head has some absolute delights. The legendary Chelo Kebab is a must have while you are visiting Peter Cat. The house special sizzler served with pork sausages, chicken steak, vegetables and eggs is another iconic dish of the restaurant. The dining room is intimate, with white walls, Tiffany-style lamps, and soft lighting.

2016-05-19 18:58:28
Suraj Iyer
16070873
4.5
When it comes to Peter Cat, the first thing which comes to our mind is the popular Iranian platter of Chello Kabab. I finally made it to this restaurant 4 days back to taste this particular plate of Chello Kabab. Ambiance wise, Peter Cat provides one of the best feel to have a drink and food simultaneously. My friend, who accompanied me had the Non Veg or the original Chelo Kabab and I being a Veggie, chose the Vegetarian version of the same. Initially, we ordered two pints of beer and by the time we finished our pint, the two steaming plates of Chello Kabab finally came to our table.¬†

From the first sight, it looked so mouth watering and consequently lived up to our expectations. The plate had about 8 pieces of sliced paneer kabab with rice and butter and sliced salad vegetables. The aroma and taste of Kabab was so smooth and enjoyable, that we did think of ordering another plate of the same, an idea we bunked after completing one plate.¬†
Overall, a must visit for all those foodies, who wants to try out the ever popular Kabab from Iran and at a place, which is considered as the most popular venue to have them.

##

2016-05-19 09:43:54
Abhishek Biswas
8355061
3.5
Another one of the few nostalgic eating joints in Kolkata, that still manage to cling on to the pieces and fragments of a scintillating past. 
Back in the day, places like Mocambo and Peter Cat were the cool and 'hip' places to go to and were frequented by the ever-so-cosmopolitan Kolkata youth. Today the building is a little dilapidated, floors creak and there is the familiar musty smell of old wood. But the recipes that made this restaurant famous have been immaculately passed on to the next generation. 
Rhetoric aside, this is definitely one of places you need to visit if you want to truly experience Kolkata.
The ambience has a nice classical dim lighting. But if privacy is what you seek, don't expect to get much of it here. Due to high demand, they've tried to fit in as many tables and chairs together as possible so you end up practically rubbing shoulders with your neighbour. 
However what really put me off about this place was the attitude of most of the waiters. They ignored us on occasion, responded half heartedly and were overall pretty rude. They made distorted faces when I asked them to serve some water and took a good 15 minutes to do so. I understand that this is an old and famous establishment that is used to large crowds but if you don't start treating them better you're eventually going to lose them. 
Anyway that's where my complaints end.
We ordered 2 chelo kebabs with 2 bottles of beer. And boy was it a feast! Without a doubt one of the finest kebabs I have ever tasted and the entire set meal is an absolute feast. You really have to experience it to understand. Full marks for the food. The prices are slightly on the higher end though not all that much. 
All in all it was a decent experience bar the service. I really hope management looks into this.

2016-05-16 20:48:36
Raj Singh
1901372
4.5
Peter Cat. The name needs no introduction any resident of Kolkata. An iconic address on the map of the city, and it surely doesn't disappoint. It being a Sunday, I knew there would be waiting, but I had not prepared to see the crowd outside the gates. At least 40 people were in the queue. But luck favoured and we were inside in just 10 mins. Happily seated, we ordered chicken steak (2 PCs) and chicken Irani kabab (8 PCs).  Though Chicken steak was unlike what I had had in Pune, since I had not expected the potato and honey taste, still It was good. I would recommend the sizzler one. Then came Chicken Irani kabab. It was perfect, though I missed the green chutney. Finally time for main course and because of various recommendations, we ordered Chello Kabab, and it was totally worth it. Mix of mutton and chicken, complete with rice, butter cubes and half fried egg poach. Heavenly it was. Then we were too heavy to order any other main course. Miscalculation of capacity apparently, hahaha. :)
Peter Cat is worth its name, worth every penny.

##

2016-05-14 00:03:14
Anish Das
15790915
4.5
This place has been on my radar for quiet a long time now and the main reason was my dad. His overwhelming praise of this restaurant made me carve to dine here.
So last Thursday me and dad visited this resto.
The long hanging flowers shaped lamps and brick walls, servers wearing a traditional dresses, the sound of people chatting mixed with the crackle of sizzelers and the aroma of the delicious food being served gave the place an authentic vibe.
Staffs are very courteous and friendly and the service is quiet moderate.
Coming to food
Chicken Irani kebab - I wonder how could a chicken be so soft and flavourful. Perfect amount of spices and the tender soft chicken.
Betkey munerie - Again this was a boon to my taste buds. Soft, flavorful and my dad's favourite.
Nalli ghost - two big pieces of spicy, soft, flavourful mutto cooked in very delicious Indian spices. This was my favourite starter.
Chelo kebab - flavourful rice with soft chicken kebabs and a poached egg and butter. The mutton seek kebab was not upto the mark. It could have been way way better.
House special sizzler - I love sizzlers. The crackling sound and the aroma makes me more hungry. The chicken steaks were very soft and so were the liver and overall one of the best sizzlers I ever had.
Caramel custard - well I didn't like this dessert at all. It was nothing compared to a few I have had in Kolkata .
Overall a very good time spent here with delicious food and my dad. I now know why he praises this place so much.
P.s. - before I could take the pictures of chelo kebab and sizzler they were finished. My apologies
Cheer

##

2016-05-13 19:13:12
Ushinar Mukhopadhyay
16011287
3.5
This heritage place & a "monument" of kolkata foodies is synonymous with good food! one more thing they are synonymous with is their Chello Kebab which is every penny worth the gossip and nostalgia it evokes. Although its a minimalist preparation and a rhino like me needs to feed on 4 of them atleast to feel full still i am not at all disappointed. The rice of the dish is the best f***ing rice i have ever tasted in my entire life. The melting butter, the poached egg, the grilled veggies and the perfectly done sausages is a total knockout esp on winter evenings after a stroll on the Park Street. The dim setting (I belong it when restaurants have dim cozy lighting rather than full throttle stadium-grade flood lights), red lamps, cramped sitting is perfect for dates but equally good for a friends' day-out.
. 
MUST HAVES : Chello Kebab, House Special Sizzler, couple them with a pint of beer
PROS : Great food, Excellent ambience 
CONS : Quantity is poor (Quality is top notch though), the waiters lack through knowledge of the dishes and does not communicate properly, preparation time could be a bit faster, NOT COST EFFICIENT when you take the quantity under consideration!

2016-05-11 22:27:37
Amrit Majumder

4.5
Firstly, I would like to comment on the ambience. Its cool and dark, with lamps focusing on the food, and the decor lifts the spirit of the intended ambience. All these takes the stress out of you, the moment you enter, especially on a hot summer day.
And then as you would expect, I ordered the famous 'Chelo Kabab' (Mutton). I dont think i need to comment on this platter since it has already been done so many times. It encouraged me to try something else, and so i did: Tandoori Mixed Grill (sizzler), delicious and fun as you get all types of tandoors (fish, chicken, prawn, egg). Though an advice: after having a chelo kabab, you might need more than two people to finish a sizzler.
After having a belly full of meats, it felt stuffy inside, so i had a Jal Jeera. I felt comfortable drinking that (squeeze some lemon to enhance the taste).

2016-05-09 14:55:08

2.5
We were a group of 7 and went to celebrate my niece's good scores in her ICSE exams on ¬†7th May for lunch!! have been here umpteen times for 17-18 years and never felt so disappointed with the quality of the food!! Am a member of a popular foodies froup in Kolkata with 10000+ members and people have been posting there how peter cat isnt the same anymore, thats its quality has dwindled!!

We ordered ¬†cream of chicken soup, mutton chelo kebab, normal chelo kebab and the pi√®ce de r√©sistance "Tandoori mixed grill" thats passionately recommended ( printed on the menu !!!).. The Chelo kebab meals were okayish , nothing great with the meat being dry , devoid of any juices or aroma!! The soup was watery and not thick with bland cube shaped chicken pieces at the bottom!!

But my special remark has to be for the " Tandoori mixed grill" -- I mean what kind of a joke was this being served?? The service person said this will have pieces of lamb, chicken, fish, eggs and prawns spiced with indian tandoori masalas and served in a sizzler, sounded interesting and hence wanted to try it!! but what came was beyond our imagination or words... the meats were cooked in a ¬†MASALA GRAVY and put in a sizzler and served... so what we got was masala meat/fish curry.. it had 1 tiny mutton piece, i fish cube, 2 chicken pieces, i boiled egg and the TAIL OF A SHRIMP/PRAWN!!! The taste was pathetic and the whole dish looked so disturbing to the eye!! and this costs 375+taxes...WOW!!
My simple advice to this great joint is.. You have been brilliant over the years and have made a name for yourself all thanks to your food quality and your patrons who swear by your food... dont let them down and dont take them for granted... EVER!!

Peter cat is a place where a huge amount of nostalgia is attached to. Back then when I was a small kid we quite frequently used to have our gatherings in Peter cat. Way back we used to hog on chelo kebabs, Marrakesh & sizzlers. It's been almost 10 years since I left Kolkata and this winter when I got a chance to be at my hometown I visited Peter cat. I must say visiting Peter cat made me feel time has stopped there. The same old dimly lit restaurant with waiters wearing turbans and the same old chelo kebabs whose taste has been preserved and kept the same all these years. An awesome place, back in Bombay I am yet to come across a place which serves chelos anywhere close to Peter cat!!

2016-05-01 11:50:25
Sameek Dey
6625541
4.5
The olfactory of sizlers, one of the oldest diner in the city. A good place to be at when you're searching for a classy restaurant with good food and want to have a good experience. This place offers you a good variety and quality of food,good service and of course the time and money spent is worthwhile. Heard a lot about this place, and alas got a chance to be here. Impressive decor on my first visit here. Our order was chicken Irani kebab, strawberry crush, pineapple blossom and the all favorite chelo kebab. 
To strat of with, I was searching for something more spicy but when I asked them to suggest some, they replied saying they don't serve anything too spicy thus had to go with the chicken Irani kebab. I must say the kebab didn't disappointed me, the caramelized onions complimented the kebabs good. Though what I felt was, the kebab could have been a bit tender. The smoothies were really good, you get a good creamy feel when you'll have a first sip plus the essence of their respective flavours. 
Then came the legendary chelo kebab, I can dare to review that, but would like to mention that the rice was a bit undercooked. Otherwise the dish really lives upto to the hype it gathered in the past and still in continue. The poach, butter cube, kebabs and rice.. Yes they taste awesome, altogether. 
Was happy with the service. A bit costlier on the pocket but worth it for what they offer. The aroma inside the place whenever somebody orders for a sizlers is a plus. It increases your Appetite. 
In all would like to visit this place again.

It's slightly heavy on the pocket.. But the charm and appeal of Peter Cat demands that compensation!
A must visit if you have not been here :)

2016-04-29 17:09:47
Sumit
165241
4.0
On my recent visit to Kolkata, I knew this would be my last visit to Kolkata as no more traveling to this town. So I listed all my favorite Kolkata restaurant and made sure that I visit all of them before I leave town and head back to Delhi. I have been to Peter cat many times, can't count on fingers. So this time as well I had to wait like 20 odd minutes for the table, its a norm here. So no complaints. Ambiance : place takes you to classy times, where lights are dim, each table has the lamp over. Small tables which are getting old now. Comfortable and cozy place. 
Food :On my last visit, I ordered the same dish I had at my first visit in 2012 at Peter Cat. Mutton cheelo kabab: The signature dish at Peter cat. I have traveled all over India but nothing like this ever been served to me. I just love those moist mutton kababs, buttered rice. Perfect combination, colorful and balanced meal. You get your proteins, carbs, fats, Fibre all together in one dish. Loved it the first day I had it and this time as well. 
Service : the place is always full on evenings especially on the weekend so service does get affected. But still, they do a commendable job. 
So if you are here for the first time then do go with the signature dish. I had other items of menu aswell all are prepared really well and portion sizes are good too. 
So if I ever visit Kolkata again. I will be back for sure.

##

2016-04-27 17:45:48
Apurva Dwivedi
2780074
4.0
Location : Opposite KFC and right beside Au bon pain in Park Street this is a legendary restaurant in Kolkata.

Ambiance : typical of a restaurant at Park Street it exudes old world charm but somewhere u do feel it needs some renovation. The lighting is dim and i quite liked it.

Service : the staff have become a bit arrogant i guess and after repeated requests to change our table which was right at the entrance they did not listen. The waiter seemed in a hurry while taking the order. The food arrived pretty quick though.

Food : We ordered for the famous Chelo Kebab and the Veg mix grill sizzler. The food was really nice and tasty. I would however like to point out that the rice should have been warmer so that the butter cuber they put on it melt and the seekh kebab should have been more tender. The veg sizzler was surprisingly very well made. I specially like the palak thing they used.

Drink : we ordered for the strawberry milkshake. It was just about average. They should use more ice cream so that the shake is thicker.

Pocket pinch : our bill was for 1000 bucks which is okay given the standard of food and the quality of it. Definitely value for money.

All in all it was a good lunch and i returned really satisfied with the overall experience!

The popularity of this restaurant can be simply gauged by the fact that it is almost always full..weekend or weekday, day or night.
Overlook the slightly cramped and dingy interiors and go straight for its legendary speciality, the Chelo Kebab. Succulent reshmi and seekh kebabs on a bed of buttered rice topped with a fried egg - melt in your mouth and sinful.
I also enjoy their Chicken Steak Sizzler, not just the presentation but also the juicy meat and potatoes make for a wholesome meal. Definitely a must try restaurant in Kolkata.

2016-04-23 09:51:07
Shankhadip Ghosh
484132
2.5
According to everyones suggestion, I went to Peter Cat to try their 'legendary' Chelo Kabab and Sizzler. But as they say, you have to wait several lives to get into heaven....we had to wait so long just to get into this restaurant, it felt like several lives.
When we got inside after nearly a 2.5 hours wait, I instantly felt claustrophobic. Tables were cramped in small places, one couple was already fighting with the waiter as their table was given just beside the table where waiters were keeping the dishes.
However we got our table and the waiter was very lethargic to take orders. When we called him to add 2 more drinks to our order, he acted like he was doing a favor. Then finally came the long waited food. Sizzler was pretty good, but chelo was just average. Tasted better chelo in other places in the city.

While coming out, I felt the interior is so dim lit that you can't actually see the floor where you are going. Overall, I felt it's an over hyped restaurant because of its heritage.

2016-04-16 18:45:42
Parna Roychoudhury
27870132
4.5
Peter cat is named as one of the legendary restaurants in kolkata... I was very eager to visit this place and finally today i visited there.. The restaurant is situated in the heart of park street area and is not hard to locate. The name itself says all about it.. I went there with my boyfriend.. The very first thing that will attract you is the awesome soothing decoration of the restaurant.. There is a shade of orange and grey all around.. We went there in the afternoon and we had to wait there for atleast 15 -20 mins.. We obviously ordered one chello kabab which is the signature dish of Peter Cat.. The chelo kabab is made of basmati rice with three small cubes of butter on the top of it, one egg poach nd ofcourse the mouth watering kababs. The kababs were very soft tender nd juicy and is available in the form of sheeks as well as round chunks. We also ordered for House special sizzlers where you will get two chicken steaks , sausages and liver cooked in a spicy sauce and it is also very delicious.. So i am rating this place 4.5 out of 5 because it maintains its quality. Though dishes are a little over priced but considering the taste and quality of food , i will say Worth it... Will love to visit here again..

##

2016-04-13 22:28:37
Rishabh Singh
33766326
4.5
Peter Cat is one of the most famous restaurants in the whole of Kolkata and it definitely lives up to it's hype. I have been here a couple of times and I was never disappointed. 
I have had the following :
Chelo Kebab - The most famous dish offer this restaurant. Absolutely delicious! Love fail to bits and pieces everything was perfect. The kebab was cooked to perfection. It was moist and succulent and even the rice, just by itself, tasted very nice
Grilled Beckty Muniere - Another absolutely fabulous dish. The Fish was cooked to perfection. It was soft and flaky, the sauce was also very very nice  and the vegetables also complimented the dish very well. Though if I do have to criticize anything then I must add that the potatoes were a tad undercooked, not a lot but a little bit.
Fish Sizzler - Another knock out dish. The fish was simply perfect. The rice was just amazing and as a whole it was just what a sizzler should be; hot, smokey and it had a wonderful aroma which filled the whole table. This is definitely one of the best sizzlers I have had in quite a long time and certainly among the best 5 I have tried in Kolkata. 
Apart from this since my parents love Indian food so we have tried the  tandoori chicken, dal makhni, roti and palak paneer. 
The tandoori chicken was very very well cooked, the chicken was moist and succulent and it had a very nice flavour but I must add that the flavour was only on the outside for me the chicken inside was quite bland. 
The palak paneer was quite loved by everyone, apparently it was the best palak paneer my family had ever had. I did not try it since I'm not quite fond of Indian food so I can't really say but I heard some rave reviews about the dish, so I would suggest it if you are an Indian food lover.
The dal makhni though was quite a disappointment. It was quite sweet and that made it quiet unpleasant. I have no idea what they put in it, but it definitely had a sweetish flavour which was not liked by anyone in my family, so if I had to choose any dish that I would like to replace out of whatever I've had so far, the dal makhni would be it.
To sum it up, Peter cat is definitely a place worth trying. The best part about it is that the food is not very costly, you have a wonderful Ambience, some wonderful staff and definitely a fine dining experience, but the price is definitely not over the top or overly extravagant. This is definitely well within the budget and you are bound to have a wonderful experience. Trust me!

2016-04-12 05:40:13
Subhrajyoti Adhya
4362561
3.0
Visited today.. Ordered Chelo Kabab and Grilled fish apart from desserts... I won't say much about the food quality as others have said a lot... But the egg in the Chelo Kabab came with some tiny pieces of egg shell for free... The pieces were so small that they could hardly be seen but were very much discernible in the mouth... When I complained, they just did nothing. The very least I expected was to have the egg portion of the dish replaced, but they did nothing. They demanded "proof" of those... Unfortunately, I didn't carry a microscope, so couldn't produce the proof... So here I am, narrating my experience to folks over here.. So the next time you take your Chelo Kabab, watch out for those egg shells...

And by the way, the original Chelo Kabab had two pieces of mutton... I can't see the logic of serving mutton in the normal Chelo Kabab when there's a separate dish with mutton included... It could be a deal breaker for those who don't touch mutton like myself...

To sum up, five stars for food, one star for service, three stars for price...

This restaurant is probably one of the most popular and well-known in the city. A favourite haunt for even celebrities, their chelo kebab and sizzlers need no introduction. I've tasted their chelo, mutton and chicken steak sizzler and all were simply amazing dishes. Right from the tantalising smell wafting and hovering on the air to the sizzling noice of the sizzler till you thrust a crunchy morsel in your mouth, the entire experience is one worth having and indulging in. Have visited here on the occasion of my birthdays and for family lunches during the Pujas, and every time the Cat has meowed at me with beckoning dishes !

2016-04-09 18:41:33
Mandavi Saha
60838
3.5
I happened to visit this place on one my food-centric trips in kolkata and since park Street is the food-capital area in Kolkata ,this is one of the indispensable recommendations by all food enthusiasts!
We made it a point to take plunge and stick to the recommendations- the Chello kebabs!
Tender succulent meat was served in form of sheekh as well as chunks -they impressed every tastebud to the core, and the happiness of a sumptuous meal sunk down to the heart.
We dropped by around 6pm but had to enroll ourselves in the waiting register, so now you can imagine the crowd during the suppertime!
The seating is cosy with an otherwise dark hall and small bulbs placed right over each table,ideal for some deserved privacy for the guests.
The staff was warm,well versed with the menu and quick to make confident recommendations,much appreciated.
One the price side,it seems reasonable for the league of restaurants Petercat makes it's presence felt in!

TIP- Try avoiding the rush hours and hence the long queues and waiting periods.

2016-04-09 05:24:45
Arjun Chaudhry
2234638
4.0
I was quite eager to try this place as it was much acclaimed and recommended by many people. The hardest part was getting into the restaurant , as it was saturday night and I had to wait almost an hour before getting a table.
The resturant had the old times family restaurant vibe to it and that's why it takes us back to the memory lane of our childhood going in these types of places with our family.
Within no time, we ordered mutton chelo kebeb which was enthusiatically recommended by the server and fish makhmali before the kebab. 
The kebab dish was absolutely delicious. It had mutton seekh, grilled chicken , half fried egg over rice over it.
The seekh was perfectly done and the chicken tasted fabulous and the egg complimented the rice. The fish made out of betki was smooth in texture and soft but not too soft. There was a namkeen served with the drinks , it was also good.
This place is must visit when you are in kolkata.

##

2016-04-06 12:23:25
Rahul Chopra
34103337
1.0
Drawing insane amounts of crowd each day, queue meandering so much that to the uninitiated it may reminisce of Apple fanboys lines right before launch date. Yes! Exactly that one line of over obsessed individuals. The topic of conversation this post - their most popular offering - Chelo Kebab.

The dish
So, there is steamed basmati rice with a dollop of melting Amul butter trying to be seductive but clearly it does not happening. Flanked by two lukewarm seekhs of mutton kebab, they are anorexic and kinda look sad. Kebabs being thin is like Thums Up served at room temperature - an absolute insult!¬†

Then there is roasted chicken tikka with capsicum and onions, which is nothing to write home about, and then the oh by the way sunny side up; which doesn't look too happy or as a matter of fact sunny.

RM: Speaking of sunny this place could do with some more light like literally. I refuse to click this photos and let this be known officially that I did not eat anything here. This dish is like that spider you crush with a book. You know its a mess underneath but you still can't resist looking. This chelo kabab is a mess but still - magically - everyone want to eat it.

With great fervour, even after the very minimal aesthetic pleasure derived from the sight of the dish, we reluctantly dig in, trying to find something magical in the rice, some flavour that will belie it's peasant appearance and thudd ... it's just steamed rice, with butter; back to gravity.¬†

The kebab is at best average, and very below average for a place of this "reputation". Next in line is another common kebab, reshmi, which is not reshmi, it looks reshmi, white and creamy and all that, but the chicken is hard and again - magically - it's lukewarm! By the end of these three I didn't even want to travel far upto the egg, I wanted it to remain a breakfast fav, I didn't want to insult it just because these guys put it on a plate with the others.

PC: Any true Calcuttan worth the rosogullas he has eaten will be able to point you to the road opposite (Free School Street) and help you identify a small restaurant that will give you some serious kebabs. What it may lack in pomp it will make up in taste.

There is no great service here either. Age old ambience though, colonial almost, felt good while we walked in, it kind of helps build up the legend. Managers are really not too courteous after a long wait outside. All they have on their agenda is to flip tables as fast as possible. Don't be surprised if you are handed the menu right outside while you wait. Some of the old timers are pretty much a part of the decor here. The dust settled on the low hanging lamps. Rahul insists that we point out and mention that dust found in human living space mostly consists of dead human skin. Yeah. Let that sink in a bit.

The weather was Calcutta winters: I love you. Glorious food: I love you too. But Peter Cat, do better, for the those still in the queue :)

Chelo Kebab at Peter Cat has attained a strange coveted status that really does not live up to the expectations by any stretch of imagination. It is at best an imitation of a real chelo kebab that has gone awfully wrong.

For our list of the best things to eat in Calcutta, this experience got Peter, Cut!

The only thing that bothers is, I always have to wait to grab a seat here. Otherwise all is good at Peter cat.
P. S - Do go for chelo kebabs!

The ambience is good but everything else is over hyped. Had to wait 45 mins just to get in. The food came in another 30 mins after we placed the order.

There was hardly any items for my vegetarian friends. The paneer masala was tasteless as it didn't have proper seasoning.

If you want to spend time in a good rustic ambience you will like this restaurant. However, if you want good food please avoid this place. There are better places in Kolkata.

##

2016-03-20 22:34:03
Sayantani Sen
33029425
5.0
I have been going to this place forever, but I suspect that is true for most Calcuttans. Their chelo kebab is of course legendary. But for those not so fond of eggs like myself, the Marakesh is also a very good option. It is similar to the chelo, with a stuffed tomato instead of a fried egg. The rest of the kebabs are the same. Peter Cat serves mind blowing sizzlers. I especially love the House special which has chicken breast, sausages, liver and potato cooked in delicious barbecue sauce. The tandoori mixed grill is a perfect choice for those who like spicy food. It has chicken, mutton as well as prawn cooked in a heavy gravy.I believe the desserts at this place are the least talked about in spite of being absolutely heavenly. They make the chocolate sauce themselves, it does not come out of a bottle. Hence it is thick, creamy and chocolaty and is always served in a separate milk jug. The meringue with ice cream and chocolate sauce is one of my favorites. The brownie with ice cream and the same chocolate sauce is also great. Try the souffle of the day. We had a mocha flavored souffle once and it was absolutely amazing. For those not too fond of chocolate, they also serve a super tooty fruity ice cream.

##

2016-03-20 22:21:11
Hyangla_bibi
30666101
4.5
The first thing that popped in mind after entering Peter Cat was... Wawo! What an ambiance...!! The food quality was really good.. We ordered obviously The Chelo Kabab first...tempting..hot..steamed basmati rice..with 3cubes of butter..an egg poach on top..along with a chkn kabab and two mutton kabab... Just loved it. My plate was finished too soon.. Then we ordered Dum ki Run.in sizzler course.. With bread rolls.. Again a great dish..the taste was so good..so mesmerizing.. Yes,the foods are little expensive though.. But for the love of food... I wl visit again there.

This is one of the legendary restaurant that Kolkata raves about. Being a kolkatan,  its my discredit that this was the first time I visited Peter Cat. 

You talk about Peter Cat and Chelo Kabab is the only thing that will come to your mind. 
So me along with my hubby opted for fish makhmali and Chelo Kabab.  To gulp this down,  we ordered for two cocktails - bachelor's and screw driver. 

Fish makhmali absolutely justifies it's name. Utterly soft and truly delicious I must say.  
But for Chelo Kabab,  I got a bit disappointed as the mutton Kabab seemed to be very chewy and not much delicious.  The chicken Kabab was very dry and thus I couldn't enjoyed my meal. 

It seemed to me that it would have been better if we tried the other dishes rather than the legendary dish. 

Nevertheless,  I would love to visit this awesome restaurant again for its perfect ambience.

2016-03-16 00:55:12
Madhur
5033861
3.0
Had heard a lot about 'chello kabab' here, and people waiting outside to get a table. I went there on a weekday afternoon and was made to wait 10 mins before being allowed inside, only to find half the restaurant empty. 

Anyway ordered the 'chello kabab' which turned out to be nothing more than a non veg platter. 2 sticks of mutton seekh, 2 sticks of chicken tikka, buttered rice and a half fried egg. The taste was good but kababs were dry, which happens when you lower the already made kabab back into the tandoor to re heat, or keep the marinated meat too long in freezer. It kind of gets dehydrated and doesn't stay succulent.

Overall not bad. The portion is decent and considering the location, ambience, and fame the price tag of around ‚Çπ 400/- per plate is fair.

It's not that I suggest you not to visit there but dont have high hopes.

For desert we ordered, 3 full tuti fulti (there is a half one also available).

Pro- The location is very convenient. They have some signature dishes.

Cons-As I entered I felt the place needs a renovation. Chelo Kabab was average and tuti-fruti was below average. It was served in a normal glass in which they serve water in the restaurant. It sank my heart. Lastly, the hotel staff will behave as if you are not paying for the food, they are doing a favor. If you are paying by card then be prepared to pay a hefty tip. If not, they will not hesitate to insult you in their restaurant. When I complained there was no manager available. A person from reception heard our complain and apologize, which I do not think worth after ruining my evening with my family.I will not recommend this restaurant to any one after my bad experience.

##

2016-03-06 22:05:54
Rupsa Mitra
31031690
4.5
Peter cat is definitely one of the legendary eateries of Kolkata, no doubt about that!
But at weekends or special occasions one has to stand in queues for hours to get a seat. That is the most tiring part ...but the good thing about it is, it kicks the hunger to a new level...
Now the interior decor is amazing...with dim lights perfectly apt for dining. The staffs look great in their royal traditional attires with head gears as well...totally creating a heritable ambience. 
We ordered the famous Chelo Kabab, Biryani-ala-Kashmiri and Chicken Mayonnaise cold salad from continental.
Chelo kabab being served as chicken kababs on a bed of aromatic long grained basmati rice with 2-3 dollops of butter, half poached half fried egg on it with two long mutton sheek kababs.. The chicken kababs are tender and succulent..mutton sheekhs are a bit chewy n hard..loved this dish.
Biryani did disappoint us though.
The cold chicken mayonnaise though made my day...best among this lot...totally scored over me. :)
Finished the meal by ordering Pica Cosa. :)
We'll be coming back for more.
Highly Recommended!

##

2016-03-01 21:45:00
Suvojit Sinha
228937
3.5
I have been to Peter Cat many times but finally decided to sit down and write my thoughts about it. This is one Park Street place which has withstood the test of time while many of its peers have gone downhill. And the  simple reason  is well.. it is the only place in the world which serves Chello kebab!!

So much so that there are always queues in front and an average waiting time of 45 minutes whether you come at 1 pm or 3 pm or 5 pm .. doe snot matter.

For those that do not know or are visiting Kolkata for the first time , Chello kebab is a shaslik and a sheekh kebab on buttered rice and finished with a fried egg.. Sounds simple but whoever dreamt up this combination deserves an award..Most people who come to peter Cat don't order anything else . I think there is plenty said about the Chello Kebab so Id ecided to try out the Chicken Marrakesh and the fish Meuniere. The Chicken Marrakesh is very similar to the Chello conceptually with a different kebab and without the egg. The Fish Meuniere was good for one portion and for the other the fish was undercooked. We had also ordered soups which were extremely average.

On the whole this experiment reaffirmed popular perceptions around Peter Cat, go there for the Chello Kebab only ... Do not experiment

By the way, you may find the people who mange the waiting list fairly rude and the waiters not so friendly.. but take that in your stride , the Chello kebab is worth it !

##

2016-03-01 17:45:30
Aaditya Arya
6846611
4.5
This is another legendary must visit place for all people from outside Calcutta (everyone from Calcutta already goes there anyways). If you'r trying to make up your mind about where you should eat at park street. This is where you should eat. Start with the prawn cocktail, follow it up by the chelo kebab and chicken sizzler (chicken) or dum ki raan (mutton) and your good (also the tomato soups are gr8 and are a park street exclusive). After this meal you will need a Friend to carry you home because you will be high on food and probably be slurring or falling around the place. We all love you Peter c. Thank you for hanging around :)

##

2016-02-25 21:17:23
Amitava Chowdhury
33063938
3.5
Last month we went to this place to celebrate our new-year party at night. This was my second visit to this restaurant. That day in morning I called the restaurant to reserve our booking. The executive on the other side replied that it does not have any reservation facility and getting into the restaurant will be first come-first serve basis. I planned that we would leave early from our place and certainly get a good seating arrangement in it and thus we need not to wait for the food. 

But I was absolutely wrong! We waited there for 2 and half hours to pass through the entrance of the restaurant. I was thinking the reason why Peter Cat being a good restaurant does not have any reservation facility or why do they not expand in size. They could have opened another branch somewhere else in Kolkata. My poor intuition suggested that the restaurant probably did not change the business pattern and policy to hold its tradition because Peter Cat is not a newbie in restaurant industry. Anyway, another idea came in my mind that probably they want to keep us waiting before the door because doing so, would manifold our hunger. So when they would allow us to enter into the restaurant, we would jump on the dishes and Peter Cat would make more profit from our pocket as we turned into hungry creatures few moments back. Ha ha ha! Somehow I managed to spend that 2 and half hours thinking all these non-sense!

Anyway, we ordered "Chello Kebab" and some sizzlers with bun. The foods were good and had a signature style of Peter Cat. It is well-known for its signature dish "Chello Kebab". Another thing I noticed that it has reduced the quantity of rice and probably kebabs (not sure!) in the dish from my last visit. It was not expected. The dish did not taste like the way it did in the first time. Anyway, we had nice experience in the restaurant. There is nothing to mention about the ambience and the hospitality of staffs as people already know about all these things and they expect a positive reaction from the restaurant side. 

Overall, I would request the management of Peter Cat to find some alternative so that people need not to wait outside for so long. And another point is - do not alter the quantity and quality of your signature dish - "Chello Kebab"!

2016-02-16 21:50:47
Jasmin Das
33559419
5.0
This place is a must for people visiting Kolkata for the first time. The ambience, the atmosphere, the food is all too great.  the staff are tremendously helpful and love striking up a conversation over meal.  even their attire is a significant sight!  our meal consisted of the legendary famous "chelo kebab ". Had heard all my Bengali friends praise about this dish and finally I had the opportunity to try. It consists of 2 fish kebabs, chicken or Mutton kebabs with pieces of capsicum in Between (what you order),  slices of cucumber,  steamed rice with pieces of butter and a poached egg placed right on top of the rice. The chicken and the Mutton was cooked to perfection.. Juicy, tender and the spices were right on point. It was a heavenly meal.  The dimmed lights and the food made it a prefect romantic lunch for us.. Must try!  Can't wait to go back and have again!

##

2016-02-16 12:50:05
Devlina Ganguly
864168
4.0
Now what do I write about Peter Cat that hasn't been written before? The mecca for food lovers across the City of Joy, the nostalgia trip that every pureblood Calcuttan takes when visiting the city. The serpentine queues every day of the week, not just weekends, bear testimony to the never-waning popularity of this "heritage" restaurant.
Risking the ire of all those who swear by the steaks. mixed grill and the Chelo Kebab of Peter Cat, I have to say that I myself have never understood the hysteria surrounding this place. Not saying that the food is bad, no way so, but I don't find it spectacularly special to brave the hours-long wait. Never been too fond of the Chelo Kebab, but that's my personal choice, no reflection on the quality at all.
As for the steaks/sizzlers, I find them too Indianised, spiced up and sauced liberally to suit the palettes of the masses. I wouldn't want to take names but there are places in the city who do a far better job with steaks/sizzlers maintaining their authenticity, not tweaking them to suit Indian tastebuds.
So why have I given a rating of 4? Because nostalgia is a weakness few people are spared from. On special occasions, be it a birthday or a get together, more often than not, I have found myself wanting to go back to that familiar dimly-lit place, and partake of the House Special. Peter Cat will remain special for any true-blood Calcuttan and I am no exception!

##

2016-02-08 20:36:23
Saurabh Bhivandkar
522825
4.5
Peter Cat's warm and dimly lit interior speaks of history. Waiters look resplendent in crisp Rajasthani white and red costumes, which match the colors of the restaurant's interior but curiously contrast with its name -- a name that doesn't give away much at all. If you dig around though, you'll discover its the namesake of a famous cat who lived in Lords cricket ground in London from 1952 to 1964 (and Kolkata is a city addicted to cricket). The  Chelo Kebab( a Persian delicacy where kebabs are served with salty butter flavored rice) & Chicken Steak Sizzler alongside Mutton Biryani make for an amazing meal, with Drinks being served alongside in line with Cocktails & Regulars.

##

2016-02-05 00:19:03
Brokelings
111187
5.0
So I could finally make some time to write about this legendary restaurant. Coming from another city, I asked my friend to take me to a place which has it's own heritage and cult following. Undoubtedly, Peter Cat was the first thing he mentioned. ¬†Prior reservations are recommended if you're a group other than a family. The outset is gloomy with dim lights giving the place an ancient look. The menu looks very attractive and so do the waiters. Humbly waiting for our order, the waiter also recommended a few dishes. We chose the Vegetarian Chelo Kabab, Broccoli Cheese Tandoor (Something close to that) and another stake. The chelo kabab, is ingenious to Kolkata and is supposed to consist of 3 types of proteins. In the vegetarian option, we got served Paneer, Potato and Cauliflower (Wage remembrance). The butter rice accompanying these was out of the world. The simplicity of the dish was its own strength. The broccoli was served in a way I had never imagined, it was really tasty. They also have a whole range of fresh seasonal fruit juices which go along very well with the spicy food. Definitely recommending this place to any person travelling to Kolkata, and everyone in Kolkata who hasn't been here. Brilliant.

##

2016-01-25 20:35:22
Rituparna Sarkar
1450750
4.0
Alright so the much awaited visit to peter cat happened on a Monday afternoon and as usual there was a qeue outside the restaurant. We had to wait for 7-10 minutes we could enter and as our preference we got the upper floor. Nice sofa orange radiance everywhere so first impression turns out great. Coming down to food we ordered Budweisers and it was quite surprising they served good complimentary with drinks <most restaurants in the city just serving pine nuts which is disappointing.> Anyway main course had due to obvious reasons Chelo kebabs, tandoori roti, masala kulcha, matar paneer and a chocolate souffle.
Being a hard core non vegetarian all the veg dishes seem same to me no much difference here as well. But chelo kebabs really are over hyped in this place. Everything is just okay i tasted better kebabs at other places. Being such a talked about place customers deserve better i believe and of course paying such handsome amount as Bill. I didn't find anything extra ordinary with the kebabs. But having a tiny sweet tooth i have to love the desert and i did this time also. Souffle was amazing, melted in my mouth creamy texture in one word Awesome. Only for the desert and complimentary its a 4 otherwise despite of having the famous kebabs on the menu it would have been a 3 I'll go to taste the sizzlers next time hoping not to be disappointed.

##

2016-01-25 15:01:41
Tamal Taru
288736
4.5
First up, this place is exactly why this proverb was made - don't judge a book by its cover. The name, logo, lighting, overall ambience, dressing of the waiters, nothing actually makes sense and give a very confused messaging. But the food is what you should visit this place for. 

I am not going to write anything different than what many people have already written. 

This place is famous, and is rightfully so, for its epic dish - chelo kebab. The original chelo kebab (good for two) has mutton sheekh kebab, chicken kebab, one half fried egg and butter-rice. Although at first I doubted the necessity of the rice in the dish, the kebabs tasted heavenly with the buttered rice. Eat all the elements on the dish to get the rich taste the dish to offer. And now it makes complete sense why this dish is the national dish of Iran. The herbs used in the making of kebabs have them a very unique fragrance and flavour and it is very different from the kebabs you would usually eat. The only thing which could have been better is the texture of the mutton sheekh kebab, which was just a tad dry. 

We also tried bhetki meuni√®re and grilled fish sizzler. These two also, simply put, were out of the world. The sauce used in meuniere was outstanding. 

We also happened to try biriyani here, which was a wrong decision. 

Overall, a pleasant experience, but try not to be adventurous and stick to what the place is famous for.

2016-01-19 20:45:18
Indranil Sarkar
1735257
4.0
Craving gastronomes shepherded to sumptuous Chelo Kebabs!

The interiors exude of warmth and happiness. The low hanging ceiling lamps are inviting. They want you to come and sit and eat in peace.

The Chelo Kebabs and Sizzlers are legendary. The Chelo is an excellent example of how simple things in the right proportions served elegantly can be extremely palatable. Boiled rice, butter, two sets of kebabs (Kakori & Reshmi) and a fried egg sunny side up, that's it, and tastes marvelous. The sizzlers are commendable too. Fish Makhmali Kebabs are highly recommended.

The service is good. 

Expect a long queue any day/time of the week. The alcohol menu needs to be updated, fast.

Food 4/5

Ambiance 4/5

Service 4/5

2016-01-15 18:14:17
Avishek Dan
1129639
4.5
A delight for all gastronomers. That's what Peter Cat is.
‚Ä¢
It was my girlfriend's birthday and to celebrate it we went to the legendary Peter Cat for lunch. The name Peter Cat makes my taste buds tickle for that delicious plate of Chelo Kebab. This classic restaurant still serves the same quality of dishes as they used to do many decades ago. You won't be dissapointed with this place for sure. The interiors are a bit dark with individual dimmed lamps hanging above each table. The interiors have a typical old school feeling and has its own charm.
‚Ä¢
Going to Peter Cat and not ordering Chelo Kebab is a crime. Thus came our plate full of Chelo Kebab. What a delicious sight it is. This thing always remains on top of the list for every foodie. The taste of that super fine rice along with the pieces of kebabs and poached egg is just a winning combination. Some say that this is the best Chelo Kebab in whole India. Not sure about that, as I haven't had Chelo Kebabs in all parts of the country but this one is definitely something else. Utterly mouthwatering, with the aroma of the steamed fine rice with a touch of butter and the explicably delectable Kebabs. What a meal.
‚Ä¢
Next we decided to order a sizzler. The sizzling Tandoori Mixed Grill Sizzler explains the specialty of Sizzlers at Peter Cat! Everything was super delicious in it. Talking about the service of this place - It was superbly fast. Everything came bang within 5 minutes.
‚Ä¢
Lastly we ordered Coke float which is a delicious beverage that satisfied our craving of a drink.
‚Ä¢
Peter Cat is a restaurant that won't ever dissapoint you for sure but one may have to wait for some time to get a seat inside because most of the time flocks of people gather to have their lunch or dinner at this place. Once you get inside, it is literally a gastronomer's heaven.

##

2016-01-13 23:14:03
Senjuti Biswas
1995338
2.5
Peter cat is considered one of the legendary restaurants in Kolkata and the hype about the place cannot even be measured in any terms. Every friend of mine has told me to go here and have their "Chelo kebabs" and sizzlers. So this time I did go and I had quite a disappointing experience i must say. 
Firstly, it was super crowded because I went during the Christmas week. The waiting list was about 45 mins long, and what's worse? People who know the manager and chef are randomly walking in and getting tables, whereas other people are just waiting and waiting for their turn to arrive. This sucks, it's absolutely unfair at least during the peak time when so many people are waiting and you just give preference to contacts. This put me off, then finally we got a table after quite some time. 
Upon entering, I kinda liked the ambience. Casual dining ambience, dimly lit and nicely decorated because it was Christmas! I liked the menu card also, unique design! 
So we settled to order, Chelo kebabs, chicken sizzler, crispy fried prawns, two screwdrivers and a strawberry mocktail. 
Half my interest was gone, when I saw the reactions on the face of the waiter and his impatience. I was asking him for suggestions, the look on his face was so disgusting as if he wants us to leave as soon as possible. He was so disinterested, with such a horrible look on his face nobody would feel like ordering food also. 
Anyway the food took way too long to arrive and clearly they were unable to manage the rush. The golden fried prawns didn't have any prawn inside, it was flat in shape and didn't even taste good. The cocktails came in tiny glasses, looked more like a normal orange juice. No sense of presentation or anything. 
Finally, came the Chelo kebabs. Decent enough, I've no idea why people go crazy about it. The presentation is good thankfully. It's chicken kebabs, mutton seekh Kebabs, rice with dollops of butter and a fried egg. 
The chicken kebabs do taste good, I liked the flavour. Even the seekh kebab tastes really good. 
Then came the sizzler, another disappointment. The sauce was normal sweet n sour sauce, no rice or noodles along with the sizzler. The chicken was chewy and the coating used kept peeling off. I've had far better sizzlers in malls of food courts. Really! 
Pricing is slightly on the higher side considering the quality of food served. Honestly, I've no idea what the hype is about because the food was absolutely not great. And what's worse is their service and hospitality. It's the typical Kolkata restaurant thing that the waiters behave as if they're doing a favour on you by serving you. 
Not going back here again, Park Street has far better places than this and people really need to make the right choice instead of getting carried away by the hype. 
Peter cat - some serious improvements needed!

2016-01-11 15:53:14
Partha Roy
16651423
2.5
Dear All,
¬†Let me share my experience with you at Peter Cat Restaurant situated at 18A, Park Street, Kolkata.¬†‚Ä¢	Before you enter you need to enrol your name and number of heads even if you are going on weekdays. Weekends are subject to Luck.¬†‚Ä¢	Stewards standing outside the restaurant will then segregate and allot table as per their convenience and assortment. Bongs with families will be allocated extreme end at ground floor of the restaurant, Bengali couple again on extreme end and Maru‚Äôs with families on 1st floor and in front rows.¬†‚Ä¢	If you are lucky, then perhaps you get table in at the front row or on the upper floor, or else they will aim and assign table which will be at the extreme last corner of the restaurant on the ground floor.¬†‚Ä¢	The food is really good and has nothing to do with waiting or sitting arrangement experience. ¬†‚Ä¢	The Ambience is good provided you are sitting on the upper floor or in front row on the ground floor. But once are allotted a table at the end of the ground floor your opinion will change radically.¬†‚Ä¢	The Cutlery used are quite old and plates are fading away with the Peter Cat logos.¬†‚Ä¢	Some of the Table Napkins you might also find torn ones if you are that fortunate. I consider myself as lucky.¬†‚Ä¢	Overall experience is not very satisfactory since if you consider the prices it will almost cost INR 1200 for 2 persons. ¬† ¬†‚Ä¢	So all together Peter Cat is a Neglected, yet recognised Restaurant in Kolkata.

2016-01-11 14:21:00
Aiswarya Das
30734528
4.0
I visited this place yesterday for the first time with my family. We had to wait for around 20 min before we were let inside. The decor is beautiful with shades of orange all around. For starters we ordered Tandoori Broccoli and Peter Cat's signature dish, the Chelo Kebabs. The broccoli tasted just heavenly. The soft and tender broccoli florets melted into our mouths. I had heard a lot about Chelo Kebabs from my friends and yes, it definitely stood upto our expectations. The kebabs were delicious and the butter rice perfectly complimented them. For mains, we had butter naan, biriyani, afghani chicken, fish makhmali and mutton. The naans were very soft and tasted perfect along with the mutton and fish dishes. The biriyani was nothing special. It actually did not taste like biriyani but it was not bad either. The service was a bit poor. We had to keep calling the waiters from time to time. Overall it was a nice experience and I would recommend everyone to visit this place atleast once.

##

2016-01-06 11:28:58
Ashish Gautam
1463992
3.5
During my visit to Kolkata I picked this place for my lunch and tried their famous chello kebabs with bunch of cocktails and finished it up with their special dessert. In all It was good but seriously not worth the hype.

No matter at what time you visit, it will always be crowded and you have to wait to get a table. I waited for around 15-20 minutes before entering this dimly lit yet impressive ambiance with beautiful decor and nice seating. The dining area is sure to impress with its eye pleasing components and even the menu is creatively done which gives an overall enchanting experience to your meal. Staff is also good and know their job really well.

I ordered Chello kebabs with cocktails. Cocktails were great and nicely done but the scarcity of strong ones in the menu is not a good thing for people who prefer their drinks strong. Kebabs were good too and were served very nicely with impressive garnishing with rice, seekh and egg topped with butter and salad. It was a complete meal in itself with great kebabs but seekh and rice failed to impress. Seekh had very dissatisfying texture with taste not pleasing at all. Rice were too plain and I would have preferred them with a bit of flavoring and seasoning. In dessert as suggested by staff I went for strawberry with ice cream which was nothing but strawberries served with a couple if scoops of vanilla ice cream and wafer. Honestly I was expecting more considering its price.

In all this place is great with really nice ambiance, great staff and delectable food but totally not worth the hype.

My Rating:
1. Food: 3.5/5
2. Ambiance: 4/5

2015-12-31 17:45:19
Ag
729895
4.0
So be prepared to wait for atleast an hour ( it took us 1hr 45 mins and a mini meal), to get inside. But once inside, its a pleasure to be served so well. Beautiful food, great service, good serving size , awesome ambience & a value for money meal. 

But before i go forward, let me tell you the chelo kebab for which this place is famous is overrated. Its a wonderful combination of unexpected ingredients, but trust me when i say this, i've had better kebabs at unknown places. So besides the let down on that front, the harem's chicken (i think thats what it is called) - with naan is amazing. the naan itself is beautiful, i could eat a bucketful. The chicken was slightly over cooked, but the gravy was to die for . The run mocktail being perfectly yummy was a pleasant surprise and so were the silver beer mugs. :)

To end the meal  - their meringue with chocolate sauce - its a full meal in itself  & tuti fruity ice cream.. a perfect round up. 

I'd say its worth the wait.

##

2015-12-29 10:34:45
Natasha Jha
2410108
2.0
As I begin to write this review the child inside me is devastated. Peter cat is right up there, with the other legends of Calcutta, or so I was told. 

My excitement was palpable, as I bounced around the entrance for over an hour before being ushered in- word to the wise : if there are more than ten names before you put your name down on the "list" it's probably going to be over an hour in waiting time. 

The first thing that hit me on entering the place was the dank carpet smell. Ignoring it, I proceeded towards our table, with a place that old such things become part of the charm. The service was prompt and soon a server engaged with us. His silken voice advising us on what to order. As a group we were pre decided on chelo kababs, however, I insisted on a mutton Cutlet as well  as I was famished. 

The mutton cutlet arrived and we attacked it like a pack of dogs, only to be bitterly disappointed. There was no salt. The patty was bland and it seemed like a chunk of fried meat. Not something you would like to ingest after the insane wait. We requested for a new batch and after another twenty minutes our food arrived. This one was a shade better with a hint of salt. At this point we didn't care. 

After polishing off the not so appetising cutlet we waited for another fifteen minutes before our chelo kabab arrived. An elaborately decorated plate the food looked inviting. As I dug into it, the mutton seemed ordinary but the chicken was succulent and for a moment our wait seemed justified. 

I was disappointed with the serving time, the general hygiene( bathrooms were terrible) and the food quality. I don't know if the hype around the place overshadowed the actual quality of food. But I was let down at discovering a mediocre place behind the screen of a magniloquent charade.  Peter cat gets a 2.0 from my end.

2015-12-28 23:14:29
Adwitiya Modak
3213063
3.5
Lived practically half my teenage life on Park Street but for some reason never tried this place out until recently. Went with a friend around 4ish on a lazy Tuesday and was lucky to find no queues. 
We ordered a Chelo Kebab and Chicken Sizzler for both of us and probably would have loved to order more had the staff been a little friendly. Probably the reputation of being one of the most sought after restaurant in Park Street has gotten into their heads. 
Anyway the dimly lit restaurant does add a bit of romantic atmosphere, which, like I said, is killed instantly by the staff.
The Chelo Kebab and Sizzler was presented extremely well and hot, perfect for the cold-dull winter weeks. The presentation was very good. The food, on the other hand, was good but not great.
My over all experience has been somewhat satisfactory. I have been hoping to go back again to see if I have a different experience since the first impression does not necessarily have to be the last one. üòä

##

2015-12-28 00:02:21
Nicole Urvi
29899249
1.0
To say I am disappointed with this place would be an understatement.

1) They wouldn't give us a seat on the top level of the restaurant even though there were seats. We had to fight to get those seats.
2) They forgot our drink orders and to refill the snack bowl which is complimentary with the drinks.
3) If you look at the photos I've uploaded, you'll see that the kebab sizes were TINY. My local restaurant makes kebabs which are bigger. Irrespective of the fact that it is the holiday season, when you charge more than 350 for a dish exclusive of taxes, you should meet up to the set standard!
4) The waiter was too busy trying to grease us to get a larger tip, and so he ended up taking away a kebab which was on the plate which he assumed was finished with. Such etiquette and mistakes are not expected from a restaurant such as Peter Cat.
5) The mutton pieces on the Mixed Tandoori Sizzler were UNDERCOOKED. We couldn't even cut through the piece of meat we were given.

All in all, it was a very bad experience during the holidays. Not something that I would have expected out of Peter cat.

##

2015-12-23 19:43:23
Aditri Biswas
27244027
4.0
Ambience is the first thing that hits you when you enter Peter Cat. There's just so much nostalgia, heritage, Kolkata-ness attached to Peter Cat that, being a Kolkattan, you just cannot give this place a miss. Dim lights, round tables, people speaking in hushed voices, there is a fantastic old-world charm, which is quite a contrast to the classy, modern Park Street environment. The waiters are always in full uniform, including a head garment as well.
Coming to the food, its no surprise that Chelo kabab was in order. There is so much hype about this particular dish that maybe my personal expectation was a tad bit high. Overall it is a good dish, although the mutton kababs weren't as delicious as i had been expecting. Other than that, you must try it. We ordered a Tandoori Mixed Grill which was average, to say the least. All in all, you must visit Peter Cat once, just to taste the famous Chelo kabab and to experience a cultural heritage at its peak, if not for anything else. Ting! :-)

##

2015-12-21 15:23:25
Archit Tantia
378512
1.5
The ambiance is amazing but everything that follows is just the opposite.

When we called for the person taking the order to ask about the serving size of the dishes, he rudely asked "Serving size means?" followed by "these are the main dishes and these are the side dishes" and walked away.

When the starters came, they were cold and slimy. By now most of us were so irritated with the rudeness of the staff and the disgusting starters that my friends decided to leave and get a table at the good old Bar-B-Q next door. We asked the waiter to cancel the main course order and get the bill.

What happens next is interesting. After waiting for 10-15 minutes we asked the waiter for the bill again but in return he came with the dishes. He said your dishes are here because you ordered them. We politely asked him that we wanted the dishes to be cancelled as the starters were really bad and that our friends had already left. He took away the dishes but the guy who took our order came back with them just to throw the dishes on our tables and to say "You have to take this dish because you ordered it." I asked him to call the manager of the restaurant so that I could talk to somebody who had some sense in him.

Meanwhile: All the tables around us were complaining about something or the other to the waiters. There was one table where a lady was complaining that she had ordered a fresh line sweet and sour but the drink was too sweet. The waiters were arguing that this was the correct recipe and that where was nothing they could do.

The manager arrived along with the waiter who was busy handing over the bill to me (which included the main course items we didn't eat/want). The person who had taken our order was also standing there arguing that it was not his fault. The manager listened to us and accepted that the staff was indeed rude and that they shouldn't have thrown the plates around like that. He asked the waiter to just bill us for the starters and we left.

The place is very old and very famous for the food but in my opinion, the popularity of the place has infected the minds of the staff there to be rude to its customers.

The Chelo Kebabs might be a famous dish on the menu but they would taste disgusting when served with such a bad attitude.

This place has the honour of the first 1.5 stars (just for the ambiance) rating from me on Zomato!

##

2015-12-21 14:51:42
Debjanee Chakrabarti
1549645
4.5
Going to Peter Cat is like going on a pilgrimage. Be prepared for the long, long, long queue, angry devotees who get more and more agitated with every passing minute, and a whole lot of expectations. From time to time you wait for a divine intervention that would perhaps speed up your entry from a mysterious list of names that seems to grow longer and longer. Anyhoo, Peter Cat is Peter Cat. There are those who love it and there are those who keep cribbing at the "deteriorated quality of food." I still love the place and harbour no such grievances. We always start off with some beer and we love the steel mugs they pour it in, and the chanachur with the pickled onions. Lovely stuff. We keep the starters very light and usually order the fish tikka kebab or the rajma gilauti kebab. We usually order the buttery, herby, amazing chelo kebab and the chicken steak sizzler as the main course. My partner usually has the chelo kebab and glares at me as I keep pecking and pawing at his plate. Can't be helped. All in all, love the place. :)

2015-12-06 23:21:25

15674309
1.0
So we a group of 3..... All vegetarians ..... Probably we should have read the reviews before going to peter cat...... Anyways after 2-3 people recommended we went ahead and were told there was a waiting for 30-45 mins.  When i told the usher that please write down my phone number and give me a call, he outrightly said no and when i asked for the restaurants phone no the same again was conveyed to me, i probably have been to all the places in Delhi & Gurgaon, and most of them do better business than peter cat, still they take the guests phone numbers so that they can be informed. Its not that also that peter cat provides a good waiting area to the guests. STILL after waiting for 40 minutes we went and ordered. So first comes the waiter with glasses in his hands and don't even bother to serve water. Simply puts the bottle on the table and leaves. Then comes the soup. Pathetic. As if drinking a watery version of tomato ketchup and that too a local one. Sizzler comes next and all i can see are some unrecognisable pieces of some veggies all covered with gravy. Could not even make out what i was eating. So we thought it is not good for vegetarians so we asked the manager to cancel our food order, first he accepts to do so, then tells the old grumpy waiter to get the order cancelled, the waiter tells him to do it on his own and he then comes to us and says that we cannot cancel the order.  So thinking that food items might be ok, we tell him to serve the food. So we are served plates from the next table where people are already sitting. On complaining he tells us that he kept him on the other table by mistake and the plates were actually meant for us. Next the food comes and the old grumpy waiter puts all the pieces of breads directly in our plates thereby making a choice for us himself. So we already had decided that if the food is not good we will probably get it packed and give it to a beggar so atleast some good comes out of this ordeal. Finally we tried eating but could not ( it was simply not to our taste) so we tell them to pack the food and get our bill. To our surprise ( actually after this service we should not be surprised) they had charged us even for the aluminium foil and carry bag. Coz we did not want to create a scene and get to a nearby Mc donalds as soon as we could, we paid the amount, the waiter returned the change and i dont know why i still left some change ( about 20-25 Rs) with them, then to my disgust the old grumpy waiter agains mumbles something as if i committed a crime. In all the best thing out of this experience is that a poor disabled man got a full meal.

##

2015-12-01 17:54:58
Atindra Chakraborty
151379
4.0
Despite having lived in Kolkata for 22 years , I have dined out at Peter cat just twice. This review is based on the second experience.
After returning from Hyderabad, I visited this place to re-try their chelo kebabs. It was as mouth watering as it was 3 years ago. This time I also tried the mixed sizzler. It was too saucy for my taste. Moreover, it included a fish and chicken liver also which was a little appalling. I will probably never try it again.

In terms of the decor and ambiance, it's as classic as it has always been. A landmark both geographically and in the books of a food lover. In terms of service the place is a 4/5. They serve the food pretty quickly in spite of the great demand during rush hour. Also, this place is ever crowded and there will be some waiting time before you can actually enter and eat.

Another point about the cordiality of the staff; I had left behind my debit card there (by mistake) and they had kept it with the manager after I called them up. I was allowed to collect it the following day with ease. So, immensely thankful on a personal front!¬†

So, if you can condone the minor downsides and want to taste dishes that have been heralded in the annals of time , do visit Peter Cat!

I decided to visit our legendary restaurant at least once in a month from now :)

1) seating along the walls in the ground floor is very uncomfortable due to paucity of space.
