##

2015-11-26 17:50:37
Debaleena
204142
2.5
Peter Cat serves ordinary food, made extraordinary only when one adds nostalgia and old colonial hangover in industrial quantities to make up for the mediocre food. Not that nostalgia is a bad thing, but if one doesn't have those associated memories, one gets just average food and that can be slightly disappointing !

The famous chelo is good kebab, though today my shekh kebab was a tad dry. Best out-of-the-world kebabs ? No.

The chicken steak sizzler is a piece of steak with potato wedges, carrots and beans, soaked in a sweet, brown sauce (don't be French and try to understand the sauce!). If you have a slightly diverse pallette, ignore. 

My final suggestion ? Go to Mocambo ! Same owner, same stuff and much better food.

##

2015-11-23 20:35:11
Ranit Chakraborty
32485978
4.5
Peter Cat was a puja destination for me. As it was the pujas, we had to wait for entering. However, after the food was served, it was well understood that the wait was worth it.
The ambience of Peter Cat is quite cozy with dim lighting. It sets the mood for a close, comfortable dining experience, be it a romantic one or with your family (as was my case!). Moving to the swiftness of the service, there's no complaints there even. The food was served up within 15 mins of placing the order.
Now, the food served over there is generally high end. Items served are generally chracterised by flavor in Peter Cat rather than spiciness. The Chelo Kebabs and the sizzlers were out of the world, so much so that we went ahead and ordered a second plate. Even the foods that are not the trademarks of Peter Cat, are tasty to a fault.
Granted that the pocket pinch cannot be overlooked, but it's definitely worth it. Satisfaction can be granted in the restaurant. So, definitely go for it!!

##

2015-11-22 02:17:45
Arjun Pakrashi
32534115
4.0
Visiting Peter Cat since the time when Chelo Kebab was 80 Rs. I have been here uncountable number of times with friends and family.

It is always a tough time to get in as almost all the time all over the year there will be a queue to enter and therefore you need to register your name and later you get called when a table becomes available. Thought little time estimates for the waiting time is provided and mostly I found them to be inaccurate. I generally tend to visit them in a very uncommon time so that the queue is either empty or very short. Weekdays noon time or afternoon time on a non-festive season worked well.

After entering without going through the menu book we will either order a Chelo Kebab or the Chicken Marakesh. These meat platters focus on the different kinds of kebabs to be eaten with rice and butter. I like the stuffed capcicum which comes with Chicken Marakesh. The important thing to note is these are consistently good. We also tried kima naan and Harem's Joy and found to be pretty good. As a starter ordering chilli babycorn has become a ritual. The Mutton Shammi Kebab and Fish Makmali are pretty good too. Though we also get the sizzlers time to time. I found the Grilled Chicken sizzler to be very nice.

For the vegetarian only people, they can try the Vegitable Chelo Kebab. The chicken kebabs are replaced with ample amount of paneer grilled in a sheek, and mutton kebabs are substituted with vegitable preparations.

Bottom line, this is a heritage restaurant and a place to have a solid and legendary kebab platter and sizzlers. Always at one of the top places in my list.

##

2015-11-20 02:56:46
Shreyashi Bhattacharya
31160224
4.0
It's a crime to be a foodie and not yet tasted the legendary chelo kababs of Peter Cat!! Situated in posh food hub of Kolkata, this place stands as a landmark in Park Street. It was on a Sunday,us friends visited this place for lunch and after waiting for 30 minutes we got a table. Even though we were almost salivating at this point, it was impossible not to notice the ambience we were in. This place held the old Calcutta charm, it witnessed the evolution and integration of Western cuisines in India.
We started with cold chicken salad which was tasty and enough for 3-4 people, with pineapple juice. In the main we had the Chelos and it was even better than we expected! Let me start with the fact that you don't need an appetizer if you decide to have Chelos, one plate is huge enough to finish already. Now about the taste....the buttered rice and smoked vegetables are heavenly, and the kebabs were juicy, succulent and with a taste that is completely out of the world. Don't confuse them with the Mughlai cuisine. They're unique and you get to taste this delicious creation only at Rs 334!
I do have a problem with couple things; service is extremely slow. Even though I admit it was the weekend rush, but it didn't justify the 40 minutes interval between entr√©e and main. An advice to fellow foodies, do not order mocktails in large. The large quantity which they claim isn't large at all and is a complete rip off!
Overall, you can overlook every fault of theirs because of the food. Do not miss out on this, experiencing Peter Cat is experiencing Kolkata....sorry..Calcutta!?

##

2015-11-18 10:06:57
Leah Franqui
31892502
3.0
I can review this place with impunity knowing comfortably that whatever I say will have no effect on its popularity, as its a historical restaurant tourists like myself will continue to flock to for the experience if nothing else. 

Dimly lit and oozing with vintage if slightly seedy charm, the interior is exactly what you would expect from a restaurant of its time, and I'm surprised no film has been set there yet. The cocktail list is amusingly witty with a wide range of options, but I tend to stick to old monk in Indian bars. The drinks are largely quite reasonable, a pleasant surprise for such a tourist trap. We ordered a veg galotti kebab to start, which was fine, nothing special, and the chalo kababs as a main, chicken and mutton mix, again, nothing special. I could say that in general about Peter Cat, not bad, not great, just okay. 

But its worth a trip for a drink and to gawk around and feel like you are in another time. And it's far better than Macambo where we tried to eat and were baffled by the rude unhelpful staff and ongoing construction during dining hours which motivated us to leave after cancelling our halfhearted order. If you are going for an institution, Peter Cat is the place, although it might be better to have the full meal elsewhere.

I had always wanted to visit this place but never had such an opportunity but today i got a chance to visit this vintage place with my friends.We reached at around 2:30 and there was as usual a queue outside but fortunately we got a table within 5 minutes.On entering the first thing that impressed me was the vintage decoration with the low orange bulbs.We ordered the legendary chelo kabab,chicken marakesh and house special steak sizzler and sweet lime soda.The food arrived with 15 minutes and we plunged into the sinful plates of food.The chelo kebab stood up to its reputation,the steamed rice with butter and the runny egg poach was yummy.The kebab pieces were also yummy and delicious.But i felt the chicken kebabs in chicken marakesh was better.In the sizzler i had some sausage and it was lip smacking.Overall peter cat lives up to its reputation of legendary kebabs.Had an awesome time there and would be visiting soon.

Peter Cat - One of the legendary food joint of Kolkata located at a prime location, yes it's true you need to wait for the ample of time for a table here on the weekends but once you are in you'll feel like wait at the queue was worth it..¬†
It's Charming interiors, the dim lights and the ambiance has reached this place to another level..¬†
Perhaps the first thing that comes in any foodie's mind in Kolkata once they hear about "The Chello Kebabs".."Kebabomaniacs" .... Will find this place heavenly..¬†
Probably they serves the best Chello Kebabs in Kolkata.. But that doesn't not mean one should overlook the sizzlers they serve.. Nope! Not at all..¬†
The food served is more than adequate and can easily feed two hungry soul at least.. The service is prompt and servers are courteous..¬†
There were people sitting behind the people who were sitting beside of some more people and who were sitting opposite more n more people. In between this riotous colourful congregation were the servers, dressed in white with a top knot on their head (pagri) weaving their way through the maze of tables to reach their destination..so if you haven't been to Peter Cat then you are not from the Kolkata... Be kolkatans..

2015-11-03 12:19:06
Saikat Pal
10040671
2.5
I have been a great fan of chello kebab at Peter cat for ages since my childhood days. But when recently on my visit to kolkata i stepped into this restaurant , I must say that it was something of a shambles to me. This restaurant is still continuing with those same interiors as they had originally started with. The same lightings, same chairs and tables and same waiters , some of whom are so aged that they have well crossed the Government retirement age. These waiters neither do understand proper english nor can they speak. The carpets n staircase would make u feel like u r in a heritage structure which would fall down anyday and u could even celebrate the Halloween here. They have simply failed to change with time and sadly would be left behind soon. The tables are laid so close by that forget a personal meeting, u cant even discuss the menu amongst urselves without the person sitting at the next table overhearing you. And if there is a group of people speaking at their normal tone at the table beside you then it would seem like they are shouting and u are bound to be annoyed with that sound. The lights are very pathetic. The chello kebab has lost its sheen. If u order them the chello kebab straight away without any starters or drinks, the waiter would look at you as if he is doing some favour to you by serving you. And when the chello kebab arrives then its simply pathetic-looks like boiled rice with a spoon of butter on top and few pieces of kebabs dropped on the side. 
I dont understand why people still queue outside and wait for hours to get a table in this pathetic place. 
I guess the management has aged and havent seen what the world is upto now. Its time they woke up and buckle up their shoes else soon it will turn into a haunted house.

One of the oldest restaurants in Kolkata which has managed to keep its place still high on its popularity quotients...

We also had pineapple blossom mocktail along with the our main courses which had a wonderful soothing taste and complemented well with our dishes.
The only problem is that you have to wait in queues almost whenever you visit this place.. but the waiters are very courteous and take every little possible care of you to give a highly satisfying dining experience!

##

2015-10-26 20:54:19
Saurodeep Basak
1507076
3.0
Peter Cat has been around for decades & that speaks a lot ‚Äì Restaurants open very often & close down almost as often. The ones who survive the test of time surely have something nice to offer.

The d√©cor is retro in today‚Äôs context ‚Äì red sofas facing each other & nice lamp shades above each table. The lighting is dim overall but the lamps on each table illuminate the table good enough to see each other, have a good chat & enjoy some good food. There are two floors. We were shown the lower one as the floor above is mostly crowded and takes ages to manage a seat.

Waiting staff looks "purani",¬†with their sherwani suits, flamboyant headgear & pointed shoes. Most of them are however quite 'Old School' ‚Äì smooth talking, not-so-knowledgeable, not overtly attentive but attentive as well, not quite warm, talks with an air of authority interspersed with some rare smiles & I guess quite bored of doing the same job for donkey‚Äôs years which clearly shows in their faces.The food is good in general & at the prices that the food is offered, I would say thwy could been better.

To start, we oredered their house speciality - 2 Chelow Kebabs platter. Peter Cat‚Äôs Chelo Kabab has mid-grained steamed rice in the base but has two dollops of Amul Butter that make the rice sinfully good. However, it is unable to match the original version by a wide gap. The ‚ÄòOriginal Chelo Kabab‚Äô of Peter Cat has one set of chicken kababs & two mutton seekh kababs. There is also a mutton Chelo kabab in which all kababs r mutton. The server suggested that we go for the ‚Äòoriginal‚Äô. The chicken kababs that came with the Chelo Kabab were good but usual. They were not juicy, not melt in the mouth but very tasty & flavorful. The mutton kababs were bad at texture as well ‚Äì brittle, not soft, not juicy, not chewy either and it felt bland in the mouth. Another house speciality is their choice of souffle's. We ordered Mocha Souffle' (Mochachino favoured). It was sinful. We enjoyed the dessert far more than the actual meal. We washed down our meal with fresh lime soda Sweet & salt that failed to make a statement. It was not bad though.¬†

I guess Peter Cat has a bright long future simply for the price-value equation that they have mastered over time. For culinary freaks & hardcore foodies with an exposure to the ‚Äòreal thing‚Äô, Peter Cat might not appeal as much.

However, the ambience with some gloomy yet appealing light arrangements and the staffs with antediluvian outfits which are reminiscent of the pre-independence coffee house era will make you feel marvelous . Also the sizzlers, especially the house special sizzler will make your visit a indelible one!

2015-10-23 13:58:23
Nimisha Srivastav
3143908
2.5
We went to this place during pujo because it was so well recommended!
We ordered chicken steak, vegetable steak, chello kebab, house special, shahi korma and tutti-fruity and hot sizzler brownie as desserts!
Vegetable steak  was bland (more like sweet) and we were told it's supposed to be like that! 
Even the chicken sizzler had a very strong sweet taste!
The only saving grace was the shahi korma. Though way too buttery for our tastes, it had a distinct flavour!
The brownie tasted stale and when we told the waiter, we were informed that it's their speciality and just CANNOT be stale!!
Also when we asked for a doggy bag, we were charged for the box and aluminium foil!! I have never seen this before!
Lastly, all this happened after a long wait... We had waited for 2 hours to get inside!

##

2015-10-19 22:33:15
Soham Ghosh
1833872
3.5
Peter Cat is probably the only alternative to Mocambo. These 2 names go hand-in-hand when it comes to defining the Park Street food experience. Iconic like Mocambo, Peter Cat offers a similar dining experience, but unique in their own way.

The food is terrific. Anything that applies to Mocambo, applies to Peter Cat as well. The stand-out preparation is the Chelo Kebab. Some may argue that the House special sizzler offers competition. Truth be told, they're all just delicious, no two ways to put it. ¬†
The ambience is wonderful, the d√©cor tends to stir up an appetite. There isn't much to say about Peter Cat apart from that it makes for a wonderful meal and never ceases to amaze, no matter how many times you eat here.¬†

Update (16/05/16): Service, in terms of pace and efficiency, has dwindled. Food is still good and Peter Cat still remains a classic. But I fear they're struggling to keep up with Mocambo.

Thanks for reading, and pardon me for any grammatical mistakes I may have made.

##

2015-10-19 01:19:04
Chandrima Das
291750
4.5
What to say about this place! Few heritage restros in Kolkata like this can still boast about their best quality ambience and food to people who come to visit over here from other states/countries. Not writing anything about the signature dish Chelo Kabab which is legendary in this place, if you come to Kolkata, apart from Rosogolla and Mishti Doi, you should have Chelo Kabab from this place for tasting the deadly concoction of mutton, chicken and buttery rice. I want to take the names of some less-mentioned dishes for those people who are already done with the dishes of fame. Mutton Pishori Kabab is one of them. Even being a red-meat-hater, I loved that, so you can imagine its awesomeness! Afghani Chicken is great in taste if you like less-smoky but fried flavour of chicken, then you can order this dish instead of sizzlers. Among the sizzlers, the servers will always recommend for ordering mixed grill tandoor which contains chicken liver too. If you do not like livers, then order for chicken steak sizzler since it does not contain liver. Among fish preps, fried bekti with tartar sauce ticks my palate more than the munier which is more recommended by others. You can order for munier if you can take the fish without getting it fried. Apart from food, mixed cocktail served by them is good, we - the schoolmates made so many reunions in this place, and all were filled with good memories because of this place!

2015-10-10 01:22:26
Saikat Sengupta
1816579
4.5
If you are looking for Iranian dish in Kolkata then what other place is better than our very popular Peter Cat which is famous for their Chelo Kabab, the national dish of Iran. Almost everyone order Chelo Kabab when you are at Peter Cat. We are no exception so the dish is as expected delicious and heavy. The atmosphere is great as well as the food. Now let's come to the issues I have faced. Peter Cat is probably the first choice for most of the people at Park Street therefore the place is always packed up so you gotta wait in the queue for some minutes.And the second issue is the place lacks free space. The place is just a cluster of tables,chairs and people. Having said that Peter Cat really is one of the best attraction for a foodie. :-)

2015-10-07 19:32:18
Srijan RoyChowdhury
1319153
4.5
What can i say about peter cat.... It has always been one of the best restaurants in kolkata..i went there with my family and we were welcomed very cordially and were alloted a table as soon as we reached... But one must be ready to wait in a huge queue as they are housefull almost all the time and dont accept any prebooking.. We ordered the original chalo kebab and the mutton chalo kebab.. Both the dishes were made with the utmost precision and the serving time was also quick... But the only problem is that the place is full all the time and there is a lot of noise and chatter from the tables around so dont expect to share a moment of privacy with your significant other... Go to this place to enjoy the food with your company... But dont expect enjoy your company with the food.... 
Consider yourself lucky if you get a table on reaching and thank your lucky stars if the place is not completely full...but anyway you do it... The food is always going to be exquisite....

##

2015-10-07 18:02:00
Satarupa Hajra
32057172
5.0
Who doesn't know about the famed Peter Cat at Park Street. I find it wonderful. It is truly up my street. I have been here for a couple of times. It's funny albeit not astonishing that I have actually gorged myself on its quintessential Chelo Kebab dish for nine out of ten times. It is unique one with a variety of items like rice, eggs, steaks, grilled paneer, grilled mutton, Persian herbs and vegetables and butter in spades. I am still in awe of this mouth-watering plate! Anyway moving ahead, the Biriyanis are fabulously executed here and you shall be spoilt for choice. Now they have some really heart-warming Sizzlers like the Tandoori Mixed Grill, House Special, Chicken Steak and the likes of these which are too good. Sizzler lovers must not procrastinate visiting the place. Finally the drinks. I am not so hot on drinks, speaking plainly. Yet I was insisted upon to try a sip or two of the El Borracho ( whisky sour) and wound up downing the entire glass! It was much to my chagrin, so damn tasty! Hence I would like to encourage everyone to explore all the splendid possibilities there to have your fill of some incredible and interesting amalgamation of the Persian and Indian cuisines.

##

2015-10-07 15:03:39
Kaustubh Das
2103604
4.5
One of the most popular and the most famous restro of Kolkata. We were welcomed very warmly at the gate and were allotted a table directly as we reached there just at 7 pm. But please be ready to spend considerable time in queue if you are even just half an hour late as they are always full and no advance table booking is accepted. Well, could not order anything other than the famous chelo kebab and it was really yummy. Portion was just adequate but tastes heavenly. The desserts were very good. Caramel custard was nice and the brownie with ice cream and hot choco sauce was just excellent. Service is really quick. However, when we ordered for the drinks which was supposed to be served on the rocks, it was just served normal with ice being served separately, that too the ice was small broken pieces which was melting so fast that could not enjoy the drink to the fullest. Otherwise, everything was lovely.

2015-10-07 12:58:03
PROSENJIT KAR

4.5
One of the most iconic restaurants on parkstreet. Most of the time you will have to wait for atleast 10-15mins during a peak time to get a seat. 

But once you are in the ambience will attract you. Dim lighting makes it a very soothing ambience. I have mostly tried the famous Chelo Kabab and the Mix grill sizzler. Chelo Kabab is a meal in itself. Varieties of Kababs served with a portion of rice,a fried egg and a good dollop of butter. Just heavenly. The Mix grill sizzler too is a great mix of all the non veg Kababs and topped with a Indian gravy. Served with dinner rolls. Awesome taste and very filling. And very economical too in today's times.

##

2015-10-04 23:00:22
Gaurav Sarkar
6784031
4.5
Finally visited this legendary place after ages!! One of the best places to dine in at parkstreet!!
Ambience is classy nd posch.. quite spacious..dimly lit with nice red hanging lamps on each table.. also a bowl of pickeled onions, achaar( mixed pickle) along with chillies and lemon were kept at each table which is quite appreciated..
Service was good nd the waiter was quite attentive..
Evn at 5.45 pm on a sunday..we found quite a rush and as time passed..more people started to drop in showing how popular this eatery is.
Coming to the food..we ordered the trademark chello kabab..it ws really good..the rice,butter dollops,chicken kababs wid grilled veggies and poached egg along wid the "chello kabab" ( succulent moist minced meat) made up a fine meal..
Next came grilled chicken sizzler.. the brown sauce ws really tasty and it complemented the grilled chicken pieces..was served with grilled potatoes blended with spices nd sm sautted veggies.the pieces of chicken cud hv had lesser bones and more meat..however the taste made up for it.
Next ordered the betcky munier.. nw dis was another standout dish..two good pieces of bhetki fillets grilled (moist and tender) nd served in a really delicious white creamy sauce..accomponied by some roasted potatoes( same as served in the grilled chicken platter).
A pure gastronomical delight with lip smacking food at decent prices..
It costs us 1098 exact inclusive of all d taxes..
Chello kabab- Rs 334
Betcky munier- Rs 325
Grilled chicken sizzler- Rs 255.
A must visit!

service 8/10
location 9/10 ...

2015-10-02 19:14:23

3.5
I was planning to write an review on peter cat or to be precise their chelo kabab for a long time but somehow it was left out. At last I thought of giving it a go with my re cent endeavours, well than here it goes:
I always felt cramped out sitting there in my grads and after my masters and job i still feel the same.
We ordered fish makhmali in starters and it was mouth watering.
As always the person i went with ordered mutton chelo kabab. Taste wise it has been kept intact although my partner had a different view on it. For me only a small pointer is that i felt the capsicum in the platter was undercooked.
I had masala kulcha and chicken reshmi butter masala both of them were good and hearty in terms of portion.
Overall its a great place for a family get together but though the staffs are very polite and quite frankly i admire that most, still I have to say they are not capable of handling non indian clients and that hampers the reputation of this place.

2015-10-01 19:15:02
Om Awasthi
1706841
4.5
The restaurant is situated at park Street Kolkata.. The entire street is full of many restaurant and eating joints..
I visited on recommendation of one of my friend and I was not at all disappoint .

The ambience of the restaurant is amazing . the sitting place is divided into ground and first floor.

You have to wait for minimum of 15-30 minutes on weekdays to get the seat and on weekends evening it could be more.

The staff is very warming and will not pester you with their presence.

I ordered vegetable steak . This was one of their signature dish and it was mouthful choice. It's enough for single person.

It's little on the costlier side but that compromises with presentation and taste of food. 

I highly recommend this restaurant if you really want to cherish the food.

2015-09-26 12:12:19
Arkosnato Neogy
1575819
4.5
Everybody who lives in Kolkata knows this place. Without exception. PC has a great brand name, and its not without reason. One of the best continental food places in the city. Sizzlers, started over a decade ago (possibly first in the city) continue to charm till this day (Chelo Kabab, please). The prawn cocktail is simply heavenly. Ambience is great, on the quieter side but in a good way. Prices are slighlty upscale but the quality of food is really worth it. Fair warning - its best to book a table if you are visiting on a weekend evening otherwise you might end up waiting an hour on the street, which obviously tends to spoil the experience.

2015-09-25 22:33:06
Reeka Choudhury
16000747
4.0
Love the feel of this place. The pretty low hung lamps in the otherwise dim lighting adds to the charm. Added to it, is the way the waiters are dressed, with their fancy turbans. On this visit, ordered the Beckty Meunier and the famous Chelo Kebab. The Meunier, which had fish fillets in white hollandaise sauce, with baked potatoes and freshly chopped veggies on the side, was really good. And Chelo Kebab, need I describe it? It was pure decadence, and one can see why this deserves to be the signature dish here. All in all, this was quite a filling meal for two. But I would like to mention that last time, I had tried the Fried Chicken Liver after reading reviews on Zomato, and I am sorry to say that the dish had disappointed me. So there's still room for improvement in this otherwise highly recommended place.

##

2015-09-24 21:00:13
Jubaraj Sinha
31961640
4.0
What can you write about an institution in the food circuit of the city. It has been a haunt for many a Kolkatan and even outsiders for a long time. It has been one of our favorite spots for Sizzlers and the iconic Chelo Kabab since childhood.

The numerous visits have not dented the appetite to come back for more of the same to this place.

The fish finger is one the best served in the Park Street area. Apart from that you have a good selection of kababs and some continental choices.

The only issue is getting a table on most days for both lunch and dinner and especially during weekends the waiting time can easily be more than an hour. This has never deterred 'fans' of Peter Cat and the queues don't get shorter.

The service is so-so but then the prices are very reasonable for such an outlet.

We hope it continues to excel in the food department and we keep going back for more.

2015-09-19 22:30:26
Jayabrata Dhakai
1653330
4.0
GREAT FOOD!!

It really deserves a spot in the Legendary Restaurants Collection. You should really avoid weekends if you are unwilling to stand in a queue. However this shouldn't lead you to believe that they have less seating area, it has two floors but that could still fall short for food crazy bongs.

I was leaving for Bangalore and my friend for Pune and thought Peter Cat would be the best place for three good friends to have lunch and have fun before we meet again. It has really nice interiors with hanging lamps, really comfortable seats, dim lights, it really sets the mood. Oh and another thing, they have a really quick service.

Obviously we didn't have any inclination for veg item otherwise we wouldn't have been there in the first place. We ordered CHICKEN STEAK SIZZLER, It had chicken, carrots, potatoes, beans and a poached egg. We were predetermined to have Iranian delicacy. I had CHICKEN MARAKESH and my friends ordered CHICKEN CHELO KEBAB. Both the dishes looks similar has almost similar items with a minor difference. Plain white rice, chunk of butter, salad, chicken reshmi kebab. The only difference being, marakesh has a chicken pasty whereas the chello has a poached egg an the food was mouth watering, delicious, too good to explain in words.

I have one grievance though, they serve whiskey in tall glasses, usual standards say they should use flat based, broad mouth, small glasses.

##

2015-09-19 10:04:13
Subharun Mukherjee
124988
2.0
Peter Cat, as nostalgic as it is, leaves a bad taste in your mouth with it's ill mannered staff and 'we care a damn' attitude. Coming to the food, it is just about alright. The starters comprising of fish fingers and mutton sheeks were really awesome though what followed was not. The chelo kabab (though widely worshipped) is basically some buttered rice with a fried egg and a side of mutton sheek kabab and chicken kabab. No doubt it is good but runs more on the hype than substance. The sizzler is just awful with soggy fries and a strange platter full of batter fried chicken fillets (again soggy from being dipped in gravy for too long). A gentle complain to the manager is met with a sharp "...but that is how sizzlers are supposed to be". Well gentleman it is time you walk out of your little hole and see what the world is offering both in terms of food and service. Don't travel too far for right next door in Park St. itself Mocambo and Bar-B-Q serve much better food (though the service is again another story). This review however has little or no consequence for Peter Cat for they do not care (as people still wait for hours to get a place to sit and seem to faint with exhilaration after touching their god like chelo kabab). I know it is blashphemous to criticize an institution like Peter Cat but I apologize to it's many years of establishment and it's fan club when I say - Please drop into peter cat for an evening of nostalgia and insults.

2015-09-19 00:37:41
Sandipan Sen

And I guess it's pretty common there because the servers were pretty skilled in avoiding the tables and patrons who were waiting. Overall a disappointment considering the legendary status of Peter Cat.

2015-09-16 22:04:25

3.0
Landed in Cal, and had this on my to-do list for day 2....went on a Saturday afternoon, around 1'ish, got a place for one, right away....took the public's highly opinionated Chelo Kebab, with two mugs of beer.
Have to admit, as a Delhiite, I'm not impressed at all. The chicken kebabs were just plain rubbery, with herb seasoning slapped over them, while the mutton, although quite savoury, were nothing out of the ordinary. Any kebab house in old Dilli will offer way more ¬†in terms of the flavours. Never really understood the fuss though. Chelo Kebabs are Persian by design. There is absolutely nothing Persian about the platter at Peter Cat.
Have to give full points for the ambience, though. Do visit it for a well preserved Victorian feel, in a contemporary setting.

##

2015-09-15 23:37:06
Diptajeet Datta
199112
3.5
Located just beside Music World (for those who still find it very hard to accept the presence of Au Bon Pain where Music World is used to be), Peter Cat is a legendary restaurant in Calcutta. If you are visiting Park Street area, you must make a point to visit it. The quality of the food may not be the same as it used to be a few years back but it is definitely worth visiting just to feel the awe as well as soak yourself into a bit of Old Kolkata. The ambience is still good and so is the sitting. Service has always been a positive point of this place and it hasn't changed either. The only thing that felt a bit different was the quality of food.

Our orders:

Fish makhmali kabab

mutton seekh kabab

fish finger

Chelo kabab

Except the mutton seekh kabab, the rest tasted very nice though I was not very impressed with the chelo kabab. I remember I used to frequent this place with my family or cousins a while back. The food used to be excellent and that's why we used to go there so often. Now the food tasted okay but not that great. Especially the chelo kabab. Perhaps it is one food item that has gained more fame than the restaurant serving it. A specialty of Peter Cat for ages, this chelo kabab is an assortment dish. It contains a bed of long grained rice with dollops of amul butter, a half-boiled omlette, 2 mutton seekh kababs and a set of chicken kababs well done and paired with roasted vegetables - 1 with each chicken kabab. This whole thing is legendary and people wait for hours to taste this. It is no doubt very exciting and delicious but during my recent visit to the city, I happened to revisit this place and did not really feel the same charm of chelo kabab as it used to be. The price has climbed up and the quantity has come down. If you can ignore this fact, all is well and delightful.

PS:

1. They serve alcohol but funny the collection of whisky isn't that great.

2. The dim lights will give you a cozy feeling.

3. No Smoking inside the restaurant.

4. They have 2 floors of sitting, can't say which one is better but I have seen people preferring the upper one.

5. Peter Cat seemed a bit overpriced to me considering the portions of food.

6. The rest room is upstairs, there isn't one in the ground floor.

U need to do a booking before get into there. Got a seat and ordered the much hyped dish mutton chelo kebab, veg steak and Biriyani ala nawabi and chicken tandoori. This place is a gem of food preparation where u will get salsa of sizzlers, Mediterranean and mugal food and its will presented to you with huge delegacies.
Service was fast and food was beyond imagination and we were in no mood of sharing each others dish. Meat was soft juicy tender and nicely cooked, it just blown our mind. Thought as if a visit to this place paid off our trip of Kolkata. "Peter cat rocks". At the center of park street where there's no night this place is a must visit and holds a heritage of mix cuisine. Charges were not expensive and food was heavenly. Guys please mark this place as must visit on u r menu when u hunting in the streets of Kolkata.

##

2015-09-06 23:58:34

15809717
3.5

##

2015-09-06 16:11:30
Abhinandan Chiney
250356
4.5
One of the several iconic restaurants in Kolkata, Peter Cat is a must visit for all food lovers and meat lovers alike. The restaurant has upheld its 70s decor and traditional food and drinks menu. This place is so popular that a 30 minute wait for a table ¬†(considering it is a fairly large place) is considered standard. People start queuing up over an hour before service starts - such is the frenzy regardless of whether it is a weekday and weekend. Located at the one the "food streets" of the city filled with iconic restaurants, the crazy about Peter Cat shows how well the hotel has maintained its standards.¬†Food is mostly delicious with the classic Chelo Kabab being the crown on its jewels. One cannot go wrong with any non vegetarian item on this menu. The only downside of a visit being the time of service. The restaurant is under staffed and over crowded so service is slow and sometimes frustrating.¬†

A visit to Kolkata is incomplete without a visit to Park Street - and a visit to Park Street is incomplete without a meal at Peter Cat (albeit after waiting for over 30 minutes for a table).

It‚Äôs the best in town. Chelo Kabab happens to be one of the signature dishes of Peter Cat.

During Christmas and New Year, it becomes really difficult to grab a seat. People get to stand in queue from almost 6:00 in the evening. However, having said that, the wait in the queue is definitely worthwhile.

I don't think any calcutta foodie has skipped this restaurant similarly I have visited it many times but for my recent visit I thought I should write a review about this place. Saturday and Sunday is always crowded you can't do anything about it so as usual we had to wait for half an hour to get a table. There is nothing more to say about the ambience which everyone knows is very warm and nice with is accentuated with those red cosy chairs and dim lights. We quickly ordered 1 chello kebab,1 house special sizzler, 1 bekty munier and 3 fresh lime sodas. Personally I think that the chello kebab is good but not awesome and truelly speaking this is the only place till date which serves a decent chello kebab.  My friend enjoyed her sizzler which I think was yummy and perfect. In bekty munier the quality of the fish was topnotch and cooked really really well in a light creamy gravy(simply loved it) but alas the potato served with it was quite spicy and a complete contrast in taste than the fish which was a bit weird. Nevertheless we enjoyed our food but the most annoying thing are their staffs because I think they are really weird . The total amount came to rs. 1500 approx.

It is not usual tandoori masala types but it was a little bland which infact worked for me surprisingly, it was really good. Now the main course peas pulao was great, perfectly prepared. Pineapple Raita was a huge let down, I didn't expect that (Maybe it might be served liked that in Kolkata) but by Mumbai standards it was let down, it had mishti doi as the base chopped pineapple spread over it that's it. One paneer dish was fine not great, roti were crisp n good. Overall my pineapple Raita & paneer sabzi disappointed me so much that I didn't even order dessert. 


(Not a Kolkata Based person, Had Visited Kolkata for a short trip)

##

2015-08-21 00:55:23
Robbin Hood
1997478
3.5
We were a group of 6 friends. we ordered chicken kebabs as starter, and in main course, the legendary Chelo Kabab. 
Two of us ordered Dum Ki Raan also. 

I am a regular in this restaurant since 1997. I used to come with my father. And since then what I have observed is, the pace of their service is quite slow sometimes. 

Kebab was Okay; nothing special to mention. 
And for chelo kabab their standard is almost similar since past 15-20 years I believe. 
Though if the quality of rice would be a bit better, that would have created real magic. I found the quality of rice (boiling), not too perfect that day. 

Dum ki raan was the show stellar. 
Perfectly boiled lamb and the thickness of the gravy was just perfect. 

Any given day I would suggest either Chelo kabab or Dum Ki Raan here. 

Apart from these two jewels, other offerings are good, but nothing special to stimulate your taste buds.

##

2015-08-19 22:06:13
Debankur Basu
576137
4.5
Being from Kolkata, certain places are ingrained in your growing up years food wise. This place certainly ranks high in the list. Restaurants sadly are identified or labelled by a signature dish these days and this, kind of hinders the patron's choice of ordering something apart from that. Yes, I am referring to the czars of all the food here - the chello kebab. No doubt it is the tastiest and classiest original you could get here but it is sheer injustice to the other equally brilliant dishes that they have.
I am pretty sure no one orders continental and sandwiches here although they take up quite a significant real estate on the menu cards. I talk out of experience. Okay enough brooding but the review is to celebrate what is supposed to be a culinary revelation - the chellos and of course they are something to be relished with pleasure. It is a plate full of meaty goodness (if you opt for the mutton variant) and I simply love the coal-charred tomato they serve along with it and the buttered rice. This is a close relative to an Iranian dish called the koobi-deh (if I am not horribly incorrect). The kebabs be it in this dish or from the other menu options are always succulent, juicy and meat-lover's dream.

Well this surely is a place to visit but not only for the chellos. The others need generous tastings as well you see. Dying to have my fill again. :-)

A first visit to Kolkata after years and a quick google search said go visit peter cat and try out chello kebab.

Peter cats staff is nice but hospitality is not there forte.

I finally got it, and one if the staff politely suggested that I try Chello Kebab and Zam Zam drink.

The kebabs is nothing more than mutton seekh, chicken kebabs, rice and some butter. Thats all.¬†

It wasn't a great meal but not too bad as well.

Maybe I should have tried their sizzlers or visited a better place.

Kolkata I am sure you can provide better food!~

One of the biggest legends in kolkata cuisine!  This place does not need any introduction at all. The huge queue outside the restaurant should speak for itself. The place is huge! The most famous dish here is the Chelo Kebab and it deserves respect! The other dishes are exceptionally well made too, and the desserts are impeccable!  Everything about this restaurant is top notch. Some of the services provided by the waiter wasn't very well pleasant so it doesn't get a 5 in my opinion.  But when the food hits the taste buds, these things didn't hold much weight at all! If you are going there for the first time, Chelo Kebab is the dish to go for and once you leave, it will be understood why this place holds its reputation as the legend that it is!

What can I say about Peter Cat, save, that a classic should not be tampered with.... And that is exactly the motto of the peter cat family.... Being a Peter Cat regular since my childhood.... I have not seen the place, the decor, or the standard, quality and taste of the food change in any ways.... True slip ups happen, long waits in the queue happen... But a Peter Cat loyalist will always return... Despite all this....
So this Instalment of Peter Cat found this glutton and a fellow food Aficionado waiting for 30 mins ( a small wait considering it was a Sat afternoon), entering the restaurant ever glowing in the red orange lighting.... Scampering upstairs , grabbing a corner sofa... Plush red ... Hastily ordering Chelo Kebabs and coke.... And we were in heaven.... Our foodscape yesterday was limited to the classic favourite... Chelo Kebab.... Mutton seek kebab, chicken tikka kebabs with tomatoes, capsicum and onion, charred in a tandoor to succulent perfection, surrounding a small mound of fine long grained basmati rice, cubes of butter, grilled tomato and the legendary fried egg sunny side up...... Yet again I was in food heaven....you can't improve on perfection.... Thank God there are somethings in this world which doesn't change .. Chelo Kebab being one of them!!!! My friends being a major sweet tooth.... Ordered Meringue with vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce... Which was rich and decadent.... Covered in thick lustrous chocolate sauce.... Tough the Meringue was not upto the mark and lacked that delicate cracking texture. I ordered another classic.... The cr√®me caramel.... In one word .. Awesome....
The pocket pinch as we all know is reasonable....
And the soul.... Well what can I say. Except..... I am a happy happy woman.... ;)

2015-08-06 19:51:55
Rima Chowdhury
2430016
3.5
Well, I should have written about this ages ago. Visited once. Reviews can be found pretty good in zomato. Ratings too for ambience, food, their behaviour. But I personally didn't get to see when I visited. 

It is nicely decorated, very well, seemed to have a gently calming effect. I love restaurants with soothing interior decorations. It's not so cozy. Dim lights completes it. 

Firstly, we felt very uncomfortable after sitting. Tables for two people wasn't actually for two. We didn't have space to adjust our plates. Light above the table was so dull. We told the supervisor that we are feeling a bit uncomfortable here. Even after complaining, they didn't change our table to four people tables. Even when the four people tables were empty. We had a fight literally adjusting the plates within that short space.

May be I am the only one who didn't find hospitality. I didn't find stuffs friendly. I don't like being observed while eating, talking. They were roaming around every table. They had problem when a baby cried, they had problem when a group of friends charttered. 

When it comes to food, yes it was really above average. Nothing can beat their hot smoky chelo kabab. Their mutton preparations delicious. I tried their paneer preparations with roti. That didnt satisfy me though. I loved kababs and mutton preparations. Pea pallao okayish. Wish to try their biryani and chicken preparations. Roast chicken was heavenly, highly recommended. Wish to try their sizzlers. Lastly meringue with vanilla ice cream and hot chocolate sauce. They helped us choosing the desert. I feel a dinner is totally imperfect without a tempting desert.

##

2015-08-03 02:11:59
Vishwas Jajodia
8432741
1.5
A North Indian restaurant that doesn't serve chutney, especially with kebabs! Sorry, then it is simply not a North Indian restaurant.

We went to Peter Cat after reading the rave reviews posted here but we came back highly disappointed. Below is what all we ordered (in order) and what we felt about them-

1) Masala Papad
Soggy papads with too many green chillies. If we liked spicy, we would have asked for it.

2) Cream of Swet Corn, Cream of Sweet Corn Chicken and Tomato Soup
Very bland soup and when we asked for some soy sauce to improve it, we were told that they don't keep soy sauce.

3) Veg Seekh Kebab, Fish Makhmali and Chilly Babycorn
The fish was good and the kebabs were okay but then when we asked for chutney, we were told that the restaurant hasn't served green mint chutney since its inception in 1975. Wow! Some fun fact that was. The babycorns arrived after we had forgotten about them and were okay (my friends didn't like but I foound them okay).

4) Nentara, Begum Bahar, Chicken Reshmi Butter Masala and Dal Makhni
5) Assorted breads- Garlic and Butter Nan, Tandoori Roti, Laccha Paratha
Chicken and dal were good but Nentara and Begum Bahar didn't quite taste that good. 
What is with the thickness of their breads? We found it to be too thick. 

We went to dine out after more than a month of a hectic college life and for all of us, it was our first visit to a proper dining place after arriving here in Kolkata and least to say we were disappointed with the limited options in the menu and the taste of food.

Quality and hospitality were top notch and an extra 0.5 only for that but the service was slow- We had to ask for our table to be cleared multiple times and no bowls were given (again, they do not give bowls). 

All in all, not a great experience.

2015-07-27 16:01:02

3.5
Been to this place a couple of times before, yesterday again I visited this place, for lunch.
Welcomed to the nice shady ambience reminiscent of its age old charm, we got our selves a seat immediately when we arrived.
We ordered prawn cocktail n crispy chilli babycorn as starters.
The prawn cocktail was a surprise. I must say that i haven't tasted any cold starters before. A tangy, curd based, soupy affair of soft pieces of prawn settled on crushed ice...just the perfect start to the lunch. The babycorn was also nice.
Next we ordered chicken steak sizzler, chelo kebab n mixed veg grill sizzler.
The chelo kebab n chicken steak sizzler being a fan favourite or rather definition of this restaurant doesn't need any more words to describe and I won't dare to describe them. If you haven't tasted them already, you my friend, have missed out on a culture of Kolkata.
I would like to add, personally I dont like them too much, the chelo kebabs or the sizzlers, they dont go with my taste.
But every time I visit this place, I feel I'm satisfied with the food.
PS. 1100 bux for 2ppl.

##

2015-07-26 21:30:11
Sagar Pandit
2717400
3.5
Even if you aren't a sucker for charming old places, Park Street's colonial boulevards might just convert you into one. Peter Cat is one of those nostalgia inducing places for anyone who has ever visited or lived in Kolkata.

We went there one Thursday afternoon, post 3, that too for lunch. Only in Kolkata will you have waiting at 330PM on a weekday! The charm of Peter Cat with the friendly chatter of complaining Bongs was infectious It was a great start!

We were seated by no nonsense turbaned waiters. They wear their ludicrous uniforms with hilarious nonchalance.

We didn't waste anytime ordering the Chicken Chello Kebabs with fresh lime sodas, the dish was recommended by friends from all over the country.

The food arrived in about 15 mins: a steaming plate with 2 chellos, a skewer of tikkas, buttered rice, veggies and cream. Definitely scrumptious! The Chello was cooked perfectly, a rarity. The Chicken of the tenderest quality and marinated for at least a day! The whole plate was beautifully wholesome. There's something about food like this that soothes you even if it isn't anything extraordinary.

It's priced reasonably: about 500 rupees per person.

The service is like all successful old time restaurants: unconcerned, efficient and very much eat quickly and get out types.

This place has quite a few reviews, so I'm definitely not belling this cat :p

Had gone for dinner to Chelo Kebab !! Oh wait i meant Peter Cat. But thats the legacy of the place. 8 out of 10 people there were eating some or the other Chelo!! Peter Cat is one of the legendary outlets of Kolkata which has managed to maintain its old world charm. From the looks to the lights to the waiters everything is old school. ##

2015-07-22 10:45:07
Meghomita
2146948
5.0
This place is beyond anyone's wildest food expectations. I think the whole Grumpy Cat meme took their reference from this place-the original Grumpy Peter Cat with an inclination for good food. We went there on a late Sunday evening. Everything was dimly lit and only few tables had guests who stayed back even after the lunch hour was over to enjoy the ambience.
We ordered the prawn cocktail, 2 original chelo kebabs, grilled fish sizzler and lime sodas as refreshments. The prawn cocktail had that classic 80s feel about it. It was loaded with juicy prawns swimming in a tangy, creamy, mildly spicy sauce. Then came the thing these guys are famous for. The original chelo kebab containing one whole skewer of chicken kebab, rice with generous dosage of butter, fried sunny-side egg, two mutton sheekh kebabs and salad. This plate deserves a special place in food history. The chicken with its mild flavours and succulence eaten along with the butter rice that started satiating our tastebuds. I could eat three platefuls of it. The sheekh kebabs were also flavorful but here the chicken was the star of the dish. The grilled fish sizzler came sizzling to our table which had two pieces of grilled fish doused with a brown sauce, resting on a lettuce bed along with steamed veggies and roasted sticky potatoes. You could really taste the freshness of the fish and the potatoes were a star addition to this dish.
After enjoying the food, I realized why people chose to stay back way past the lunch hour. I absolutely love this place. From the staff, to the ambience and then the excellent quality of food with the grumpy cat looking over you as you eat, this place needs to be bookmarked by all.

2015-07-21 22:54:32

##

2015-07-19 23:05:23
Epicurious Madhuja
643805
4.0
A visit to Kolkata and Park Street is almost incomplete without stepping into Peter Cat, but beware of the queues on any given day of the week. Rightfully listed with the legendary tag, the overall feel and ambiance is very pleasing and sure to transport you decades back in time. But the main reason that foodies flock here is obviously the menu and the quality of food. They have an interesting and unique spread of items on offer and most are bound to catch your attention. Personally I have always headed straight for their legendary special... the Chelo Kebab which is a real delight of a complete meal, for all the senses. On a very recent visit, I also enjoyed their fish fingers very much, though that is something hard to go wrong with in Kolkata! The Screwdriver however, in spite of being possibly the simplest cocktail on their list was a let-down. Maybe it's better to just stick to liquors which come straight out of the bottle!
Verdict: Must experience if you are in Kolkata!

1 Fish Sizzler(4.5/5)
The Fishy Surprise!!
Food was served in 10 minutes.
Quantity was sufficient ( 4.5/10)

The food was at the right temperature.

Also their Continental and Indian dishes are also amazing. The ambiance is extremely good and warm. Prawn Cocktail which is an apetizer is to die for. The only problem is it gets very crowded during the lunch and dining hours. You need to wait for around 30 mins to get a table especially during weekends. This is a must visit for every individual who considers himself to be a foodie.

##

2015-07-16 18:06:50
Joy
637571
3.5
What can be said more in terms of decor and food? Pure Royalty. Like how we used to read about the days of British Raj in our history books.

Excellent ambiance. Quiet. Great for a Date. The decor was all about hanging light-shade.

Food wise. Ordered the Chelo-Kebab. Chicken Reshmi Butter Masala.
Went with a whole load of expectations from the Chelo-Kebab. Was partially met. The mutton kebab was succulent. Probably they could work on the white rice accompaniment. It lets the kebabs run the show. But they were a bit of a downer really.

Service. Snooty. Not very friendly. Just like the decor was of the British era. So was the mentality of the staff there. Not courteous, customer friendly.

Would I visit again? Yes. A lot more to explore

##

2015-07-16 02:45:26
Oindrila Kundu (donaeats.com)
1605206
4.5
A legendary name - Peter Cat- and a personal favourite of mine. This place has not yet dissapointed me in any way. The interiors are dim, cosy and soothing with the red sofas & the hanging lamps. Perfect place for a meal with friends or family or one's significant other..

Among the food items I have tried over my numerous visits, the most famous dish of this place, The Original Chelo Kebab, needs no special mention. It is delicious & one plate makes for a fulfilling meal for one. Among the starters, Fish Makhmali Kebab is hands down the best fish kebab I have ever had. It is soft & juicy & just melts in your mouth. The Dum-ki-raan is a boneless mutton dish made with onions & is extremely delicious. It can be had as a starter & can also be paired as a main course with their soft butter naans. The Masala Gratin is an Indianised version of the continental gratin - it has a masala flavoured cheesy white sauce. The Beckty Bell Muniere is another of my favourites - two fillets of beckty smeared in white sauce with masala potatoes & boiled veggies & pasta. Among the sizzlers, The Tandoori Mixed Grill, containing pieces of chicken, mutton, liver, fish, prawn & boiled egg in a tandoori based gravy, is good as well. The Chocolate Nut Sundae -containing two slabs of chocolate ice-cream, a chocolate wafer, some small fruit cubes(not sure of this) and a cherry on top- is a good option for dessert. And their Iced Coffee with Ice Cream is a beverage I love a lot.

I have heard many people mentioning that the service of this place is not that good, but I havent faced any problems regarding service till now & hopefully I wont be facing any such problem in the future as well.

Kudos to the place & its awesome food :)

2015-07-13 15:45:03
Aseem Gupta
1369943
1.0
Had heard a lot about this place. Then - I went, I saw and I was conquered!
Nothing special apart from chello kabab. Food was very okay and this quality of food can be found anywhere in India and with much much better service.¬†

Behavior of staff was atrocious! I am surprised that with this rock bottom level of service, such places are still surviving in India.¬†

I wasn't getting 3G connection at my table, so I went around close to the main door to get good connectivity to book a cab (Information - In Kolkata, its very hard to get a cab after 9:30 pm even if you are in areas like Park Street). The manager came upto me and said - 'Dont stand like this near door, go out and do this'. I explained that I am not getting proper connectivity at your table and thats why I am standing here trying to book a cab. But they were adamant in sending me outside the door in rains and that they did!

Another weird thing they do is that if you are listed on their waiting list, they will only allow you to enter when all the people who are supposed to eat are present. So, if you reach before your friends and think you can grab a table for them to save time, you are mistaken. Because the staff needs to see all the faces before they can allow you in!

I guess, even if the food was from heaven, the experience leaves you tasteless!

3.5
I am new to Calcutta but even I know that Peter Cat is an institution. You know that if you are in Calcutta, you have to go here and for a newcomer, all you can do is hope that it does not disappoint. True to its standing, there was a 45 minute waiting time on Sunday evening. Everything about this place says history, heritage and culture. The d√©cor is both unique and typical (you know its counterpart down the road :) ) And yet, it is all about the food. The veg chelo kebab (as wannabe as I may be :P) comes loaded with tandoori paneer and veggies, potato steak, a veg seekh kebab and buttery rice. This is a humongous plate of food and I struggled to finish the paneer. The steak and the soft, aromatic rice, I loved. My friend was delirious after having the original chelo kebab. As badly as we wanted to try desserts, we just had no space.

PS: I saw that every table has a plate of chelo kebab, that's how popular it is!

2015-07-08 22:55:22
Rounak Saha
1540697
1.0
It seems like the esteemed restaurant of Calcutta has forgotten how to behave. This review is to remind the administration the importance of good manners and how to treat their customers with courtesy. 

On the evening of July 8th, my friends and I had gone to Peter Cat to celebrate a birthday. Naturally there was a cake. Peter cat apparently doesn't allow cakes to be cut because well insecurity maybe ?

When we learnt about this we actually set the cake aside. All well till now. After a minute or so this manager comes up to us and charges us to put away the cake immediately because  it was obviously creating such a problem. And the problem was so big that he had to use a headmaster tone.

The place might serve good food. But the administration and staff needs to pull up their socks. Coming to the food bit, there is no consistency any more. One day they make amazing stuff another day it'll be pretty bleh. 

I don't know what's up with this place. It used to be really nice. Get well soon. Also if you ever apologise mean it.

And the cello kabab- guys, come on! ##

2015-07-08 21:38:43
Apurba Chakraborty
15693808
1.0
Visited the place on 7th July,15 around 6 in the evening. The staffs were not at all helpful to the point of being arrogant. Perhaps they judge a book by the cover. Ordered chicken soup with asparagus, mutton hamburger steak and chelo kebab. The soup had excessive corn starch, no flavor, nothing. The mutton hamburger steak was way over brunt, tasted bitter. Now coming to Chelo Kebab their signature dish. For those of you don't know, it is two types of kebabs, one chicken cubes roasted with mild spices and another prepared with minced chicken, served with a spiced steamed rice, which had a over powering taste of clove, along with a poached egg on top with very generous amount of butter. I can't quite understand why people go gaga over this dish. The both kebabs were very dry. The clovy rice with butter and poached egg, it is not something very alluring to my taste buds I should say. If you are a teetotaler and want excellent food and are brought up with the brilliant street foods of Calcutta, this is definitely not the place to go in my opinion. Way over hyped. One more thing they keep your credit card for extra-ordinary long period even if you had received the message and know that your card have been swiped, they do not return it immediately. Beware of that!

The service is excellent, with friendly waiting staff and all. Very nice ambiance as well. Location? Right beside where the Music World used to be on Park Street.¬†
This place is a must visit if you are in Kolkata.

2015-07-04 00:19:00
Srabasti Gupta
11326721
4.5
Peter cat.. The name itself is enough for kolkata-ians to understand.. This year i celebrated my birthday here. Then again, as a reviewer i have to describe my experience over here.. Haha.. Anyways, coming to the location, though most of the people knows, still for the newbies, its in park street just in the lane next to flurys' and an bon pain (previously music world outlet). We had to write our names and wait for approx 10 mins. As we entered, i was quiet mesmerized with the ambience, dim litted, attentive staffs and the smell of food.. Just wow.. Look is vintage one and also the staffs were wearing pathan suits with turban on their head which added more authentic look to the ambience. Coming to the food, peter cat is famous for chello kebab.. Everybody goes there for chello kebab only. Apart from that you can try chicken marakesh.. Both of them are platter. We ordered fresh lime soda and a coke. The only con i found is the fresh lime soda was bit more sour than necessary. Staffs were good, foods were awesome.. Must visit for every one.. Would love to visit again to try many other dishes over there. Happy peter cating!! :)

2015-07-01 14:07:46

3.0
It was a must-visit place due to the massive reputation of the Chelo Kebabs.
The ambiance was good and I was provided with a table on the upper deck of the restaurant, which I should have avoided since it is so very close to the Service door of the Restaurant. Dim lights and the waiters dressed in that fancy attire gives it somewhat of a Persian feel.
Now coming to Chelo Kebab. I was much happy with the first taste of the dish. However it was a rather bad experience or maybe my sheer luck that there was a hair that i spotted in the egg. BTW, I also had the Tandoori Mixed grill which was up to the mark.
A hair and the service door was enough to ruin my experience and creates hesitation in my mind to visit the place again. Maybe someday I would give another try and it wouldn't be as bad an experience. But till then 3/5 is all I have on offer.

##

2015-06-29 08:40:06
Bodhisattwa Chakraborty
12452671
3.0
Peter Cat is a famous name among the foodies of Kolkata.  The eatery is known for it's delicious Chelo kebab. The restaurant serves various other North Indian dishes. The decor is pleasant and soothing and the staffs are efficient and friendly. The restaurant offers quick service and is a good choice for a family dining. The only big issue with Peter Cat is the long waiting que,  especially on weekends before one can even enter the restaurant.  The staffs out there to manage the que is not very efficient and often behave a bit rudely. The average waiting time is almost an hour in weekends. The recent visit to this eatery was not very pleasant to me and my friends. After an hour-long wait, we managed an entry, and as usual ordered their signature dish. Everything except the reshmi kebabs were cold. This was not expected a few years back. The food quality is also degraded a bit. I wish the authority should take some seriuos measures to bring back the previous glory. In summary, Peter Cat is still a very good choice for family dining with resonable prices,  only if you have enough patience to wait for your turn.

##

2015-06-22 15:23:49
Avijit Chakrabarty
4312521
2.5
Peter cat..an old 70's themed restaurant..! Recently had an opportunity to visit the place with my mom and her colleagues! Everybody in that group was just too excited to visit the place. It was Sunday and hence the waiting time for our group of 13 was more than 2 hours! I thought I won't regret it, if the food would cast its magic on me. Finally after the long long wait our turn came.. It was wonderfully decorated and the ambience was nice. Everybody had heard a lots about Chelo kebab and Prawn Cocktail and without any hesitation everybody decided to stick to it.. As my mom had ordered Chicken Chelo kebab, I decided to try something different, so I tried Shah Nauz... One taste into the dish.... Awful , disgusting!!! The menu describes that it contains spring chicken stuffed with mutton kheema and chicken liver....in reality it contains two pieces of chicken in an ocean of chicken liver and egg kheema with no sight of mutton kheema..! Now the Chelo kebab.. Any body who would have ever stayed in Hyderabad would laugh out loud on the first sight... So what is Chelo kabab... White biriyani rice with a lump of butter and an egg poch on it.. This is flanked by two chicken sheekh kebab, and four pieces of chicken tikka kebab stuffed in green vegetables!! Taste is even not that great and cost more than 300 rupees.! Waste. Any restaurant in Hyderabad serves more tasty kebab at much less price .. The only thing that I liked was the Prawn Cocktail still its over priced. Truely an overhyped place, and a 1 timer..!! Sorry Peter Cat, I didn't like you, nor did my mom!

Well, there are already a large number of reviews for this legendary place, I wonder if there remains something new to say about this place! ;)
I visited this restaurant for the first time about 8-9yrs ago, and was mesmerized by the fine dining experience. The place has retained its reputation for so many years thanks to their incredible "chelo kabab" dish. Apart from this I love their perfectly cooked, tasty chicken steak sizzlar. Recently I visited this place with my friends and had a delicious and sumptuous meal within budget. 
I would recommend to try chicken/mutton steak sizzlar, kebabs and peter cat special tandoori apart from chelo kababs. Its a must visit place for foodies in Kolkata. :)

##

2015-06-18 02:34:17
Debarshi Basak
16042969
2.0
Went to this restaurant the previous weekend. We walked up to Peter Cat and bam! seat was available as it was around 4-5pm. Ordered 2 Brandy Collins, 1 Cream of Spring Chicken Soup(1/2), 1 Bread Roll, 1 Grilled Chicken Sizzler and the 'famous' Chelo Kebab.

The order came in, 1 Brandy Collins instead of 2. The drink was not that great to me so it somehow went good (we never reminded them about the second drink).

Second, its time for the Soup, 1 bowl full Soup came in, we informed it was ordered as 1/2 each for both. The waiter went back and divided the soup and served.

No bread rolls still........

The waiter was around serving the other tables, we called him up again to finally bestow us with some Bread Rolls. Served. The Soup was so good that we were actually waiting for the Bread Roll for rescue. Thank God! the Bread rolls went down alongwith the soup.

Its time for the Grilled Chicken Sizzler. What I can see is a mammoth platter with two pieces of chicken lying around with some steamed carrot and beans. Period.

The 'famous' Chelo Kebab came at last, its actually some roasted chicken with some mutton steaks (I dont actually know what was that) and rice with salt and dripping butter.

I dont know why I had such a horrific experience, but to me the fault lies within the starter soup maybe? For me the starters set the mood for the eating session that is about to begin. The Cream of Spring Chicken Soup put all the nails properly to the apetite. Ciao

2015-06-16 01:19:41
Sreyashi Dutta
6021421
4.5
I dont have adequate words to say about this restaurant or rather wont be able to explain it in terms of food quality, taste, service, ambience & soo onn...

We tried one of its signature dish Chelo Kebab. One plate serves for one portion. Actually one will never like to share even a single bite from his/her portion. full marks for taste & plating. The rice, the meats, the poached egg were literally soaked in butter. This dish is a must try.
One should also try for sizzlers & mutton hamburger steak. Drinks are quite expensive but one can get alot of options starting from soft drinks to lime soda & ending till international wines..
The crowd is very posh. No unnecessarily sound. No fashionable interior decoration. The service is quiet good. The managers there will help you to choose with your best combo meal. In one line elegance & excellence at its height.
Its a bit expensive place. Pre-booking is suggested. one will feel fully satisfied by spending beyond one's limit.
Thank u peter cat. I would love to visit you again & again.

2015-06-10 13:41:29
Rajat Hazra
1034317
4.0
I don't even know why am writing this review. Some places don't need any validation, they are a institution onto themselves. This one such place in park street.¬†

Like mocambo, it has managed to retain its old world charm and also it's clientele from the past apart from the bunch of new admirers including me. Since, we had plans to have out full meal at mocambo, we simply had our starters and drinks here.

Needless to mention Chelo Kebab was our unanimous decision accompanied by screw driver and planters punch. The chicken was succulent and juicy and no sooner had my teeth sunk into the meat did I feel the meat melting in my mouth. Old timers would be able to vouch for whether the Chelos have remained faithful to those golden days.¬†

The drinks were reasonably prized and generously served which is so unlike most restaurants in Delhi where cocktails are mere dilutions of fruit juices unless you had forewarned the waiters. Be prepared to wait in queue to grab a seat but I assure you that every minute spent outside will be more than compensated. Both the ambience and services were quite good. Highly recommended.

Well some restaurants just don't need a review. One such is the Peter Cat, Park Street. Whether you have been there or not you have heard about their impeccable reputation even outside the city. A celebrity among restaurants, both due to its heritage and location, Peter Cat is an excellent choice among solo, couple or family diners. Peter Cat has long been tempting visitors with its famous and most sought after dish the Chello kabab. Another valid reason for me to visit this wonderfully old world restaurant are its cocktails. Old Fashioned being my favourite one. The ambience and experience of the restaurant hikes it even more in the must visit list.

##

2015-06-04 00:19:27
Pranab Chatterjee
27904977
4.0
If there is one ancient restaurant in Kolkata or Calcutta as it was known when Peter Cat opened,which has not changed one bit in the way it looks it is this place.I am visiting this place for 30 years and it looks exactly the same.The same dressed Durwan or Doorman to be politically correct,the dimly lit interiors with the covered lamps almost touching your beer bottle on the table,the same liveried waiters with lots of attitude,and the stewards of mostly Anglo Indian descent who are also a vanishing tribe in a job they did better than anyone in Park Street.The one thing that has changed is the almost omnipresent waiting crowd outside at all hours which is annoying because it gives a halo to this place which I feel is unjustified and also shows that management really does not care to even provide plastic chairs for this loyal breed.
Now if interviewed 90 % customers would say that they had Chello Kabab,the supposedly famous dish of Iranian descent and also the mixed grill sizzler.
That's what we ordered along with fresh lime soda and a Bloody Mary for my drinking friend.
The Chello Kabab is a dish of several kababs like the sheesh Kabab,the chicken tikka etc on a bed of buttered rice,subtly flavoured,which definitely is an uniquely wholesome dish and Peter Cat does this perfectly.But to connoisseurs the quality of flesh will not taste the same way it was a decade back.But like the mutton chap of Shiraz,the devilled crab of Mocambo,this dish has become folklore in India.We just became willing participants.Long Live the Cat!!!!!!!

##

2015-05-31 23:59:20
Sauradip Ghosh
13982421
4.5
Living in Kolkata for the past 8 odd years and yet never experiencing a date with probably one of the city's most famous eatery is something nobody would like to admit. A Sunday it was; a famishing, stomach, a special occasion and lots of expectations. And man was I impressed! A kooky hybridized ambiance of an oriental bar with its carpeted floor with an authentic Indian dash of colored turbans, Peter Cat's enigmatic old world charm immediately took me in. The rates were unbelievably economical. As any first timer would ( and definitely should) we ordered Chelo Kebabs and a beer to go with. Service was courteous and prompt. The Kebabs (both chicken and mutton) were cooked to perfection with an assortment of herbs and spices (which I couldn't put a finger at because the taste simple doesn't let you think much!) served with piping hot rice and a sunny side up. The grilled vegetables went great with the beer (served in metal tumblers) and the red subdued lighting being the perfect host for a dozen odd selfies/photographs (as your taste requires)Overall, a fantastic way to spend time with your family and friends. Looking forward to try the sizzlers next time.

2015-05-31 22:00:42
Ruchira Das
1460818
4.5
Someone lives in kolkata , loves to eat, and dosent know about peter cat's chelo kabab is a next to impossible.
Peter cat stands in park street with all its glory and glamour. Need not to mention its an legendary restuarant of kolkata.  
Let alone the festive days, it is hard to get a seat on the weekends and even in daily peak hours. You have to wait in a long que. So i prefer to visit in odd hours.
Food: the chelo kebab and biriyani are my all time favourites. But during my last visit i wanted to try something new ,thus orderd beckty meunier and tandoori mixed grill sizzler and obviously one chelo. Both the 1st nd 2nd dish were devine. The beckty mdunier is made of boneless bhetky and cheese. It was perfectly spiced up. I will highly recomend this dish to all who likes fish. And the mixed grill was mouth watering. 
It had chicken mutton pork lamb. I also liked d grilled vegetabls served along with the meas. Nothing to mention about the chelo as they serve the best chelo in the city. And as usual their lime soda had perfect balance of sweet and salt.
Ambience is nice. The red sofas and dim lights. i like them.
Service is usualy good but this last visit of was not pleasnt. The food came too late. 
However i am eagarly waiting for a next visit and i want to try some veg dish this time.

##

2015-05-31 20:46:41
Anirban Sen
331519
5.0
Visited Peter Cat after a while today.

This iconic restaurant just off Park Street needs no introduction. Old world charm, super food and extremely affordable prices are some of the reasons for which people are willing to wait outside for a table, which can take more than an hour on occasions.

This is possibly the only place, where each time I visit, I tell myself that I will order something different this time, and diligently study the menu only to end up ordering Chelo Kebab for the n-th time.

Their latest innovation (about 4-5 years back) was the Mutton Chelo Kebab which is an improvement on perfection (if that is possible).

I hate waiting outside for a table, but once you enter, all the pain disappears instantly.

Portion sizes may have reduced slightly over the years, but the taste has remained the same.

Unfortunately, I have never been able to try anything else apart from the Chelo Kebab so maybe next time...

2015-05-31 17:37:43
Rajeev Saraogi

3.0
Peter Cat known to Kolkata for its Chello Kabab and Sizzlers. If you are planning to spend time and do not wish to wait on the road for hours, get inside by 6.30 pm. The only reason for me to keep going back is the laid back ambience, food quality but do not expect Good Service. Keep asking for stuff like water as well. If only the number of tables could have been replaced to make way for personalised service it would have put some best fine dining places in shame. A place serving kabab does not give any dip or sauce as compliment but has pickle kept on table top, ironically. Rating is increased due to the food quality nothing else. We spent 3 hours and at the end felt like the staff was pushing us out though the bill size was not less by any standard. I hope the management notes this and takes action.

2015-05-29 14:51:03
Sreejata Chakraborty
2562482
3.5
It is never too late to write about this legendary restaurant of Calcutta. I have been going to this place since when I was a small child with my parents, and now I go there because of insistent relatives and friends visiting the city. I won‚Äôt particularly say that it has fallen from its grace, neither would I say that the place is overhyped. But I will definitely accept the fact that over the years the place has failed to retain its quality. I still find that colonial charm when I go there, but sadly apart from a few sizzlers and the Chelo Kebabs( which are still the best in Calcutta), there is hardly anything to look forward to in Peter Cat. Peter Cat represents a part of Calcutta to me which I know is flawed, but yet I love dearly. I don‚Äôt live in Calcutta anymore, but whenever I go back to my hometown, I make it a point to visit Peter Cat, to go down the memory lane and revisit the wonderful moments that I have spent there. For me and I think for most Calcuttans, Peter Cat is not just a restaurant, it‚Äôs much more than that. And it will always remain so. And I‚Äôm sure the Chelos are going to remain the same.

A long queue, and brilliant food at the end of the wait, is what symbolises Peter Cat. Any day of the week, any time of the day, it is impossible to get in without standing in a queue. Stand in the queue, sit, enjoy the ambience, and let Peter Cat surprise you.
