##

2015-05-23 13:35:07
Anmol Grover
4617951
3.0
Having heard so much about this place and not having been here even once, I was determined to come here this time round while I was visiting the city! My parents had been here twice the week before and were unavailable to get a table even after having waited for half an hour. So finally getting a table on their third try also raised their level of expectations. This is also one of those age old restaurants on Park Street with its old world charm and yummy food (supposedly). Since we were in the mood for a quick dinner we decided to order a portion of Fish Tikka, Fried Fish with Tartare Sauce and two portions of the Chelo Kababs (this place is known for them). The Fish Tikka came first and was so delicious that it kind of raised our expectations about the rest of the meal even higher! We got the Fried Fish next and from the look of it itself we figured there was something off. The crumb coating was more like a layer above the fish and made it seem more like a fish pakoda. The boiled vegetables that accompanied it also looked stale. The Chelo Kababs took a little longer to come. It is essentially a portion of chicken and mutton kababs served with some buttered rice and a fried egg. Our kababs were cold when we got them and the meat was hard and dry and flavours barely there. Even having them along with the rice didn't do anything to it as the rice was also dry. I honestly don't get the hype about this particular dish or even the place as a whole as after waiting for more than half an hour (along with all the amazing reviews) we atleast expected a decent meal. I was thoroughly disappointed and my parents more so as they had been so eager to get me here. Maybe it was just our luck we had this bad experience but I doubt we're going to come here again!

2015-05-22 17:02:26
Araghni Chatterjee
2345542
4.0
Delicacies of Kolkata is incomplete without Peter Cat, situated at the heart of Gourmet (Park) Street. I have been to the place few times but let's discuss about my most recent rendezvous on 13th May, 2015. As usual let me divide this review in 2 parts.

Pros:
1. The food is delicious to say the least. I had the famous chelow kebab and brownie with vanilla ice cream in hot chocolate sauce. There is only one word for the food items: Bellissimo. The cooking is so damn good.

2. For a restaurant of this stature has some best behaved stuffs. The service is really good.

3. The amount of chocolate sauce requires special mention. It tastes like heaven.

4. The ambience is super awesome. The cozy corners give you an elegant feeling.

Cons:

1. The long queue still irritates me. Though it signifies the place's popularity.

2. The price tags are quite on the higher side. They have increased the price by 15%+ since my last visit.

3. The food amount has decreased significantly. Probably the rice part of chelow has been minimised to cut cost.

My Rating: 4/5

2015-05-22 00:02:09
Rupama Banerjee Queen
1606077
4.0
I visited this place when i was in my school days.. Atlast after so many years i got a chance  to visit this place again with my friend. We ordered pineapple juice chelo kabab and chicken marakesh and tuti frooti.. The food was tasty and and i have no complains regarding the taste or preparation. Pineapple juice made us feel better in this hot and sultry afternoon. But one thing which made me surprised was the behaviour of the waiter.. They were creating a situation as if we have to finish the food very quickly.. To eat and cherish the food is always my hobby but i really noticed that they were making us to eat quickly and finish the plates and pay the bill. Both my friend and i was really surprised to see this type of hospitality. This made me little sad disappointed me as well. But for the love of the food and also the taste of tuti frooti and also the decor which made me to ignore this situation at that point of time and made me and my friend to cool down.. I will surely love to visit this place again and hope at least that time the waiter will give me some little time to cherish the food and eat it with full of enjoyment.. For food my rating will be 4.3 out of five, for decor 4.5 and for service 3. Hope so the management take some steps regarding the hospitality.

4.5
this place is considered to be one of the most prestigious restaurants of the city and rightly so. Nostalgia sweeps me as I write this review as this was one of the first restaurants i had been to as a kid. I feel really very glad to say that this place still has not lost its charm and still everybody including me love this place just the same inspite of various new fancy dine ins emerging in Park street! Well its definitely for the food as well as the classy ambience this place has. The staff here are very courteous and homely and thats very important for the success of a place.
The food item which strikes our mind as we utter Peter Cat is what? The chello kabab!!!! And rightly so !! Its the best I have tasted! This one is a must have for all. The rice is perfectly buttered... the kababs are yummy and it melts in the mouth... the veggies are well cooked and it is awesomeness served prettily in a plate...:) The sizzlers here are worth mentioning too and so are the cocktails. This place is nice with great food and great drinks to sip on and its easy on the pocket too :)

2015-05-18 20:57:03
Anuvab Bandyopadhyay
659827
3.5
One of the city favourites, this place has gone down a bit with time. Their menu remains the same, while the food isn't as great as it was, even 7 or 8 years ago when I used to go there as a kid. The quantity is less, the ambiance isn't as classy as it used to be, the place runs mostly on it's brand and the fact that most people are driven to it's tables by a sheer sense of nostalgia.¬†The chelo kebab is the one reason to keep on visiting this place, as well as it's famous sizzlers. They have reduced the quantity, and increased the price but it's still as great as it used to be. The sizzlers, however, are not as great as you would expect them. Fish sizzlers should come as a surprise for those who don't set much store by fish anyway.¬†If you want that 70s feel, and can't resist the urge to tuck into that chelo kebab once more, you should definitely hop by.

2015-05-06 16:12:46
Nilesh S Vani
29239604
1.0
Customers Wait to get a Table.

We had our names listed for a table at 8:15 pm on 1st May 2015. We were told it would be 35 to 40 minutes before we were "admitted". At 9 pm when we inquired, we were first told that "Sorry, it would be another 30 to 45 minutes - and no we cannot assure you the time". When we raised an issue stating why did they not tell us before - The "Gatekeeper and Manager" argued that first of all "He has no evidence that we registered our Name at 8:15 pm" and defended their "Policy" that Customers have to wait till there is place - They cannot assure when guests will be admitted and that is how they have been running this restaurant and it has made them "Famous and Sought After". Soon, other waiting guests expressed their anguish including some who had been waiting for 2 hours after being told 30 minutes. 

The restaurant "supposedly" believes that is this "Long Wait" that enhances their "Imagery" and "Desirability" as "The Forbidden Apple" for Adam.

Wonder if this is the age for such Arrogance!!!

The dining area is dimly lit so one wonders what one eats.

##

2015-05-05 13:04:49
Saunak Basu
262797
4.0
Undoubtedly¬† one of the star player in Kolkata Cullinary Map,Peter Cat has been satiating the taste buds of Kolkata foodies for decades..Nothing much to speak about this place,since it is supremely popular..ever since my childhood whenever we used to visit park street this was our automotic first choice unless otherwise..The only and biggest Con is surely the long queues that u have to experience whenever u visit this place..also their watchman seemed to be a bit rude to the waiting diners..
Although this place is known for its Chelo Kebab and it has become quite cliche I would highly recommend venturing into some lesser known dishes on their menu:
Cold Chicken Salad: Just loved the seasoning..nice mild flavours..
Shikar: This is one of the best mutton kebab I have ever tasted..soft,juicy tender mutton boti,loved the smokiness of the dish..
Chicken Marakesh: A nice alternative to Chelo Kebab..Inspired from moroccan cuisine..love the kebab and the quality of rice..
Nawabi: Another of their signature mutton delicacy..Loved the spicy and tangy flavours..it is a bit sour which adds to the taste..Highly Recommended..
Tanddori Mixed Grill: Loved the prawns in the sizzler..sufficient portion for two to share..served with bread rolls..
Chocolate Nut Sundae: Though I have tasted thousands of different Deserts and Ice Creams in various places,this always remain one of my favourite sundae..dinners in Peter Cat can never end without this..something seems to never change..
Overall dining at Peter Cat is an expereince,a tryst with the forgotten times..nostalgia at its very best..
Food: 4.5/5
Pricing: 3.5/5
Service: 3.5/5
Ambiance: 4/5

##

2015-05-04 00:31:02
Anamitraa/The Gut Filling
671420
4.5
This is one of my favourite reastaurants in the city. And for me, it reserves a special place in my heart due to many reasons. I have made many memories over here. I have been going there since my childhood. The decor, ambience, the staffs - everything and everyone in Peter Cat are very special to me. As soon as you enter, you have to take your mind in the sixties where you have to settle yourself amidst a classy yet chic ambience. I prefer the sitting arrangement for two by the side of the entrance which gives me a feeling of dining in an European style. Well, now comes the most important thing, that is FOOD! I just love everything I have here. The prawn cocktail gives a soothing cooling effect in your tongue appetizing your body for the next surprises coming up. I often get confused about what to order for the main course. The House Special Sizzler, Bhetki Meuniere and their very much celebrated Chello Kebab are my all time favourites. You have to choose one to eat in one meal because all of them are pretty heavy. That feeling of the butter melting in your mouth and the fried egg waiting to be gobbled up is just next to be on cloud 9. Yes, I am this much obsessed about everything in Peter Cat. For those, who haven't yet been there and are judging the restaurant by this review, I plead to you, the next thing you should do after reading this is head to Peter Cat and try their delicacies, all of them, if possible. Happy Dining! :)

##

2015-05-02 20:08:24
Subham Ghosh
2987484
3.0
Peter cat is well known all over kolkata for its chello kabab and sizzlers. But i found nothing great about their food. Its their name and fame by which they run. Also, i dont know why zomato dint upload prices in their menu cards. So i have uploaded few pics of their menu card along with their prices.

Location- From park street metro, walk upto the crossing near flurys. Then take the lane to your right and there lies peter cat beside au bon pain.

I had to wait for nearly half an hour to get my seat. Since it was my first time to peter cat, i dint knew that i had to write my name. So my waiting time got extended.

Ambience- The interior was dark and well decorated with lamps.

Food and service- We ordered
1. Tandoor mixed grill sizzler - It had a piece of chicken, one small piece of fish, prawn and paneer, one half egg, one seekh kabab and three pieces of chicken liver. Every item was provided in a small amount just the chicken liver was given in a huge quantity which i dint like to eat. I was quite annoyed at this. But the sizzler tasted good.

2. Chello kabab - I was happy to have ordered this. Five pieces of lip-smacking chicken kabab, two mutton seekh kabab and rice with butter and omlet. It was nice.

Coming to the service, i had to wait for 15 mins before my order was taken and then it was served in not before 20 mins. I was hungry and disappointed. Also i was diasappointed seeing three pieces of chicken liver in the sizzler where the other items were served in less quantity.
At the billing time, when i gave the waiter a tip of 20rs, he was still staring at us. I dint know the reason behind such an idiotic behaviour. How much more do you expect in a tip from students? Since he was an old man, i did not say him anything but i suggest him to learn some courtesy. I think 3.0 rating is something more that i have given them after today's experience !! I wont recommend this place to anybody and neithr am i ever going there !

2015-05-01 18:42:57
Aniket Mallick
2118918
4.0
Best place in the city to have Chelo Kebab and Sizzlers. Heard a lot about how amazing this place is. Got a chance to try this place out and here is my review. This place is always filled with people. Que of people eagerly waiting to get a table, including me. Finally got a table. Really lovely place i must admit, great ambiance, the aroma of butter and Kebab makes you famish. We sat for a while until we got attended by someone, and my first impression was not that good they weren't polite especially the waiters. We ordered Grilled fish, Chicken steak sizzler and a couple of Chelo Kebabs. Food took its own sweet time to arrive at our table. The Grilled fish and The Chicken steak sizzler was absolutely spot on. Cooked to perfection and had an amazing flavor. Then we were given the legendary Chelo Kebab, and I'm sorry to burst the bubble here it is an over hyped dish. The Rice was cooked perfectly so were the Chicken malai kebab or the white kebab that they give. Problem was the Egg and the Mutton shekh kebab, The yolk was suppose ooze out when you cut it, but it was over cooked so half of the yolk was still in its liquid form and half was solid. Then the Mutton shekh kebab, It had no prominent flavor and it was over cooked and dry. Left a really bad taste.
Still it is very good restaurant and it is recommended for those who haven't had a taste of Peter Cat. It is my personal opinion, I guess they have gotten sloppy and carefree over the year.

##

2015-04-26 12:15:38
Rishav Dhar
29108935
4.5
Summary
Ambiance: 9
Food: 10
Value for money: 9
Service: 9
Location: 10
Opinion: Must visit.¬†

Ambiance: The place is buzzing with enthusiasm throughout the day. While that may mean long waiting queues, the feel inside is reminiscent of Kolkata during its hay days. It attracts crowd of all age groups alike and is an ideal setting for friendly brunches and casual meetings. For people with family who prefer calmer surroundings, there is a separate section upstairs. However, For people unaware of the heritage value of this place, they have to wait for the food to be able to appreciate the hype.¬†

Food: the best part about Peter Cat is its amazing kebabs and sizzlers. Kolkata is often accused of being partial towards non vegetarians but Peter Cat is an exception. Both the veg and non veg Chelo kebab is mouth wateringly amazing. The gastronomical orgasm can be experienced in the sizzlers and kebabs as well!

Value for money: Every penny spent here is worth it. However, the decor might not be very sophisticated as mentioned before.¬†

Service: Due to the huge rush throughout the day service might be a tad slow. But the waiters are very friendly and willing to help out the uninformed and confused visitor.

Location: Located bang in the middle of Kolkata's most happening street, reaching Peter Cat is no rocket science. Take the right turn from Flurys and you're there. However, finding a suitable parking location might be a problem. Try the multi-level car park at a distance in case you're unable to find one. Be warned, the parking rates are quite steep.¬†

This place is frequented by the glitterati and is one of the most famous places in the city. Don't get disheartened by the long queues. It is worth it :-)

##

2015-04-24 15:27:18
RG
913755
3.5
Peter cat, a name that has been in and around the foodies of Kolkata for quite a long time now it seems, probably one of the oldest and classiest name people in Kolkata had grown up hearing about. The one thing that instantly comes to mind upon hearing peter cat is the famous chello kebab, the quality of which I am afraid has degraded over he years. This place has now lost once its former glory. Located in one of the most classiest parts of the town, peter cat still has its charm. The decor is not something to catch the eye, the food quality is moderately good and the quantity is also good, particularly good for casual dining. The place is also not that much expensive considering the other restaurants located in the vicinity. The food takes a bit of time to arrive and it is usually very busy with large number of people always gushing in.

##

2015-04-24 15:11:33
Amitabha Mukhopadhayay
9263571
4.0
Peter Cat, a quaint name at best and definately not one that conjures images of the gastronomical delights that are served inside.

I generally do not order starters but at times I will allow myself a soup ( a cream of tomato with a liberal dash of black pepper) or the chicken cocktail sausages.¬†

For the mains it is generally the Chello Kebab, which is why I think Zomato has placed this particular restaurant under the legendary category. The taste and quality are consistent. However ........

My absolute favourite at Peter Cat is this Veg Sizzler that they have ( don't know the exact name of the dish) but amongst the many fine vegetables present in this dish is a tomato that is stuffed with paneer, which transforms a good veg sizzler to an amazing veg sizzler. At this point I would like to point out that I am a die hard meat-a-holic but it is dishes such as this ( along with my moms Dhokar Torkari, Paporer Dalna) and a few such selected items that do at times manage to lure my inner herbivore out for a fine feast.

Dessert is usually the brownie with ice-cream and hot chocolate sauce.

The decor is ok-ish( nothing to write home about) and the service is ok-ish too, the waiters generally don't have time to chit chat as due to the popularity of this place there is always a queue, which brings me to my last point getting a table here can be an exhausting experience, but on a positive note it'll make you all the hungrier when you do finally make it it.

After all what are legendary restaurants without legendary queues.

No doubt you are old and a heritage to the city, but it's time evolve as the customer expectations have changed over the period of time. 

Staff - stuck up, no smiles and shabby dressing surely irany fashion has improved and hence the dresses can be improved. A smile won't kill or cost

Entry experience- the guy at the gate has no smile, there is waiting but no waiting area, current area does not even offer seating 

Food - losing its touch ordered for House Special Steak sizzler, was sad. Nothing reflecting of the house for sure. Tandori Mixed sizzler - too much gravy and sad combination. Chelo Kebab - quality has gone down

Bar - ordered a drink and requested for a glass change, was refused for that stating this is the only glass for a cocktail can't give a whiskey tumbler. 

Payment - still running old credit card machines.

Dude you are a heritage don't let cheap food become a reason to dine at the joint.

##

2015-04-18 02:29:24
Utsav Ganguly
2537814
4.0
With the turbaned waiters in their white uniforms, the dimly lit interiors and the low hanging lamps that seem to privately light up your table, Peter Cat takes us back in time. I visited it with my parents this Easter, to try out some of the most renowned dishes of this legendary restaurant.¬†

Beckty Meunier - Yes, that is how the fish is spelled on the menu, in the old Anglo-Indian style, I presume. The fish was flaky and tender, and the parsley butter sauce brought out the flavour of the fish even better. It was served with a side of spiced potatoes, which provided a tangy contrast to the mild fish, and some steamed carrots and french beans. Altogether, the dish works really well, and it was a lovely way to start the meal.

Chicken Steak Sizzler - Peter Cat is known for its sizzlers, and I was determined to try it. However, although the hissing, steaming platter impressed at first sight, it failed to deliver on flavour. The sauce had a strong taste with not much depth.

Chelo Kabab - One simply does not visit Peter Cat for the first time and not try the Chelo Kabab, and the first spoonful was enough to make me realise why this seemingly dry plate of rice and skewered meats was so sought after. The rice, smothered in butter and delicately flavoured with cardamom and tiny bits of green, was divine. Surprisingly, the kababs, the perfectly cooked egg and the salad then seem like an added luxury. A complete and perfect dish to say the least.

Meringue with Vanilla Ice Cream and Hot Chocolate Sauce - Good, but not brilliant. The cold ice cream contrasted well with the rich, hot chocolate sauce, but the meringue had gone a bit soggy and chewy, thus depriving the dish of the crunch it needed.¬†

Overall, the experience was quite good. The Chelo Kabab was certainly the standout course of the meal, it is worth coming back for, time and time again.

##

I was really happy with everything thing here..do check out the liquor menu even if you don't booze its funny

2015-04-08 18:49:49
Avishome Banerjee
2124442
4.5
If you are looking out for peter cat on park street ,its quite easy as you will notice a long queue of hungry people huffing and puffing to get a table outside a white building.
Peter cat not only attracts people for their legendary Chelo Kebabs and Afghani chicken but also for the royal ambience with dim lighting and tall pathan waiters serving food.
Now coming to the food the Chelo Kebab in itself is a complete meal as you get around five pieces of chicken kebabs blended with persian herbs and mutton sheek kebab served on buttered rice and a poached egg which makes a heavenly combination and melts in your mouth.If you want to go for something else Aghan chicken is a must try and also Chicken tikka butter masala.
Every item in this restaurant is perfectly priced and so is the service and quality,this is why so many people visit this restaurant everyday.

2015-04-07 12:12:05
Debolina Dutta

4.5
I visited Peter cat for lunch last week. Though it looked like we'll have to wait a lot to get a table, but, we were lucky because, there was a vacant five-seater. When you enter Peter cat, it's dim lights and '70s decor will definitely catch your attention. In spite of the rush, the service is quick and the staff is friendly. Moving to the food, which of course is the main charm, is just perfectly cooked and presented. We had chelo kebabs, chicken sizzlers and fresh lime soda. This is an ideal place for a fine-dining experience, if the drawbacks of car-parking and waiting for a table is overlooked(which wouldn't be very difficult, because, the food is going to cast a spell on you ;))

2015-04-04 13:36:52
Sayan Sambit

4.5
Had heard a lot about this place and it's legendary chelo kabab. So, while in the city, decided to give it a try.

The ambiance is very suave and has a shadowy feel to it. It adds to the whole secret(y) feeling that this place has portrayed. It adds to the charm of the place.

The service is par excellence and the people are very helpful and courteous. Extra help is offered at the drop of a hat.

The food is good. I didn't understand the hype over this "chelo kaba". Agreed that they were very succulent and the entire mashup was very savoury. But the kabab on its own was just great, nothing to go gaga over.

Ambiance - 4.5/5
Service - 5/5
Food - 5/5

The rating is for the overall experience that I got out of the restaurant. The chelo kababs were ok, but overall, the food was great.

##

2015-03-30 02:11:44
Satyaki Sensarma
3213426
4.0
In childhood may be, I have been here several times, memory of which has become fade enough not to make any impact on this review. Post childhood, I had heard of this place and its signature dish 'chelo kababs' several time from many sources. On the Christmas Eve of 2013, I had a visit to this restaurant around 2:30 PM. As expected, there was a huge queue. I wrote my name and they told there was no chance before 4 PM. I roamed around and came back at 4 PM. I came to know, my name was called already and since I was not there that time, I have to wait for the next appropriate vacancy. So did I with a fair expectation. After a while, the executive who was calling names went off and a new executive came and resumed calling with names. Some sense clicked in my mind and I approached that new guy asking about my turn. Surprisingly, he asked me to do a fresh entry of my name again since it was already called! It was already 4:45 PM. This is the first time I shouted with grievance in any restaurant. But it worked like magic almost immediately. We entered and got a table. I don't want to blame management for this as I know the rush that comes every year on this day is unreal and extremely difficult to manage. With the tremendous pressure that dances on the top of the heads of each and every staff of the restaurant, this minor mistakes may happen and should not be counted.
After sitting, the experience was nice. It is well decorated with a soothing ambiance. Staffs are dressed in gorgeous uniforms. We ordered chelo kababs and the delivery was quite fast. I loved the food, its presentation, taste, aroma, quality and quantity. The butter rice tasted awesome. The meats of the kababs were finely cooked and grilled to perfection; just melted in mouth. Though I felt the price to be a bit on the higher side. I came out with all the initial bad memories washed off and only a nice feeling of taste in my mouth and mind which persists even today. This place is truly and uniquely a legendary one in the city.

##

2015-03-26 16:21:26
Shirshendu De
15218801
3.0
Well, for this restaurant it is better if I write a second review after having food items other than Chelo and Sizzler, made myself to this outlet for 2 times and in both the times I had Chelo kabab and Sizzler, this is the only Chelo and Sizzler that I have tasted in my life. If this is how Chelo and Sizzler taste universally then it is not the fault of the restaurant but the item itself. I dont like the Chelo kabab (Rs 320+), because at home too I get the same rice with butter and yesss you have the option to buy this fine rice from Big Bazar outlets, and my mother has got that funda to make that fine smell to come out of the rice. Butter.....ohhh I don't think they give BMW butter. and mutton sticks you can have from popular Mughlai outlets which taste much better than the ones which are served with the dish, next comes the kebabs, hmmm....please visit Arsalan, Alibaba like food joints and have the Chicken Reshmi or Chicken Tikka Kebabs and you will never think of the kebab pieces that are served in Chelo.
Next is Sizzler (Rs 320+), being someone who has an enthusiastic interest in non veg and having tasted some really unique chicken and mutton dishes I really don't approve the taste of Sizzler, come on..... Chicken with boiled veggies like beans, tomatoes and cucumber plssss...and I don't get convinced just by the sound of the dish that it makes the moment it is placed hot on your table from the oven.
We also ordered fresh lime soda but it is too costly and at Rs 62 you can have wonderful lime soda drinks from some other shops, yes from standard restaurants.
Each time I have been to Park St, every time I have noticed a good crowd of food loving people in front of the joint. One needs to wait for a good amount of time before getting chance for a place inside. Now mostly people order the already mentioned items, for first timers I understand, myself being this genre in my time. But most follow it as a craze without giving a reason.
Finally, the atmosphere is good, waiters are so so, processing time.....time taking, this is due to the rush, a bit pricey...this much
Will have to taste other items in the menu to do a good judgement.

##

2015-03-24 14:48:45
Monalisa Gupta
15038301
3.5
Peter Cat is one such eatery which holds a special place in most Kolkatans hearts. So 2 weeks back I visited this place after quite a long time to have dinner with my family. Visiting after such a long gap did not make me feel alien. The ambience, reception and service felt still the same. After a good 20mins wait, we got our entry into the restaurant. The orders comprised of Prawn cocktail, Grilled fish sizzler and our good old Chelo Kabab.

Prawn cocktail - It tasted good, the subtle sweet, salty, sour flavours with good texture, chilled temperatures and the prawn gave a soothing start.

Grilled Fish sizzler - In the beginning I was disappointed as the initial fizz associated with a sizzler was almost missing. Seemed to have been prepared in advance, so was not that sizzling hot. However, it tasted great. The fish was cooked to perfection, the sauce tasted delicious and the associated veggies tasted great too.

Non-veg chelo kabab - The combination of rice, butter, egg poach, chicken and mutton kabab along with salad is always heavenly. But this time chelo kabab did not taste up to the mark. The rice seemed to be undercooked and the smooth flavours seemed to be missing. So the experience was not that satisfying.

Overall, I can comment that the prime focus that I always had while visiting this place did not meet my expectation but I hope to get better experience the next time I visit this place.

##

2015-03-24 04:03:56
Piya
1091388
4.0
This place is featured under "legendary" and legends needs no introduction or reviews! 

Their Chelo kebabs are one of a kind and I have never tasted something so perfectly delicious all my life! Their North Indian section comprising of chicken bharta, kebabs and breads are sumptuously delicious! Desserts are top notch and the vanilla with hot chocolate sauce is one of my favourites because they make the chocolate sauce from scratch- no Hershey's short cut here! 
The waiters are swift and efficient and most importantly courteous! I have been going here since I was 6 years old and I think I will be visiting this place even when I will be 60! 
Everyone in Kolkata knows about the famous chelo kebabs and the mouth watering sizzlers hence I won't waste my energy writing about a place which is already world famous in India or rather Calcutta! Haha 

Lately their portions in chelo kebab are getting a little smaller and prices are increasing but I guess when you have built a brand name you can always do these small things to make some extra profit!

##

2015-03-21 12:10:28
Avradeep Datta
875581
3.5
There is nothing much to write about what Peter Cat represents to the food scene of Kolkata. Took my parents out for dinner on a weeknight. Wanted to book a table beforehand but that isn't an option at Peter Cat. We ended up sitting on its steps for 30 mins before we got a table. I really wish they at least have a waiting lounge rather than ask their customers to sit on steps.
The decor of the place is classy. Plush red chairs and seatees and nice hanging lights. We went for a prawn cocktail, a house special sizzler with bread rolls and a chello kebab for the starters and mains. The prawn cocktail was nice and creamy and cold. The sizzler wowed with its showmanship but I felt it lacked any depth of taste. The chello kebab was wonderful! Perfectly poached egg and beautiful kebabs but the rice in the dish was perhaps the most beautiful component. 
For the dessert we ordered a creme caramel and a peter cat special. The creme caramel was horrible! It is one of the worst dessert in a very long time. The caramel was watery and the custard was tasteless. The special was decent though. Lots of ice cream with fresh fruits, nuts and raisins.
The service is fast but the waiters have a problem serving the dishes. 
Overall a very nice place for a family dinnef but nothing mindblowing in it.

2015-03-18 00:29:19
Ankita Doshi

4.5
Peter cat is a legendary calcutta restaurant. It is one of the most famous restaurants in the city and has still maintained its old calcutta charm with its dim lights, waitors with classic turbans and the guard who salutes you as you enter and leave. The warmth and the old world ambience attracts you to the place. The chelo kebab is outstanding with its paneer tikka and seekh kebab which literally melt in your mouth alongwith the rice and butter accompaniments. The sizzlers are really delicious too, especially the continental one. If its your first time in the city and you want a taste of the old calcutta I highly recommend peter cat.

They suggestd us chelo kabab which was actualy good.. But apart from that NAYANTARA a mix veg was worst. Breads were not up to the mark. They served the starter and main course together.. Worst part was that around 5 of the staff were standin on our head makin us hell uncmfrtable.. It was like they were waitn for us to finish n go.. We dint even finished our food and one of them asked, 'sir bill kar du?'.. Next moment the other one started pickin up plates.. No more words.. Hell disappointed..

2015-03-10 13:17:01
Shreyasi Hazra
3019292
3.5
Peter Cat is one of the most talked about restaurants in town, and hence needs no introduction.
Location: Hit the Park st and you are almost there. If you still can't find, don't use GMaps, ask localites.¬†
Ambiance: Dimly lit Red hues create the aura. Enough space to accommodate large number of customers, still you will find queue during weekends or festive seasons, just to remind you the popularity of the restaurant. well, waiting here for food is worth of your time. 3.5/5
Service: Personally, I like the dress code of the staffs. It gives you an essence of old Calcutta. They are well behaved. If you order signature dishes like chelo, waiting time is not much, But if you order other than that, prepare yourself to spend time with your table mates before the food arrives. 3.5/5
Food: Been here, Haven't tasted their Chelo Kebab??? Is there anyone? It's bliss. A platter with rice, butter, egg, chicken kebabs with onion and capsicum clubbed together and Mutton sheikh Kebab. What else one can ask for a delicious gastronomic experience? Well well, at least before my last visit, I would have said, It tastes heavenly. But unfortunately, the signature dish isn't exactly the same as before. The quality has deteriorated. Last time, The mutton sheikh Kebabs were not up to the mark. Also, the quantity of rice has become less. Please, please Peter cat, don't make us disappointed with your signature dish. It's a request. Previously 4.5/5, Now 3/5

One of the renowned and most talked about restaurants of Kolkata, situated at the Park street area. You should always make reservation before dropping in to avoid waiting in the long queue during anytime of the day, this place is always crowed. Essentially known for its delectable sizzlers and scrumptious chello kebabs, this dimly lit place serves other cuisines as well, but its better to stick to the sizzlers and the chellos that they are famous for. For Chinese visit bar-b-q two minutes walk from the place. Service is pretty good. Ambiance is not killer, but not bad either. Its a place best for celebration with buddies, not for a romantic date, unless only and only good food is what you and your partner is looking for. I personally like their decor. A must try.

2015-03-04 19:33:26
TheSkinnyBhukkad
526716
3.5
Peter Cat is one of the most famous restaurants in Kolkata and needs no introduction.Frankly saying I found the interiors a bit dull,though the dim lighting creates a nice mood.I had the Veg Chelo Kebab, Rajma Galouti Kebab and Tandoori Brochholi.

I really loved the Chelo Kebab.The dish consisted of Veg Seekh kebab,Tandoori Aloo and Paneer Tikka with a portion of rice and butter.The kebabs were well done and very flavourful.The paneer had a kind of achari taste to it.Also it went well with the buttered rice.
Coming to the broccoli,I must say that it was better the last time I had it.This time the broccoli seemed a bit raw and the flavour hadnt seeped in so well.
The Galouti Kebab was average .Also the dish wasnt really warm.Galouti Kebabs are more flavoursome .The dish had a unidimensional kind of flavour.

I'm giving them a 3.5 just because of the Chelo Kebab,I'v had better here.Quality should not vary so much.

##

2015-03-01 01:37:26
Foodie Panda
20292985
4.0
This legendary place in Kolkata does not need an introduction. Every kid to grown-up in the city will have some or the other memory attached to the place and will definitely be nostalgic about it. Celebrities frequenting the place, movies being shot every now and then, and needless to say, the history that goes back to decades, each goes in making the restaurant a must visit eat-out destination. The place is always huss and buss with visitors and managing a table in 15 minutes of waiting in queue is no less than an achievement.
So what makes it so different and special! The unique range of food they serve of-course, with their secret recipe. To my surprise their menu is literally shaped in the form of a cat. And what tops it all in the menu is ‚Äì ‚ÄòChelo Kabab‚Äô. I had heard so much about this particular dish that could not wait to order this. This is a platter with set of utterly soft chicken kebabs and two steaks of mutton kebabs. They like to serve these around fragrant rice wonderfully slithered in ghee. It is topped with a nicely done poch. Baked tomato and smashed potato also accompany these. If you are done with this dish and still left with some appetite, then prawn cocktail is a must try. Betki Muenier from their seafood section also makes it to my recommendation list. Very soft fish is battered and served smeared in white sauce. Before you realize what all went in, the soft chunks just dissolve. The buzz of sizzlers being served was aloud. When it comes to dessert, I can bet if the fullness of the dishes spares you a corner. The range is good though. Here I will also put a disclaimer; the place may not live up to its name but for the placid ambience. Every table lit by a dim hanging lamp enough just to see what you are digging in. Rest all kept dark deliberately to cut aloof each table of the other.
In your next visit to the city buzzing with yellow ambassadors, don‚Äôt forget to book one straight to the heart of Park Street and gorge on to be part of this awesome food odyssey.

Taste buds: Jumping with joy
Pocket shouts: Little heavy
When I look around: No point taking your eyes off table when it is kept dark around
Waiting time for tummy: Not very long if you manage a table

Keep gorging!
- Foodie Panda 
For more reviews: Visit - foodeepanda.com

2015-02-26 22:54:49
AJAI ATAL
1398925
3.5
This¬† is not really one of the old timers of the Park Street area¬†like Mocambos,Trincas,Mags as it came up only in the late 70s. Nonetheless its builtup a fairly loyal clientel. The decor is warm and inviting as is the name of the place.Seating is comfy and the service effecient. Peter Cat serves decent quality Continental and English food. The Tandoori dishes,especiallly the kebabs,(Chelo is a must try) The chicken do pyaza,butter masala,prawns and fish are all tasty and very satisfying. The English cusine such as the fried fish,grilled¬† or poached especially the Beckti are super as is the Prawn cocktail. italian is not really their forte though and the sauces taste heavily of maida !! Stick to the Tandoori dishes and curries or the fish and prawns for western and you cant go wrong.Not the Best food in town but worth a try and youre sure to enjoy it.

The cocktails were amazing , though less in volume.¬†
We tried the Chicken Tikka too, which wasn't disappointing. It was good, if not the best. Finally came the Chelo Kebab - priced at Rs 315. Since I had it for the first time, I liked it pretty much. Both the kebabs were well cooked and huge in quantity. The rice was fragrant and slithered with butter. The poach was perfect and overall it was a great dish. Would definitely go back and try the other stuff. The service and ambiance are good too.

2015-02-23 23:25:26
Arka Datta
16785850
4.0
I have been to this place six times. I know, because I counted. It's very hard to get a table here, which I totally say as a compliment. The restaurant is always crowded because it's one of the- if not THE- best places to eat in my city. 

The atmosphere is un-matchable, and the serving is of world class quality. You get your food served to you not later than it's not worth of. What I mean is: the food is so good that you can actually forgive them for taking some time to present your order to you.

And the menu is filled with a great many options to select from, which includes both food and drinks. The price is a little on the higher side, but that too is completely justified because of the experience you will have here.

I assure you that all your senses will be satisfied in this place. At least that is what happens to me every time. 

And I must also include that even so it is famous for its Chelow Kabab, the restaurant has many other dishes that are as good if not better. Try as many of them you can on your visits.

We were asked to order everything at once and the waiter wouldn't give us five minutes to go through the menu. Rushed through the menu and ordered the main course ( one veg and one non-veg) and a dessert. The veg dish was a disappointment. The dish was so dry that I asked for a bottle of coke and was denied the same since they apparently closed the fridge. The dessert was also not worth the money. The service is poor. Vegetarians will have a bad time there. Non-veg food seems to be good. The whole waiting process is so frustrating. Go there only if you have hours to simply waste.

##

2015-02-18 19:35:48
Pulkit Goenka
2222410
4.0
Divine!!!! That's the feeling one has after having a lunch at Peter Cat!!!!! I decided to go out for a lunch with a friend of mine.... He suggested Peter Cat!!!! It was around 2pm, the place was quite full and there were people waiting but we managed to get a table since only two of us were there......
Well Peter Cat reminds you of restaurants seen in old movies.... With very minimal decor and dim lights the place has its own unique aura.....
Chelo Kebabs!!!! That's what usually I or rather every second person orders at Peter Cat.... So this time me and my friend decided to order something different..... Since there were not many options in vegetarian, so we ordered the next best thing one gets at Peter Cat which is Sizzler!!! We ordered a Vegetable Mixed Grill Sizzler with dinner rolls and fresh lime soda for beverages..... The platter was simply outstanding, especially the Sheek Kebabs in it were amazing...... Eat,Eat & Eat!!!! That's what we felt at that time..... We were fully satisfied with our meal....
Given so many plus points Peter Cat has a few negatives also which it needs to work upon.... One of them is lack of space, the tables are really small in size and distance between the two separate tables is kept at minimal..... God knows why?!?! But the biggest lack in Peter Cat is of a good and mannered staff!!!! I would say Peter Cat has the most uncourteous staff in the city restaurants which impacts the delicious food it offers!!!! They need to hire a good lot!!!! Maybe in the near future one could see Peter Cat overcome its shortcomings!!!!
But on the whole Peter Cat is an excellent place to dine out with friends and family!!!!
I still have a craving for the mouth watering Chelo Kebabs!!! I think I should I have ordered them too........

##

2015-02-17 10:16:09
Amlan Majumder
802659
5.0
Perhaps the only place where the food not only pacified my stomach but also pleased my mind and heart. This place definitely needs no introduction. The food, its taste, the ambience, the staffs, seating arrangement, everything, was more than being "just right". Ambience is very soothing, even though the restaurant is crowded even on weekdays, u dont feel ur privacy being disturbed by the presence of fellow guests sitting adjacent to you. Lighting and spaces around you makes you feel more comfortable. No over the top interiors, simple decoration, has a mezzanine floor above, gives a different experience. Staffs are very busy so may not appear courteous, but are polite and soft spoken, Wearing a smile on their face could have helped though :) . Their a-la-carte menu does give you the option to choose from the many exotic and unique dishes it has to offer. Upon recommendation by my friends i ordered a portion of Mutton Chello Kabab along with a portion each of Egg mayonnaise and a variant of mutton biryani called Biryani-al-nawabi. Just as described by my friends the Mutton Chello Kabab was simply outstanding. Even the butter rice served with it was amazing!! I dont know how the butter rice tasted so great but it actually did. The mutton reshmi kabab and the chunks of mutton kabab in it was purely delightful. The texture was smooth, so soft that it nearly melted in my mouth. The sunny-side up poached egg was to sooth the pallette and satisfy all the taste buds in the mouth before the next dish arrived. The mutton biryani seemed and tasted more like the biryanis that i have had in kerala, smaller grains of rice that are spicy and had an extra kick of mustard oil on it. Yes the biryani was tasting less of ghee and more of vegetable oil in it. Nevertheless, this different version of biryani did impress me a lot. In the end i went for the egg mayonnaise, and it did surprise me with its creaminess and absolute joy of egg slices and vegetable cubes in it. Its more like a Russian salad with egg slices placed carefully on top of it without getting its yolk displaced, and the whole thing is covered evenly with an extra layer of mayonnaise. An absolute fattening but outrageously delightful taste that keeps u in euphoria as long as it has its leftover in ur mouth. But one note of precaution, this egg mayonnaise is a very heavy and large dish and its appearance is deceptive. So its advisable that a portion of egg mayonnaise should be shared. I chose to eat it in the end cuz mayonnaise doesnt allows my taste buds to taste anything else. We ended this feast with a can of Coke Zero. We were left heavy and pleasantly sedated and this euphoric feeling continued for the next 8 hours.
By far, this was the outstanding experience I ever had in my culinary journey. I had never tasted such elegant yet brutally and ridiculously good food. These three dishes and two cans of coke zero costed us Rs. 1070 including tax. Had to pay Rs. 50 tip to the waiter who was looking eagerly at us after giving us the change back. Didnt bother at this as i just had the food that was best in taste i ever had. Besides, paying Rs. 1100/- for such a great culinary experience for two mouths to feed is very economical. Saying "Peter cat rocks" or "Peter cat is awesome" is definitely an understatement for me. I highly recommend this restaurant. I was thinking of giving 4.5/5 to this restaurant due to the few shortcomings like waiters asking for more tips, waiters appearing scary and dead serious all the time, but recalling the taste of the foods is overshadowing any negative thoughts that I am having for this place. Am going to this restaurant again soon!! :)

Peter cat is one of the most reknowned restaurants in the Park street. It is located opposite to KFC and adjacent to Au Bon. Peter Cat has always made me wait and do away with my dining fast because the rush of people outside the resto keeps growing with time. The staff is polite and it is a well-organised place. I love the lights inside but interiors can be improved. Coming to the food, the first item I would suggest people to go for is their esteemed Chelo kebab which is always beautifully made. Apart from chelo kebab, grilled chicken sizzlers, prawn cocktail, chicken tandoori, sag chicken,peas paratha are delicious. For the dessert I always stick to my personal favourite i.e. brownie with vanilla ice cream and choc sauce. It amazes me everytime I indulge in the dessert. One can also go for Tutty frutti. Peter cat is an expensive restaurant so make sure your pocket pinch is sound enough . Give Peter cat a shot if you are at Kolkata. Chelo kebab will drive you insane. :)

##

2015-02-06 08:01:11
Sumitavo Paul
183369
4.5
Peter Cat is my favourite restaurant in Kolkata. Some people cry out that peter cat is over hyped and over crowded but I live with the peter cat mania. I can stand outside peter cat for an hour to get a seat and enjoy the food. Located at central park street, it is one of the busiest restaurants in the city. Over the years, price has increased considerably but the craze is still there.

Chelo Kebab is the hottest item and with the decreasing amount of rice everyday - the fan following and craze seem to increase. An unique persian dish introduces first in Kolkata and many other competitors have tried copying that. But Peter Cat is still the best.

Sizzlers are very good and at a very reasonable price. Go for the tandoori mixed grill.

Indian food at Peter cat is also good - lasooni naan, keema naan, fish makhmali kebab, seekh kebab, dum-ki-raan (wow, what a mutton dish, soft and succulent), mutton rogan josh, chicken butter masala- all hugely recommended.

Overall 4.5 for my favourite restaurant.

##

2015-02-01 22:49:53
Mallika Fatehpuria
2087794
1.0
I had always heard about the hype around Peter Cat and their signature dish, Chelo Kebab, and was waiting for a long time to try it. This week I had a guest from Delhi, who wanted to eat at a place that represented this city in terms of food. This place was the first thing that came to my mind and I couldn't have been more disappointed with my decision. We went on a Friday afternoon and got tables quite easily. We were seated upstairs. We ordered for two plates of their famous Chelo kebab. My guest had a sinus problem and with the AC right on top of her head it was getting impossible for her to sit there. We asked the server if we could have our table changed and he spoke to us in the worst manner possible and said that was not possible since our order had already been placed. I was surprised as this was the first time I was hearing something so absurd in a restaurant. And to have been spoken at rudely, it just added to the displeasure. We still requested again and after five minutes of chucking attitude he finally agreed. Also I had asked him to leave the menu on the table since I just wanted to look through it and see if I needed something else and I was told that I would be given one when I needed it and that they can't leave it on the table. The server literally snatched it from my hand. Keeping in mind my guest, I did not say a word to the waiter. When the food finally arrived, it was stone cold and something really very average. I failed to understand the hype around the dish. The sunny side up on top of the rice could have been made better by a small kid. There was no body who came and asked if we wanted anything else or refilled the water or anything. Overall it was one of my worst experience at a restaurant. And it was super embarrassing as well because I had spoken so highly about the place to my guest before taking her there. Never ever again. Oh and they don't even deserve the rating I've given them. Unfortunately zomato doesn't allow me to go lower.

2015-01-31 17:25:43
Elizabeth Gupta
106303
2.0
We've always been great fans of Peter Cat. In fact, anyone coming to our home from out of Calcutta is always taken for a Peter Cat meal. Imagine, then our terrible feeling of total let-down when we went there for lunch today.

First, we were seated at a table that was leaning to the right, so we found ourselves sitting at an angle. The table had neither a table cloth, nor flowers in the unique copper vase. No water was poured out into the glasses, nor was the table rearranged for us (it was a table that seated four, and usually the waiter rearranges things so that it is comfortable for the persons at the table). The bowl with the green chillies and lime was just kind of chucked on the side. We had ordered beer with our food. The waiter usually shows the bottle and asks if it is cold enough. Today, he just poured the beer into our tankards. Then, he brought the bread roll for my husband, picked it up with his hands and dumped it on the side plate. Three roughly cut cubes of butter unattractively displayed on the butter dish were then slid on to the table. My husband had ordered the Tandoori Mixed Grill (Passionately Recommended), which comes under Peter Cat Sizzler Specialities. It came with a very damp sizzle....Worse, the gravy was all over and the vegetables on the side looked as if it had been bunged there - quite unattractive and totally unappetizing. I had ordered a Roast Chicken (non-sizzler) and after the 'Sizzler's' sizzling had all but fizzled out, my plate came - it looked a mess. I've never, ever, ever seen food displayed so badly in Peter Cat, or served so carelessly. I don't know which shocked me more - that one of my favorite restaurants had disappointed me so badly, or that the food was lousy. 

Sad. Sad. Sad.

##

2015-01-30 15:17:54
Kiran Kumar
3921321
3.5
Recently visited Kolkata and I was amazed by the rave reviews and the cult status enjoyed by this restaurant. So decided to give it a try.

We were two hungry souls who managed to reach this restaurant at 3 pm and to our surprise it was still crowded. Managed to squeeze in after waiting for some good 20 minutes.

AMBIANCE - The ambiance was quite good with the tables closely packed.¬†

FOOD - We were pretty much hungry by the time we entered so skipped the soup and jumped to the main course . Having read so many rave reviews about the iconic Chello Kababs couldn't stop myself from trying those out. So we tried out the famous The Original Chello Kabab and the Veg Chello Kabab. The Chello Kabab had a generous portion of meat and rice with the butter cubicles. To be honest both the Kababs were good but not great or heavenly as I had expected it to be. We also tried the Vegetable mixed grill sizzlers and it was also just okay and unfortunately we couldn't manage to complete it.¬†

SERVICE - The service was swift but the staff need to be trained on some manners. The server just banged the plates on the table. I do understand that the restaurant is pretty crowded and the service has to be swift but not compromising on some basic etiquettes.

FINAL VERDICT - ¬†Peter Cat is a very good place if you want to have some quick food or catch up with your buddies. The price being very nominal for the quality of food offered it is definitely a place to visit.

2015-01-29 20:06:22
Kaustav Sen
1088586
5.0
If you havent been to Peter Cat on your trip to Park Street, Kolkata, please, please, turn back and head there right now.¬†
Very rightly put under legendary category here, is this ancient food heaven where almost everything you get to order is simply awesome.¬†
On my various earlier visits, I have stuck to the very predictable and droolworthy Chello Kebab and a Screwdriver.¬†
But this time, on 27th Jan, for lunch, I and my ex-colleague went in, and we wanted to try something else. We went for the sizzlers and kebab. We ordered the Irani Kebab and a Chicken Grilled Sizzler and a Chicken Roast Sizzler each. Plus, she took a Pineapple Drink (read pineapple milk shake) and I took a screwdriver.
After a wait of about 10 mins, before we could smell it, or see it, we heard our food arrive.¬†
Now the sizzlers are were very much no frills, no nonsense, simply delicious strips of meat. And yes, they gave us four blocks of butter to use as intended :p
We had ordered a bread roll with it, but none of us even took a bite of it, we were simply too full.
Not missing the kebabs, they were soft, very tasty and simply melted away the minute we bit em.¬†
I ll reiterate, if you have a budget of 500 rs and want to have an awesome lunch, please just get in here and you wont regret it!

The inventor of the legendary "Chello-Kabab" continues to run. The ambience is cramped and loud, but that's the USP. The food is truly awesome, but the service has slightly degraded over the years. Thankfully the food hasn't.

2015-01-28 19:50:58
Rituparna Roy
1593404
4.0
It is natural to get swayed away in emotions while recollecting this place especially when you are a Calcuttan. I am really not sure how much this place might be loved by someone who doesn‚Äôt have any attachment with the city. It can be perceived to be normal fine dine place with nothing-out-of-the-world d√©cor or service or ambience serving good food. But then, I am a Calcuttan.

¬†It is very difficult to try out any other option when you have chelo kebab in the menu. What I love about this dish is the fact that the whole platter is so rightly spiced. The kebabs are soft and juicy and mildly flavored, having the right amount of charcoal flavor. The flat egg on the rice with an ample portion of butter and blanched tomato- these are ordinary ingredients, but in this platter, they all look and taste so exotic! In the desserts, I like the stylish way they serve brownie with vanilla and chocolate sauce. But otherwise I find their dessert menu a bit dull. 

They are quite good at their service. I find their ambience very special as it is always cheerful and happy, with diners very busy in their ‚Äòadda‚Äô. This place is a must visit for every Calcuttan.

2015-01-26 15:05:23
Diplodoccus

4.0
It is difficult to write something new for a leader like peter cat. Park street gastronomy scene is incomplete without the chelo kababs of peter cat.
Since , most of us would have tested chelo kababs at one point or the other , I would rather like to mention the absolute cracker of a dish , dum di raan , today.
It is the entire back leg of a goat , devoid of bones. Smoked and sauted with onion,chillies and garlic spices. A heavenly side as an accompaniment to rum or whisky. Ideal for 3-4 heads , it has remain a staple for our endless evenings at peter cat.

2015-01-14 18:49:34
Kaustav Nayak
1276373
4.0
If you live in Kolkata, pride yourself as a food aficionado and haven't been to Peter Cat, then that is something scandalous.¬†Every foodie at some point visits this dimly lit, cozily seated dining place at Park Street. And then they come out a fan.¬†Most importantly Peter Cat's such a safe option. Be it a date, a casual business meeting or hanging out with old friends, you can never go wrong with this place.¬†¬†
The chelo kebab here is legendary. And the house special chicken steak with sausages and liver too is a class apart. Recommended.¬†Among drinks and starters they have a rather good coffee with ice cream. Even in the age of CCD's and hundreds of mushrooming cafes, this tastes different. Among desserts the chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream and hot chocolate sauce is a treat for your little buddies in the tongue.¬†¬†The waiters are courteous, the service is fast. One of the banes of fame, the place can be crowdy at peak hours and hence getting a seat may take some time. The price is reasonable. A place that justifies its legendary tag. :)

3119378
4.5
Peter cat is a restaurant with a class of its own. It is my utmost favourite place for sizzlers and kebabs. I have visited this place many times and the feel of this place is always simply amazing. It is spacious, the decor is simple yet classy and the ambience is just lovely. Coming to the food, I have always stuck to their signature dish called the Chelo Kebab. It is the best ensemble dish I have ever tasted. It is impeccable in taste and the kebabs are simply lip smacking. The presentation of this dish is another feature which i absolutely love. Among other food items,I tasted afgani chicken with kabuli naan,which was just delicious. The afgani chicken with its tenderly cooked chicken and the juicy curry is impeccable in taste. However it was during my last visit i tried two of their other specialities,the beckty muniere and the house special sizzler. Needless to say, I was completely blown by their taste too. The beckty muniere together with the sauce and different flavours was outstanding. Its one of the most amazing dish i ever tasted till date!!! The house special sizzler(chicken served with sausages and liver) is tangy and spicy in taste and leaves a long lasting aftertaste. The chicken is juicy and the sausages are moist and tender. In short it is a winner dish. Nothing negative comes to the mind about this restaurant apart from the fact that there is a wait of at least half an hour for getting a seat on weekends. However I have faced this problem just once as most of my other visits were on weekdays. Peter cat is one of the legendary restaurants of Kolkata and though I have visited this place many times in past...I will continue to do so in the near future also.

So we left not giving any too and the dissatisfaction was clear on this face and body language. Had he not been standing he would have got a tip and a full 5 points for the restaurant. 4th Oct 2015 Visit.

We were given seat at the ground floor. Ambiance is always nice in the restaurant. We had 2 ScrewDrivers 2 beer pint, one Iranian chicken kebab, 2 chelo kebab . 
The serving was late back, relaxed quite apt for a Sunday lunch. Had a lovely time 
Definitely a must visit. The improvement I found from my last visit was this time that they now have wireless card punching machine . But the waiters still stands near the table and look out for tips.

##

2015-01-10 21:16:32
Harsh Mohapatra
307371
4.5
It took me a long time, but I finally made my first visit to one of kolkata's must visit during a food pilgrimage. As expected, we had to wait in a line of devotees before we got entry into the place.

We sat in a cosy corner under a brightly lit table. I went ahead and ordered the legendary chello kebab to start of with. I had much expectations due to the hype created around the dish and I will admit it turned quite a surprise for me. It was a nice filling, balanced dish with the subtle basmati rice proving a sidekick to the spicy kebabs. I don't have to tell you to go ahead and try it.

But the other dishes which I ordered were absolutely delightful. Do try the following:

1. Chicken Steak Sizzler: A sizzling surprise with a tender steak and a brilliant sauce

2. Prawn Butter Masala - Yes you heard it right. The tandoori prawn were absolutely brilliant in the tangy gravy.

3.Chicken Afghani - In a light-brown thick cashew gravy, chicken pieces are wonderfully cooked till they are succulent and tender.

4. Shrimp cocktail - A chilled,creamy appetizer of shrimps to get your digestive machinery rolling. Recommended.

5. Beckty Muniere - A brilliant preparation of fish in a creamy butter sauce. I literally closed my eyes in bliss for few seconds to experience all the flavors of the dish. 

The service is also good with the staff helping you to make decisions and customizations if you need any.

##

2015-01-08 16:13:47
Priyanka Nandy
2301908
5.0
I adore Peter Cat. The staff are regal, yet friendly (deferential, even, depending on their mood), and the interiors are charming. Despite the low lighting, table lamps, and 60's thick velvet curtains, this place doesn't have either a pretentious feel, or the gently decaying air of old colonial eating houses.¬†

Then there's the food. Absolutely wonderful food! Nearly everything on the menu is great, but first-timers must really try at least a few of the following:¬†
1. Chicken mayo salad - a rich, creamy, mayonnaise-y salad made of LOTS of diced steamed vegetables covered by a dome of thinly-sliced roast chicken covered in house-made mayonnaise. Eat this with a dinner roll.

2. All forms of fried fish,

3. Dum-ki-raan (slow-cooked leg of lamb), which, if you're a moderate eater, you should only order half of.¬†

4. The fish makhmali, the shah nauz, the sizzler platters, and of course, the chello kaba plate, if only for experience's sake. It's not their best dish, but it's certainly the best known.

Tip decently if you like the service. These gentlemen tend to remember faces, and given how reasonable the prices are, and how good the food, the people who work at this place have certainly earned those extra bucks. ¬†Also, arrive at least an hour before you intend to eat. Even on regular non-holidays and during non-lunch/non-dinner hours, Peter Cat will usually have a queue thirty people deep ahead of you at the door.

##

2015-01-06 20:17:54
Rupsa Das
650008
3.0
Hello, Peter cat! One of the most legendary place to exist in Calcutta. You are a non-Calcuttian, come here for a lunch or dinner experience! Getting a table without waiting for a considerable amount of time is almost impossible! You got at 4 in the evening, you still wait for 15-20 minutes to get a seat.¬†

I have come here with my family everytime and I am moderately happy to eat at this place everytime. I am not enthralled and blown away by the quality of the food here. However, I like the little orange lights, and the romantic atmosphere that it creates which is obviously broken by the constant chatter around the restaurant. Blame me! I like a very silent restaurant. The most famous dish of this place, the Chello kebab is usually what every mortal present in the restaurant orders. So, I kind of do the same. The best thing about the Chello kebab is the butter rice and the Reshmi chicken kebabs. The combination of them both makes life wonderful. However, I absolutely detest the mutton sheekh kebab. Sorry, loyal fans! But I cannot help it. And I also don't get the significance of the huge tomato that is always provided with the rice. Probably it has it's own sweet significance, but I personally do not like it. Apart from the Chello, once ordered Chicken steak. The chicken steak is just a moderate tasting steak. I didn't once drool all over the food here. There are loyal Peter Cat-ians, but I am not one of them. Sorry!

Positives: Ambiance which is quite romantic, The cute cat menu card and the legend that they have created with Chello kebab, the taste, the price.
Negatives: The wait, oh I could kill people after waiting for nearly 30 minutes or more, the over-hype ¬†of the place.

I would come back here, yes. Why not? I like the Chello kebab as well! But I am not the loyalist of this place. Peter Cat elitists, don't kill me!

##

2015-01-01 12:17:32
Shiladitya Sarkar
384424
4.5
On a cold festive december evening I headed out to dine at peter cat knowing the fact that I would need to wait endlessly for a table. My sister and her husband had flown in from the states and they wanted to have their favourite chelo kebabs and sizzlers.

After about an hour's wait outside we were taken to our table. Hungry like bulls we ordered food and booze straightaway. So hungry were we that we polished off the accompaniments that come with the booze instantly.

The soup (we ordered cream of chicken) for the kids arrived in 10 minutes. It was rather bland. The chelo kebab and the mixed grill sizzlers were served in another 15 minutes while we gulped down the booze. The chelo kebab was amazing. I do not have words to describe how awesome it was. The mixed grill sizzler arrived next and it was prepared Indian style. Perhaps in a hurry we had chosen the tandoori one. Never mind. It tasted pretty good with generous portions of chicken, fish, liver, mutton and egg all marinated with indian paste and grilled. The mutton was soft and was nice to dig into! The sizzlers were heavy needless to say. Too full we were that we did not try deserts.

Awesome food at an awesome place. Only if you have the patience to stand in long queues even on a monday evening!

##

2014-12-31 17:25:19
Rajeev Nangia
182439
4.0
The afternoon of my one day stopover in Kolkata and after an epic but much less than perfect breakfast ( look up my review of Flury's to understand this contradiction ) the park area legend " Flury's " I was determined to discover some great food. I had actually spend the two and a half hour after my breakfast scouting for a place to have lunch. 
Wandering around the streets at around one on a Monday afternoon , in a lane just off Flury's on the park street  , I was confronted by what looked like a mini mob , waiting outside to be admitted to this strangely named establishment "Peter Cat " . 

Assuming , so many people , most locals , would certainly know where to find good food , even I joined that crowd. Being a solo diner can have certain privileges at times , in a very little time I was lead to a table by very professional but bored looking floor manager. By the way , throughout my excellent dining experience , that was one common thread it all the employes there , very efficient, refilling water after every sip   I took from my glass , replacing the table linen and silver as soon as required but utterly bored , this was further illustrated by there converting my table , a small two seater just by the staircase , into an instant service bay , wether a table nearby wanted an extra fork or some black pepper , they instantly provided it to them by taking it off my table and when one of them was left with some spare napkins after setting up a table he just dumped them there and all this without even glancing at me :). I guess they know that the patrons come here just for the foods and such finer details can be overlooked , at least on a table seating just a lone non demanding dinner .

Now the decor , the carpet was well worn , the seats reasonably comfortable though cramped , the lighting low and the ambiance just nicely neutral , no statements there . 

But the statements started with there menus . The cocktail menu first , it is a nice longish booklet with real catchy names and great caricatures , just looking at them puts you in a mood to have a drink :) but I resisted the temptation and went straight for the food menu , shaped like a , you guessed  it right , cat :) , loads of choices here and I was totally at sea , so I decided to order a dish I knew nothing about , The Chello Kabab and that turned out to be the best decision of the day. Buttered rice , cooked  al dente , topped with a sunny side up , a boiled tomato and dollops of butter , with a lamb sheekh Kabab and a chicken tikka with grilled onions off the skewer on the side , a picture of culinary paradise. My only disappointment after eating this dish was that It was so filling that after eating it there was no scope for me to eat anything else and discover some more hidden gems from the menu . Utterly delicious. 

So before the final word , a thought , in course of reviewing all these restaurants It appears as if I am turning into some kind of a food snob spinning long tales but to me it is sharing my experience in totality and the only reason for criticising is to make these already nice places , nicer and the reviews more fun and informative to read. 

Ok , so will I go back and recommend the "Peter Cat ' ? and the answer is a big YES to both the questions. Not to be missed 

Enjoy.

A fair priced meal for the quality you receive.

2014-12-22 23:38:05
Anindya Dutt
2836970
3.5
Peter Cat, a name synonymous with every Calcuttan. Its a symbol of heritage and a must visit in the list of every foodie. The cue in front of Peter Cat can never go unnoticed  whenever one visits Park Street. After a significant wait you are welcmed into a dimly lit hall filled with the chitter-chatter of people,the crackling sounds of the sizzlers and the mixed aroma of the burnt butter with that of the liqour. The whole ambience just takes you back in time.
About the food, the must try would be the all famous chello kabab and the various sizzlers. Also if you are not a Continental food lover then they have the biriyani and other indian dishes to offer. The food is quite good but a little too pricey.

We had to constantly tell the waiter to serve water. Things weren't going good as it is I went to the washroom and saw that there was a freaking queue to pee. There was a person guarding the door And people are literally waiting for the person to open the door and allow them to pee. 2014-12-12 12:29:48
Krish Shenoy

3.5
When you ask your Kolkata based freinds for good places to eat,peter catfeatures on almost everyone's list.
And as soon as someone says Peter Cat the words Chello Kebabs follow,you instantly know that this is a legendary grub spot you can't miss.
So me and my friend landed there one week night and were lucky just to be there before the line started.
We had beer in the famous brass mugs which gave us a Game of Thrones like feeling and waited patiently for the Chello Kebabs.
After around 10 mins a king size platter with 2 different kebabs,rice and a fried egg arrived.The sight was a little confusing at first but once i started to dig in the confusions just vanished.
All the components just worked out perfectly to give a awesome tasting experience.
The ambience and the service was just fine to please the patrons.
Will definately recommend peter cat and chello kebabs to anyone who happens to be in Kolkata

2014-12-12 02:16:42

4.5
Name anyone, who hasn't been to Peter Cat? If not, then please go right after you have read my review. They are famous for their chelo kababs and sizzlers. It reminds me of the sound "zzzzz", like those rattlesnakes.

They serve alcohol. I had my first Bloody Mary here. :p It is 'densely populated', as the crowd is always heavy and you would see a huge queue right in front of Peter Cat. Getting inside without waiting....you need to be really lucky. Since the place is little crowded, one would hear buzzing sound besides the sound of the cutlery. They make some real good delicacies for vegetarians and for fish lovers. Good combination of chicken and mutton liver. :)
Oh! I feel myself hungry now. :(
They have some special kababs everyday and each day is a different one. 
People who wants to visit there for the first time, a suggestion, please be prepared to wait but don't give up.

Here every damn thing was boiled and tossed in sweet and tangy BBQ sauce. Although the chelo kebab was really good.

2014-12-03 16:16:30
Bindiya Mutum
1461467
4.5
Step1: Come here during peak meal time only if you are willing and have the patience to wait in line for your table.
Step2: Be amazed at the elegant ambience of an old calcutta charm. Also notice the uniform of your waiter and their gracious manner and feel special.
Step3: Order your food, most recommended the famous authentic kebab. I've tried their biryani, navratna, fried liver and many more, never to be disappointed.
Step4: Chat away with your company and wait eagerly for your food and enjoy the restaurant ambience.
Step5: Gorge down your food as soon as it comes cause you cant wait to dig in. Reason why I ve no pictures of it despite being here uncountable number of times.
Step4: Be content with the quick service, courteous staff and most importantly the food, and happily be off!
Edit: It was chelo kebabs and pictures are attached below!

This review was long due as I have been going to this joint since as long as I can remember way back into my childhood and no matter how many fancy joints pop up in Kolkata, this place has really stood the test of time. Chelo Kebabs and Sizzlers, nothing to really say about them as they have been every Kolkatan's all time favorites. But what I really like about this place is its ambience. There seems to be that certain air of colonial era which still exists and makes you nostalgic to think about the old 1960s Kolkata. Among the hustle and bustle of the crowd there still exists a certain serenity and you can still find a cozy corner in this dimly lit joint.¬†
Way to go Peter Cat, don't change a think about the way you are....

2014-12-01 18:44:36
Utsab Biswas
116213
3.5
I had heard a lot of good reviews and feedbacks of Peter Cat and its Chelo Kebabs and Sizzlers from my friends. But once I visited the place myself, I must say I was a bit disappointed.
The ambience was excellent. I ordered a Chicken Chelo Kebab .... It was really good dish , as the reviews said. But when I compared it to the price, I did not think the cost was justified. You can get better quality and quantity of foods in some other restaurants if you spend same amount of money.
And the service .... it was really not up to the mark. The service might not matter to some people , specially those who are regulars and used to it. But I felt very much annoyed the way the waiter hurried to get my card for bill payment and kept on standing there....... or the way he kept on waiting before us pointing the bill-book for tips !!! Generally I expect the waiter to leave the bill at our table and collect it by coming back after a couple of minutes and then collect the tips once we leave the table, but may be the Peter Cat waiters were not comfortable with the idea.
I rate Peter Cat 3.5 only for the ambience and food, as the service gets only 1.5 from me..

In festive season or on weekends it is very difficult to get a table if you didn't booked in advance.The service was really good.
It is still one of the must go destination in Park street.I will recommend this place to others,go and have a slice of the famous Chelo Kebab and relive some old Park Street.

##

2014-11-09 23:06:35
Darpa Narayan S
1617754
4.0
Another legendary and evergreen restaurant in the heart of parkstreet. Who doesn't knows the legacy and rich history of "Peter Cat". It is owned by Nitin Kothari, who is the owner of "Mocambo" as well. I am visiting this place for years now.  I was in kindergarden when i visited this place for the first time with my father. The decor and the attire of the waiters has a vivid similarity with that of Mocambo. But Peter Cat has its own identitiy and distinction cause of its  deligent hospitality and commitment towards quality offerings. I was introduced to "sizzlers" by my parents at this place and since then i never had a second thought of enjoying my plate of sizzler at some place else. Though they offer both north indian and continental cuisines but it is the north indian delicacies in which they specializes in. From the experience which i have gained after visiting this place for years their dishes which according to me stand out in the crowd are - chicken steak sizzler, grilled fish, chello kababs etc. These are the few dishes which you cannot think of eating any where else than Peter Cat. The uncompromising quality, unbeatable hospitality and the never changing ambience cements the legacy of Peter Cat in everyone's heart.
