2014-11-07 16:59:48
Shireen Ghosh
490701
5.0
Location: the Legendary Peter Cat is famous in Park Street, Kolkata. It is located on the street which leads to Loreto Collage and is right behind Flury‚Äôs and erstwhile Music World. On Weekends Peter cat become the most crowded restaurant. so you would have to wait for minimum half an hour for your turn. But i feel its worth waiting. you might have some problem in parking your Car on weekends but weekdays car parking is easily available.

Description: It is one of the oldest restaurants in Kolkata who still has maintained its charm, Pride and Reputation. It takes you to a different era as you enter Peter cat.¬†

D√©cor/interior/ Ambiance: You might feel that you have entered into the 70‚Äôs era as you step into Peter cat. The dim lights, low music, tall raj-style dressed waiters, red carpet, comfortable sofas and sitting arrangements make the ambiance perfect.   

Food ordered: I had ordered their famous Chelo Kabab (the Original)

Food experience: The Chelo Kabab platter comes with 2 types of Kabab, Rice with Butter, Poached Egg. The taste is awesome and very much different from any other Chelo Kabab from other restaurants. They donot compromise on the quality as well as the quantity of the food. The kabab's melt in the mouth. which is the best part.

Recommendation: Chelo Kabab, Saag Meat (Seasonal).

Pocket pinch: Very cheap and very pocket friendly.

Bon App√©tit

##

2014-11-07 13:58:09
Simran Kapoor
10591321
4.5
I went to Peter Cat two weeks back with a friend who was visiting Kolkata for the first time. We had reach at about 1pm to have lunch and had to wait for 15 minutes to get a seat (this raised my friend‚Äôs expectations- seeing the popularity of the place). I declared well before-hand that this is the place to be if you want to have amazing dining experience.  

We got a seat bang next to the entrance which was a let-down to both of us as every time the door opened for a guest, we could hear the unpleasant street madness. The waiting staff was very friendly and helped us with the menu. I ordered their specialty, "Chelo Kebab". I must say, it was one of the most beautiful presentations of mouth watering food that I have ever seen. First bite and it was full of flavor. 

My friend ordered the "Dum-Ki-Raan" and some Naan to along with it. These people really know how to slow a cook a mutton leg. It was tender and full of flavor. For drinks, we ordered beer and the best part was that it was served in antique looking metallic mugs. The manager told me that they are custom ordered to artists from Uttar Pradesh. These people really go the extra yard to give you the best experience. 

The ambiance was really nice and the place was well lit and welcoming. The guests were a mix of families, friends, business mates and couples. Highly recommend this place to everyone!

##

2014-11-06 16:13:50
Anurima Sen
19168
4.5
On my last visit to Peter Cat, we ordered the following:

Farah (delicately seasoned fish kababs)
Shikar (tender boneless pieces of mutton)
Afghani chicken
Keema nun
Sweet lime soda

There were three of us and we wanted to sample things that we had not ordered earlier. During our previous visits to this restaurant, I had mostly been limited to chelo and sizzlers (both of which taste really great). Enough and more has been written about the ambiance, so there is no point in reiterating what most people already know. However, this time around I noticed that even though the servers were courteous and well-mannered, they tend to hurry the customers a lot. It does take time to go through the enormous menu, and it does not help if your waiter is breathing down your neck!¬†

Moving on to the food - it was glorious. Every single bite of the fish kabab was juicy and infused with delicate flavours. Highly recommended. The mutton kabab was spicier than I expected it to be, but this too was a great choice for a starter. It was tender, smoky and tasted good. Even though these were dry in nature, I had no problem eating the kababs with my keema nun. The keema nun was soft, with a thick stuffing of mutton keema, and very filling. I was a bit let down by the Afghani, honestly. Perhaps the kababs had really surprised us with their textures and flavours, and we expected something great out of the Afghani as well. It was well cooked, the chicken was tender, but the gravy was nothing special.

Value for money: 4/5
Quality: 4.5/5
Service and Ambiance: 3.5/5

##

2014-10-23 15:06:25
PRITHVIJIT DEBNATH
907173
4.0
As you enter after the usual waiting period on the streets, just around the corner of Flury's and the erstwhile Music world of Park street, you are taken to a different era. The legendary Peter Cat is also co-owned by the owner of Mocambo, and there are lots of similarity in the interiors- semi dark with raj-style dressed waiters with strong personalities, soft carpet, low lights and well maintained haughtiness. But they store many large water containers between the main long hall and the small room at the back which mars the experience.
This time I met Ms.Aparna Sen, the famous actor/director and she too ordered as I did, the eponymous Chello kabab, which is the most famous dish of this restaurant. It's a Iranian dish and after taking it in many original Iranian restaurants, I may safely say that Peter Cat makes it much better for the Indian palate. The kababs are much better tasting. It's a dish of rice with butter, two sticks of Kabab, a chicken and a mutton, and some grilled veggies. Very satisfying and filling.
I have taken chicken liver, and prawn cocktail previously- both of which were pretty good, as was the ice cream cola. These guys are good in Indian mughlai and of course in continental dishes.
Service is good and fast.
For a gorgeous family feast, as well as tete a tete with special friends, Peter Cat is the place for every body.

They were really good and the chello kebab was wonderful. The ambience was amazing. It was full with sound of sizzlers everywhere. The dim lights were very suitable. We had a great tym there. But the prices were on a little higher side.

##

2014-10-22 13:18:43
Atreyee Biswas
525007
4.5
These people are the true legends!! I wonder how they maintain the same taste, texture and quality through ages...!!! The 70's decor.. the old staircases.. the dim light.. and the cat-shaped menu-card.. nostalgia defined!!

Peter cat was the obvious choice for my birthday dinner.. Bhetki Muniere being the obvious choice for starters.. Chelo Kabab and Chicken Steak Sizzler being the ones for main course!

Their serving time is amazingly less! Bhetki Muniere was served by 10mins.. along with the fresh lime soda and fruit cup, the mocktail.. Bhetki Muniere was an absolute bliss.. The cheesy affair with the fresh fish fillets make me fall in love with this place, every time! What I adore more about this dish is the sweet-n-spicy potato pieces served, instead of french fries.. I can swear by this dish, really!!!

The mocktail, Fruit Cup was a little strange to my taste.. Apple and papaya pieces put in a blend of soda and mixed fruit juice.. lacked the punch..

Chicken Chelo Kabab is my another favourite.. The buttered rice plays the perfect companion for the grilled veggies and the kababs.. The reshmi kabab was super-soft.. I always find the seekh kabab a little spicy, the reason for I love this dish!

Then comes the Chicken Steak Sizzler.. The spicy, tangy potato strips and the juicy, succulent chicken steak.. mindblowing!!

Peter Cat always makes us too full to try out any of their dessert items.. No exception this time too!! Will try to try their meringue someday, I hope!

2014-10-21 01:12:05
PG
335223
3.0
Everybody I know and their uncle recommended this place. "Oh you are going to Kolkata for work, you must eat at Peter Cat", they said.

Well, to check out what's the hype is all about, I called to make a reservation and was told - "we don't take reservation" (many places don't take reservations on weekend, so it is cool). I get to the place and am told there is a waiting for 45 mins. 'Must be damn good, if so many people are waiting,' I thought to myself. And so I waited among a large crowd.

Finally got a table and ordered food. The place still has decor from the raj era (I mostly guess, because the dim lighting makes it hard to see).

After some time, the famed chelo kababs came out of the kitchen. And they were worth the wait and exercise. Succulent, right balance of spice, and fulfilling portion size. ¬†Loved it, gobbled it. It was mind blowing.

And that is where the blowing of mind stopped. Rest of the food was very average. May be I was expecting too much because of the long list of recommenders, large crowd in the waiting, and the super entr√©e. But there wasn't anything worth writing and raving. The chicken sizzler was honestly garden variety.

The service was good, as you would expect from a place so highly recommended by everyone. Prices are reasonable.

But in the end... Peter Cat turned out to be a one trick pony.

##

2014-10-17 22:30:58
Kamalika Mukherjee
178472
4.5
I cannot say or comment about one of the oldest restaurants of the town. I say I am not eligible enough . But because I am here to review, this is what I can comment on.

Headed for PC at around 1.30 in the afternoon and happy , no waiting in queues. Smooth entry into the restaurant and wham!
A new world opened up in front of me. Identical like Mocambo.
Same old dim lighting, magical feel and yes the smell of delicious food in the air. Very charming and magical. As they say, Old is Gold.

Seated myself in 5 odd minutes and placed the order without even looking at the menu.
Yes, you got that right.

Chelo Kebab.¬†

The much famed iranian dish. The chicken version for me. And the mutton version for my friend. Cannot comment on his, but mine...well, read on.

In about 5 minutes, I saw this plate stacked with chicken kebabs, grilled tomatoes, capsicums and a cucumber. Buttered rice with an egg poach and two mutton seekh on the side. A lovely affair!

And did i tell you, the rice smelled of cinnamon and the taste, it was light and nice. Wallah!
I actually found the cinnamon on my plate.

The kebabs were pretty good, bite sized and the grilled tomatoes were good. I liked the right side of the place. Now, the mutton seekh which sat on the left.
Now, I've never tried mutton seekh before and honestly? I liked it. It was soft and tasted nice.

I really liked the chelo kebabs. And I'll sure be back for more.
One plate and you're stuffed. It is a big meal for a person and I happened to gobble down everything.

Well, blame my greed for good food!

Will be back for more,
Cheers!

##

2014-10-17 19:23:18
Namasee Ganguly
2307898
3.0
Recently went there with my family. It was a Sunday evening. Reached there at around 8 pm and found a long queue in front of us. So we put our name in the waiting list and had to wait for atleast 1.5 hours before getting a table. We went in and ordered a strawberry mocktail,fish makhmali and chelo kebabs. The mocktail was not at all good and was simply a strawberry milkshake. The fish makhmali was good but the chelo kebabs were horrible. The dish itself was not properly heated,such that even the butter refused to melt. My mom found a piece of eggshell in her egg and the mutton had an overdose of coriander and jeera powder. I had visited Peter cat many times before,but this time I was really disappointed with the food. The restro has fallen in standards,only the name remains.

##

2014-10-11 16:44:03
Bishal Naskar
1881514
4.0
Peter Cat !! The name says it all. It is one of the old heritages of Park Street and its popular for its legendary CHELO KABABS and mouth watering Sizzlers.¬†
Now coming to the ambiance. Its somewhat like the retro 60's atmosphere with dim lights, minimum decor and old days staircase. It remains packed up even in the weekdays during the busy office hours ........ u'll get to know by the long queue outside the restaurant almost everyday. So getting a table here without waiting is almost an impossibility,¬†
It was on DASHAMI this year when me and two of my friends visited this place. As normal, we had to wait for around 30 minutes before we got a table. BENGALI crowd dominated the place on that eve.¬†We all were hungry as hell, thus without wasting time we ordered their legendary Chelo Kabas and Prawn cocktail as an appetizer along with diet cokes.
The long wait was worth it on the basis of the quality of the food. They served our food within 10 minutes.
Chelo kabab - Peter cat serves the best chelo kabab in town. No doubt in that. It includes 2 mutton stakes,  6 chicken kebab,                               one grilled tomato, bed of rice and on top of that a poached egg 2-3 butter cubes at the side which adds more flavour. ¬†
Prawn cocktail - It was too too sweet for me and i felt too much of tomato in it for which i didn't liked it much. ¬†
Diet coke - Now what to describe about it :P
The quantity of the chelo kabab was enough for one's meal. The best part is that they maintained their quality of food even during the Puja time. The waiters were descent enough to explain each and every dish (if u ask them).¬†All in all a it was great (except the appetizer). Next time i visit here i am surely gonna try their Sizzlers.

I would have expected the server to talk more and engage more with the customer. Service was prompt. 
I was in the end more interested to run away from the place and didn't want anything more which I think isn't good for a restaurant. However, this restaurant is very mature operationally and do good at whatever they do. I hope the management becomes more professional and makes this place into a fine dining place. 

This place has a long history and a lot of potential which not being worked upon. As they operate now, this place will always exist but will never become great.

##

2014-10-05 20:13:33
Arghya Mallick
310662
4.0
Out of the busy street of Park st., this place is like a oasis. The old nostalgia type decor and the old days type uniform of the waiters makes you feel the heritage of this place. Some people may complain about the dark lighting of the place, but to my taste the dim lighting makes it even more romantic, and of course the tables are very well lit with lamps hanging from over the head. The sits are also very cozy. 
Now coming to food, the mythical Chello kebab, was overall good I must say, with the rice cooked to perfection, served with a piece of butter, topped with an egg, and sided with some vegetables; but the Kebabs itself, was not that mouth watering. In a plate of Chello kebab there are two types of kebabs, one is mutton and the other is chicken, and they both were good but nothing very special. But I must Confess that the overall platter was too good to look at, and it can also fill up ones stomach completely.
Coming to sizzler this place serves one of the best sizzlers in town. We ordered simple chicken steak, and it was delivered to us in a very beautiful wooden tray. The sizzling sound and again the look of the platter was awesome.¬† They know how to serve and beautify, I must tell. 
Though the bill was a bit of a pinch to the pocket, yet I must Say that think of this restaurant for any special event you wanna enjoy in an eatery. Peter Cat won't let you down any bit.

2014-09-19 14:13:13
Sukant Pandit
1417532
4.5
Its a sizzling place in park street. Just beside Au bon pain it looks plain from outside but the flock of people waiting,outside will tell you its sizzling hot inside.
If you happen to be in park street then this place should be on your list.
They serve one of the best sizzlers in town and probably any you might have had. Their taste and preparation are unique.
You may have regular food anywhere but if you are here then make sure to have a chef's special sizzler(non veg) and veg grilled steak.
Chelo kabaabs are just awesome here. The best. These both items are speciality and a must try.
Regular food is nice, but i can't comment as i was too engrossed in their specialty tastes. Nice interiors and a nice place for a couple to have a date. Slightly costly but each penny spent here is worth.

Don't miss this place

3.5
Peter Cat is one of the city's oldest establishments, with an atmosphere that harkens back to its early days in the 1960s. The dining room is intimate, with white stucco walls, Tiffany-style lamps, and soft lighting; the menu is a mixture of good Continental and Indian dishes, especially the tandoori fare.

I have actually lost count of the number of times i ordered a plate of their legendary CHELLO KEBAB and their HOUSE SPECIAL SIZZLER with liver,chicken sausages, sauteed vegetables.these popular dishes are now way beyond recommending ;)

Recently in a couple of experiences, i sampled some other dishes,of which DUM-KI-RAAN is a stand out dish. tender spiced mutton, the full plate of it has lots n lots to share for 6-7 persons.pair it up with the soft cheese nans..bliss!

CHICKEN MARAKESH is a similar dish as chelo,is as good if not better.i loved it as an alternative main course.

PRAWN COCKTAIL- this was disgusting! the cream sauce was tad too sweet, with a overpowering sour taste of tomato ketchup in it, we had to leave it after having a spoon each. Mocambo does this best!

FRESH LIME SODA lacked the punch,
for desserts the usual fare of CHOCOLATE BROWNIE WITH VANILLA ICECREAM & CHOCOLATE SAUCE, TRUTI FRUTI etc are nice.
The staff to be frank,are ill mannered.they indirectly ask for empting the tables even when the hours of rush are over.

p.s. the last time we occupied the corner table of 1st floor, n the fire alarm actually rang on serving the sizzler on table! funny indeed!! :p

3.5
PETER CAT.
My father shared me a story of my childhood related to this place.
I asked him to show me the cat because I thought this is a place for cats.

My parents celebrated my fifth birthday at this place which I don't remember at all. But I have a connection which takes me there every time I am confused of anything.

My favorite dish is not their Chelo Kabab but Bekti Munier. It is served with potatoes which is delicious in the mouth.
House Special sizzler, Grilled Fish, Grilled Chicken, Chicken Steak, Mutton Hamburger Steak, Dam-ki-run, I love them all.
Avoid trying prawn cocktail which I felt overhyped as per its presentation and name.
Finish with Souffle or Warm Brownie which fulfills the urge of good food.

The ambience is old class which is shouting for a complete renovation.
The food tastes excellent if you choose them with care.
The staffs are good not great.
The location is at the heart of Park Street which is easy to locate for any noobs.

I remember a blunder we did and for this we will only blame one of the waiter who took our order and did not guide us for our order even after asking. May be because it was Ashtami and they were too busy with the customers in the crowded restaurant. Now let's share the blunder with all: We had made a mistake of ordering Tandoori Broccoli and we thought we will be served Tandoori Chicken assorted with Broccoli leaves. :P Right after the dish was served, we were like... what the heck is this!! Lol. Two grilled broccoli leaves on a dish! It was so thankful of the other waiter who helped us out in changing the dish. 
The rest we had ordered were fantastic. Still I'd suggest all not to pay a visit to this place during the Puja time. Peter Cat is much better in the other seasons. 0.5 deducted for the silent waiter who doesn't care to open his mouth ever. :P

2014-09-09 22:20:30

4.5
Located just below Stephen court at Park Street this is the most loved restaurant of Kolkata! This restaurant needs no introduction,so I will directly share one of my experience giving priorities on food quality and quantity , service and ambiance.¬†
So, it was my brother's treat and we decided to go out for a family dinner , and what can be better than Peter Cat for this kind of events!¬†
We ordered, Whisky sour(for me) , Asperagus soup, ¬†2 chello kebab's (original) , 1 sizzling dum ki raan and 1 grilled bhetki with dinner breads.¬†

Food quality and quantity----->
Whisky Sour--- Made of syrup,lemon juice and whisky ¬†served in tumbler, well garnished with a cherry in bottom, I just ¬†loved it.
¬†Asparagus soup---- This was a pretty normal asparagus soup and there was nothing special in it.
Chello kebab-- Certainly Peter cat ¬†makes ¬†the best Chello in town, which includes 2 mutton stakes , ¬†6 chicken kebab,one grilled tomato, poched egg, rice with adequate butter cubes. This one is what Peter Cat is famous for and it is just wonderful!! A whole meal for one.¬†

Dum ki rann(sizzzler)-- This is a wonderful preparation of mutton and we all just loved it.

Grilled bhetki -- This includes 2 bhetki fillets, 5 roasted potatoes and other vegetables ( beans,carrots). The bhetki filled were served with a sauce which ruined its taste!! Well, we din't liked it.Ambiance------->¬†A dimly lit place, with comfortable chairs and sofas with lamp shed on each table, I just love Peter Cat's ambiance! Service---------> ¬†Coming to service, most of the staffs are well groomed while some needs serious English training! Again the service is fast, which we all like at Peter Cat.

2014-09-05 13:20:28
Shreya Banerjee
1256271
4.5
Peter cat. Will fall short of words on describing this place.
Park Street, the incredibly posh and fun-filled stretch of road in Calcutta, overflowing with restaurants, and surprisingly, most of them being top-class. That's where Peter Cat belongs, and nowhere else, and it lives up to its reputation!
Ambience: The atmosphere inside peter cat is dark, shadowy, and has an air of sophistication, mostly due to the age of the establishment as well as the crowd class. Remains crowded almost all the time. But the wait is fruitful when you take a seat and sizzlers come to your table.¬†

Food: The sizzlers and the Chelo Kababs! They alone are enough to satisfy everyone‚Äôs taste! It‚Äôs a guarantee that one will experience at least three sizzlers going to other tables during an entire meal at Peter Cat. The meat sizzlers contain sufficient amount of potato fries and salad to not make it totally meaty. The Chelo Kababs contain chicken and mutton kababs, rice, butter and salad. A perfect choice for someone who can‚Äôt decide which dish to take!

Something else worth mentioning is the drinks of Peter Cat. They must have an excellent bartender because their cocktails are amazing! Be it a Screwdriver, or a Gimlet, or a John Collins, it‚Äôs made perfectly, though people who drink regularly will probably find them too diluted.

Although this restaurant is famous for sizzlers and chelo kebabs, the cold chicken sizzler, fish fingers and fish kebabs r worth trying. My favourite family restaurant till date. Whenever my family arranges for any dinner-The 1st name that comes to mind is PETER CAT!
And not to forget, the staffs r cordial, they will make you feel comfortable when you reach a table.
A 4.5 from my side.

##

2014-09-01 21:36:09
Anupam Dutta
1577515
3.5
Food and location of this outlet overseeded all the other possible flaws that it incurs. Staff behaviour is not cordeal but won't give you a hard time either. Peter Cat can be thought of as a typical park street restaurant with excellent food and decent ambience with low light. 

I went there with few of my friends for celebrating a friend's birthday. First, they didn't take our booking over phone mentioning that its on first come first serve basis. We took a cake along with us. However, restaurant staffs strictly told us not to open the cake or do anything remotely close to a cake cutting ceremony. I won't be going back there for celebrating any occassion since without booking one has to stand there for at least 40 minutes on any weekend and in the end one will not be able to celebrate. 

We ordered chicken irani kabab and fish makhmali as starters. They wrongly served chicken reshmi kabab at our table along with the ones ordered which they apologise but added it to the bill. This, to my belief, is not at all a good etiquette. Fish makhmali was very soft, prepared with the right amount of spices. From the group of 7, there went orders for 5 chelo kababs (as expected), a house special sizzler and a cold chicken salad for main course.

While I need not speak about Chelo Kabab, the sizzler that I ordered was cooked to perfection. Chicken steak with mutton sausages provides an awesome combination and mouth watering taste. Definitely go for this dish if you are not craving for having the most talked about chelo kabab. Chicken salad from cold buffet menu wasn't bad either apart from the fact that there were lots and lots of mayo. Quantity was hefty, more than enough for a single person to finish it. 

Overall, it is always nice to be back at Peter Cat beacuse of the quality of food that it serves. And that is the sole reason why one will find 100 people queuing outside for more than an hour. The reason of not rating the outlet higher is due to the attitude of house staff which is far from friendly.

Peter cat, located right at the heart of Park Street,Kolkata needs absolutely no introduction. Its the most widely spoken about Resturant in the city. You would always come across that one person in kolkata who would not only suggest, but insist that you visit the legendary resturant, Peter Cat. First and foremost, it is EXTREMELY difficult to acquire a place here so you must probably go for prior reservations. While the Chelo kebab still reigns to be the signature dish, a personal favourite would be the Prawn cocktail. Its a cold and tangy dish and is highly recommended from my side. The sizzlers are great and simply delicious. The interiors are dim yet classy and the staff very efficient and courteous. Their service is quick and you don't have to wait long after your order is placed. This is one of the many resturants that truly defines kolkata and if you're here, a trip to Peter Cat is mandate :) Cheers!

##

2014-08-30 22:10:00
Swati C
5328591
3.0
Another of those coasting along on nostalgia places which isn't such a bad thing. Food memories are powerful and if Peter Cat is where you spent your glorious childhood and youth, nothing else would ever suffice. Too bad I was  a Persian food veteran by the time I entered Peter Cat and too bad I got steered towards the one Persian dish they attempt to make there. 



Chelo kebab - which in the Peter Cat version has a koobideh and shish kebab combination - is perhaps the most iconic Persian dish. Inexplicably, Peter Cat adds a fried egg on top of the rice which is definitely not traditional - there's never any fried egg in chelo kebab - only the kebab, rice (chelo), grilled tomatoes (and pepper), loads of melted butter on top of rice and sumac powder to sprinkle on top. Sometimes if you request, you can get a raw egg yolk to mix with your rice - but I'm yet to see an actual Persian person mix in the yolk - hello salmonella! 



So anyway - all this digression just to say that Peter Cat's chelo kebab is nothing like Persian chelo kebab. And if you've never had the real thing you actually might like this - it's not bad, not amazing, but not mediocre either. I've had more chelo kebab meals than I can count and have even made chelo kebab myself several times so this just doesn't cut it. Also, didn't grow up in Cal so the nostalgia factor  just isn't there.

2014-08-29 23:41:18
Deba
296230
4.5
Ok...This one's the pride of Calcutta and the jewel in the throne of the king of Calcutta foodies- Park Street. One thing to die for is the Chelo kabab. Its a complete meal in itself. I could not have anythig else after that. So I dont know a lot about the desserts. Another thing, the quantity is huge, so order one plate first and another one only when you deem necessary. Saves a lot of food that way. The world needs it! The menu is cool with the card shaped as the logo - Peter the cat. The interiors are a reminder of the old Calcutta dining culture. No music, faint jingling of the stainless steel crockery. The seating with heavy chairs and sofas and the dim lighting. The only advice would be to reach before 7 pm on weekdays to avoid being starved to death and never attempt to have food there on weekends! You would be standing (or if you're lucky sitiing on a stool) waiting like a beggar on the streets of Calcutta and by the time you get your plate, the hunger will faze out. -.5 for that :)

The name says everything for this legendary restruant. I have got special memories with PC. It made a special day very very special, my b'day.
Anyone wants to get a real taste of some great food, this is the place you should drop into without a second thought in your mind. ##

2014-08-25 23:23:51
Hulkyfulki
2108074
1.0
I recently moved to Kolkata and being a foodie, I did my homework about good food here. Almost everyone who is from Kolkata said that if I do not eat at Peter Cat, then i would miss the best food Kolkata serves. This raised my expectations very high. I Was really excited to eat at Peter Cat but I was highly disappointed.
The very famous Prawn Cocktail tasted more like tomato sauce and mayonnaise. The prawns in the cocktail were just okay. Not juicy at all.
Then I ordered a cocktail which was served to me with a fly in it. It was replaced but it has killed my mood for good food by then. The Chelo kabab quality was very good but didn't taste great. 
I got Very disappointed with the food, we tried to order something regular. We ordered the sizzler and were told that the sizzler in Peter Cat is just a piece of meat, no mashed potato/rice/noodles but we could order a bread roll separately. Frustrated by then we ordered the Bread roll which was just bread. We couldn't finish the steak as the meat wasn't cooked properly and had to order a egg mayonnaise salad just to fill up our stomach. Surprisingly, the salad was quite filling but not satisfying for the taste buds. The fish steak was decent, nothing spectacular.
I was disappointed with the service as well. The servers kept bumping into customers, spilling food everywhere. 
I would never go back to Peter Cat again after this horrible experience.

##

2014-08-25 17:28:34
Prateek Patodia
1442767
3.5
So after hearing much about the legendary place, yes, its shameful that a Calcuttan like myself has visited for the first time yesterday. Needless to say the visit was much to ones liking. The welcome however was not great but I dont blame them considering that people were still showing up at 2.30 PM for a waiting of 30-40 minutes. So maybe my opinions on the overall experience took a hit since I had waited for 40 min for what was simply a 'hit the spot' sunday lunch.
Having visited with my wife, we called for an Iranian Kebab, the chicken steak sizzler and the Tandoori Sizzler. Not wishing to be harshly critical, but the Iranian Kebab tasted barely Iranian but then I was comparing it to my experience with the real deal I had been eating for a week last year in Tehran. This brought me to take my gaze to the neighboring table to see the legendary Chelow Kebab. Again, drawing comparison to my experience last year and seeing the missing mix of saffron rice and the overdose of masala and veggies in the chicken kebab, I decided this dish may be for some other time.
This was followed by the sizzlers which were very satisfying. the chicken steak sizzler was presented with a healthy topping of brown sauce but some of the stock and red wine flavour was missing. The steak however was beautifully cooked. The portion overall was however a little small. The serving only had one moderate sized steak and the serving of potatoes and veggies could have been better. It was however perfectly cooked and piping hot and tasted great if you choose not to nitpick the fine details.
The Tandoori Sizzler was rather good. The serving size was excellent and coupled with a naan I had a great feast with the misses digging in for a few bites. The mutton sheekh was excellent, the chicken was beautifully cooked and tasted great. However my experience was let down due to a few points though. First, the prawn wasnt properly shelled, the lamb must have been an off cut or something as it was very difficult to find any meat on it, there was only half a boiled egg (expected atleast one) and something that may not appeal to many others is the chicken liver. My wife accidentally popped a bite and immediately spat it out although I dont really mind it. Also the piece of the fish kebab was really small.
The service was as you would expect from any park street eatery but my overall experience was really let down due to the ambiance and the desserts. The place in todays age seems positively shady. The decors nice and could do well with simply better lighting. The desserts on the other hand were horrendous. To be fair I was recommended to have the tutti frutti but I went for an off the menu caramel souffle which was pathetic. Even the fruit beverages were rather poor.
If I was to rate the food alone it would be a solid 4 but the overall experience had mixed feeling throughout so without any breakups I think this is a fair remark but the place is definitely worth more visits.

##

2014-08-24 14:49:46
Arunima Banerjee
303254
5.0
Peter Cat is not just a restaurant, it is an emotion for me! Every time I go to Calcutta, the first pointer on my to-do list is to visit Peter Cat and eat their sizzler and taste their chello kebab. This review is based on one such recent visit.

Ambiance:
Peter Cat cannot be empty post 8. If you don't like queues, reach there at around 7-ish. Dim lamps hanging over each table, faint sounds of cutlery and people talking everywhere. It's like an evening party in that place every time I go. You get your seat and stare into the cat's face that's printed on the sheets that are kept on the table. Yes, I do that.

Food:
I skip through everything in the menu to jump to the part where there are sizzlers and Chelo Kebab. One House Special Sizzler and a Chelo Kebab 'The Original'. The sizzler sizzles its way through to your table. Huge chicken steak topped with potato fries, veggies, sausages and egg, with a base of cabbage leaf. A tiny portion of salad on the other side with pepper. All of this is dipped into a delicious sauce! This is a must, must, must-have. Up next is my lesser favourite dish, Chelo Kebab. The Kebabs are to die for. The rice butter with the egg is a treat for us bongs. However, last time the mutton kebab was a little chewy but everything else made up for it.¬†

Service:
The waiters are quick and nice. They can tell you about the dishes and they sure have good recommendation skills. Super-reasonable food, after all it's Calcutta!

There was a time when dining out meant Peter Cat for me. One of the most famous dinning places in Calcutta and it does live up to its reputation. I am more of a fan of its ambiance than its food actually. My usual order is a House Special Sizzler and I just love the texture and sauce. Fish fry/fingers are good but a little bland. Do not ever try Tandoori Mixed Grill, it disappointed me so badly that I had stopped visiting this place for a long time. And they really need to make the Chello Kebabs a little more softer.Pocket Pinch would be Rs 1500 for meal for two w/o liquor.Weekend visits would mean waiting in the queue for near about half an hour.

All said and done, this place is a Legend and will always be one. So its a MUST VISIT.

2014-08-21 16:47:18
Madhumanti Sanyal
3712451
2.5
The interiors of this restaurant definitely speak of how old it is, with quaint red lamps hanging over vintage wooden tables. However, I definitely do not feel comfortable when restaurants are so dark and mysterious. For one, you don't get to see the varied colours of the food that you have in front of you. Anyway, most of the people in the large group that I went in, decided to order either of Chelo Kebab, their famous Iranian dish, or Chicken Tandoori sizzler. The Chelo Kebab is a very comforting food, with blobs of butter melting into soft rice, while you may at times bite into the little kebabs on one side of the plate, or cut into the fried egg, which was somewhere between an omelette and a sunny-side-up, on the other. This dish surely fills you with a deep sense of satisfaction, though it does not really stand out in terms of taste. The chicken sizzler which I tasted, had too much of an Indian taste in the curry to go with the boiled vegetables that were served. The desserts were a disappointment, as they managed to go wrong with even Chocolate Viennetta. Never before had I tasted chocolate ice-cream which was so hard to cut into, even after I had waited for long, or so tasteless. Surely I had expected a far better experience, considering the hype that surrounds this restaurant.

##

2014-08-19 22:30:13
Sutanu Roy
1182524
4.5
So I dare to review one of Kolkata's legend, finally on my (I lost count)th visit to the place. Dropped by on a Saturday evening with a bunch of friends just before rush hour. We started of with a few cocktails(Planters Punch, Peter Cat Cooler and Amazonia), fish makhmali kebab(moist and melt in your mouth pieces of fish, 5 pieces seemed too less), becky muniere(beckty fillets grilled and served in cheesy white sauce with veggies, the edges of the fillets a bit chewy but the middle as tender could be, the sauce is just perfect) and grilled chicken sizzler(a classic sizzler of 2 chicken pieces with veggies, feel like going on and on). Once we were done with the amazing starters(or so we treated them as) we just could not wait for the main course, so it was chicken chelo kebab(the usual), chicken marakesh(tried this dish for the first time, almost like the chelo except the reshmi is a bit different tasting-good different, and instead of the poached egg they serve a minced meat filled chicken over the buttered rice) and a mixed grill sizzler(again a classic of chicken, mutton, prawn, liver etc in a tasty gravy sizzler served with veggies, though the one piece per item leaves you wanting for more). So we gobble everything up as if hungry for days, but we are just not willing to leave(though the steward tried his best to make us leave, bringing the bill to the table at one point). So we went on to order the baked chicken(diced chicken in cheese with onions, capsicum and tomatoes baked to a juciy, awesome, heavenly perfection) and small pegs of smirnoff and just kept on relieving the experience.

But finally it was time to leave, though we wanted to keep on tasting those amazing dishes but our stomachs would not permit. 

Just an amazing place which never disappoints, deducting the .5 because of the pushy arrogant nature of the waiters and stewards(though it was peak hours it is granted but we expect a bit better).

2014-08-19 11:09:57
Ayan Ghosh
1163674
5.0
Peter Cat is a restaurant that probably needs no introduction of reviews. The sheer number of patrons who vouch for Peter Cat is enough to say that this is one of those restaurants that have achieved cult status. 
I remember going to Peter Car since when I was 5 years old. This hissing and crackling sound of sizzlers would leave me awe-struck. At that point of time, the whole thing of so much sound and fumes coming out of a food was all that I can fondly remenber. Now, I'm matured enough to appreciate taste. The chicken steak sizzler is still my favorite. My only complaint is that over the years, the size of the steak has reduced quite a bit. The chello kebab is another house favorite. 
I remember taking a friend of mine from Holland to Peter Cat a few months back. He w went crazy about the Fish Makhmali kebab and the chicken reshmi butter masala. 
My parents simply adore the prawn cocktail and the fish munniere. Infact, my father has been a regular to Peter Cat since the part for decades. I guess very few restaurants has such a tradition to keep up to and I feel happy that Peter Cat still manages to impress me as it did when I first visited the place some 23 of years back.

2014-08-17 20:13:58
Sayan Ganguly

4.5
Peter Cat perhaps would be the one iconic restaurant in the heart of Park Street that can very well represent the dotty foodie nature of Kolkatans. For starters, one has to wait for at least 20 -30 minutes to get a table. Sadly, they don‚Äôt take reservations over the phone, so it does not get any easier. However, it is always worth the wait as the food and ambience is amazing. The dim-lilted interiors along with the lip smacking food make up for the waiting time. The must try on the list is of course, the chelo kebab, the mixed sizzler, chicken Marrakesh and the grilled fish. A pint of beer (served in their legendary heavy weighted silver plated beer mug) or the cocktails complements the food well. 

I had been living outside Kolkata for quite a few years and every time I came back to Kolkata for a vacation, Peter Cat was right there on my ‚Äòplaces to visit‚Äô list. A late lunch (to avoid the usual lunch time queues) with the closest of my friends along with some beer always lifted my spirits!

Yeah. It's Peter Cat. A lot has been said already. Numerous visits have been made. I have always made it a point to visit at odd times so that I dint have to wait!! 4pm for lunch or 7pm for dinner!! Cross that line and you may as well be prepared to wait for an hour!! I am not someone who is prepared to wait that long for food!!

The kebabs are downright delicious. Every single one of them. My favourite is the Mutton shikari. The Chicken Marakesh is another favorite. 
You can be choosy, picky,fastidious. But one thing is sure if you are a kolkatan you can not ignore Peter Cat.

A legendary place no doubt... Have been eating here since the last 25years with my family and still am biased towards this place thought sometimes nowadays it becomes a bit inconsistent towards its quality and quantity.. My eternal favourite are the Chello kebabs and Chicken Marakesh.. I dont like the sizzlers here much.. Mocambo serves better ones but i would like to mention The tandoori mixed grill sizzler .. I just love the sauce.. Amazing taste.. The kebabs are really good spclly the Mutton Shikaar kebab and Chicken irani kebab..goes very well with the Cocktails.. To end the meal, have their Tutty fruity icecream.. an eternal fav :)

##

2014-08-04 12:30:41
Rohan Poddar
330137
3.5
Every restaurant has its highs and lows. Peter Cat is symbolic of the Old Calcutta charm but in recent times, it has failed to live up to its name. A connoiseur of good food would be able to spot the change in quality of the food over the years. It is imperative on part of these restaurants to constantly monitor the quality of their servings. Considering the fact, that these are not any other fast food joint or run-of-the-mill restaurant, they must pay greater heed. Peter Cat is still a great crowd puller for its Chello Kebabs, but I was thoroughly dissapointed with what was served. The kebabs were dry, the rice hardly had butter and it seemed as if the food was served with haste.
People look forward to eating here because these are heritage places reminiscent of delectable Calcutta food. They need to buck up.
P.S : All those who have not been here, its a must visit. Avoid weekends.

##

2014-07-28 12:51:02
Paromita Saha
51466
5.0
I do not remember the number of times this place since my birth. This restaurant will take you to the era of the seventies when Park Street was frequented by the Bourgeoisie. It has become a heritage restaurant which is a must visit place if you are on a visit to the city of joy. The most popular dish is Chelo Kabab (both veg & non veg). It is a persian dish which is served with Persian rice with butter, mutton sheekh kababs, chicken rashmi kababs, an omlette. The rice along with the butter melts in your mouth to give you an ambrosial feel. even when i am writing this review my mouth is watering thinking of the aroma and taste of the chelo kabab. The other favourite dishes of mine are Veg au grating and chicken steaks. 
Several waiters and stewards have been there forever... ready to serve you your favourite items from the menu of the restaurant.

All time favourites are
Chelo kebab - pure bliss in form of different kebabs n rice n butter n egg.. Full meal by itself 
Prawn cocktail - a cold dish served in a glass.  Heavenly to the last spoon
Mixed sizzler - if u happen to sit near the serving area,  ull see a sizzler come out every 2 mins.  I like the mixed grill sizzler the mos which has everything 
Fish muniere - when I want to try different, I have this.  Yummy fish cooked perfectly 
Caramel custard - one of the best in town
All in all,must try

##

2014-07-19 20:12:29
Aman Sonthalia
913636
4.5
I thought of giving it 5 but the possibility of achieving perfection restricts me from doing , so I settle with 4.5 
Sometimes being a critique you start thinking of negatives , but if someone says that about Peter Cat I assure that person is nitpicking . 
Coming to the basis of reviewing  I rate based on food , ambiance and service . Value for money is just a mere function of the above with a positive relationship.
Getting started with the food I must say that being a Vegetarian you more often than not have few dishes to order . So keeping the limitation in mind I would rate it as one of the best North Indian food serving restaurant. That's pretty subjective I suppose but you gotta taste it to believe me. 
Since I order a fixed menu,out there my usual choices are Chelo Kebab , Sizzlers, Tomato Soup. If its not sufficient go for  the basic Indian order . The taste of the former dishes are distinct and you surely exercise your taste buds and trust me this is a workout we would all love. 
Without getting too much rhetorical and coming to the ambiance its my favorite. The dim lights and the dark surroundings makes it a good combination. I simply don't like Italian marbles with too much lighting hitting your eyes. So full marks for its decor.
Service is good and it hardly matters when you go for dinners . 

So is it value for Money, I think so it is and plz don't listen to those who say for vegetarians its not ideal.

We found Peter Cat food is not as great as it appears to be on Zomato. We ordered Dum Ki Run and Fish Makhmali Kebab for starter followed by Chello Kebab and Tandori mixed grill sizzler for two people. The portion size was generous. However, all the foods were very salty except Makhmali kebab which was also the best among all. Contrary to the legend of Chello Kebab, I found it a simple assortment of butter rice, Sheek Kebab and Chicken kebab. The Sheek kebab was very ordinary. Though the chicken kebab was better than the Sheek. The sizzler although was visually very appealing but taste wise was not something to die for. However, the ambience was good and so was the service.

Located in Park Street - Peter Cat  is one of the oldest & prestigious restaurants of Kolkata.

Almost every foodie in kol knows this place so i am not writing anything abt its 70's like decor & atmosphere which is obviously great. 

The menu is extensive the golden cat shaped menu card still stays same as it was yrs ago.

The vegetarian food didn't had too many option in sizzlers. In fact to b precise only 2 option are available. V ordered both vegetarian steak sizzler looked amazing but tasted okay. Nothing great. But other was good .

Serving time is quick and drinks were served almost immediately after order r u. The temperature was just perfect. Waiters were friendly . 

Overall not a bad experience.

Ambience: Ambience is not bad. Dim lights, simple music, simple decor and giant traditional staircase. I rate it 3.5/5.

Service: Very good service. Got prompt responses from over-burdened waiters, because I went there in peak time. I rate it 4.0/5.

Overall I would say, do visit but do not order sizzlers.

3.5
Peter cat is synonymous with long queues. It is situated right in the bustling Park street and very easy to locate. I am new in this city.However, have always heard about and its signature dish'Chelo Kebab'platter since a long long time. This is on my wishlist as soon as I shifted to this city and more than eager to experience the magic. It was a saturday and it made it more busier than ever. We,four of us, got in after a wait of almost 2 hours. The ambiece felt iconic. Right from the dim lighting interior to the dress code of the staff transported me to the colonial times. I was astounded to see the number of people sitting inside and hogging into their plates. As expected,we ordered the ever famous chelo kebab. But, I was ghastly taken aback!! The disj to me tasted next to other ordinary dishes. The mutton seekh kebab was too dry and flavours didnt do much to me. Overall, it seemed overhyped and overrated to me. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I guess it used to be that oh!so mouthwatering and delicious before.But, for  a first time taster, it drowned completely.

##

2014-07-07 15:32:41
Samali Gupta
1968516
1.5
My friend and I visited Peter Cat on 1st June 2014. While billing, my friend's debit card was swiped twice by the person at the counter and he ended up paying double the sum. When it was brought to the notice of the management, they casually replied that these types of error are common and that the money would get refunded within 72 hours. After a week, when the money was not credited back to the account, we went to meet the manager. A person named Hansel told us that we have to wait for 15 days to get the money back since we had used a debit card and that they would talk to the bank to hasten the process. My friend again contacted the restaurant on 3rd July 2014 when he was told that he was misguided about waiting for 15 days, but since it has been more than a month, a letter has to be sent to the bank and then only, the money can get credited. He is still waiting to hear from the bank and the restaurant.
       It makes me wonder how such a reputed restaurant can be so callous towards their customer. They should know that their responsibility does not merely end with the food. A casual dinner ended up as a harassing and stressful experience that we had not anticipated. I don't think I will ever visit the place again.

The wait was a total of 90 MINUTE PLUS (despite turning up at 19:20 Hrs.) and of course no waiting area. So we were standing there waiting for our turn in the streets, sweating profusely because almost any PARK Street joint refuses to take down the number of a customer and give a call or sms when the seats are available (Why Do that? Let these poor humble customers suffer and yes it‚Äôs a SIN cause you are at PETER CAT in all GENTS groups let them suffer more. It kinda gives them pleasure and definitely heightens their ever-growing false pride and ego). Initially the manager said 20-25 minutes wait, which I thought decent enough in any park street joint but eventually the waiting period kept on increasing and then finally came our turn after some 90 ODD MINUTES. 
‚Ä¢	AMBIENCE: As Expected it was good. People eating and chatting in a joyful manner (read noisy), and yes definitely they conquered there way in the holy PETER CAT. We were made to sit at the last possible corner of the ground floor. Thank God the AC was working (nothing else matters after the wait).
‚Ä¢	SERVICE for food: Again a lot of waiting which is natural considering the restaurant jam packed (it‚Äôs a common scene in any park street joint so cant really complain).
‚Ä¢	FOOD: Ordered Beckti Meuni√®re: The quality of fish was good but the taste overall was very mediocre. 
                              Baked Chicken: Taste very plain, I‚Äôve had better baked chicken at other places including my home. The dish wasn‚Äôt that creamy. It felt pretty normal, nothing special considering the hype of PETER CAT.
                               Some Veg Dishes like cauliflower roasted and one other item. I didn‚Äôt taste them so cant really comment and 
                              Non-Veg Chelo Kebab: It‚Äôs the most hyped dish here. It basically consists of Rice, Butter, Minced Mutton kebab made on Skewers, Chicken Kebab (Boneless cooked again in skewers as a piece with green pepper and onion in between slices) and Egg sunny side up placed carefully over rice. This was the only thing that cheered us up a little I guess because of the beautiful presentation. The Platter looked marvelous. It was a perfect plate with Meat and Rice to devour. The taste however was again good but not the best of the kebabs. Anyone who‚Äôs a fan of lucknow Kebabs will agree to what I said. All in all it was a visual delight mainly.

To SUM UP the whole experience of PETER CAT turned sour mainly because of the extremely poor management. One may say that I could have left the spot for some other restaurant but the manager kept us waiting in the lieu of offering us a seat very soon and by the time we realized it was already 20:00 hrs. which automatically means there would be rush hour in other joints of park street, so we were all trapped by the cunning manager.
I request the Peter Cat management to kindly change their ridiculous philosophy of treating men different from mixed group or ladies only group(be it large group with mixed sexes or ladies only, all were given preference without even thinking twice about the group of 6 waiting right next to the door). ##

2014-07-04 10:54:05
Rahul Ghoshal(Bongali Dada In Hyderabad)
88214
4.5
Finally after much wait we were able to visit the much famous "PETER CAT" located in the busy Park Street. The cool ambiance was an immediate relief from the humidity outside and we were quickly escorted by a pathan dressed attendant to a table nearby. Without much delay we ordered for a fresh lime soda, chelo kebab and a "house special sizzler" , two of its talked about specialties.  The Fresh lime arrived first , quite fresh and tangy and was gulped down quickly. The Chelo kebabs lived up to their expectations and are infact a meat  lovers delight. The kebabs were well prepared with the right amount of spices and were presented well with a portion of rice and half fried egg laid neatly over the platter. The kebabs were quite juicy and well cooked. The sizzler was served hot attracting onlookers from nearby tables adjusting their sights to the sizzling noise as it made its way to our table. The sizzler was decent and was well cooked. The chicken sausages added a spicy tinge to the otherwise buttery chicken in the sizzler. The portions of both the dishes were adequate to fill up a hungry human.  Overall a pleasant experience with quality food and hospitable staff. A place not very heavy on the pocket but offering a good family ambiance. We look forward to visiting the place soon again.

##

2014-06-28 22:06:14
Shashank Chiripal
119255
4.0
I had to go to Peter Cat almost 5 times in the last three months to be sure that the review that I give them is based upon consistent experiences of their food and service. The first experience was too good to be true so I just had to be sure.

The place has a HUUUUUGGGGEEEEE queue at almost every time unless you turn up really early in the evening. There have been a couple of times where I have had to wait almost an hour. Every single time, the wait has always been worth it. I will not talk about their service, which is not BAD, but isn't anything to write home about either. They know they will always sell no matter how good or bad the service they provide, is. Do not go here if you are expecting service. You may not have to wait more than ten minutes for your drinks. OR you may just have to wait more than half an hour to give your order after you're seated. Their food though, is an entirely different story.

Their Indian Mughlai food is good. I was able to taste some of their vegetarian staples like Dal, Paneer and Rotis, etc. but they have been consistently good. All their chicken and vegetarian sizzlers were wonderful with just the right quantity and flavours...they've been wholesome and hearty meals I have enjoyed everytime I tried them. However their Chelo Kebabs are absolutely fantastic. Most of the time I have had their Chicken Chelo Kebab staple which is the reason why this restaurant is well known. The portions are enough for one person as long as you don't make the mistake of ordering entrees. The kebabs are always perfectly cooked with the right balance of flavours. The combination of the kebabs, rice and salad in single mouthful is absolute genius on the palate. I say Chicken Chelo Kebab STAPLE because that is what sells the most here...unfortunately.

What motivated me to write this is this - their Mutton Chelo Kebab is simply the best 'combo meal' I have had till date. The mutton kebab is absolutely melt-in-mouth with (and I cannot stress this enough) the PERFECT amount of spices and marination in the meat. On previous occasions I had only ever ordered the Chicken Chelo Kebab, and because the standards it had set were so high that I was wary of trying anything else...but I was so glad that I did.

I am now converted, and if you haven't had their Mutton Chelo yet, I'm sure when you do, you will be too.

##

2014-06-28 03:20:55
Sayan Guha
1173510
4.0
One of the best restaurent in park street area to taste the vintage calcutta. the inside ambience, stuff's wardrobe will give a feeling of the heritage city. Regarding food, i have tried chelo kabab, chicken marakesh, fish sizzler, chicken sizzler, roast chicken, grilled fish. every food items are very tasty. still i would suggest to must have sizzler, marakesh and chelo kabab over here, it's like they are the pioneer of these dishes in kolkata. in drinks, they have a very descent menu. i never heard "sir, we don't have this drink" from them. 
considering the cons, their price is on a higher side, but they never compromise with the taste and quality. also the biggest problem is, if u are planning to go on weekends, u have to wait around one hour in the waiting queue. but still my recommendation is "must go", else u are really going to miss something...

2014-06-23 20:07:34
Varsha Ray
1620124
4.0
One of the pillars of the food mecca of the city , I cannot even remember the first time I visited the place. All I can remember is , nagging my cousins with the question Why is the restaurant named after a cat and being too afraid to touch the sizzler imaging it would be dead hot ! (Stupid me :( ) Family celebrations , Nabami lunch , cousins gathering .... Peter Cat it was and it is .In spite of new eating places coming up in the city that is lost in its own time , I  seem to have a bias towards this place.

The white walls , the maroon carpet , the old stair case , the dark interior , the contrasting dim lights , sizzle sounds and a low hush-hush........ this is how I would describe Peter Cat to a first-time-in-Calcutta-n. Me and my 3 other friends... S,P and another S visited PC today in the afternoon for lunch.After a 3 min wait , we were given a table upstairs.We ordered our usual - Chelo Kebabs and Steak sizzler.They took quite some time to serve us our food but since its PC , never-mind !! The Chelo Kababs were fantastic as usual .... but what disappointed me ...was their chicken steak sizzler.The chicken wasn't soft enough and the sizzler totally lacked taste. Not the kind I expected to have.The last time I had the dish,the chicken had a soft juicy taste to it which was completely absent today.

For desert , we ordered the brownie with vanilla ice-cream and hot chocolate sauce.They serve the sauce in a small copper kettle like thing , which is great to look at. The dish was perfect with the wafer in it and the brownie was pretty soft .So...kudos to it !!!!

Peter Cat is a place beyond comparisons and beyond reviews.So .... wateva it is ...its a must visit place for every Calcuttan !!

Peter cat the name us so familiar ever since your childhood but never expected to be a restaurant on a hustling busting street with long cues groups of people waiting to dig inside and call it a meal in the heart of the city Park Street. The restaurant stays full from the time they open till they close. Its an old place who has been catering to a million by now and now connected emotionally to a million. They serve seriously good food and make you enjoy your gala time. I had ordered the special dish which has an equal legacy as to the place
 " Chelo Kebabs" My apprehension as a punjabi could not make me understand the presentation of the dish and neither the  combination,but once it went to the mouth it touched down straight to my heart and that to very hard.Steamed rice with Seekh kebab and Malai tikka with dollops of table butter and sunny side egg as a garnish the combo is a divine and meal is a hit. Peter cat is also famous for their Chinese delicacy and fruit beer. But to all the first timers if kolkata then Peter cat and if Peter cat then
 " Chelo Kebabs " .

Keep hunting on the ground for a delectable palate.

Cheers

##

2014-06-17 20:43:14
Shreya Som
447424
3.5
The legendary Peter Cat at Park Street. Its no use being a foodie and living in kolkata,if one has not visited the Peter cat. 
Peter Cat has been serving kolkata's foodies for more than 70 years. 
So i bumped into one weekdays afternoon for lunch with my friend. 
The red lights and the old staircase just adds the feel of old times. 
But for me it seemed like a average restaurant. Very average decor only the hanging lights were impressed me.
The place feels a bit low maintained , and i hope that they would upgrade their decor and also retained there 70s feel but with a modern twist. 
Coming to the foods we were two people,so we ordered chicken steak sizzler and there famous " Chelo kabab ".
The chelo kabab was average, it didn't tasted any good, apart from nicely decorated presentation. The rice was simple butter rice comes with kababs and pouche on the top with a portion of salad ( But the butter rice was great ) 
Next the Chicken steak sizzler which was served quickly. The strange thing is that they don't serve bread with the sizzler which was bit surprising to me.. The sizzler tasted good but nothing great. 
The service was quick,but the waiters wasn't t friendly.The price was quite decent, for two people with alcohol it cost about 1500.
Overall to me this restaurant is over hyped place to eat in Park Street surely have better place than this.


Rating -
Expenses - 4/5
Ambience - 3/5
Food -3/5
Service -3/5

##

2014-06-17 17:03:10
Abhishek Pal
2797818
5.0
I have been to this restaurant almost 20 times.Three words to sum up this entire restaurant would be brilliant,exquisite and  authentic.Brilliant service,exquisite decoration and ambience and the food is simply delicious.
As a matter of fact I have grown up with this place,and remember almost every moment I have spent here-be it a date,with my family or friends.
The reception at this restaurant till the time you leave (though you will never feel like) is simply outstanding. Speak of its brilliance,talk about its food, Peter Cat tops the list any day.
Initially the Prawn Cocktail used to be my favorite when I was in the 5th grade or so,but my choices changed as I began to explore their delicacies.
The Chelo Kebab was the first one that fell in my hands,and I can proudly say that nobody on this planet an make the Chelo Kebab in a super manner like this restaurant.
If this is your first time at Peter Cat never miss the two dishes I just mentioned.Otherwise opt for the Chicken Sizzler if you wish to.The quantity of food is quite good at this restaurant.The bar requires a little makeover thou, but otherwise its a 5/5 for me.

People queued at the entrance shout saying ‚Äúhow long do I have to wait?‚Äù There is no need for it, as there are numerous other restaurants now in Park Street. The food quality has deteriorated, but the crowd keeps increasing day by day. The wait of 1 ‚Äì 2 hrs is not worth it. Drains out the excitement and energy of spending a nice time with your closed ones.
Nevertheless, the famous Chelo Kebab is something I definitely need to have when I go there. Sizzlers are not great as before, but decent enough at the price they offer.  I love their Mixed Tandoori Sizzler.

Cost for 2 in my case: 700 approx (without alcohol), 1200 approx (with alcohol).

##

2014-06-13 01:49:20
Abhirup Basu
2790944
4.0
One of the top 3 restaurants in the Park Street area, in terms of recognition....The place has become somewhat of an legend for the youth of Kolkata...good to take a girl, u wanna impress...warm and cosy atmosphere with just the right amount of chic...the cocktail list deserves a 2nd look with its quirky descriptions of classic mixes...the chello kebab is something that is always cooking in the kitchen... The food menu is short one, im impressed by a restaurant which is so famous and has been keeping it short and simple in terms of menu for such a long time. It means they mean business... The 1st dish- The Bhetky Meuniere, wasn't impressive at all.... The dried out, just over fish fillets were served with cheeze that's just enough to coat the fish...on one side...the butter lemon and parsley combination of the Meuniere was strangely missing....the only hint of freshness was the small slice of lemon on the top for decoration....the sides were equally uninteresting.... The potato was under, and size that looked a bit gross....beens and carrot made up the rest of the the dish.... Next came the Tandoori Prawns.... I have to say it that's a new version of the age old classic. A spice staffed prawn with just a bit more shell than I like, and with a taste that reminds u more of chicken reshmi butter masala than a tandoori smoky earthy seafood. The quantity on the plate was good. Next came the signature classic chellobkebab...the standard quantity of rice with a couple of mutton seekh kebabs, Chicken sasliks, some butter cubes and a poached egg to top it all...the dish was as usual perfect.

2014-06-10 11:58:59
Srilagna Chatterjee

5.0
Been here a dozen times and this is one of those places which hardly needs a review. An excellent place to go for a meal whether you are with your family or friends. The low lighted ambience and quick and polite  service is highly commendable and the food served is probably among the best found in the city. The menu presents a variety of  continental and north Indian choices my personal favorites being the Chelo Kebab platter and the Chicken Steak Sizzler. They also serve several innovative desserts which add to your satisfaction after an excellent meal. Overall it is cost effective and one of the places you just have to visit if u r in d city. The only bad thing is you can never get a place here without waiting but believe me when I say the wait will be definitely worth it. 
Conclusion: its simply awesome <3
So go and give it a try foodoholics!

2014-06-10 08:10:35

696049
5.0
Peter Cat is famous for Chelo Kebab. Now Chelo kebab is the national dish of Iran. Here it consists of steamed rice(with a blob of butter),egg poach, kebabs and salad. Along with that we ordered Tandoori Mix Grill(sizzler), Masala Kulcha, Mutton Rogan Josh, Chicken Shahi Korma and Biryani Ala Nawabi(chiken biryani).

Each and every food were equally delicious, mouthwatering and extremely yummy!
The biryani's chicken was boneless(served two big pieces and an egg). Their service was amazing. We were served very nicely and we totally enjoyed the meal.

P.S. Please try their biryani because it is totally out of the world!

Peter cat a name synonym with etiquette! situated in the heart of park street this place still bears the aura of the 70's dining ambiance...the owners being cricket lovers named this place  after a cat who lived in the Lords cricket ground in London! I recently took-out my friends for lunch on my birthday and we had an awesome experience! The food..they are delicious and mouth-watering! Sizzlers + chello kabab with a brewed drink.......are all time win-win! The servicing is also good. The interiors are something which makes the entire place interesting...those red hanging lamps add to the otherwise modest intramural. It is an expensive eatery but what i can assure is that you get the value back...i have been to other expensive one's but the quantity i got here was definitely better!! So i will strongly recommend all the foodies out there to try for this one(if they didn't yet)! #HappyEating

##

2014-06-04 01:52:59
High On Food
304528
4.0
A trip to Kolkata isn't in any way complete without a visit to Peter Cat. This legendary eatery on Part Street just opposite Times Furnishings has been a stalwart in its own right when it comes to food. 

The menu is extensive, the golden CAT shaped menu card still stays the same as it was years ago and the sizzlers still make their way out of the kitchen with that crackling noise we Kolkattans are all so familiar with.

The review and the experience is just one of the numerous trips I have made to this favorite eatery. It was Jan 2014 and for us bengalis who stay in Delhi for a living, it was not cold at all as per Delhi winter standards. We reached Peter Cat around 8:30 at night and could not manage a seat outright...there were at least 5 families waiting before us. After about half an hour and repeated requests to the manager....we got lucky. 

I always prefer sitting upstairs ..where the seats overlook the seating on the ground floor. It was a cozily lit corner table and we ordered Prawn Cocktail, Chelo kebab, chicken sizzler and chocolate mousse. Peter Cat has never ever let me down...loved everything we ordered and returned home a happy and contented soul.

2014-06-04 00:51:07

Peter Cat- its nt just another restaurant bt a brand in itself!! Famous fr their sizzlers and chelo kebabs, Peter Cat is very conveniently located though parking is a big issue! Rest assured u wl have a waiting time of half an hr no matter whethr its weekday or weekend! The ambience is superb with the sound of sizzlers amidst chitchat of diners, servers quite traditionally dressed and ok i wud say (nt d mst polite or professional) , food is of exceptional quality! One of the best places to eat in Park Street undoubtedly!
Bt thats where the story ends. Kolkata is now nuch beyond park street! There are excellent restaurants in almost every corner of the city! Peter Cat must evolve itself if it wishes to continue competing against the trending ones!! Hoping that its future wl b as glorious as the past!

2014-06-02 22:46:52
Tanumoy Roy
1644621
4.5
This is the second time that I have visited this old Kolkata restaurant. To be honest, first time with their highly rated chelo kebab I was a little disappointed. Every time I visit this place I get those old Kolkata flavours.... dim light, cozy sitting, simple decor, thick velvet carpet underneath and old wooden staircase.... 
Their reception and warm behaviour have always touched me  and this time their food also left a long lasting flavour on my palette. We were just passing by this place and just couldn't resist myself from visiting this one and only place once again. As we did not have any hunger, we just ordered two soft drinks and beckty muniere. Serving time was fast and the temperature of the food was just perfect. It is a complete meal. Truly the food was awesome, out of this world and lip smacking. Certainly they won our hearts this time through their foods. In that classic 70's ambience I fully enjoyed my food slowly but surely, a sweet tune of piano what was missing, would have been the icing on the cake.
A must visit place in Kolkata. 
They maintained their food quality and originality and this is the USP of this place. 
A little complaint - the table was at times clumsy, table space was short and too many things on it. Table should be manager in a much better way.

P.S. - Their sizzlers and kebabs are must try, better than chelo kebab.

2014-05-30 23:22:33
BR
1075818
3.0
It was just yesterday, when I went in for a chicken steak. And I was disappointed in ways more than one. This review may well seem like I was there to only find faults.
It was a busy time for business, and I thought I walked in to the cool place I had always known Peter Cat to be. The decor was so delightful, the dim lights around the walls and the red lampshades over the tables. I was looking for a decent chair, and was shown all corners as I was alone, that too in a very unpleasant tone. Understandable, that it was business time and you being the management would try to accommodate as many eaters as you can. But there has to be someone to see its done with grace. Caring for guests is important.
And then finding a seat , placing the order and admiring the place I noticed a pile of files or something next to the billing counter. Such an eyesore. And then the ugly crates next to the bartender killed the premium feeling. Further, I saw a waiter picking snacks from the little wooden snack bowls to fill his hand, at the bar. Outrageous.
And I wondered, as it seemed it was only yesterday, a few years back when I first visited this place and fell in love with it.
Ok, the food. The plate was beautifully decorated. It was colourful with steamed beans and carrots, the dark sauce on the steaks added contrast, and the smell was pickly. Perfect. The knife didn't have an easy time through the chicken fillet, it could have been a lot tenderer. In the mouth it just tasted like deep fried chicken dipped in arrowroot, and garnished with the amazing sauce. It was an Ok meal.
The conduct of the staff needs to be evaluated. And it is to be noted that the past glory is not be basked in but to be preserved.

2014-05-28 17:32:05
Kshitij Charania
1134306
3.5
Peter Cat. The most unusual thing about this is its name. I was surprised when I heard it for the first time. I am still wondering why should anyone keep this name. Starting with the ambience, (this is a general observation by me) almost all of these "premium restaurants" have one thing in common, if the interiors are not impressive, make the restaurant dark and hang colourful lamps over each table.This strategy really works. I have read many reviews saying that the restaurants had awesome interiors but when I go to check them out, what I see is the dark restaurants with contrasting lamps. Moreover, I had been to Mocambo restaurant on the opposite road of Peter Cat which has the same interiors (By interiors, I mean the lamp hanging above my head). I have attached the pictures of the HANGING AMBIENCE. Coming to the food, there was nothing extraordinary. It was regular restaurant food. We were a group of 10 people and tried almost all cuisines available. The service was good. Now comes the value, it is an expensive restaurant, but I have seen restaurants much more expensive than this. But still, the rates are much higher than it should be.

HANGING Ambience: 2.5/5
Service: 4/5
Value for money: 2/5
Taste: 3/5

2014-05-28 00:15:24
Soubhik Sen
311351
4.5
There was a time when Park street used to be the food Mecca of the city. While it still is, there are other streets in Kolkata which have sprung up as new food destinations. Take Sarat Bose road for example. Still there are people like me to whom park street would never loose its relevance. To me to still is THE best food destination of the city. Full of good old memories, my food experience starts on a high note the moment I enter this street. And why has this street found such an important corner in my heart, is because of the 3 stalwarts in this area, namely Peter Cat, Bar b Que, Mocambo. You can call me partial, but the moment I eat something from these places, my ratings travel east bound. 
When I was a kid, I was a big fan of chinese food and when my father took me to this place for the first time, i was very disappointed to see no chinese cuisines in the menu card. That was my first and last moment of disappointment in this temple of taste. No special mentions, stuff yourself up each day with different items and your taste buds would live forever.

##

2014-05-26 23:25:40
Deepan Banerjee
263010
4.0
Have been there several times. At first i was fascinated by the true Kolkata feel it had, the old Kolkata charm. 
The restaurant is dimly lit but offers a cosy dining. Waiters r ok.
Peter cat is known by its famous chello kebab, which to me is way over hyped. Its an assorted kebab platter with bed of buttery rice n poached egg. The egg is often over cooked n it doesn't ooze out when cut, like its supposed to.
Bt the meat is tender n juicy. A good dish Bt nothing to die for.
I wud rather order a chicken sizzler n cold salad. Good restaurant for the "oh so Kolkata" charm it has Bt a bit overhyped to me.
Price is on the steeper side.
On festive days be there as early as possible to avoid hours in the queue.

Please remember to block seat and visit and staff is old so be nice to them or else they get angry ;)

##

2014-05-21 17:25:25
Ruchismita Mukherjee
444517
3.5
Take the Calcuttan out of me, and I will probably not see any greatness in Peter Cat. Chelo Kebab which is their signature dish was first introduced by them to the ubiquitous rice-eating bengali. It is a plate of buttered rice, with an egg (sunny side up), and some generously thrown in mix meat kebabs. The global Calcuttan like me who has been there done that will take the license to say "well, what is so great about that?"...So yes, the sizzlers, the very indianized, cheesy, gooey continental fare, the Chinese, the Indian is not 'great', albeit the first of its kind that this city has known.
Then what makes it so special? So it is the old-world park street charm that comes alive in this Calcutta Restaurant - the colonial flavor in the decor, the stiff collared ushers and waiters, the dim lighting...Everything about this place is oh so Calcutta.
So if you are a first-timer in Kolkata, do visit Peter Cat, for its an experience like none other.

##

2014-05-21 09:38:37
Arijit Basu

4.5
