If cuisine is a circle then Peter Cat is a radius. 
just enjoy the food... Have Fun..... :)

##

2014-05-20 23:46:51
Arijit Mukherjee
1176517
4.5
A stature to Kolkata's delicacies. The Chelo Kabab platter serves as a benchmark through out India. And not to mention its sizzler or steak is a true challenge to your taste buds. The mouthwatering sound and the aroma of butter served over a special "sizzle" table top paper. The Chelo kabab platter derives its name from - "Chal-o-Kebab"' which means rice and kebab . And no Kolkata foodie would dare to jump over a dish if its Chelo Kebab . Adding to the attractive menu is its innovative and bud-popping cocktails , especially the " Zam Zam" or the "Peter Cat Cooler" . The daring combination of Whisky and Rum is a true challenge for boozers . All together its a worth dining experience doing justice to your pocket.

##

2014-05-20 18:26:16
Pritam Paul
2196348
4.0
There can be very few restaurants that one knows before their consciousness arose. Perhaps Peter Cat is such an one for me ^_ ^ I was brought there way back in 90's and even today in 2014 people still going gaga over it. 

Having an avid desire for North Indian foods I do like the dishes quite a bit. You can try Fish Farah for a change as a starter, the fish they served is soft, tender and delicately mixed with spices. Biriyani is spiced up really well and by that I mean its too heavy for one person to have a go at the whole plate, rather it will be good if you share this just to taste and do not expect this to taste alike other biriyani's of the town, it is different. What I really liked is the different type of Nuns they offer. You can try Kabuli or keema nun with the wide range of side dishes they serve. Sizzlers are quite famous here as well, they taste decent and looked even better when served. And last but not least the Chelo Kabab is the most ordered dish they offer which is quite decent but something I feel a bit over-rated. I have had better chelo kabab at almost same price in some other place.

Ambiance is decent if you are new here, is awesome if you have certain past memories. The prices are very much reasonable but wish to be served with bit more smiling faces. It is cosy and nice if you are really early in the evening or be ready to sweat it out in the long queue in front of it :)

##

2014-05-15 22:19:04
Somrita Chandra
2404624
4.5
peter cat needs no intro at all...One of a kind restaurant for having continental & north indian food with sophisticated ambience.
Location:-
In the adjacent lane of flury's, opp to park Street KFC.
Ambiance/Service:-
I went there on 25th December with parents for lunch, as we wanted to avoid d rush n long queue at nit.But dat didn't help at all.
We had to wait for half an hour.But after that, we placed our order n the service was really good n fast.The waiter n manager both were very cooperative. Indoor was dimly lit and decor was good.Romantic Ambience. :)
Food:-
For starter, we ordered Fish makhmali kebab as suggested by the waiter himself, n believe me dat was really delicious with a melt in a mouth feel.we washed it down with jaljeera n lemon soda.
Now, for main course, we ordered 1 chelo kebab (chicken), 1 Grilled fish sizzler, 1 mutton biryani, 2 pc.s nun and 1 chicken curry, alongwith green salad.
chelo kebab is there signature dish and a personal fav of mine.A very filling dish...awesome. ..grilled fish sizzler is also very tasty...served on the bed of lettuce, with sauteed veggies, it was a combo of taste n health.Mutton biryani was ok, a bit oily with succulent pieces of mutton n potato. 
For dessert, tutti fruity ice cream we had, a decent dessert that looks enchanting....
Overall rating :- 4.5/5
Surely visit fr some more delicacies n chelo kebabs too..:)
A worth try for foodies.

The service was quick, but the waiter was not very friendly. Overall, to me, this resto is a OVER HYPED place to eat food. Park Street surely have better place than this.

4.0
One of the oldest places to dine in park street and yet a favourite. You dont mind standing in a queue and waiting for few minutes to occupy a table. Hot favourites: chelo kebab, fish and chicken sizzlers, kebabs, mutton rogan josh with garlic naan and one can try some very good desserts like soufle and caramel custard. The only thing that makes people come back is the consistency in the quality of food and the service. The waiting time is very low so that makes peter cat a great place to dine if you are at park street. Also its not v pocket pinching unlike most restaurants these days.

2014-05-02 03:53:57
Archan Ray
437277
4.5
Was there to celebrate a certain achievement. Situated right next to the music world, the place from outside gives you a vintage feel. Since it was a Friday, had to wait for half an hour to get a seat. Inside, the ambience was great. Didn't waste much time and ordered for Chelo Kababs. The mix of rice roasted kababs, Kathi rolls, butter and a poached egg was magical. Add to it the flavorsome of a well roasted salad. The rice helped in breaking the jinx every time. 
Next order was a chicken sizzler. Smoking hot stuff, served with a poached egg again, this was a treat and again lived up to its expectations. The sauce was subtle and great, and I just devoured on it. Trust me it is quite tough to gorge on this after the Chelo. But then, it was a day to devour on godliness. 

Verdict: definitely go an eat what I did. Definitely visit the place for the name of it, for the food they serve. Me? Yeah, I'll be around.

This Chelo-alike dish has both Chicken and mutton kebabs and in almost 1.5 times the quantity in Chelo. Once experimental, now it is my regular.
In the Sizzler department, Peter Cat is my absolute favourite by miles ahead of any other. They don;'t add rice, pasta, noodles to their sizzler and make it to heavy on the stomach. The combination of boiled veggies with some yummy sauce on the well cooked meat makes it a dish, which you can eat regularly without ever getting bored.

##

2014-04-24 11:58:19
Food Fanatic
502878
4.5
Loved, loved the chicken tikka

##

2014-04-24 00:24:13
Karishma Sharma (asoulfoodstory.com)
1169354
3.5
I have been a regular at Peter Cat since i was a kid.There's something about park street, its amalgamation of the old and new,how it blends both together to form something like a worldly experience.
Any foodie in Calcutta would easily recommend you this place,and why wouldnt they? This place has been serving lip smacking sizzlers and kebabs since so many years.
My most recent visit(29.03.2014)  however was a little disappointing, not on the food front but the service front,let me clarify. 
The waiters seemed disinterented :/
Our order was the veg chelo kebab which was so so so good,like usual :) Next up we ordered the vegetable mixed grill, a sizzler so divine, with impeccable flavours.My taste buds are so familiar with these flavours * gushes* We also ordered fresh lime soda sweet and they served us sweet and salty! We asked them to replace,"yes ma'am plz wait" and thats what we did, waited and waited :/
Also hygiene was something of a concern that day!The plates and water glasses were not properly cleaned, resulting in small tiny whitish things floating in our glass of water,inspite of being poured from a bottle of packaged water.Also, since we were hosting a friend from mumbai there,it was quite embarrassing :| So my rating of 3.5 is only because of the food i ate, and because its Peter Cat im rating!

##

2014-04-15 00:52:21
Abhishikta Chakraborty
1256231
4.5
Peter Cat! The name stands as one of the heritage eating places of Kolkata. Getting a table here without having to wait, is almost an impossibility, and if the number of people in the group is large, God Save You :D
But this place is definitely worth the wait! 

The chelo kabab is the signature dish of Peter Cat. What looks like just a little rice would absolutely fill your stomach once you are done with the entire plate! The mutton kabab, the chicken the egg, the butter, even the capsicums are just perfectly made. 5 on 5!

I personally find the quantity of chicken sizzler, which is another signature dish of Peter Cat, a little too less. That might be because I am an avid fan of chicken. Never tasted the dessert s here yet but the Paneer tikka kabab of this place is heavenly, and underrated. You also get a lot of choices in drinks!

I have been told that Prawn cocktail is another specialty of Peter Cat and I must try that next time.

Over all, a wonderful place. A must visit if you are or are not a native of Kolkata. We were made to sit on the inside section of Peter Cat once and I did not like that part. So, even if takes a little waiting, try and sit on the outside section and if you are lucky or in a bigger group, you can sit on the first floor which is prettier! One warning, since this place is so well known and famous, the service can be a little rude. The food somehow makes up for it.

Peter Cat is part of Kolkata‚Äôs heritage. Its‚Äô Chello kebab has gained an iconic status which is unforeseen for any other item of any other restaurant. The concoction of buttered rice, poached egg and chicken kebabs and mutton seekh kebab is really unique and filling. 2014-04-05 16:31:47
Himadri Sekhar
1391737
3.5
It was my maiden visit after hearing so much about this place. Got along with a colleague of mine for a lunch. We had no idea that we would have to wait for so long to get a table. My friend was in mood for something Indian. We were very hungry and coupled with his choice for lunch, it completely got out of my mind to have their signature dish: The Chelo Kebab. Anyway this is what we ordered: Fresh Lime soda, Roast chicken for starters, Chicken Liver Masala, Chicken Shahi Korma, nan and tandoori roti. The food arrived pretty fast starting with the roast chicken, which was descent enough. The Indian dishes were in fact below average. The Shahi korma was a very simple dish with chicken in a soft gravy along with big potatoes and an egg. It also tasted bland and needed a bit more seasoning. I have never had liver masala before and hence I didn't know how it was supposed to taste. I had a bite of it and didn't touch it for the rest of my meal. I have never experienced tasting chicken liver so bad as this was. This place is certainly not apt for having anything Indian and certainly nothing innovative is going on here. But I do hope to come back soon, just for the Chelo Kebabs....

##

2014-03-09 12:30:42
Piku
1013949
4.0
Among the most popular restaurants in kolkata with two signature dishes-The Original Chelo Kebab and The House Special sizzler! Located at the prime park street area,this place is always crowded,even during weekdays.
Ambience 8/10
Similar to mocambo,you get the orange hanging lamps and the comfortable couches. There is a separate section on the first floor as well. The menu card is cat shaped!
Food Presentation 9/10
The prawn cocktail is served in a special chalice which keeps the temperature down. The sizzler is served on a separate serving mat and the steak alongside stir fried vegetables. The chelo Kebab looks pretty impressive with all the chicken kebabs forming a semicircle around the butter rice!
Food Quality 8/10
The cocktail  is really tangy with generous mayo and soft prawns. The chicken steak sizzler is soft and tastes good! The chelo is pretty good but not as exceptional as is the hype about it. It's just regular kebab chunks and mutton sheeks with rice and cubes of butter and a poach. The shah nauz was a bit chewy and had too much liver to my liking. But overall it was nice.
Food quantity 9/10
The chelo kebab is sufficient for one person. It is a wholesome meal. Even one serving of sizzler should suffice one person.
Cost effectiveness 7/10
Well this place has seen a hike in prices over these few years and nowadays chelo kebabs of similar quality are available at reasonable rates at some other restaurants also. But you'll surely have a memorable experience once you visit Peter cat.
Overall 41/50

2014-03-04 02:47:54
Ambarish Singh Roy
126239
4.5
I feel silly writing a review about Peter Cat...after all...it's reputation precedes it. But it is one of my favourite restaurants and I've lost count of how many times I have been there or have ordered food from this amazing restaurant. When I yearn for spicy food (or sometimes even Continental) I head for Peter Cat.

I passionately recommend the following:

Indian Section:

Non-Veg Chelo Kebab - it's a given, but there is no parallel.
Dum Ki Raan
Mutton Shikar Kebab
Tandoori Prawns
Prawn Butter Masala
Chicken Shah Nauz
Non-Veg Tandoori Platter/Sizzler
Tandoori Broccoli

Continental Section:

Prawn Cocktail
Fish Fingers with Tartar Sauce
Beckty Muniere
Chicken Steak
Grilled Fish

This is a price-conscious restaurant and they deliberately keep their prices low. I wish they would increase their prices and improve the quality of a few items - especially the fish. If you are a regular there the people recognize you and usher you into the first available seat. Otherwise there is a big line, even on weekdays. I also wish they would serve a better selection of Beer and Scotch. The ambiance hasn't changed in decades. It is crowded. But the food more than makes up for all that, and perhaps it adds to the charm of the place. 

This place doesn't need a recommendation, nevertheless, I do recommend it most sincerely to all our fellow foodies.

2014-03-01 23:01:27
Yajnaseni Saha
169960
4.0
in love wid their chelo kebab....sshall want to go back always for more

##

2014-02-28 14:44:12
Bee The Foodee
1691036
3.0
It‚Äôs no use being a foodie and living in Calcutta, if one has not visited and then talked about peter cat at least once!
Peter cat has the incredible power to hang onto the 70s vibe in an unabashed manner. The red lights and old world staircase just adds to the feel. The wait to get into this place on a weekend is maddening, so come in plenty early and with people who you can bear to chit chat with for some time before you‚Äôre granted entry. So definitely not a place for formal setups or lunch with colleagues.

I only go to this place for the chello kebabs, I have never ever had anything else on the menu. Does that not say everything about the chelloKs? I have tried both the veg and non-veg versions of it, and though a hardcore meatatarian, I would still prefer the veg platter over the non veg. The rice which comes along with the kebabs is flavored with salty butter or salt and butter (I am not that evolved to understand the difference), but the rice is great.

The place feels a little low maintenance, and I wish just sometimes the dated d√©cor would be updated to retain the 70s feel but to bring in a modern twist to it.

2014-02-25 19:58:20
Sudakshina Bhattacharya
208660
3.5
It is one of the better restaurants from the sea of restaurants that speckle the very busy Park Street. Minimal decor and dimmed light gives one the comfort of gorging on to one's food uninterrupted. Well if this is your first time then you might just want to reach early at this place because it gets crowded really fast....should be there by 1 for lunch and before 8 for dinner unless of course you fancy waiting outside or to turn around and march into KFC.
The chelo kebab was exquisite a few years back and then it became great and now its good. It is served with buttered rice and a poached egg accompanied by chicken tikkas.... a wholesome dish in itself that does not require any starters to be ordered.
i am more of a fan to the chicken sizzler served with a delicious sauce and some veggies. Now this is the dish that was and still is delicious. 
The rara mutton is well cooked and well spiced which makes it salivatingly good if you are not in the mood for the above dishes.
And then there is the prawn cocktail which i think is just about average here...if u are craving one go to Mocambo...its their forte.
desserts are well...um...ok.
But trust me once you have had food here u wud want to come back and your pocket and some of your taste buds would agree.

2014-02-22 18:50:48
Jug Head
1627817
4.0
Very famous in Kolkata peter cat is situated on the busy park street . The day unfortunately was valentines and they took no bookings or reservations , we landed up to see at least 50 people standing outside .... we didn't wait and came back the next day for lunch.

Seated promptly and ordered for Chelo kebab in lamb - the lamb was soft and juicy with the butter rice and with that 3 pieces of chicken which looked like malai tikka. loved the chelo kebab ... have eaten this at quite a few restaurants and yes it was on the top with the others. 

CHicken reshmi - kebabs juicy and soft my daughter enjoyed them with butter naan's . I ate a couple of pieces and they were definitely good . 

Chicken biryani - the way biryani is made here is different and has potatoes in them . the biryani was good had all the flavours right and chicken was cooked well ..... 

Didn't have space for desserts. 

I rate this place 4.0 and wish them all the best

2014-02-21 11:45:41
Priyanka Roychowdhury
145190
4.5
Peter Cat needs no eulogy to any food lover. For decades this legendary restaurant has been a favorite food destination. Frequented this place often in the childhood with family. The Chelo Kebab at Peter Cat is the stuff that legends are made of, albeit diminishing in quality since when I can recall from my younger days. However, it is not something to hold against them. The ambiance is still pleasant, the food still coveted and the waiters, still friendly. The Tandoori Mixed Grill and the Chicken Steak are equally good. Going over and over again is still not enough to satiate the glutton that accompanies when one thinks of Peter Cat. 

Although Chelo is certainly everyone's favorite ad is inadvertently seen to be amongst almost every order, most of the other dishes served here are equally appetizing. After countless visits, when you somewhat tire of the Chelo, make sure to try the other options. You won't be disappointing.

The specialty of Peter -Cat  food is in the perfect blend of sweet and spicy flavors.

‚ÄúThe protected regional product of west Bengal. Our Special Kebabs prepared in rare spices, blended  with Persian herbs and served on a bed of rice with butter and an egg.‚Äù
4. Souffl√© of the day-(Good)
Now,
I am in love with Bengali cuisine.
Peter Cat is a great place to dine-in with family and friends. Highly recommended. Would Luv to try here next time.

On a chilly winter day, we arrived at Peter cat to savor the most-talked Chello-kebab. Ambiance is at par. But book your tables otherwise you have to wait long time on wekkend and on weekdays too. 2014-02-11 12:43:11
Bhaskar Bhattacharjee
584031
2.0
Food has been excellent and outstanding in this Restaurant and Chello Kabab has been a pride of Kolkata, all thanks to Peter Cat for maintaining it for such a long time. The only concern is regarding the "STAFF". Being a Hotelier and working in this industry (ITC SONAR for 10 years and other 5 star properties) for such a long time I have understood that its the people/services that makes the difference, not the food. The Stewards and the Managers of this restaurant are lousy and having negative attitude towards their guests. when I said that the mutton seekh served in Chello Kabab seems to be tough and dry the Steward replied "yehi hai, aise hi banta hai" . For your kind information I am a Chef by Profession working as a senior Chef for 12 years in a 5 star hotel for many years so I knew that lamb is being overcooked. When I reported it to the Manager/Captain he was even ineffective and didn't even bother to offer me a fresh helping in-spite of me giving my introduction. Moreover while I was moving out the particular Steward was standing to get a TIP from me and also gave me a starred look when I didn't give that. Sad to say your staffs are a total waste, inhospitable, terrible and rotten for such a wonderful place.

##

2014-02-06 17:18:44
Rukshana Kapadia
168480
4.5
Peter Cat is certainly one of the pillars on the Kolkata food scene and a personal favorite. I am always so eager to dig into my meal that I invariably forget to take pictures of the food and most of you who read my reviews will know that I simply love to take photographs of my favorite dishes. Hopefully next time I will remember to do so. Red sofas and chairs , dim lighting , the enchanting whiff of sizzler smoke all add to the retro allure of Peter Cat. The long lines of diners waiting for a table every day and the 1500 plus votes it has got on Zomato not to mention that it features on over 800 favorite lists including mine is a testament to the reputation and food heritage of this legendary restaurant. 

The Chelo Kebab is its most famous dish available in Chicken/Mutton and Vegetarian Options is a hot seller and its rare if every table does not have atleast one Chelo Kebab sitting on it ! 

My other recomendations are listed below -
Starters - Prawn Cocktail, Fried Chicken Liver , Mutton Shammi Kebab and Fish Makhmali are all delicious.
Kebabs - Chicken Reshmi Kebab , Mutton Shikar Kebab  , Mutton Bara Kebab and Tandoori Prawn make my mouth water.
Indian Main Course - Paneer Butter Masala , Kabuli Channa , Chicken Reshmi Butter Masala and Mutton Nawabi are my hot picks paired with Rotis or the Biryani.
Sizzlers - House Special , Chicken Steak or Tandoori Mixed Grill will leave your taste buds smoking.
Dessert- Cream Caramel or Tutti Frutti for a happy ending.

They still serve a childhood favorite Cheese Pineapple and Cherry Sticks which I love and reminds me of my visits with my grandparents 30 years back !!!! I usually always prepare a parcel for the house as its humanly impossible to satiate all my cravings in one go :-P !!!! 
If you like to drink order up a beer which they serve in the old style metal tankards with a delicious chanachur (you only get this if you order an alcoholic beverage) or if your a cocktail person check out the hilariously illustrated cocktail menu and order yourself a Rum Collins , Peter Cat's Cooler or the Bloody Mary and wait to dine. 
This place sure makes your tummy feel like the Cat's Whiskers !!!

----- 07 Aug, 2012 -----

Dark, crowded and filled with delicious smells of all the sizzlers wafting around, this is one of my favourite places to dine on Park Street. Funnily enough though, I am not a Chelo Kebab fan. I love the Indian food, Chicken Reshmi Kabab, Mutton Shikar Kebab, Chicken Bharta, Channa Masala and Paneer Butter Masala are excellent as is the Kali Dal and Mutton Nawabi. They make excellent Chicken Liver as a starter and good Shaami Kebabs as well and for desserts the Caramel Custard is an excellent option. 
Their sizzlers are fairly decent and portions are good but either go early or be prepared for a very long wait outside.

2014-02-03 21:54:49

A big NO to all the veggies out here!!
After having wanting to try out this place for months yesterday I finally got a chance to get a seat here (have returned a couple of times earlier due to abysmally high waiting time).Just when we thought the toughest part was over and ordered some starters (Paneer tikka and Veg Burger) we were proven wrong.The toughest part was not to get in but get the food served on our table before our hunger died.After having waited for more than 35 minutes we finally got our order served on the table.Given that we all were really hungry and even an average quality food would have appetizing for us we were dismayed at the quality of food served-pathetic would be an understatement.The paneer tikka was under cooked and wasn't even remotely close to its original taste and the burger had a worse than road side aloo patty stuffed in between.French fries served along with the burger was stale and worsened our mood.We unanimously decided that we had enough bad food for the day and walked out and had way better food at a dhaba.

##

2014-02-03 19:56:55
Anirban Das
1558018
3.5
Almost a cult restaurant in Kolkata! If you go to Park Street for dinner, you have to be either in Peter Cat or in Barbeque (both from the same owners). Visited this place number of times, and never left disapponted. Chelo Kabab is their favourite dish. But if you want to experiment beyond Chelo Kabab, go for the Fish Finger, Grilled/Fried Fish. The tartar sauce they serve is very delicious. I usually stay away from there other mughlai dishes, you could find a better variety of them in other city restaurants.
Things which could be improved - The sitting area. The twin seater just in front of the main door should be removed. Its just in the middle of the street, and very uncomfortable during summers, when the main door is opened frequently. Also they could improve on the cutlery and the hand towel. I have found the towel torn and dirty a few times.
The best thing is it's still very affordable price wise.

2014-01-27 00:14:36
Dr Bodhisatwa Choudhuri
278835
4.5
I'm a great fan of Peter Cat restaurant at the heart of Kolkata for a long time.....since I tasted the delicious chelo kebab for the first time. Its a very heavy food, full of calories & cholesterol, but absolutely mouthwatering. And also the sizzlers and Prawn cocktail are just awesome. Combine them with the variety of cocktails available at your disposal at a very reasonable price, you get a fine dining experience with your loved ones....... But keep this in mind, Kolkatans love this place. So be early on special days or you have to wait in a very very long queue outside. 
The environment inside is very cozy, albeit a little dark. The tables are lighted by a fancy bulb hanging at the center of the table. And the waiters greet you in traditional moghlai dresses. But in time what I feel that the waiters behavior have deteriorated. And the mismanagement of the queue standing outside the gate should be avoided....

2014-01-25 13:24:15
Sourav Saha
419820
4.5
What to comment on one of the legends of Park Street. I went their with my girlfriend one fine afternoon. The ambience of the restaurant is excellent. Staff is well trained abd very helpful.
Most wonderful thing was the menu, so cutely displayed within a cat face.
The variety of cocktails and the variance in their speciality, Sizzlers, will make you spellbound. Choose from any of the many available, and you won't be disappointed. Service is also very good.
Only con I found was the size of the table for two. Its too small to fit two glasses, two plates and the dishes you ordered, that you have to compromise a bit.
Otherwise, I am really impressed. Peter Cat, I will be visiting you very soon again.

2014-01-23 18:32:38
SUVANKAR ROY
476957
4.0
Whenever you visit this area, it is so natural that you step in to Peter Cat to have your stomach refueled. With good pedigree in continental dishes, this restaurant will not disappoint you in any way. We went there on a weekday afternoon but the whole restaurant was still brimming with people and we had difficulty finding seats for only 2 of us. But it was more that made up for when we were served the all time favourite Chelo Kabab. And we also tried the Tandoori mixed grill from the sizzler category. Both these items were wonderful for the palate. The service was also good and did not disappoint us. So in all, I would like to rank it in the very good category.

2014-01-18 21:02:32
Sriparna Chatterjee
168803
5.0
Now this is the place born and brought up in kolkata's legacy....It's just as much a place to visit as any other heritage site...and is definitely my favourite...

although this place will always have a queue....but i don't think anyone ever complained!!....Inside....the whole get-up has an old era-charm...always bustling and joyful....

To me, Peter Cat is synonymous with the Chelo-Kebab....that beautiful plateful of soft rice..with a lava of molten butter flowing...beautifully adorned with flavourful and succulent kebabs...and garnished with roasted veggies...ultimately crowned with a sunny fried egg....it is truly a royal dish...although other places nearby serve it...but this place is THE original...

Among the rest...the indianised Sizzlers are really worth trying....one could also opt for the Mughlai options...
They offer a really good range of cocktails and other drinks to wash everything down with...

There are very few places that can match up to the exuberance of Peter Cat....and this is one place that will always have a place in every Calcuttan's heart!!

This one lists among the first few restuarants I dined in Kolkata , having heard the legacy of Peter Cat I was a little worried  if we could manage to get a place,thankfully we dint have to wait too long and managed to get a place on the ground floor although I'd wanted to seat at the top.

Me being a vegetarian ordered Vegetable chelo Kebab and poca cosa(sunset), I must say I have never had a whole meal as tasty and satisfying as this was, paneer barbeques rightly cooked and flavored, the nicely flavored rice with butter, the sheik kebabs were a delight, it was perfect.The Cocktail Poca cosa dint sink in that well, the ingrediants din seem to sink in well, but i guess there a lot more to try from the liquor menu.

The service was a little laid back, which need to improve

On a whole my taste buds were rewarded and will surely visit this place for the Chelo kebabs.

1.  Outstanding ambience
2.  Outstanding cooking

4.  Outstanding service
5.  Outstanding affordability

A true legend and a restaurant to introduce the concept of Raan in Kolkata.

Also the First tp introduce Chicken Bharta in Kolkata.

The First restaurant to introduce Chicken Steak.

And the first resaturant to introduce SIZZLERS

Also the first restaurant to to introduce Persian Pulao.....

A true masterpeice signatory Chello Kebab, and the first restaurant to introduce this dish in Kolkata and the concept of serving kebab with pilaf.

Hot Chocolate is really scrumptous.....

If above reasons does not explain why one should go to this five star restaurant,  then there are no other reasons in this world

2014-01-05 04:11:13
Pradeep Kumar
390821
3.5
Have heard about Peter cat from my friends and beyond a lot. So naturally the expectations have been bloating a lot. 

We went there on a busy year end lunch. There was a big crowd, but still we were able to walk in immediately as we were ok with having a table for 2 even with a kid. We were clear to order only the signature dishes and hence did not fiddle much. A soup followed by Chelo kebabs and chicken sizzlers. The waiter suggested to go with additional bread roles and we obliged. 

The food arrived in style. I saw impressed with the sizzler with tender cooked chicken and veg. But could not stop comparing them with the wholesome ones we used to find in noodle bar, Hyderabad. Quantity was less than expected. The grilled kebabs were good but I was not impressed with the fried ones. 

Surprisingly the overall price was also ok. I would certainly want to try some other non signature dishes if I get another chance.

2014-01-03 14:28:15
Dev Reinstated
398498
4.0
Now, this comes late, but can never be missed. Peter Cat, a legacy in itself. A strongly recommended  restaurant for any visitor, tourist or for that matter anyone who  steps in Kolkata.

To start with, Prawn Cocktail, a dish which was a definitive innovation in itself; and my personal excitement to be there. It just doesn't leave your palate for a long time. fried chicken liver, which is a another major attraction as a starter. And at any visit, I don't remember to miss them.

And then, something which this place has bred on...Sizzlers... Grilled Fish Sizzlers and Chicken Steak Sizzlers, my all time preference... They are wholesome, tasty and too good to be missed.... The food here has always maintained its standards...

A special mention... Zam Zam, in the beginning I tried it for the crazy name it had.. and then it turns out to be my favourite...

The service here at times, has disappointed the the customers. And there has been an issue of space and reservations on special days. But we can give all this a miss to eat the delicious food.

So, if you are in Kolkata, you better not miss Peter Cat.

2013-12-30 17:08:08
Archita Dutta
1244185
4.0
Its been time since i have lost count on how many times i have actually visited this place. At any instant the restaurant u relate with park street is peter cat. whether with friends or family its always THE ultimate place you can visit without a second thought.

There was a time when i used to enter the place and straight over ordered chelo kebab without even going through the menu card and am sure many do the same but i would like to put forward my suggestion of trying out there sizzlers too. The grilled fish sizzler is aweesome and the grilled chicken sizzler stands after the fish one but chelo kebab will always be on top of the list (Can't help i am very weak when it comes to chelo kebab :P) The cream of chicken asparagus soup is just mouth-watery creamy. That is my favorite in the soups range. Chicken biryani is just below average so better not ordered.

To cut short Kolkata's finest restaurant Peter Cat and its delicious offering chelo kebab can drive any foodie crazy.

What i would like the management to take care of is, recently i had visited the place and  it was very heart breaking to see the waiters hanging around the table at the time of bill payment for tips. It doesn't suit the class of the restaurant besides they should be aware that service charge amount is added to the bill so there's no point being so demanding for tips.

2013-12-24 01:21:32
Palash Chatterjee
949782
4.5
Peter Cat was a common name on the list of all foodies that I have had the privilege of interacting with. And so, I along with my friends decided to pay a visit. It was a weekday afternoon and we, a group of 9, had to wait for quite a few minutes to get a table. But the wait was totally worth it.
The ambiance is captivating. The seating is extremely pleasant and the lighting just perfect.
The service is good. We were greeted warmly by the staff. As majority of us were vegetarians, there was a confusion regarding the order, but the staff helped us out on this one.
From what I had at Peter Cat, Chello Kabab is definitely its best bet. No wonder Peter Cat has become synonymous for Chello Kabab. The non-veg mixed grill sizzler too was nice, although I personally would have liked it a bit more spicy. The chicken biriyani which they serve is decent. 
Mutton roganjosh was good too, though definitely not the best I have had.

Overall the Peter Cat experience has great. I am looking forward to pay a second visit soon. :)

2013-12-19 22:22:59
Akash Chaudhuri
1277540
4.0
The legacy of Peter Cat continues and it occupies a major place in Kolkata's rich heritage. Peter Cat, located at Park Street is one of the legends of this beautiful city. This place is always crowded on weekends and special occasions, so it is better to visit on a weekday, otherwise plan to wait outside for more than an hour. Now, coming to the most important part, food quality of Peter Cat is excellent, specially the kebabs. We ordered Afghani Chicken, it was very tasty. Like everyone does, we also ordered the famous Chelo Kebab and it was really impressive. Not just the kebab, but the rice with butter and egg also smelled good. Appetising indeed ! 

Chelo Kebab overshadows all other items on the menu, but each item on the menu stands out tall. The ambience is great and the service is good (but the waiters always demand for more tips). I have heard many people say that the standards of Peter Cat has gone down, but still it has a lot to offer.  

All these makes Peter Cat a must-go. If you are in the city for the first time and you want to try out some restaurants, then Peter Cat should be one of them. 

Food quality and taste: 4.5/5
Food presentation: 4.5/5
Ambience: 4/5
Service: 3/5
Value for money: 4.5/5

2013-12-11 11:07:32
Jason F
1483928
4.0
Iconic Kolkata restaurant. Been coming here since my childhood days,so a lot of nostalgia attached to it.
Every time I come back to Kolkata I always make it a point to come at least once for some Dansburg beer along with Chelo Kebab or a Sizzler.
Went there for dinner.As usual there was a huge crowd waiting to get in,almost resembling a mob. Luckily it was only two of us and we managed to score a seat in 10 minutes.
Anyways on this visit found out they no longer serve Dansburg which was a huge disappointment. Started with the fish Makhmali, Mutton bara and chicken tikka . Still nice,not the best I've had but almost feels like comfort food. Standout was the fish makhmali.

Had the Tandoori Mixed grill sizzler as the main course. Good as usual but found that they put a wee bit too much of gravy on it,not a deal killer though.

Glad to see that Peter Cat still maintains its tradition,not much has changed (which is a good thing). Just wish they would add Dansburg back on the menu.

I would normally rate it 3.5, the extra half star is because of nostalgia and memories attached to it

Food: 7.5/10
Service: 6/10
Ambience and Decor: 7/10

##

2013-12-09 18:09:23
Anuradha Chakraborty
1426351
4.0
I visited Peter Cat twice and both the times I had to wait for an hour or so to get a table for two! This is probably one of the turn-offs of this restaurant but when the food arrives on your table and when you take the first bite from it, you forget everything! Chelo Kebab, which is the speciality of this place, is indeed an awesome platter! The kebabs on it are always very tender and juicy. I love the sizzlers as well. For me, more than Chelo Kebab, the sizzlers of Peter Cat gets more points in terms of taste as well as the presentation. I love to take cocktails with my meals and the Screw Driver is the best one for me here! The starters are great as well. Fish and chips is another delicacy which you might get elsewhere but it won't taste as good as Peter Cat's! Apart from the fact that the place is generally too crowded and the waiters are a bit arrogant, Peter Cat is a must visit for one and all in Kolkata and also for the ones who visit Kolkata occasionally! For me, this place is 4 out of 5 !

THANKS FOR SPOILING MY SUNDAY......

##

2013-12-08 23:39:17
Chandrayee Neogi
1478284
4.0
The  Chelo Kebabs took me to Peter Cat and while coming out of the front-door of this restaurant clinging to its age-old history of wooing Kolkatan foodies with their drool-worthy platters, the chelo was one of the lingering thoughts that were uppermost on my mind. I am not planning to talk much about the signature dish of this better known part of Park Street and will be rather happy to share a few more love affairs that I had on a Saturday night at this eatery. 

Let me offer enough adulation to the very elegant looking Amazonia (Vodka+pineapple juice). That was the perfect beginning of  the evening after a tedious wait of an hour, outside the restaurant. The red wine that followed with an impeccably elegant looking Fish Makhmali Kebabs ( that literally melts in your mouth) made my evening. The Chicken Hyderabadi Kebab would have received better grades from me only if it would have not been on the same table with the Fish Makhmali Kebabs. Honestly speaking, a salute to the Maitre d, who suggested this dish that can single-handedly woo a group of foodies back from many other lip smacking suitors. 

The Roasted chicken sizzler made its presence felt ( not only with its sizzling sound and the power to set the fire alarm ringing) in its own right. Even the toasted potatoes on the platter and the special poached egg ( I never had such a wonderful poach before) on the Chelo platter played the cupids in my love affair with Peter Cat on last Saturday night ( 07.12.13). If the Amazonia started it all off with the right mood. Chelo made it come a full circle to make me fall in love with this place.

The best part of any dish was probably ( rather obviously) the tenderness of all protein assortments in the dishes we ordered ( fish, chicken, mutton). I will go back to this place and this time, will get less irritated to wait for an hour to receive my first drink of the night.

##

2013-12-08 15:37:43
Agnipravo Sengupta
803841
4.0
The Chelo Kebab was the only reason why visiting Peter Cat was necessary. I'm definitely not the first one (and hell, I obviously won't be the last) who's gonna get clean-bowled with the Magnum Opus of this restaurant. I did hear how good the dish is, but it's also true that I often wondered, "Is this praise really worth it? It's a dish with rice, butter, poached egg and 2 types of kebabs, after all."

Sunday nights are pretty hassle-prone if you are going for a Park Street dinner. But I never imagined it was gonna be something so mind-boggling with Peter Cat! I guess I was extremely lucky to get a seat with just 45 minutes of waiting outside. Ordered one Chelo Kebab & one Griller Chicken Sizzler along with a Screwdriver and a Budweiser. The Sizzler was fantastic; 2 huge pieces of chicken breasts cooked to perfection. However, it got completely overshadowed when I sank my teeth into the real deal - the Chelo. The thing which caught me off-guard was not the kebabs but the rice. It has this strange aroma that gets complimented so well with the butter dollop. Even if the kebabs (which were equally stupendous) were not there, I could have gobbled on just the rice itself. Take a bow, Peter Cat! It was amazing!

Mind you, the range of cocktails available here is pretty huge and they are cheaper than most high-end restaurants. If you are into having a glass with the main course, Peter Cat is definitely a place to opt for.

Overall, the experience was pretty good. Just be a little early to reach this restaurant, as its popularity might make you wait a long time. Absence of seating arrangements for the people waiting outside, and a little lack of knowledge coming from the attendant (who couldn't explain the difference between Grilled Chicken and Roast Chicken) were a let-down. But the food was awesome... and it more or less, covered the loopholes well.

2013-12-06 22:27:53
Rudranil Dasgupta
905531
2.0
A place which was a extreme favorite of mine has slowly disintegrated with time. I took my father on his birthday and my experience was dissapointing to say the least. As soon we entered we were pushed to the non family section with an excuse that there were no female members. When I politely mentioned that a father and son constitutes a family it did not make any difference. I didnt want to make matters worse and went to the section mentioned. The food was worse - chicken irani kabab looked like reshmi kabab with a different name, chelo kabab no longer is the best in kolkata and fish fingers were really average. The height of the evening was a small bowl of oil soaked french fries at 100 rupees. In between the waiters managed to switch our drink orders but I found it before it was too late ;)

 Request from an earnest lover of Peter Cat -improve your standards to match your legacy. Want to come again for a better experience. Also to waiters - please stop hanging over the customers head for tips. Looks very awkward at such a classy place.

##

2013-12-06 17:12:08
Arijit Ukil
555801
4.5
The menu is a classic in Peter Cat and has managed to hold onto the same taste as it was 20 years now! If you dig around though, you'll discover its the namesake of a famous cat who lived in Lords cricket ground in London from 1952 to 1964 (and Kolkata is a city addicted to cricket). What has changed and for the better is the service with waiters ever attentive. Fish Muniar & Chelo Kebab were mouthwatering.. the caramel custard was good too...! the food is an appealing mix of Indian and continental, and the environment quirky and unique. I ordered the chicken sizzler (chicken breast, vegetables, egg, and sauce), chelo kebab and both were cooked to perfection. but very few know that this is a persian restaurant with the vintage dressed waiter serving you. one should taste Biriyani nayantara, chicken lababdar kulcha and its kababs. they have a very good selection of drinks and sweet dishes. three cheers......... Peter cat rocks

##

2013-11-21 16:46:03
Rishav Dey
193398
4.0
Be prepared to wait for a table on Fridays and weekends and sometimes even on weekdays. This place is old school and really crammed up for space but it is good. The service is not that great but some of the old waiters are really nice and warm. One thing that is certain here is good food. Always. The fried chicken livers is an item that is polished off really soon. Their claims to fame is of course the chelo kebab and the sizzlers and rightfully so. I am a small eater and hence always struggle to finish these things alone. I need at least one more person to share the same with me. Also impressive are the chicken butter masala and reshmi butter masala. The naans and parathas are decent and served in old wicker baskets covered with a cloth napkin. There is really very little to not like about this legendary place. The only complain that one might hear from time to time about places like Mocambo and Peter Cat is that their staff is a bit high handed and arrogant. That is probably because of the reputation they have developed with regards to the food they serve. Each and every time that I go here I come back satisfied and with the feeling of having bitten off more than I can chew.

I hope they do something about it soon else the food may not prove to be enough.

##

2013-11-19 00:19:23
Payel Sen
493320
5.0
Peter Cat, the one restaurant I have visited over different phases of life, from being a kid, teenager, adolescent adult to an adult, only to have the memories become sweeter and pleasant every time. I don't remember returning from Peter Cat ever without a smile on my face, tongue and tummy. 

Ambience - The smell, I love the smell of Peter Cat, it is almost like associating with one's bloodline. It is amazing how the smell has remained absolutely the way it used to be even over ten years back. They have extended the smoking zone for a long time now, and something that hasn't bothered me and thus I haven't ever taken a note of. Yes, the smoking zone seating is cramped and all that, and am sure a bit of rearrangement could do it a miracle. Otherwise, both the ground and first floor provide an extremely pleasant seating. Funny thing, I have sat as a couple, a group of three/four, in big groups, and thus occupied almost all the tables laid out in Peter Cat, and thus have particular fond memories associated with each seat. :)

Service - If you ask me about the long wait in line every time of the year, 24*7, 365 days, it is awful. But again even the wait has become stereotypical Peter Cat where everyone keeps an hour in hand or so to have their chat/coffee/ice cream sessions while waiting for their turn. I do atleast and gladly so. The staff is extremely polite, always smiling and welcoming. Even the doorman. I can almost remember him aging through the years, standing steady to slouchy now. But he has always been there with a smile to welcome one to the hungry haven of Peter Cat.

Cocktails - I had the first cocktails of my life ever at Peter Cat and thus came to know about Gin, Vodka, Whisky, Rum, etc. My favourite was and still remains their rum collins. The smell of the syrup and lemon itself here gives me a high. Peter Cat always served pocket friendly cocktails and the trend continues even now. The chanachur served by them holds no competition. Have it with the onion in vinegar and the tongue is on a roll! 

Food - My favourites at Peter Cat comprise a list, chelo kebab, beckty muniere, fish and chips, grilled fish, mixed grill, chicken steak and liver curry. I have never gone out of these items to check the rest of the menu. It is almost a matter of sanctity - Peter Cat sizzler! The waiter will first place the orange or pink paper on the table and within minutes the sizzling dish will be infront of you, making you burn your tongue for a good whole two days. :) I have had sizzlers in Peter Cat when there weren't flourishing restaurants in and around town, and never have I felt that the dish has been compromised. It is almost like maintaining and promoting the loyalty of a brand.

Peter Cat, I will visit you with my grand children, great grand children. Hold your head high, you DESERVE it!

2013-11-13 15:13:13
Abhishek Saha
326251
4.5
Good food, brilliant ambiance, decent service
There would be very few people who have stayed in Kolkata for a substantial time period and not have known of Peter Cat. A kind of royalty, this place is teeming with guests during weekends; so much so that there are hour long waiting queues just to get in. We were on a visit on Sunday night for dinner, and as luck would have had it a 40 min wait. But that didn't deter us and we waited.
Once in, the ambiance definitely impresses you. A total fine dining look and lots of small tables. We ordered chelo kebab (which is a specialty there), biriyani and a chicken side dish. The biriyani was decent but the kebabs were amazing. While they could have improved on the service (which was a bit lack lustre) but I would give the benefit since the traffic of guests was just too much. A place for visiting frequently of course.

##

2013-11-07 02:17:11
Adheesh Agarwal
657350
5.0
Zomato is the site i use the most, when ever i come back home because a huge part of my trips home is food. I do not like going to places i have been before because there are so many new places i need to go to every time i come back home.
Peter Cat is one of the few places i just have to exempt from my rule.

It is a heritage restaurant which is still without doubt the best the city has to offer. Be it the huge wait you mostly need to face to get into the restaurant to the dark and cool feel of it interiors and most of all the, oh so delicious Tandoori Chicken I dream about so often when I am in Bangalore, its all part of Peter Cat's unique and delicious experience.

Your experience starts from the doorman who is like the Secretary of The President. He gets to choose who goes in based on the no of people waiting at the tables available. Then, after entering the lamps over the circular tables always make me feel like a gangster having his daily grub. The smartly dressed and etiquette waiters add to the appeal of this magnificent restaurant .

Although everything on the menu is good the stand out dishes are - 

Tandoori Chicken - I have had tandoori chicken all over India but nothing beats Peter Cat. It is the juiciest tastiest chicken i have ever had with the the best marinate which is tangy and spicy and just percolates to the center of the   chicken. Just writing about it makes me drool.

Chelo Kabab - This is the kebab meal you should go for. The egg is perfect, the roasted tomato to die for and the Kebabs when all buttered up the closest you can get to perfection. Eat the kebabs with the egg for best taste. I always reserve the tomato for last because it always leaves a pleasant after taste.

This is the best restaurant in Kolkata and what makes it even better is that you get alcohol there. 

Overall - The place to go to enjoy beautiful Chicken and Kebabs along with a few cocktails and beers

#1 Restaurant in Kolkata for sure.

##

2013-11-04 17:43:44
Anoosha Banerjee
1371502
4.0
I think one can tell for the innumerable number if reviews and the legendary Chelo Kebab that this place is an exceptionally eating place. I was informed of this restaurant my my grandparents and how they have seen this restaurant since their childhood, loving every time they go. Hearing all the praise, I was naturally quite excited to go. 
Unfortunately, once we had arrived, we had to wait around 40 minutes to get a seat, I assume this isn't usually a problem . But just don't go during rush time or you will have to wait in the heat. 
The ambiance of the place hit me at once- and I loved it. The cozy, private atmosphere that is presented through the low dim lights sets up the scene for an enchanting Arabian night. 
However, the night again hit a bump on the road. I had ordered a prawn cocktail and found myself cringing every time I took a bit. It was much too sweet and didn't not have as much tomato as previous prawn cocktails that I have had. Also, one thing I love about shrimp cocktails is the fresh crunch of fennel, coriander, and cucumbers which was void in this dish. 
In very reasonable time., the famous Chelo Kebab was placed at our tables. I was very impressed with the colorful and elegant presentation of the dish and enchanted by the smell. Both kebabs  were were marinated and tender. It went well with the rich butter rice and the fresh cucumber and tomato. The eggs was also nice and I love how it is layer on the bed of rice. However one thing I would like to mention is not to go to Peters Cat thinking that you will had the most extraordinary dish in your life. Thou the meal was good- and I mean really good- it definitely didn't meet my super high expectation. Now this is no fault of the restaurant, but please be mindful not to go with supper high expectations, because they will not be met.

2013-10-25 08:18:52
Rajdeep Bhattacharjee
181052
4.5
This place is a legend. The restaurant is located in Park Street and is one of the most famous restaurants in the city. Over the years, every Calcuttan with an inclination towards good food has atleast visited this place once if not more. I went there with my friend (Dipak), I think this is my 50th visit to this place or may be more. The atmosphere inside is just awesome with soft dim lights, the cat shaped menu card and smells of kebabs & sizzlers all around to make your tongue tickling. We straight order their signature dish 'Chelo Kebab'. The 'Chelo Kebab' of Peter Cat is still consistently good after all these years and a favourite for most regulars in this joint. If you are a regular customer, you know what I‚Äôm talking about, but if you are a newcomer do try the Chelo Kebab (An absolute Delight). Peter cat is also known for its sizzlers. The mutton hamburger steak and the tandoori mixed grill are highly recommended. Most of their sizzlers are served with grilled vegetables or potato mash. My experience at this place has always been great. Maybe just slightly on the expensive side, but the quality of the time spent makes up for it. Highly recommended if you want to soak a bit of Park Street and a bit of Kolkata as well as enjoy good food.

##

2013-10-20 15:34:47
Priyam Chaudhury
214951
4.5
A Sunday lunch can never be better than Peter Cat. Why restrict to lunch, any meal of the day in Peter Cat is worth every penny  you spend on it. Yes , it is that good a resto. As a result, i have been there a number of times when ever possible (financially :P). But now that i have shifted my base to Hyderabad, frequency has gone down drastically. Nevertheless,  when ever i get an opportunity to come to Calcutta, i try to be here. This time, it was during the Durga Puja.
During Festivities, this place as most of us would know, is heavily crowded and so first thing one should expect is queue. Although waiting outside in the queue was quite a long time, but the wait for food (Peter cat ones) is something one should enjoy. That basically builds up the hunger and the makes the food even more satisfying.(i.e , if your a foodie! ). Anyway after a wait for half n hour, when you get to enter inside, the ambiance will definitely make up for all that you had to go through while waiting outside. The Lighting and the Decor is just perfect for any date. 

Coming to Food, i think one should go at least once to this resto to try out the chello kabab and hot sizzling sizzlers !! Like others, i can vouch for it any day at any point of time. So definitely try out the chello kabab and the chicken steak sizzler. I would not suggest mixed sizzler which would have chicken , mutton and prawns in the palette.Reason being it tastes a bit different with gravy all around, unlike the authentic steak sauce. I have also tried fish fingers here , and it goes perfectly with any beverages. 

Food is not too expensive , i would rather say it has a good value for money. Beverages , keeping in mind the resto, is also reasonably priced. 

Another plus point which this resto would offer you is it's superb and courteous service. Food may take a bit of time in being served to your table, but then again i don't mind waiting for quality stuff in that amazing ambiance. 

So to conclude, i would rate it in three sections according to their priority (top to bottom) and then overall :

Food :  5/5
Ambiance : 5/5 
Service : 4/5
Value for Money : 4/5 

Overall : 4.5/5

We also did not take up the waiter's suggestion of ordering for alcohol on the side, as we had planned for fun and drinks for later. Overall I would rate the restaurant as : 
Taste : 4.5
Quality :4.0
Ambience : 4.0
Value for money : 4.0

##

2013-10-16 12:39:56
Shankhajit Srimani
279432
3.5
Location: Just beside Park Street Music World and opposite to Park St. KFC. I have been to this place many years ago (and did not visit recently mainly due to the long waiting time at the restaurant in recent times) and was always awaiting my turn for a more recent visit. The opportunity knocked the door yesterday evening when one of my cousin took few of us out for a 
treat at Petercat... We were a group of 10 and had to wait for 40 mins approx. but barring that .. WoW !!.. the feeling and the ambiance and food... just tasted the way it was before.. PERFECT !!

Serves: North Indian / Continental

Pros:
1. Food and ambiance tasted superb.
2. Service is awesome and quite prompt even during rush periods when the capacity is full.
3. Sizzlers are lip-smacking..just awesome !!...

Cons:
1. The price tag though has not increased much, the quantity has reduced in a plate. So you might be in for a surprise, if you plan to share a plate.
2. On rush days, it can take quite a toll on your patience. Quite a bit of waiting time, but probably worth it, if you have the luxury ! Also, they need to work on some mechanism to improve the waiting time (probably prior reservations..it may be 2 days in advance (say))... a -0.5 for this.
3. Chelo Kebaba lacks the earlier and original taste. Its more of a so-so now.  .. I would have given 4.5, but giving 3.5 (-1 for this as of now) until I see them improving on the quality / variety and quantity within the chelo-kebab which used to be one of their signature dishes !!

Cost for 2: Rs. 1000 (incl. tax )

Must Try:
-------------
Cocktails / Mocktails: Cinco Pie (Vodka and Orange juice) / El Boraccho (Lemon juice with Whisky)
Starters: Prawn cocktail (just love it.. had 2 of it... me and my wife) / Fish Makhmali... one the very few restaurant serving this quality of a fish starter... excellent !!
Main Course: Dum-Ki-Raan .. this is mind-blowing stuff.. the mutton will just melt in your mouth..have it with butter naan or butter tandoori roti (don't take paratha... its not that good) and the qty (full plate) will suffice 4 people for dinner / Chicken Reshmi Butter masala (gravy item)..you can have as Kebab also / Chelo Kebeb (this has deteriorated in taste.. the Kebabs r too dry and lacks the juicy flavor, especially the mutton seekh kebabs)
Sizzlers : House Special / Roast chicken .. this is a must have.. the sizzling sound, the aroma of the wine and brown sauce and the fried cabbage base... ufff!!... you will just enj'y it :)
Desserts: Tuttu Frutti / Peter Cat's Special

##

2013-10-01 00:59:51
Tarun
1155456
5.0
Peter Cat would definitely make it to the seven wonders of Kolkata, only question being to which spot !!!!!!!!!

I remember while writing a review for bar-b-q, i was amazed at the 900 votes it had with an average rating of 4.0, but right now i have got no words for the 1173 votes for peter cat with an average rating of 4.0. This review that am writing is more of an expression of gratitude and appreciation for the amazing food and memories it has provided consistently since my childhood.

If I were to recollect one of my first restaurant visits, PC would definitely be one of the first to strike my mind. Yes i would agree i was more fond of the veg burgers with a lot of fries and those huge revolving tables on the first floor when i was a child. Though the chelo kebabs and the sizzlers took over my madness for the burgers as I grew up but never lost the love for those tables that sends me to my childhood. 

I read a few reviews before writing mine and i found three things in common viz. the amazing chelo kebabs, ok sort of ambience and rude staff. Chelo kebabs are definitely crazy. No offenses meant, but i wouldn't want them to expand or renovate coz they have been like this for years and i would love them like this for a lot many years to come. I dont find the staff rude but that may be coz i already know what am going to order even before getting my seat so i dont interact much with them.

Coming to the basics, its a not so small but compactly seated restaurant located beside the recently closed down music world of park street. The place is divided into two floors with a pretty dim sort of lighting. I would advise one to take a seat by 12 noon or 7.30 in evening else there would be some waiting to do for a seat. The staff service is decently paced but waiting time is a bit long for sizzlers. Priced at insanely reasonable levels, i could order a veg sizzler and a chelo kebab with a cold drink and bill would just be 600.  

Other than grabbing the routine chelo kebabs, mix grill sizzlers or an occasional veg steak, i love their cherry cheese pineapple sticks which has gone out of most of the menus in kolkata. After having the aforesaid, whatever little space is left in my not so lil tummy, black dal and paneer makhani with a crisp tandoori roti ensures a fully contented way back home. Cutlets with a gratin,  kebabs are also great if someone wants a variety. There are quite a few varieties of desserts which are pretty decent.

If someone visits the place for the first time, one should expect some crazy food at very reasonable prices. Chelo kebabs and sizzlers are the must tries. But yes, a grand and a royal experience may not be the appropriate way to foresee the visit. 

For me, peter cat cravings have become a part of life and see them increasing overtime instead of dying out !!

2013-09-25 17:43:38
Kumar Ritwik
13306
5.0
First things first ‚Äì Peter Cat is my favorite restaurant in Kolkata, by far. I first ended up here by accident, and since then every time I visit Kolkata I try visiting Peter Cat. It‚Äôs just a wonderful place.

Food here is positively brilliant. There are no other words for it. Admittedly, I have not been through the whole menu here, but that‚Äôs because I love a couple of their items so much, I end up ordering one of those.
1.	Chelo Kabab: I am not sure what the history of this dish is and who invented it, but these guys have perfected it. On the face of it, the recipe is too simple ‚Äì it‚Äôs basically buttered rice with kebab and sunny side eggs. But it‚Äôs this simplicity that makes it so amazing. It is surely among the best dishes I have tasted in any restaurant and the dish I actually miss a lot.
2.	The house special sizzler: Yes, it‚Äôs just a sizzler at the end of the day, but again, these guys know how to do it. I love the variety of meats that they serve, and even their vegetables are nicely done.
The ambiance is proper old school ‚Äì a healthy mix of colonial and royal. There is an attired durbaan at the gate, and attired waiters inside. Keep in mind that it can get crowded even on weekdays and you may have to queue. So be on time. And if you are ever on the Park Street in Kolkata, this is a place you must, must try.

##

2013-09-22 21:27:48
Rudhir Chaliha
1238784
4.0
Peter Cat needs no introduction indeed. Like most of us, I've been going there for years. The place has a lovely old world charm like many restaurants on Park Street and I think, even the menu hasn't changed much in the last 30-40 years. The staff are very courteous and the waiters are patient. The place is packed in the evenings and sometimes you may have to wait in a long queue to get a table. 

One thing I have always wondered about Peter Cat is how the food is always so consistent. They take tremendous effort to maintain that standard, which is amazing.  This restaurant is great for a slow meal, chatting and talking and looking at browsing through the amusing liquor menu with friends over a few beers which quite interestingly are served in old colonial tankards (*old world charm*). You have a range of Starters / Appetisers to choose from, my wife and I just love the prawn cocktail, which is prawns dipped in a creamy sweet and sour sauce served chilled in a goblet with ice underneath it. For the main course you can choose from a Indian / Continental spread, but for me it's always the Chello Kebab, which is a meal in itself. It's buttered rice with two seekhs of Mutton Kebabs and two seekhs of Chicken Kebabs with a fried egg and tomatoes. Love it ! No wonder it still remains packed even after so many years.

##

2013-09-21 15:38:45
KAUSTAV DEB
723086
3.5
Peter Cat..the name itself evokes an enigma that is pretty much beyond sane description..Located at a stone's throw from my office, I often felt the urge to explore what was there within, behind the manned doors and the embellished PETER CAT inscription.Huge crowds throng the place throughout the year and that only accentuated my urge to give PETER CAT a serious 'go'. A few months back, I could no longer hold myself back and went there for the quintessential PETER CAT experience with my cousin sisters. The first thing that caught my attention was the ambience...Dimmed- lights do make for a surreal, pristine dining experience, but in PETER CAT's case, the place is too dimly lit for it's own good.I wouldn't be surprised if two people actually  bumping into each other is a regular occurrence here, given the lack of proper illumination and less-than-adequate space. Speaking about the food, I had pre- planned that I would order Chelo Kabab without second thoughts.We ordered two Chelo kababs and one chicken smoked sizzler..The food arrived within minutes..it told me something.They always keep chelo kababs ready whch could be served instantly and that's understandable..The average Kolkatan goes to PETER CAT to have Chelo kabab..Chelo kabab is as absolute neccessity here while everything else stands at a distant second position. The food was good, the chicken kabab pieces were ripe and succulent, though the mutton kababs didn't taste all that great. The buttered rice with the 'sunny-side-up' fried egg went well with the smoked salad and kababs,and you don't exactly mind the 280 bucks you shell out for this dish.My cousin said the sizzler tasted great (sizzlers are always fabulous, aren't they?) and I was pretty satisfied with my first ever PETER CAT experience. However, there's one glaring thing about this place that I distinctly disliked- the stewards. You can discern from their demanour that they don't want you to occupy your seat for long, as there's a long queue waiting outside (which translates to meatier business prospects). As soon as you finish your meal, they instantly ask you whether you need anything more.If your answer happens to be a resounding NO, they would promptly present the bill and stand there with their eyes firmly planted on the bill book. You pay the bill and they still don't leave, their eyes still gazing at you and insinuating-"your time's up, the next set of people are waiting outside..OUT YOU GO"..I found that boorish and to a certain extent, rude. The stewards are meant to be jovial, congenial and accomodating. A smile is the least that they can effortlessly afford, but sadly, the stone- faced stewards here don't exactly tempt you to come to PETER CAT again.I would go with a humble 3.5 for PETER CAT for precisely this reason..
For me, BAR-B-Q, which is a few meters away from PETER CAT, still stands the tallest amongst all restaurants in PARK STREET..

There are long queues during peak hours on weekends and holidays and on these days, service takes time too. But at the end of it all the wait is worth it.

Peter Cat.. Though it needs no introduction since it is present from decades and is now part of the city's heritage but just for sake, it is located in Park Street near Music World and opposite KFC. But surprisingly enough, I made my first visit yesternight. I had heard a lot about it earlier and really wanted to try it but for some reason or the other, I wasn't able to. I went in with a lot of expectations, but frankly, I wasn't that impressed at all. It has this old world charm and all but the seating is very cramped and the stewards din't seem courteous at all. Then the time taken for service seemed forever. Coming to the food, It has a very limited menu for Vegetarians and needs improvement on that too. The portions were good especially the breads but the taste was ordinary. The kebabs were good to taste and so were the vegetables. The mocktails menu is very disappointing though it has a large variety of cocktails and liquors. Expect to shell out about 600 per head.

Not to be missed :

Both the veg and non veg Chelo Kebabs are outstanding.. They have hiked the price but who wouldn‚Äôt in today‚Äôs day ans time to serve quality food.. ##

2013-09-02 22:34:07
Shaan Gupta
489162
3.5
If you are new to Kolkata, have made some new friends, planning for a perfect dine-out with them and hoping to savor the most popular taste of the city, you will be left with the only choice - the Chelo Kebab in the Peter Cat!

Perhaps there is no foodie left in Kolkata who has not visited this place or tasted this particular item. A quintessential platter from their own kitchen, Chelo Kebab, serves as the main crowd-puller, and it does live up to its reputation greatly! But there are also other attractions of this restaurants. Their Fried Chicken Liver and Prawn Cocktail are the unsung heroes of the appetizers. The Fish Makhmali and the Chicken Shahi Korma taste surprisingly wonderful; most restaurants usually cook these items in a very cliche flavor. 

Apart from the North Indian cuisine, Peter Cat also houses a wide range of sizzlers, which are quite capable to provoke your taste-buds! Though I would suggest not to go for their seafood options which eventually do not include a number of varieties.

The desert section is a fantastic experience here. Most are regular items, but are evidently served with a special care in the making. The cocktail section is satisfactory but seriously needs to consider adding new varieties to the list.

P.S. The ambiance is oh!-so-fantastic, complemented with a unique course menu and a graphic cocktail menu. But be prepared for a waiting period of more than an hour if you have chosen to enter the premise at weekend/holiday!

##

2013-08-18 20:37:29
Debdutta Ghosh
1067318
5.0
Imagine, a cold night in Kolkata and you are passing through Park Street. Ultimate hunger bothers you, you stop your car and decide to have something hot, maybe Sizzlers. If this is the same situation with you can just think of one restaurant "Peter Cat". It is the first and the last word for Sizzlers in Kolkata. The restaurant is located in the food capital of Kolkata, Park Street.  Despite the restaurant is very big and has lots of tables, but you will find yourself waiting outside the restaurant for tables to be free even on weekdays. On weekends or festive occasions, a good wait of 40mins-1hr is expected. Earlier while waiting, you could roam around Music World next to the restaurant but it is now closed, so waiting would be boring. However your waiting finally pays as entering the restaurant you will find a nice essence sizzlers and kebabs in the air.

Talking about the food, I am on the same boat with most of the foodies in here. My favorites House Special Sizzler and Chello Kebab. The sizzlers available here could be quite expensive but as I said earlier, the price pays as no one in Kolkata can match the taste of such sizzlers.

Coming to the restaurant, service time is super fast and you will be served within 15-20minutes of your order. If you have ordered sizzler, keep in mind to drag your chair a bit far of the table while serving, though the waiters are extra careful but there is always a chance of hot sizzles on your face. Aesthetics wise the restaurant does good job, you have dim lighting inside the restaurant which makes up mood if you are on a date.

To sum up, I give Peter Cat a 5 star. My only wish would be if they could expand their existing branch or come up with a new branch. I believe that expanding the existing branch by a floor would be difficult as the building where Peter Cat is located was once a part of deadly fire and is still unstable from top. So coming with a new branch in some posh area will be a great idea.

##

2013-08-18 10:56:02
Unknown Foodie
45633
4.5
One of my first experiences of eating out was in Peter Cat. Over time a lot of new options have come up since but still one cannot forget Peter Cat.

Peter Cat holds back the certain colonial era "Calcutta" culture with waiters with red turbans and people managing with suited attire.  Food is still amazing - offers a wide range of indian and kolkata style continental dishes.

My favorite is of course "Chello Kebab" and "House special sizzler". Chello Kebabs are one of kind combination - rice with butter , a fried egg and melt in your mouth kebabs.  I think perfect for every pocket - each of this is a meal in itself. Have tried a few other items like Irani and Reshmi Kebabs. 

The place is worth - although I do think the place needs visually reinvent itself in a way to make it more appealing across new generation of eateries :)

5.0
Peter Cat is heritage. For any person born and brought up in Kolkata, You can't be a true Calcuttan unless you have had Peter cat's Chelo kebabs. 

But there's other delicacies too, like baked fish with tartar sauce and very very surprisingly, their chicken burger. It's one of the most expensive as well as yummiest chicken burgers I have ever had. It's big and they give a lot of fries and salad with it. Yum!

Also, the sizzzlers are good, if you don't want to be too experimentive. Peter Cat is a choice for when you want to enjoy some heritage. It's small, quaint, crowded, noisy with sizzles, with the feeling of being in another time and place.

2013-08-04 08:07:02
SUDIPTO BANERJEE
81658
4.0
This place is all nostalgia for me. I have lost count of the number of times I have visited this place with my friends and family. I still vividly remember that first time when I visited Peter Cat with my father. The Chelo Kebabs tasted the exact same way this week, as it did 15 years back on my first visit to this famed dining destination of Kolkata. The loyalty of the people coming here has not changed much even with the advent of so many new restaurants in its vicinity and throughout Kolkata.
The staff is very well behaved and friendly. Serving time is decent enough and the portions are fine too. All the Continental dishes are good to taste, though I would advise against trying out the typical Indian dishes. Special recommendations are Chelo Kebab, Irani Kebab, Chicken Sizzlers and the Chicken Stroganoff. It is a favorite hangout of a lot of people residing and visiting Kolkata. So be ready to stand in the long queue for entry.

##

2013-08-02 11:13:55
Gunjan Guha
926447
4.5
Peter Cat... "Naam To Suna Hi Hoga!!!"
This place is probably THE most popular restaurant in Park Street. People swear by the Sizzlers these guys serve. The cuisines they make are pretty awesome, to say the least. The dishes I will like to highlight are:
Mutton Shammi Kabab, Fish Makhmali, Chicken Irani Kabab, Farah, Shikar, Dum- Ki- Raan, Chelo Kabab (original), Chicken Marakesh, Nawabi, House Special sizzler, Tandoori Mixed Grill Sizzler and Fried Beckty with Tartare Sauce.

In short, food here equals to Bliss (check out the capital B).
Service is in the range of okay to good.

On the downside, one generally has to wait for quite some time outside before being able to get in. This is due to the huge rush this place meets with on a daily basis. I prefer avoiding this place during the Durga Puja since I am not sheerly fond of standing in queue. The other slight negative this place has is that it feels a bit crammed up with the tables set up so close to each other. 
But hey, anything for good food. ;-P

##

2013-08-01 17:10:47
Tamanna Dey
596560
3.0
If you have enough time to spare, and stand in Que with large number of people thronging outside.. then this is the correct place. During my college days, I remember, with friends, it was fine with us to stand  in the que and pass time talking sweet nothings..but now when you come with your family, with little ones asking when they will let you in...it becomes difficult..

We ordered two portions of chicken asparagus soup (Rs.122.00 per portion) for four of us and one plate each of tandoori prawn (Rs.370.00), roast chicken sizzler (Rs.220.00), chicken Marrakesh (Rs.270.00) and Chelo kebab (Rs.270.00), the greatest signature dish of the restaurant! For dessert, we chose chocolate souffle (Rs.120.00). While the soup was good in quantity and with right aroma, tandoori prawn had only six mid-sized species. The roast chicken sizzler was passable but the over hyped Chelo kebab was downright greasy; we rather liked the other variant, kebabs in chicken Marrakesh better. Chocolate souffle came in a large quantity to cater to famous Kolkata sweet tooth! 

Considering plus and minus.... its 3 from my side.

2013-08-01 12:59:27
Madhushree Banerjee
1058794
5.0
One of the best restaurant in town. It is a must vist place and one of my top favourite.I have visited this place 6-8 times and I was never dissapointed. This place is very famous not only because of food but the ambience, decor, service and the hanging dim lights which are also amazing. The famous Chelo kabab and sizzlers are the most common dishes which people try but kababs, fish fingers and desserts are also too good. People from different cities visit this place whenever they are in town it is so famous. But the only negative thing is you have to stand in long queues and wait for your turn to come. The servicing of food is also lil slow comparitively but apart from it no other flaws. the staff is very polite dressed in white pathan suits righly designed with the interiors of the restaurant. Do also try the mocktails and cocktails as well. Prices are on the higher side but you will never regret for spending on such great quality and super tasty food.

and yes i like the quirky drink menu too :-)
