2013-07-28 21:44:00
Dipronil Mondal
1050657
4.0
Peter Cat gives you an all Royal dining feel. "Except for the occasional visit by the Cockroach." The food here mind you is not exceptional nor is the selection. The USP of Peter Cat is that it serves as an brilliant hanging out place. Perfect for a get-together or perhaps a family dinner. It is very conveniently priced and thus can be claimed affordable. Starters here are lip-smacking but lack quantity " of course ".  The famous Chello kabab does prove to be a worthy delight. A selection of a range of liquors and an eclectic choice of cocktails is the cherry on the cake. That is particularly why I would call this one of my favourite dine-out destination.Service is good, Can't seem to complain.
Hence, if you are interested in a Royal British Indian Dining experience with authentic food, Peter cat is your place.
But again, They really need to take care of their pest issues or perhaps that is also a measure to make it a more historic experience of colonial India.

##

2013-07-07 11:46:48
Sanjana Bhattacharyya
235009
3.5
It is one of my favourites, but mostly out of nostalgia and memories than the actual food that is served now.

The iconic Chelo kebab, to put it simply, is a dish of rice, kebabs and eggs. In the past couple of years, I have had it quite a few times. But I fail to find the taste that excited me when I was a kid. Now on a whole, it is not a bad dish, but if I were to be pedantic about it, it certainly no longer deserves the hype and praise it gets. The chicken kebabs are no more tasty than the regular Chicken Reshmi Kebab you find at mid-range Biriyani places in Kolkata. The mutton kebabs have always had that same exotic blend of spices that you kind of grow tired of at the end of the meal. In fact, more than once, I had not been able to finish off the second stick of mutton kebab because after a while, the spices become too overpowering for my taste. The rice, on almost all occasions, has been not warm enough to melt the cubes of butter stuck in it and the AC fast cooled the rice further to make a very unappetizing, grainy component of the dish. The egg on top miraculously disappoints me every time! The egg yolk is supposed to be golden and oozy and the whites are supposed to be clear white, but I always get a fried egg where either the egg whites have goldened and curled up and yolk is inevitably nearly hard-boiled. I don't even know how they manage that because even in all my failed experiments to cook an egg, I have never been able to hard-boil an egg by frying! 

The sizzler, another much-hyped dish, is perhaps less of a disappointment because I don't particularly care for it. The potatoes are slathered in a sauce that has a slightly sweet taste, which I like better than mashed potatoes that often come lumpy or under-seasoned. I personally would like the carrots to be sauteed than boiled, or if they insist on serving it boiled, I think it should be boiled with a pinch of salt because it tastes really bland. I didn't like the Chicken steak and the Mutton Hamburger steak had a taste strangely similar to the mutton kebab in the Chelo dish.

The Indian dishes fail to impress. Frankly, if I crave some Indian food, I'd rather go to places which charge half the price for the dishes and give the same quality of food.

However, unlike a lot of other reviewers, their service didn't seem off for me. The waiters weren't overtly friendly, but polite enough and made suggestions that, so far, hasn't failed me.

Call me a stubbourn Kolkatan if you like, but despite all the small disappointments, I'd go back to Peter Cat, wait half an hour just to sit down with friends and family and have another Chelo Kebab.

##

2013-07-01 19:28:08
Ankur Chakraborty
434085
2.5
It was a wish nurtured for toooooo long- to have chelo kabab in Peter Cat. Since I am not basically from Kolkata, so never tasted Kolkata food much. Now when I go to Kolkata have to visit my in-laws and other relatives places, and after eating there it is really difficult to make some place in stomach for some restaurant food.
We went to Kolkata during Holi, and this time we targeted two things--one, we should go to either Peter Cat or Mocambo and two- we should go to Tengra for Chinese food.

So one fine day I went to Peter Cat for the famous chelo kabab. We went around at 8PM, and even that time also there was decent waiting. We had to wait for almost 202-5 minutes. The sad part is- there is no waiting lounge. So one had to loiter around on the street.
Ordered just one chelo kabab as had the plan of completing the next part of meal in Mocambo (more restaurants per meal  ). It came, we tasted and got disappointed. I mean, comeone, we had heard so many things about Chelo Kabab--everytime a friend visits Kolkata he/she goes to Peter Cat for chelo kabab and post that in FB. I guess Howrah Bridge and Victoria Memorial would come later than Chelo Kabab in terms of numbers of photos posted in Facebook. The huge anticipation is just blown away. It is just plain ricotto rice with a cube of butter on top, murgh malai kabab and mutton sheikh kabab in a single plate. 

My wife suggested that may be the unique arrangement was very new the time the dish was introduced and thus people went gung-ho over this. Might be. But then, on the same logic, a McDonalds meal would also be a greaaaaaaat meal, would not it?

Like to categorically mention that the taste of the dish was not all bad. It was very good. But with so much hoopla over it, thought it to be some nice innovative thing which, sadly to many people's disliking, is not.

2013-07-01 12:58:11
Harmaan Madon

2.5
tick this one off your to-do lists. really, peter cat suffers from a tendency to use a surfeit of oil and spice. balance and judgement is lacking in the food. and whatevr anyone says, stay clear of the the chello kebab.
i always eat at a restaurant at least thrice before i write a review, and peter cat has always let me down. considering i'm an optimist, i will eat there again, and i hope i'm proven wrong. 
ultimately, restaurants like peter cat rely of "afwa", similar to what makes movies like yeh jawaani hai dewaani work. if nach gaana and soppy cliched story lines are your thing, you'll love peter cat. if you want great food, well balanced flavours, and polite hospitality, you'll miss by a wide margin.

My personal favourites are the House Special Sizzler and the Tandoori Mixed grill sizzler. The taste is equally good at every visit. The place is always packed at peak lunch and dinner hours even on weekdays. So expect a waiting time of 15-20 minutes if you are visiting during proper meal hours. 

A meal for two would set you back by Rs 800 - Rs 1000 but it is totally worth it :)

2013-06-23 13:38:49
Preetom
356415
3.5
One of the most famous restaurant of park street. One has to be in a long queue before getting chance for a meal. Ambience is good. Price is high, most of the dishes costs around 250/-to- 300/-. Service is good. Mainly they use copper wares while serving, representing the Traditional Indian way of showing Hospitality.
Coming to the food, We have tried:-
Dum Ki raan : It's a spicy gravy dish, can be shared by two. The taste is good but the mutton they provide is not soft.

Tandoori mixed grilled : It's a spicy sizzler served with cooked vegetables,big tender piece of chicken, mutton sausage and egg. Taste is good and quantity is sufficient for one person.

The famous chello kebab at around 295/- : the combination of fine rice with butter, egg poach and chicken kebab gives it an awesome taste. Along with this they also provide a two strips of mutton kebab ( not very good) and salad. The quantity is less for a male bengali foodie

Given the hype that surrounds the name, I had high expectations and was completely let down. I braved a 2 hour long queue on a hot & humid Sunday afternoon to taste the venerated 'Mutton Chelo Kebab'. On my second visit, I was served a highly unseasoned 'Subz Biriyani' with similarly unseasoned paneer. On my third visit, the sizzler was okay, but I certainly have tested better sizzlers at smaller places.
It must be my bad luck that I faced such food where most people go thronging back all the times. But after three tries I have given up on this place and will never visit again.

##

2013-06-18 11:42:40
Rangan Mitra Ray
901776
4.5
This place in park street is just numero uno experience. Everytime I eat here, I just cant get enough of its contents. Each and everything is so good to enjoy here that its a foodie's delight to enter this place everytime over and over. The Bloody Mary and the Screwdriver to start are scintillating. 

The Grilled Beckti is indulgence, and the heritage of the Chello Kebab is just Persian exuberance. Your mouth gets filled with the softness of buttered rice and egg yolk, while a bite of Kakori Kebab (a part of the dish) is a fusion of old Delhi and Iran. The salad serves their role too. The Don Giovani of Mozart is just as extravagant as the Chello Kebab. And if you can, have the Roasted Chicken Sizzler with Garlic Bread. 

The menu card starts with a poem written by a foodie, enchanted by the sweet music of peter cat cuisine, which is an awesome read. Had I been that lyrical, an ode would surely have flowed down my nib. Nonetheless, my ode to it is this review, which is a standing ovation to this culinary heritage of Kolkata.

##

2013-06-12 17:55:14
Shiladitya Chatterjee
902791
4.0
This place is a legend. The restaurant is located in Park Street and is one of the most famous restaurants in the city. Over the years, every calcuttan with an inclination towards good food has atleast visited this place once if not more. The place reeks of old world charm and the interiors deserve a special mention. The burgundy leather seats, the soft dim lights and the  cat shaped menu card. Its the small details of Peter Cat which attract you. 

The food deserves special mention as well. The famous Chalo Kebab, possibly as famous as the restaurant itself is the dish to try. Apart from that the sizzlers are also worth trying. The food is definitely good and service is pretty decent.

However a few problems do exist. Firstly, the long waiting time even on sunday afternoons is a big spoiler. Car parking is another big issue. The rush of the restaurant results in a pretty overworked staff who tends to rush as well leading to a detoriation in service at times. 

Recommended if you want to soak a bit of Park Street and a bit of Kolkata as well as enjoy good food!!!!

##

2013-06-05 23:22:52
Somnath Basu
676598
3.0
Peter Cat has become too famous for its own good. Many years ago, one would go there to enjoy good food and excellent service. These days, waiting outside in queue has become the norm. The queues form so early that entry into the restaurant becomes a major challenge.

Once inside, the decor might soothe one's eyes, but use of transparent glass and the lack of blinds in front of the tables just next to the door make eating there a very embarrassing experience. It is unsettling to watch people watch you eat, being uncomfortably aware that there is a silent wave of envy directed at you for being inside the restaurant while the people outside are not.

The service during my most recent visit was very poor. A waiter came up and demanded to know what out order was. The order was taken in a most surly manner. The dishes (four chelo kebabs and one sizzler) took a fair amount of time to arrive.

Though the Chelo Kebab is well-known in Calcutta because of Peter Cat, the sizzlers are better overall. The Chicken Marrakesh, ordered once as an experiment a couple of years ago) is bad.

This is a restaurant that should only be frequented if
i. one likes waiting in queues for what is now average food,
ii. one is escorting hapless non-Calcuttans who need to see/"do" all the places Calcutta possesses, or
iii. if there is any desire to be "seen" at Peter Cat.

##

2013-06-04 00:53:29
Ritam Bhattacharya
884488
4.5
This restaurant is one of those rare species which have retained its prestige through generations. If you are foodie ( not just alcoholic ) and ready to have some continentals, it is a must visit place for all ages.
First I will tell the negative parts. The main issue with this place is you have to wait a longgg time to before you can grab a table ( mainly because of the popularity but still sometime it is very annoying ). The second thing is the behavior of its staff. They are not friendly,they are not hostile but they are just indifferent to you.The suggestions from the person who is taking your order are also not the best ones.
But all this things disappears when the food is served. Environment is cozy ( but sometimes noisy depending on the crowd ), the place is dimly lit to set the mood for beverages. The mood is actually set when the starters are served ( u know, alcohol will remain alcohol. Neither one can worsen or heighten the taste of beer or whiskey i guess ).
Start with prawn cocktail and Cello kabab ; then order a few more kababs (Fish,chicken,Mutton everything is good; also can go for continental non-veg salads with mayo and boiled vegs). After that it is sizzler time. I dont think any economic restaurant at park st area serves these good types of sizzlers. Close this whole session with TootiFrooti.
Excellent food ( with alcohol ) @ very economic price @ very convenient location - Peter Cat is one of the favorite legends of mine in this city.

##

2013-06-03 21:02:07
Ammeet Dutta
273422
4.0
This is one of the famous  trio of restaurants on Park Street that has been consistently serving delectable cuisine for a very long time in our City of Joy.The other two being the obvious Mocambo and Bar-B-Q.A quick check of the ratings of these joints on this site would reinforce my point.¬†
07-Apr-2016

Visited the joint on a dull weekday afternoon with an old friend for late lunch.Surprisingly there was still a winding queue outside.Luckily we were ushered in within a couple of minutes.Ordered the following: Chicken cocktail sausage,Black Label strong beer,butter naan,masala kulcha,nalli gosht,chicken reshmi butter masala.Service was prompt.The chicken cocktail sausage comprised of top-notch quality chicken sausages sauteed in a sauce(most probably Barbecue sauce)who knows!!It was yum to say the least.The beer was served chilled in their traditional brass mugs.

In the main course the nalli gosht was unique.It comprised of two large leg pieces of tender mutton in a mildly spicy yellowish gravy.Just perfect to go with the soft and fluffy naan and the masala kulcha.The chicken reshmi butter masala comprised of 8 cubes of boneless chicken in a thick gravy.It was awesome as well. No scope of grudges on this golden oldies of Kolkata.As has always been the case i was never disappointed earlier and neither on my current visit.Cheers!!

Well coming on to the subject of my discussion-Food, If you want to try off-beat items try out the Fish Farah Kebab (Rs 265).The pieces of fish are juicy and succulent and the fish used was of top quality. The Chicken Tikka (Rs 205) was decent enough, though nothing special.For  lovers of red meat try dishes like Mutton Shikar (Rs 240) - a kebab item, Mutton Nawabi (Rs 230)-a spicy semi-gravy dish made up of really soft boneless pieces of mutton that melt in your mouth.Heavenly indeed! Peter Cat is known for its sizzlers in Kolkata and not without reason.The Dum ki Raan (Rs 315) and the Chicken Steak Sizzler (Rs 260) was excellent. People who prefer to have bread with their sizzler can order the same but it is charged separately. The Chelo Kebab (Rs 255)- a signature dish of Peter Cat is still consistently good after all these years and a favourite for most regulars in this joint.

P.S.The reason for mentioning the prices against each item is to reinforce the point that good food can still be served at pretty reasonable prices even in today's age of high inflation. 
Cheers!!!

##

2013-06-03 18:44:43
Abhisek Kundu
399240
4.5
A person who has been to Park Street MUST have entered Peter Cat at least once. Pleasant interiors, extremely cooperative staff and superb food -  what else does a foodie want?

The well-known Chelo Kabab - the "beautiful" platter of kebabs with rice, is good and definitely worth trying out. 
But the best dish has to be the Tandoori Mixed Grill Sizzler. The waiter himself recommended it to me, and thumbs up! It is amazing. The succulent pieces of mutton, chicken, liver, shrimp and fish together are heaven for the tastebuds. Prices are very reasonable - approximately Rs.600 for two (without alcohol).

One drawback is the huge crowd that gathers outside, making you wait for a few minutes before you can get an empty table. Once you indulge in your food, a smile on your face is guaranteed.

##

2013-05-27 15:41:06
Arindra Datta
733854
4.5
Loved this restaurant since my childhood days. Even now whenever we are planning to eat out or go to Park Street, selection starts by wondering if we will get sitting space quickly in Peter Cat. Located at the corner of Music World. Waiting area is ample and partly covered. Restaurant exists in 3 parts - ground floor upon entering , accommodating both Families and Couples; Back side of ground floor mostly for stags or drinking groups; and 1st floor for families and bigger groups (generally). Food is great and they have an unique taste maintained for years . Service is courteous and even though they are the rockstars of Park Street,  they don't give you an attitude.  

Favourites include Chelo Kabab, Prawn Cocktail, Sizzlers and many more. 
Price range of food is most affordable and economic. You can have couple dinner within INR 600. Easy car parking space nearby. 

Cons : Not many,  but personally I like toilets less cramped. They have just one that too not big.

But the service has deteriorated over a period of time or was it always like this (only historians can answer). I'm visiting Peter-Cat for the last 11 years, & this is from my personal experience. The ambiance is old world, charming. Not swanky or suave. Good old Park Street kind. Thumps up for the food. Cheers!

2013-05-23 20:40:40
Udayan Das
185660
4.5
Review 2.0

LOCATION : If you Reach Music World You're there ! 

No matter how many times you eat here , you'll never ever get sick of it. Such is the pleasure of eating here.Ordered the Chelo Kabab platter but this time with Biriyani-Ala-Nawabi with a Strawberry Milkshake.The platter never disappoints.The rice,butter,egg with the kebabs is such a wholesome meal in itself. But the highlight of my evening was the Biriyani absolutely.I believe this is the only Biriyani that can rival Arsalan's Biriyani.The aroma and taste was a such a welcome difference. The quantity was overwhelming.The milkshake was good but not the best that i've had in this price range.  

AMBIANCE : This place is like the epitome of elegance and Taste. The lights with the red hues blend so well. The staff are all quite old but they are very well mannered and well dressed.My ideal place is the second table on the left hand side of the first floor.

FINAL CONCLUSION : From the moment you start eating you'll know why this place is so famous ! If you are a regular customer, you know what i'm talking about,but if you are a newcomer do try the Chelo   Kabab (An absolute Delight). This is their signature dish and for good reason. Once you eat here you're bound to get addicted. The menu is just so happening with plenty of items to choose from.The place may not be cheap but you'll never find a place better than this one to drop about 1000/- on food .Cost for 2 : 900/-. Satisfaction Guranteed.

Being one of the oldest restaurants in the city of joy, I feel it has one of the most loyal customer base. As a result you will never find the place empty. Excellent interiors and soulful lighting makes the place very attractive. But finally, what matters is the food and I must say its good. Theres a delicacy called Chelo Kabab and I feel this place is the most famous endorser of this dish. its a must have and an absolute delicacy in its true sense. The place is also famous for its sizzlers and they are a delight as well. The main point is if you have any of these two dishes for main course theres hardly any more space left to eat. I ll say that the starters are good as well. In all a great place for a foodie.

Truly Evergreen restaurant an Hallmark of Kolkata's STARRED RESTAURANT.
This is restaurant when comes to mind......only one word comes..... NOSTALGIA.......

I grew up eating in this restaurant with my family.

I do not have words to describe this Holy Hallmark of Kolkata's Restaurant......
a Truly God of Kolkata's restaurant.

So coming straight to the food.... and the best I had and always will have...
1. Chelo Kebab (original)
2. Tandoori Mixed Grill,
3. Persian Pulao 
4. Chicken Marakesh
5. Dum ki ran (first restaurant in Kolkata to inaugurate the concept of Raan)
7. Grilled Bhetki
8. Warm Brownie with Hot chocolate sauce and Ice-cream  (the first to introduce in Kolkata)
Finally Chicken Bharta ( the first to introduce in Kolkata and truly the best when it comes to nostalgia.....)


A Evergreen Timeless beauty........

Peter cat....aah, definitely among my favourites in the city. Go there, have a meal with your friends and family and you'll have to go back and visit again and again and again.....

2013-05-12 22:27:41
Mahasweta Paul
364881
5.0
The only place in the City,where you could never doubt either the impeccable service or the quality of the food that one would be served. 
I count Peter Cat to be the Ultimate gastronomic destination if you are on a budget but at the same time want a 4-star lunch/dinner. 
The Chelo Kebab : Needs no introduction. The Universal Favourite. The Universal Reccomendation.
I have one quirky suggestion though. If you have kids with you and they are fussy eaters,you could try out their French Fries. I call them Potato Wedges as opposed to Fries because not only they are juiciest that you will find any where in Calcutta but the most deliciously tender inside and the just rightly crisped outside. 
One of the desserts I generally like to end my meals with is the Hot Brownie with Vanilla Icecream and Hot Chocolate Sauce. That's an orgasm right there for your tastebuds. 
Apart from my favourites here,there is always their famous Sizzlers,of which the Tandoori House Special ranks #1 on my list.
From the Indian section,Mutton Rogan Josh paired with Butter Naan rocks too. 
Indulge Away!

##

2013-05-08 20:17:58
Nimisha99
51242
3.0
First trip to Calcutta and no time to explore the city (courtesy a friends wedding)... so we only managed to try out this highly recommended age-old joint.. it was completely packed on a Monday afternoon with about 5-10 minutes waiting time as well..

This place has a very "night-time" feeling attached to it.. extremely dim lighting with ceiling lamps hanging down all the way to the tables and slightly cramped up seating space..

The cuisine served here is Continental and Indian .. but most people seemed to be going for the Continental.. 

We tried the House special chicken steak, Roast chicken sizzler, and vegetable chelo kabab (the speciality of this restaurant).
The food was of above average taste, however, there were a few disappointments:
1. The roast chicken and the chicken steak tasted pretty much the same
2. The great part about the chelo kabab was the veg kabab, the paneer and potato were not up to the mark (but then again, I feel this dish is popular for its chicken version )

Considering the amount I have heard about Calcutta food all my life, I would not say this experience matched my expectations..

The most interesting thing though, is their drinks menu, with innovative names and even more creative and humorous pictures to go along with the names, it was definitely intriguing.. If i ever land up in Calcutta again.. I would definitely give this place (and especially the drinks) a try at nighttime!!

2013-05-01 02:29:37
Ritika Malhotra
173239
3.5
peter cat gas been a favourite of all calcuttans for a long time. One of the most popular joints on park street. Its most famous for its sumptuous chello kebab, which is buttered rise served with kebab. Its simple yet delicious. The feel of the place is very warm and cozy. Though on a busy day is bizzing with people and sometimes gets hard to hear yourself. You dont mind it due to the food.My favourite thing on the menu is its chicken steak sizzler. Their sizzlers make them legendary, like their mats say. You will not get this kind of sizzler anywhere else ans that s guarantee. Its just chicken with potatoes,a omelett and boiled vegetables on a sizzling plate on cabbage. No additional noodles or rice which is served with sizzlers in any other place. You have to just have to go to peter cat whenever in calcutta!

##

2013-04-30 14:58:44
Kshitij Talwar
124861
3.0
Visiting Kolkata for the first time, I had to visit Peter Cat for sure. This was the most talked about restaurants in town besides Mocambo, which apparently is by the same owner as this one. 

The reviews I read before walking in had already decided my order. So Chelo Kebabs and the Grilled chicken sizzler it was. Before I come to that, the waiting at the entrance was a bit of a let down. I would not have waited for 30 minutes on the street, if this wasnt one of the must-eat places in Kokata and if I wasn't a tourist. Plus, they have a pretty unorganized way of handling waiting customers. There is a suited guy standing at the entrance who just writes names (and number or people you need the table for) on a piece of paper, in a manner/order that only he can possibly understand. He then calls out names randomly, not necessarily on a first come first serve basis. We saw 2-3 groups who arrived after us, almost the same number of people as us, walk in before us while we continued to wait. And no, they had not made a prior reservation. The restaurant doesn't accept that, apparently.  

Moving on, the interiors are pretty average. Although i loved the dark and dimly lit setting, the restaurant does kind of give the impression of a very old restaurant. But that doesn't bother you. Its nice and well air conditioned (a pre-requisite, in humid Kolkata). 

What made me really happy was the variety of beer that they had on the menu, and all of it was available, including a beer brewed in Sikkim called Dansberg. While the restaurant had already earned half the brownie points from me with this, the rest of them were earned when the beer arrived. They serve their beer in metallic mugs (brass or something, i think) which have the name of the restaurant (Peter Cat) engraved on them. For me this was the effing deal maker. Loved it! I had already made up my mind by then that I was not gonna care how the food tasted. 

Coming to the food, honestly, the chello kebabs and the sizzler were nothing great. I mean, no offense, but it was nothing more than two mutton seekhs, a little rice, 1 egg and some chicken tikkas by the side! And those didn't taste too good either. Probably Kolkata lacks better Indian food options, for kebabs etc., which is what makes the people love it, but then again, maybe I was expecting too much out of them. 

All in all, besides the waiting period, the place is great. The service is quick, servers know their stuff and the variety is nice! Also, this one is a bit of a general Kolkata thing, but the restaurant is very well priced! Being used to Delhi/NCR prices, the menu comes off as a bit of a pleasant surprise. 

Although, if you are out and have time just for one lunch, I would recommend Mocambo over Peter Cat, just across the street for better tasting food and nice cocktails.

##

2013-04-29 16:53:31
Madhubani (The Glutton)
350348
4.5
Peter cat has been one of Kolkata's most popular restaurants since the 1960's. This place has red interiors with comfortable seating creating a dimly lit ambiance. The servers are dressed in traditional crisp white sherwanis with red turbans. The restaurant gets its name from a certain famous cat who lived in the Lords cricket ground sometime around 1960's. Yes, I am in love with everything about the restaurant. The food is great value for money. The cocktails here are cheaper than main course.The unique menu card is in the shape of a cat's head. 

Suggestion: They are so famous in Kolkata and infact all over India, that if they made a mascot of the peter cat, and sold merchandise, it would sell like their chelo kebab! 

You must have guessed that the chelo kebabs tops the list on their menu. Two minced mutton kebabs and one chicken sheek, served with buttered rice topped with an egg is a delight for the people of Kolkata. Prawn cocktail is my personal favourite. The sauce is tangy, perfectly creamy, with hint of tabasco and medium sized fresh steamed prawns, garnished with lime and herbs. They have a special starter menu which is served with drinks! The chicken tikka kebab and fish makhmali kebab would be my favourite. Soft, succulent well marinated pieces of meat and fish, the aroma of charcoal and tandoor make it a very appetising starter. Peter cat is known for its sizzlers. The mutton hamburger steak and the tandoori mixed grill are highly recommended. Most of their sizzlers are served with grilled vegetables or potato mash. You could get your steak, well done or medium grilled. The have options in sauces, best among them would be pepper, mushroom and bbq sauce. For a sweet ending to your meal, you could go for the banana split or a chocolate shake, or a warm brownie with ice cream and chocolate sauce. The latter has been on their menu since its inception and completes the whole Peter Cat experience. 

My experience at this place has always been great. The cons, that one may add is slow service often due to the heavy crowd. Also, they don't take reservations on occasions which is when you see a line almost upto Bistro by the park.That wasn't a bad experience either coz that is how I ended up eating at Bistro one time. Anyway, that experience is for a separate review.

Overall rating : 4.5
Pocket pinch for two: Rs 1200 (without alcohol)

Food: 4.5/5

2013-04-28 18:49:04
Somtirtha Das
348756
4.5
I seriously donno whether to write a review here, #210. Nevertheless, currently being in Chennai and missing Kolkata a bit too much now, shall dedicate one to Peter Cat !The first thing about the place, its name. I am a very feline human and hence absolutely in love with anything saying 'cat'. The second thing is Park Street. And the third one being that hour-long wait to get in. You enroll yourself, wait, blah-blah with whoever is accompanying you or with others waiting outside, take a walk around the area or explore the Music World store right beside. And then finally, its your chance and with an immense sense of joyous victory over the others, you get in :)Talking of the food its sincerely worth the wait. I have always had the Chelo Kabab platter there and that is what Peter Cat is (probably) most known for. Be it those cubes of melting butter on the rice grains or the kebabs or the poach or that slice of tomato on the side, everything seems perfect ! FYI, the food comes relatively quick for the waiting time outside and you might find the service a 'little' lagging but i guess thats okay given the rush.

2013-03-23 13:11:43
Sayak Kundu
389585
4.0
How on Earth do you review something so special??? How do you review that name which makes you hungry even after a meal? How do you refrain yourself from falling in love with this place?
The negatives first. The decor has not changed, but then does it need to if it is that much good?
The waiting, but then it is expected if you go to the most renowned restaurant in town.
The time taken to serve, but what can you do if there are so many people waiting for food. The prices, OK I agree it is high but then that's park street and probably the most selling restaurant on it. How do you match demand with supply without a high price.
The place is just awesome. The food is so good.
Try out the cold chicken and salad, the fried chicken liver and the Irani Kebab and try it along with the gentle murderer or some other cocktail.
Try out Fish Makhmali.
If you must go outside and away from the most ordered then have some Kabuli Nan along with Harem's Joy or Shah Nauz. I have as such never had biryani out here so cannot suggest on that.
Next moving on to the Continental Section from Chef's Seafood Specialties try out the Becktys, any of them .
Finally from what sells best out there the Sizzlers or the Chelo Kebabs. The Sizzlers are just awesome and House special is a must try. You can also try Chicken Steak or Grilled Chicken and you can also for a change try the Tandoori Mixed Grill Sizzler it is of course a Tandoori style sizzler but again very good.
To wind up have either a Tutti Frutti or the Peter Cat special though I love their mango souffle.
Go there and enjoy some good dining in terms of food and old charm decor but then the waiters may not be that much courteous so that is something sad and only the only reason that they do not get more marks on my review. Every other thing can be accepted considering the crowd but you need the mindful attention of the waiters.

2013-03-18 17:27:09
Sunando Banerjee
315194
4.5
Ahhh.....!!! Peter Cat!!!! Ahhhhhhhh..... Undoubtedly one of the best reasons to feel proud to be a Kolkatan. I cannot really give a complete review of this restaurant as my orders here had always been Chello Kebab and Chilled Beer. 
Two of three things to be cautious in Peter Cat and let me tell you those:
1. Avoid weekends and lunch time in weekdays. Hardly you get a sit and you might have to wait for more than an hour outside. 
2. For parking... it is nightmare. As such parking in Park Street is tough but for parking it in front of Peter Cat is almost impossible. So better you park your car at Russel Street and go there walking. 
3. If you are looking for the best of services, please avoid Peter Cat. You will not feel obliged for having them serve you but definitely not the best place to get the best service. 
4. Even if you reserve the place, you will find it difficult to get a place. On weekends they do not accept reservations. 

By the way, I remember had some other Kebab here but could not recollect that well as there was nothing special about it. But the Chello Kebab is just awesome. Have it and I am sure you will also feel the same....

##

2013-03-12 15:27:04
Bhavesh Bhatia
199538
4.5
Peter Cat, a renowned restaurant in Kolkata is a foodie's haven. You can dig into mouthwatering Continental and North Indian cuisines without emptying your pockets. Rush to this place if you are ravenously hungry, and when your taste buds crave for juicy meat, seasoned with herbs and spices! What makes Peter Cat famous among people is their succulent Chelo Kebabs, a sumptuous dish of buttered rice served hot with tomatoes, poached egg, mutton dumplings and mutton kebabs. Delicious and nutritious, this dish is enough to satiate your hunger anytime. I heard a lot about Peter Cat's chelo kebabs from my relatives and friends. This is one reason why I decided to have my lunch there one fine afternoon.
On entering the restaurant, I was greeted with friendly and courteous waiters, dressed immaculately in their uniforms. There was no need to check their menu card because I was sitting at Peter Cat to taste their lip smacking Chelo Kebabs. After about 30 minutes of placing my order, the dish arrived, piping hot emitting a delicious aroma. The tantalizing smell of the spicy kebabs seasoned with the melted butter was just too appetizing. I didn't wait a single minute and started gorging on the delicious chelo kebabs the moment they were laid on the table. 
Their Chelo kebabs are reasonably priced and it's a filling dish. Unless you are a gourmand, I'm sure you can't eat anything else after you've finished a plateful of chelo kebabs. You can also complete your chelo kebabs with their tasty pineapple blossom or a pint of beer. The choice is yours! Apart from chelo kebabs, Peter Cat is also famous for their delectable sizzlers. You can try their chicken sizzler, a perfect combination of chicken breast, vegetables and egg, flavored with sauce. I found their service efficient and prompt. But, what attracted my attention was the cute cat's head on the menu card and the funny quotes on their cocktail menu.
I'm sure I'll come back here again, but this time with family and friends if I can get a table free that is!

##

2013-03-07 15:18:04
Aditya Sengupta
560334
2.0
Once upon a time, there used to be a famous restaurant glorifying Park Street called Peter Cat. Alas, after decades of brilliant service - the once famous Peter Cat is now just another mediocre food joint amongst the many in the city.

The service, which used to be brilliant, is now sloppy.
The food, which used to be exquisite, is now run of the mill.
The ambience, which used to be unique, is now a cackle of plates and cutlery and loud voices.

Where has our Peter Cat gone?

Ordering a Chello Kabab has become a nightmare. Though the food is passably good, it is nowhere near the standard that Peter Cat used to order. At a time when Saturday night family dinner meant only Peter Cat, now - the restaurants adjacent to it are doing better. 

Prawn Cocktail. Biriyani. The second time around. Precious little had changed. 
I wish i wrote this review 2 years back. It would have been glowing with a 4.5 rating.

But FINAL VERDICT - If Peter Cat doesn't pick up the pace and doesn't revert back to what it originally was, then customers will slowly start filtering away. You can give this place a try. The old school feel definitely remains. And if you're lucky, you'll get good food on time. Here's wishing adieu to the old Peter Cat and a hopeful feeling that it resurfaces soon.

2013-03-04 13:59:42
Poorna Banerjee
2686
1.5
Rarely do I write a bad review about a place unless the food/service is atrocious. However, this time I am sort of forced to do so based on two separate occasions where I went there with people. The first time this happened was about a month back, when I had gone there with a group of four people, and one of them found a hair on his hamburger steak. We told the manager, who came in after ten minutes and gave a half-hearted apology, and took it away. The second time the plate was put in front of him, the meat was charred so bad that it was bitter. When we complained about this, the manager told us that this was the way the Hamburger was done, discounting the fact that we were not strangers to Peter Cat, and we have eaten there many times previously. 

The last time I went inside Peter Cat, I stood outside for 40 minutes before a table was empty. Given the fact that it was a Saturday night, I could understand the rush, and I waited patiently. I went in with my friend and we ordered our usual - Chelo Kabab and a diet coke. We generally eat this whenever we go, and its the standard for us. The food came after 20 minutes, with the drink, and during this time, we were not even given a glass of water. When the chelo kabab came, it was cold. The rice was stone cold, and the butter sat unappetizingly cold over it, cut in chunks. The egg was very cold and I nearly gagged. My partner complained of the same. I decided to abandon them, and eat only the kababs which were semi-edible. 

When the bill came, we realized that we have been charged not only for the chelo kabab but also for tandoori prawns and three diet cokes (we had ordered only one). We argued with the manager, and after 10 minutes, a revised bill was brought in for us. 

So Peter Cat is not a good place for me right now. They should be more attentive.

##

2013-03-01 23:58:40
Chandradeep Mallik
304854
3.5
The Good Ol' Chello!
Ambience: With small focus lightings on each table the place, on entering may seem a little dark but believe you me, it is more personal that way. And for those who grew up with Peter Cat, this is a place of nostalgia (and good food, of course!)
Service: The service is good as there are plenty of staff to handle even the nastiest weekend rush (I, personally, did not face any issue with their service till date).
Food: For this foodie and many others, Peter Cat stands for one thing and one thing only...the Chello Kebab. Six pieces of juiciest chicken reshmi kebabs and two pieces of delicately spiced mutton shikh kebabs served on a bed of mildly buttered rice and topped with a sunny-side up egg and butter, is a true delight! Though on their coasters they claim fame for their sizzlers, but this foodie is sorry to report that he may be biased towards the Chello...
Recommendations: The Chello Kebab, of course. But you can go ahead and try the sizzlers and steaks on offer. And a special mention in the desserts section, Brownie with ice cream and hot chocolate sauce! The reason? They actually care to make their own hot chocolate sauce with Cadbury's Cocoa powder (instead of the common practice of using Hershey's Chocolate syrup) which makes the sauce thicker, more chocolatey and thus, infinitely better! And they serve the hot chocolate sauce separately in a bowl to be poured over the brownie by myself makes me go weak at the knees...yummmm!

3.0
Peter Cat is one of the most popular restaurants in the city, and the long queue at the entrance proves it. Chello Kebab is a must try, and is surely the best dish among the ones I tried here. Its a complete meal, though the rice may not be sufficient for some people. Another popular dish is Chicken Steak (sizzler) which I found to be nothing special. You can also try Baked Chicken with dinner rolls (if you have already tried chello kebab, and not liked it). 

You won't find the waiters polite, but the service is quick. Ambiance is good, a little dark yet cozy. 

Peter cat makes the best Chello Kebabs, but I found nothing else here worthy of its popularity.

##

2013-02-13 21:15:38
Fari Hasan Ghosh
185248
3.5
I finally got my hands on the famous Chelo Kebab, and boy is it to die for! I have been hearing of this place way too much to wait to dine there.

I must say, from it's name and fame, the ambience is quite different. It's got a cozy, somewhat Mughlai feeling to it, which actually with the lights bright on, ain't too big a deal. Admit it! But nevertheless, it's comforting and pleasant. This point, however, might be not true for many but I personally found the interiors a little too dim for a restaurant. In fact, the light from above covers only the center part of the table. Once you're seated around a table, it's a little difficult to make out faces and in a way straining to look at your plate, the part where the light doesn't fall. Definitely not a place to take photos of you and your friends enjoying your scrumptious meals. It might not be a very bad idea if the tables, individually as it is now, were a little more intensely and widely lit.

Service on the other hand, is delightful. Prompt and very friendly people keep you cheerful while serving you good food.

Last but most importantly, the food. Chelo Kebab definitely lived, lives and will always live up to it's reputation, hopefully. Saying anything about it will be dishonoring because, the two kinds of kebabs and the butter rice together, it's heaven on a plate. Having said that, there is however another similar combo at Chawla's which I would highly recommend to Kebab lovers. Chilly Babycorn was chilly and charming, tasty just right. I tried the Chicken Steak Sizzler too which was, well alright. The chicken part was delicious, period! But veggies on the side were overcooked, soggy and not too appetizing. I am one of those who strictly hate leaving food on the plate, but unfortunately I had to leave some of those veggies behind. I anyways just got to say this, I have had better Chicken Steaks at Scoop.

It was all in all, a lovely first time experience at Peter Cat's until toward the end where I had the most spine chilling restaurant experience in my whole life! Took me completely by surprise and shook me down to the core! We had just finished our food and drinks and I headed to the ladies room to clean up. If you notice, there is a whole right under the tap in every wash basin which stops it from flooding. So, I was washing my hands when I noticed the area inside that whole was waterlogged and SOMETHING MOVED. I stopped the tap to check and found a couple of worms swimming about!

The restaurant is deeply loved by the people and has always lived upto it's reputation for decades and will do the same for many more decades to come. I'm sure this was a one time thing, just a little attention and inspection here and there is all that is needed. I sincerely request the management to look it up. Once I have come out of that eerie feeling I'm sure to visit this place many a more times.

##

2013-02-07 15:40:56
Rito
510142
4.5
If a name is ubiquitous with the ideas of dining out at Park Street and has been so for the last few decades, there is a reason for it. Peter Cat has been, and will be, for years to come, a landmark in the history of fine dining in Calcutta.

Peter Cat needs no introduction, in fact it is a reference point: you will often find people referring to other restaurants - KFC just opposite Peter Cat, or the Music World just beside it.

The moment you step inside (if you do not have a reservation during the heavy lunch hours or dinner times, chances are you will have to wait for 15 to 20 minutes - but it's totally worth it), you will be transported into another era. The royally dressed self-styled men as Pathans will welcome you into the elegant house. There are two sections - you may choose the upper floor, in terms of quality of service both are equal, but the ambience is a matter of personal choice.

Seated into the plush chairs or sofas, you now hold in your hands a gateway to a marvelous world of delicacies. At this point I would like to include, on a personal note: it is best to come here in a large group, so that you can delve into a lot of their items without having to waste any and sharing some of each.

Start off with the Prawn Cocktail - the best in Kolkata, without doubt, and Dum Ki Raan for starters - lamb leg pieces cooked to perfection on slow heat, soft succulent pieces. Try out the Minnestrone - an Italian delicacy or the Cream of hicken with Asparagus.

For the main course, first go for the Chicken Marrakesh - as a sort of trailer for the brilliance to come. The sizzlers are fantastic too, be it the Chef's Choice or the House Special or the Tandoori Mixed Grill.

The crowning glory of this place is undoubtedly the Chelow (spelled Chello here) Kebab. This brilliant Persian dish is the national dish of Iran, and Peter Cat's recipe for it is, according to their menu card, a protected regional product of West Bengal. It comes with saffroned basmati rice with a dollop of sinful butter, three kebabs and a grilled tomato served with eggs.This is the best selling dish of this restaurant, and one of the best items Calcutta cuisine has to offer. It tastes best with Doogh, a Persian drink, but this is not served at Peter Cat. You might as well go with any other beverage of your choice as long as it does not interfere with the flavour of the dish. It has a delicate, evenly balanced texture, and Peter Cat takes every step possible to ensure that it stays on top of all copycats who have tried to duplicate their recipe; and you can be rest assured that they do it exceedingly well.

Wrap up your meal with a Peter Cat Special Ice Cream.

Stick to the best of what they have to offer, and they will serve you will. However, this is not a place to experiment with dishes like overpriced naans or biriyanis that do not live up to expectations.

Peter Cat is as synonymous with the Chello Kebab as Shah Jahan with the Taj Mahal. And what the Taj Mahal is for a visual treat, Peter Cat's Chello is no less for your gastronomic experience.

Go ahead and try it!

##

2013-02-07 12:11:46
Sumon Mukherjee
513841
3.0
I was at Peter Cat last week on Friday evening and luckily did not have to wait for long before called out.

Service was prompt and good.

2013-02-06 22:47:53

2.5
I had only one evening in Calcutta. Post asking all friends and family, I chose to go eat a meal at Peter Cat. After patiently waiting for 20 mins ( I was told that patience would be required as there is ALWAYS waiting) I got myself a seat. Pleased as punch, I ordered the veg chelo Kebab. 
When it came, it looked appetizing and smelt good. One piece of tikka into mouth made me realise that the food was not even warm. I asked the waiter to please get me hot food. 10 mins later, the tikka was heated and the rest stone cold!
Armed with a resolute promise of NOT ruining my evening, I called the head waiter who whisked away my plate and got me new stuff. 
The aloo tikka was dry ( too much heating??), the chemo kebabs just did not cut the grade, the paneer I had honestly lost interest in!
After the rave reviews and much ado - it was NOT a pleasant experience. Can't help but wonder what the hype is about.

##

2013-02-05 01:12:02
Aditi Agrawal
468412
5.0
Peter Cat has no Peter and definitely no cat. It has a Mughal British feel to it. Dim lighting and cosy table/chairs. Not a very family place. It's a place where you relax with friends or take someone out on a date. Enjoy a pint of beer or two. 
I have been to Peter Cat only once. Getting a table is terribly difficult. But I love the unique name and its unique food and try my luck every time I am in that area for dinner.
Needless to say Chaelo Kebab (platter with sauteed rice/veg.s/kebab) is synonymous with Peter Cat. While you are trying the Chaelo Kebab (which everyone does) do try the vegetable gratin as well! It's delicious and creamy with a layer of cheese. 
No I don't know what Chaelo means. No I don't know why it's called Peter Cat either. I just like the place.
The service is crisp and efficient. The staffs are well dressed complete with turbans and vest coats. If you want to try the food (to review or taste) then visit during the day when it is easier to get a table.
I give this place a 5. Some like it and some don't. I like it and I suggest you to try it (:

##

4.0
Although this place is known for its Chello Kabab, I found the Chicken Mayonnaise and sizzlers to be equally awesome. While the food is always great, I wish they could be better with their service - at times the pride of being one of the oldest and best restaurants of the city is reflected in their behavior!

##

2013-01-24 13:56:42
Abhirup Chakrabarty
497149
5.0
It would have been sheer injustice had I not started my reviewing spree in Zomato with Peter Cat. There are tons of nostalgic moments associated with this restaurant that will remain etched in my memory forevermore.

This is one place where I have been a regular from childhood, the reason being that it's my parents favorite restaurant even after dining out at numerous other fine dining restaurants. The food still manages to amaze me every time I go in there. The vinegar soaked onions and achhar up front, the tasty chanachur/dalmoot to go with the drinks, mutton raan, chelo kebabs, aromatic sizzler, hah ! I can go on raving about this place for a life time.

I particularly love the decor with the dim lights and even have two favorite tables (one is a table for two and another a four-seater if I go with my full family) on the 1st floor, which the waiters are kind enough to provide me with in majority of my visits :)

The staffs are courteous and try to help you out in every ways possible. Price is reasonable when compared to similar counterparts. Only downside is the long waiting time in the cramped up space on special days & occasions. Apart from that, it will always be among the first three restaurants on my all time list.

Must Haves - Prawn cocktail, Jal Jeera , Cream Of Sweet Corn Chicken Soup, Dum Ki Raan, Mutton Badam Passanda, Chelo Kebab, Sizzler, Peter Cat Special Ice Cream.

I can simply describe this restaurant with one word "Excellent". We had visited this place on last Thursday. We were able to get a place instantly even-though the place was completely packed. Our order include some prawn and chicken started, Sizzler and a Chelo Kabab. With my experience with other places i was expecting the serving time of ~20 mins, but they had surprised us by serving the order with in 3 mins. I  think they have everything ready and they just server as soon as the order get placed. Starters were of little disappointment for me as they were cold as ice. I decided to forgive them considering the time they took to serve. Their signature chelo kabab was really good also the sizzler. They had another surprise waiting for us that is their pricing.. being from bangalore I was expecting the bill of arround 5-6K but the bill was arrounf just 2.3K for four.

Cheers to peter cat!

##

2013-01-09 15:11:18
Kuhelika Guha
285787
3.0
I'd heard a lot about Peter Cat and their signature Chelo Kebabs, and during my last visit to Cal I decided to visit this place with a friend. It was a weekend and understandably crowded, but I surely hadnt expected the queue to extend till Music World. It took us about an hour to get a table, and we whiled away the waiting time having gelatos from the kiosk on the corner and checking out novels at the street vendor right outside the restaurant.

When we were finally ushered in,  we were a little taken aback by the dim red interiors. We had expect something a little better considering the demand of the place. We were seated at the table right in the end, just outside the kitchen and restrooms and didn't quite like the disturbance caused by passerbys. It wasn't quite the beginning to the evening.

I ordered their Cassic Chelo Kabab that I heard so much about. I was served a plate of hot steamed rice with butter on top and Mutton Seekh Kababs and a sort of Chicken Malai Tikka on the side. It was a nice dish (3/5) with subtle flavors but far from the fireworks I had expected. My friend, a Cal guy, had also ordered the same dish and found it ecstatic, and for the first time I doubted if Calcutta people really knew their food.

All in all, a nice experience. One must visit Peter Cat at least once for the Chelo Kababs, but a second visit - not so much.

##

2013-01-02 17:05:57
Soumitra Biswas
215313
3.0
On an idle afternoon during our recent vacation at Kolkata, we were looking for a good luncheon option around Park Street...on being heavily recommended by my niece, we ambled towards Peter Cat. As we approached its entrance, we came across a sizable crowd all impatient to secure a table. Considering it was end December, the peak party time of Kolkata we had to wait for cool 40 minutes to get a table for four of us. 

It's high time Peter Cat does something about the ambiance...dimly lit interiors reminded me of Europe from WW II years...tradition may not always mean getting bogged down with the time warp! Maitre-d' was prompt though in taking orders, helping us out with the menu and guiding us in choosing right portions. 

We ordered two portions of chicken asparagus soup (Rs.122.00 per portion) for four of us and one plate each of tandoori prawn (Rs.370.00), roast chicken sizzler (Rs.220.00), chicken Marrakesh (Rs.270.00) and Chelo kebab (Rs.270.00), the greatest signature dish of the restaurant! For dessert, my daughter chose chocolate souffle (Rs.120.00). While the soup was good in quantity and with right aroma, tandoori prawn had only six mid-sized species. The roast chicken sizzler was passable but the over hyped Chelo kebab was downright greasy; we rather liked the other variant, kebabs in chicken Marrakesh better. Chocolate souffle came in a large quantity to cater to famous Kolkata sweet tooth!

The bottom line: people in large numbers still throng in Peter Cat as Calcuttans have a huge appetite for the legacy...the moderate price-line in a fancy place like Park Street helps too.

##

2012-12-18 18:42:15
Shinjini Chakraborty
415350
4.5
Peter Cat doesnt need a review. And the best thing is, you can never book for a secure reservation if you intend to spend your weekend evenings at this quintessential restaurant of Calcutta. It is always packed, and you need to wait with patience, a rumbling tummy and a meandering patience to ultimately get in. And the, you can have a seat. Either you can make a move up the staircase to the first floor, or settle yourself on the ground floor. As people always throng the place, the buzz, hums and murmurs are constant. You would be attended quick, because the waiters know their job well here. A faint strain of Victorian Rule still lingers here and there, and Peter Cat still manages to contain that past fervour. I like it in here. I like the ambiance, the crowd, the laughs, the giggles, the clinking of china dinner plates, the whiff of kebabs, sizzlers and everything else that defines it. Peter Cat, still, is all about food. And when it is food indeed, I would always and irrevocably be in mad love with the Chello Kebab. It is what it boasts of. And so shall it be. Apart from the patent dish, other cuisines available here are well-served and well cooked. You would have a good time. Do spend a little and crib not for this place is what you need to experience again and again. And as I said, Peter Cat doesnt need a review and a review wont matter for its ever-grande existence.

2012-12-09 17:41:22
Samit Roychoudhury
349869
2.5
I have seen the food served at this place go down. I remember a couple of years ago, the mutton hamburger steak was dry and hard and tasted of some awful Indian spice!

We visited again on 07.12.2012. Armed with coupons with a deal on their famed cello kabab from Groupon. We had to enter our name rand number in a register even before we started our meal.

We ordered a prawn cocktail to go with it. Fairly made, with largish prawns too. Wish the thousand islands dressing was a tad crisper.

The cello kabab was nothing to write home about. It was not served very warm. The three cubes of butter never did melt. The mutton kabab was not very tasty. Parts of it looked like it had been nibbled. The chicken kabab was far better looking but suffered from not being warm enough. The rice was fair. I do not recall getting a grilled tomato as displayed in the photograph.

I do not understand why these restaurants tend to sit on their laurels. Nothing very wrong with the service though. It was reasonable.

The Thums Up was excellent as always :)

A visit in April 2014. The Mutton Hamburger steak was just as Indian in taste, though seemed perhaps a little better. The accompaniments seemed better prepared. I tried a Bloody Mary, which was too watered down. The Baked Chicken with well browned cheese on top had good comfort food appeal. Harem's Joy (fabulous sounding, but turned out to be chicken in a makhani style gravy did not impress. The Chello / Marrakesh was just  like before, the mutton seekh portion of it was awful!. When will they make it better?

2012-12-01 07:14:34

5.0
Everybody knows everything possible to know about Peter Cat. Not much to update. Every Bengali knows how intricately woven Peter Cat is in their lives.  Whenever anything good happens "let's go to Peter Cat ". All we have to share is the experiences .. The sense of excitement when the House Special Sizzler sizzles its way to your table while the family two tables next to you stop their conversation abruptly to check where all the commotion is coming from. And you look at the plate in front of you to realize that you are the king, while you have that tender steak and the sausages accompanied with the bread rolls and butter.  (forget diet for one day) . And the moment when the platter of chello kebab is served to you and a wave of tsunami hits the insides of ur mouth.  With the soft and tender kebabs caressing ur taste buds, supported by the buttery rice!!!!!  And you look up at God, thanking Him,  for making life so beautiful.  I'd give 5 stars not for the food (I've already shown how much I love it) but for the Gentlemen who serve us in a very dignified 90s style and all the memories made.

##

2012-11-17 13:21:24
Yummraj
55295
4.0
YUMMRAJ Demystifies the Legend of Peter Cat & comes up with a rating of 3.75/5

In a nutshell:

A retro restaurant (not by design but coz they never changed with time) with a great ambience, old school staff, good food for the prices that they charge but nowhere as good compared to the 'real thing'- be it European or Persian.

Short Description - In case u r in a hurry:

Peter Cat has been around for decades & that speaks a lot - Restaurants open very often & close down almost as often. The ones who survive the test of time surely have something good / unique to offer.

The decor as I mentioned above is retro in today's context - red sofas facing each other & nice lamp shades above each table. The lighting is dim overall but the lamps on each table illuminate the table good enough to see each other, have a good chat & enjoy some good food. There are two floors & the way to top floor is as grand as it can get.

Waiting staff look Grand as well, with their sherwani suits, flamboyant headgear & pointed shoes. Most of them are however quite Old School - smooth talking, knowledgeable, not overtly attentive but attentive as well, not quite warm, talks with an air of authority interspersed with some rare smiles & I guess quite bored of doing the same job for donkey's years...... & that shows on their face. U will enjoy the evening if u think this to b a part of the package - dining at a retro restaurant & being served by people who r enacting the past
The food is good in general & at the prices that the food is offered, I wud say some are excellent. However, if u compare the non- Indian dishes to the original dishes the way they r, then u might b quite disappointed.

Detailed Description - In case u have the time to njoy reading:

To start, we ordered for 'Betki Muenier' from 'Chef's Special Seafood section'. There was no description of the food & hence we had no choice but to ask the waiting staff for recommendation regarding which of the dishes to choose in this section.

As soon as the food was served, we knew that it will be good. The looks were so confident. As the fish landed on my taste buds, the taste buddies got thrilled & cried out in joy. We cleaned off the full plateI guess in less than two minutes flat................awesome is the word. It turned out to b a batter fried fish served with white creamy sauce in such a way that the crunchiness of the batter was gone & it formed an even interesting texture. 

Along with the fish there were a bunch of dry spicy half potatoes - They tasted excellent as well. 

The letdown in this dish was the boiled veggies - they were overcooked & had lost crunchiness. 

I wud still give this dish a 4.5/5 inspite of the veggies being not up to the mark.

Post this we were served the Legendary Chelo Kabab - I say Legendary & it is actually. I always knew this but it got reinforced after I started my blog. Every single day loads of people reach my blog searching for 'peter cat chelo kabab'. Peter Cat claims in its menu card 'The protected Regional product of West Bengal'. I am surprised why they say so but they do.

Chelo Kabab is an Iranian (Persian) dish in which freshly made kababs are served on a bed of long grained aromatic rice. I was lucky enough to taste the chelo Kabab at different Iranian Restaurants in other countries. I was particularly floored by the Chelo Kabab at Persian Room, Arizona, USA. There the rice was like a good Lucknowi Dum Biryani sans the dripping ghee.

Peter Cat's Chelo Kabab has mid-grained steamed rice in the base but has two dollops of Amul Butter that make the rice sinfully good. However, it is unable to match the original version by a wide gap. I wud give the Peter Cat rice 3/5.

The 'Original Chelo Kabab' of Peter Cat has one set of chicken kababs & two mutton seekh kababs. There is also a mutton Chelo kabab in which all kababs r mutton. The server suggested that we go for the 'original'.

The chicken kababs that came with the Chelo Kabab were good but usual. They were not juicy, not melt in the mouth but very tasty & flavorful. Any good chicken kabab in Kababland Purani Dilli wud b juicier & softer. I wud give a 4/5 to the taste & 3/5 to the texture & hence overall 3.5/5 for the chicken kababs.

The mutton kababs were bad at texture as well - brittle, not soft, not juicy, not chewy either but quite good to taste. Flavors were very enjoyable too. I wud give this 2/5 for texture, 3.5/5 for taste & hence overall 2.75/5 for the mutton kababs.

Overall the Chelo Kabab thus wud be 3/5. However, considering that Chelo Kabab at Peter Cat is less than US$5 as compared to close to US $ 10 - 15 in most of the places I have eaten, I wud say that the Chelo Kabab at Peter Cat is a great dish to have at that price - ultimate value for money.

Sizzlers - The third dish that we had was again 'Legendary' according to Peter Cat's Table Mats.

 As we reached the page in menu card with 'sizzlers', we asked about the most popular sizzlers. We were told 'House special - Chicken Steak with sausages & liver' & we ordered the same.

The Sizzler was again very good for Rs. 250 but if judged in isolation, the sizzler was just good. Kobe Sizzlers serves much better sizzlers in India. The sauce of the sizzler was a bit confused in taste. It was not bad but not good either - just about OK. I wud say 2.5 / 5.

The chicken piece was good in terms of texture & taste. I wud say 4/5.
The sausages were very ordinary - like the kinds u can buy off Supermarket shelves. Soft & smooth in texture but lacking a character of its own (in terms of taste). I wud give this 3/5.

The liver was very enjoyable. I wud say 4.5/5

Overall I wud give the sizzler 3.5/5.

In terms of the overall food experience at Peter Cat, the rounded off score adds up to 3.75/5.

We washed down our meal with fresh lime soda Sweet & salt that failed to make a statement. It was not bad though.

I guess Peter Cat has a bright long future simply for the price-value equation that they have mastered over time. It also has a very die-hard fan following. For culinary freaks & hardcore foodies with an exposure to the 'real thing', Peter Cat might not appeal as much.

For more pics & reviews of other eateries in Gurgaon & Delhi, pls visit my blog:
www.yummraj.com

U can also visit the blog's facebook page & click the 'like' button for regular updates on new reviews:
http://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Yummraj/257363547631763

4.0
Good food is not what you eat with your heart's content. You can not content your heart with good food. No matter how much you eat, you will always want more.
The same goes for Chello Kebab of Peter Cat. Every time I have it, I want to go back again. This dish is worth the journey I have to make from my home to get there.
Good ambiance but they should upgrade their service a bit. Takes a lot of time for someone to come to your table and take the order and then again a long wait for the food to arrive.
Then again, the food is really worth it all. And that is what matters at a restaurant.

I have spend the most lovely time of childhood with my father here. And now after 26years of living..i enjoy every weekend with my would be in its gallore.

Kudos to the management. Every child should taste their Sunday Casata a delicious dessert with Icecream and cake and a concoction even God's are not aware of. And yes my personal Favourite Tutty Fruity.... Its really tutty as i almosy become dumb when i indulge into the creamy demon.....Mind Boggling.
And the Prawn Cocktail
Served in a brass cup which is layered with ice so you get the right temperature throughout the time you have it...the prawns are just ready to melt in your mouth and the thousand island sauce is chart topper....

Over all PETER CAT is where Calcutta Celebrates!!

2012-10-24 21:28:57
Abhishek Pandey
191534
5.0
Peter Cat....Here goes my recommendation...for always and for all. Probably the best restaurant in Kolkata for what it offers can be treated as non-comparable. The place is packed for most of the time, so you may have to wait outside for a moment or two.

The restaurant offers its signature Chelo Kabab and Sizzlers. I had the opportunity to taste both. The Sizzler despite the recommendations did not suit me....but I was delighted to eat Chelo Kabab. This Chelo Kabab, the National dish of Iran, is made critically perfect by them....from the Mutton Kabab, the flavored Rice, the Chicken Kabab, placement of Egg and Butter along with Grilled Tomato was just perfect. The Fish Makhmali was also succulent and tender. You should also try their available desserts.

The prices are good enough for the quality they offer, ambiance is nice and humble and waiters are well behaved, learned and do not nag at all, giving you the pleasure of eating. A must-visit altogether. This place is heavenly!!!

2012-10-15 23:04:08
Shounak Ghosh
74496
3.0
The first thing that comes to my mind with 'Peter Cat' is the sizzler. The restaurant advertise that they serve the best sizzlers and yes they really do that. The sizzlers are a classic in this restaurant be it the normal Chicken sizzler, the mixed plate of 'House special' or the fusion 'Tandoori Mixed grill'.. all of them are worth a try. My personal favorite is the 'House special'. But apart from the sizzlers there are hardly a few dish that stands apart. Another highly hyped dish 'Chalo kebab' is a let down...its just a combination of 4-5 kebabs with some butter rice...nothing special. The Biriyani is something that you  shouldn't dare trying (specially if you had it in Arsalan/Zeeshan/Shiraz etc). Among the other dishes only the Ran is something worth mentioning. The ambiance is good. The food is not very costly considering the location being park street. The service if fairly ok. On the whole a good place for dining. If you have not have the sizzlers, you should definitely try it...It is definitely the best sizzler in the town!!!!

##

2012-09-27 10:45:59
AyeBee
17038
4.0
Growing up in Calcutta, I have spent a good many years visiting this place for weekend lunches and weekday dinners. Once upon a time it was truly magnificent, but its becoming a shadow of itself... although the food is still very good, which is what should matter.

Its gotta quirky charm to itself in the way its alarmingly dimly lit and the way they use giant brass goblets to serve beer in an otherwise average Park Street ambience. Be prepared for a 25-30 min wait on weekends.

The Chello Kabab is Legen...wait for it...Dary! Besides that, the Indian main course dishes are authentic and yet not very heavy on the stomach. My personal favourites are the Barkawalla and the Shah Nauz. The naans and kulchas are to-die-for. The steaks and other conti dishes are very well prepared as well. You will be spoilt with choice thanks to the rather extensive menu.

The waiters have become old and hence a tad bit impatient and inefficient, but if you speak to them politely and about something local (Dada, Didi or football), they may show you some of their old world charm, that gave Peter Cat the reputation it has.. 

A good place for a quick meal at a very reasonable price. May Peter Cat live on to serve my grandchildren as well!

2012-09-13 14:55:59

'Chelo Kebab' goes hand in hand with Peter Cat. This is something which strikes you the moment you are reminded of Peter Cat. But moving a bit away from this I'll tell you what to try when you try to bell the Cat. 
Get yourself a cocktail of your choice. Mind you this place serves the best cocktails and there is a great variety to it. Along with it, try out the 'Chilly Chicken' Dry. You might say this is the most common side dish or most Chinese Restaurants serve better. But allow me to tell you the taste will last in your mouth forever because of the sheer difference from the other Chinese counterparts and the sheer similarity with the dish prepared at home. So simple, yet so delicious. I am literally drooling as I am writing this. Also the mutton and Chicken Liver are just mind blowing. Remember this, the next time you visit the place.

##

2012-09-01 12:07:06
Alguien
313241
4.0
Undoubtedly, one of the most famous places in Kolkata. Since I arrived in Kolkta, people have been constantly dragging me to Peter Cat. The ambience is great, always full but the crowd is quiet. The service is fast and kind, always keeping an eye on you for whatever you need. The menu is quite varied and the drinks menu with its funny names gives a different feeling to this place, which otherwise would look too serious. 
However, the food, is it that awesome? Or is just the place, being with people you enjoy being with, what makes the experience a great one? I think it's the second. I've had better food at less famous and less crowded restaurants (and cheaper). But they are not Peter Cat, I guess.

##

2012-08-30 15:05:58
Neeladri Chowdhury
305915
2.0
Highly over rated. Peter Cat is one confused restaurant. What does it serve? Indian? Continental? Chinese? Middle eastern? 
A mix and match of everything with an Indian taste in all.
It is famous for its Chello Kababs. That's it.
No other food on the menu is even worth trying.
Rude waiters, poor service.
Evenings are always crowded, and getting a seat in under 30 mins is a blessing.
Parking is a night mare and they have not yet heard of valet parking.
I am sure there are better restaurants to try out in Kolkata.

4.0
When it comes to tandoori food, cant beat the place...amazing food, just cant fault it and the quantity i feel is huge so you need to have an European appetite. Plenty of options, need to go there agn and agn to try them all. Steaks/sizzlers, baked chicken and above all their famous Chelo kebabs which is a all time fav.of many kolkata diners. 

Ambience n serivice is good, but my my you have to wait for ages to get in so best you book a table and be there on time or else wait in the queue and smell the good food!!!!

Also very reasonably priced if you exclude alcohol. So be calculative when you go there. Enjoy!!!

Do expect the service to be a little slothful, but you can expect a value for money meal at the end. Overall, I would recommend the people at least to visit this place once to make an opinion for themselves.

2012-08-07 14:03:07
Saurabh Beriwala
301701
3.0
After reading many reviews for this restaurant, all I have to say is this:

Old-school restaurant, equally old-school serving staff and stewards. 
Good sizzlers, over-priced bar menu! 
Extremely OVER-CROWDED on weekends! Tremendous waiting period if yo go in for a late-dinner. 
During weekends (atleast this is what I've experienced), if you are occupying a table just trying to have a good conversation with people in your company AND NOT ORDERING anything, the stooges or the waiters will keep coming to you and pester you to order food? 
When I queried them if they  were in a hurry to kick me out of their restaurant, THEY SAID:- "SIR, THERE ARE A LOT OF PEOPLE WAITING OUTSIDE..!!" (go figure that one?)

MOST annoyingly-hilarious fact about this restaurant is that the buggers don't allow you to celebrate a birthday/anniversary etc. by way of cutting a cake which you may have brought from outside.
Umm, no! They don't have their own confectionery that you are forced to buy from! No matter how much you plead/argue/FIGHT with serving staff & stooges, they will simply not allow you the happiness of celebrating inside their restaurant!

2012-07-20 20:53:34

5.0
Trust me you wont mind waiting for 45 minutes to get a place in this joint, because its totally worth it!!!! One of the legendary Kolkata-defining restaurant on Park Street,a meal in here will make your day! I can never have enough of their Mutton Chelo kebab, with the smooth buttery rice, well made sheekh kebabs and the other kebab which just melts in your mouth, its a dish every Kolkatan loves and every non kolkatan should try to have a never before experience! The tandoori mixed grill and the continental mixed grill will definitely give you a run for your money, the simmering platter is just irresistable with an odour which will tantalize your taste buds and make you salivate helplessly!!!!! I have never really been able to get out of these 3 selections in peter cat but the ala carte dishes are equally famed!!! For a starter the fried suasages and the prawn cocktail are my favorites ofcourse!!!! The Chelo Kebab in peter Cat has a magnetic attraction which pulls me to that restaurant once in a fortnight atleast, otherwise the going becomes difficult,its that addictive!!!! :)

##

2012-06-10 21:22:40
Sharmista Ds
181614
4.0
1. A mid priced three star restaurant
2. You get what you pay for
3. I have been going to this classic for the last 12 years for some of the same stuff
3. The mysterious chelo kabab - people either hate it or love it. Let me break it down: A simple meal of Basmati rice, cubes of butter, 4 cubes of mutton kabab, 4 cubes of chicken kabab and a poached egg, priced at under Rs 200. Quite straighforward. My issue with this item has been its inconsistent preparation over the many years I have had this. 70% of the time, over a period of 12 years, it is moist and tender, but the other 30% of the time there are inconsistencies. Also, the mutton kababs have changed from a moist style to gravy style, so I have been surprised in that regard. I have a preference for fresh tastes, and in the gravy style I found it to be spicy. Either way it was well cooked, just that I personally do not prefer spicy.
3. I love the french fries and bhekti munier (butter fried bhekti) that must be eaten as soon as it arrives.

##

2012-02-25 01:48:00
Dada
126024
4.0
Ever seen a sea of people waiting patiently every single day during mealtime in a line in Middleton Row often extending upto Park Street ? No this is not a voting booth, this is Peter Cat ! Undoubtedly one of
the city's most popular eating spots, Peter Cat provides the ideal mix of classy ambience coupled with mind-blowing food. The world-famous ( I am not exaggerating !) Cello Kebab is this restaurant's very own novelty. The pricing of the menu is reasonable and the service prompt. One thing you definitely need before planning a visit to Peter Cat : unlimited patience to see yourself through the queue. Whether you have it or not, trust me, it is worth the wait.

##

2011-12-24 13:23:27
Kumar Vaibhav Tanwar
58199
3.0
Where are we going for lunch? Peter Cat!! You always get waiting there..rush..and I found myself hurrying towards Middleton row with a bunch of over enthusiastic colleagues who wanted me to savour a meal there.

Luckily the dash got us a seat at the far corner, and I could see the victory on my companions faces. 

We ordered Chelo kebabs and House Sizzlers. The sizzlers were good but the restaurant seems to be overly enthusiastic about their veggies, too much of potato and carrots that the sausages and chicken had to be digged into. The chicken was juicy and the dish was if not 5 but 4 on the scale.

Chelo kebabs unlike other kebabs is like a kebab platter served with rice. Naah! That don't Impress me much..

The place is quite dark and old, and the seating is cramped.The tables are small. The service is not a winner too. But thats something I have got accustomed to at all places which have big names.

5.0
If i look back to the life i have lived....memories of near ones would e there,heart breaks, rejoices.And in them all one thing is common PETER Cat. This restraunt has been a witness of my life literally. My first visit with my dad that was dazzled by the exotic Mediternean flavour of the Chelo Kebab....the soft and homely smell of the melting butter lusturing the Basmati rice...and the marsh mellow soft and juicy chickens....trust me i can go on and on about it. We afternoon retreats from homework with my Grandmother was always assorted with The baked fish Peter Cat Served...and i can take an oath about it's simplicity yet it it had the thrill like a new lover...The cheese crust accompanied with the soft white sauce and fish, the herbs adding glee to every bite taken in the mouth...and that gush of the cheese melting inside....I felt the warmth of my Grandmother still when i have it there.The ambience was always known to me.from my first visit when i was 6 till day before yesterday now when I am 25.The sizzlers always remin ded me of Christmas Carrol....the gush of smoke tentalizing the taste buds...you want to eat it yet it's piping hot!!!Freshness is the key word..and the cordination of the spices and each and every flavour is better than the best Ballerinas in the world.
Peter Cat!!! I just cant think of my life without you!!!

##

2011-07-12 07:45:41
Dileep
44807
1.0
On a two day visit to Kolkata, went to this place for lunch after a friend's recommendation. Was expecting some special Bengali style food. It was just a normal fine-dine restaurant. Drinks were available and at normal prices. Food was disappointing. The supposedly famous Chole Kababs were ordered thinking it was some kind of starters only to find that is kind of Combo meal with rice and few pieces of meat. Next came Prawns in a big steel dish. Priced at around 250/ plate we thought it was a good deal. After having 4 pieces from it, found that rest were Potato Wedges :( That was deceiving. Isnt sea food supposed to be cheap in coastal areas? Okay, this an upscale restaurant, but at least they should serve a plate full of food whatever price it may be. Eat at places like Kerala and Goa if you dont understand. Finally we thought there is nothing great to expect from this place. Had few more drinks and ordered biryanis as it was nearing time for us to leave. Biryani was average, again huge potato pieces more than chicken. I dont understand this concept. Is chicken very expensive in this city? And no gravy/raitha with the biryani. When asked, the manage politely said we have to order that separately. This was the most irritating part. Ordered raitha for 100 bucks extra only to find it also has fruits in it. I have had biryanis from several places, from 60 to 600, I can say this was the worst because of their conditions. If you want a drop of curd with a biryani priced at 250 bucks, we have to spent 100 extra. I would keep quiet if this was a 5 star (even 5stars dont have such conditions nowadays), but this a just a normal hotel with good interiors. Overall, a very bad experience at this place. This was my first and probably last visit in the city. I am sure there must be great places in this city, but I missed it and felt I was taken for a ride in Petercat. I love bengali food. My favourite place for Bengali cuisine is Oh Calcutta here in Bangalore.

The whole treat starts from the point you hear the hiss of your meal approaching your way, then u sight it in its own smoky halo & as it comes closer to be plated its aroma starts flirting with u. Finally as u cut through it with the knife, u know the texture is perfect. And then it is love at first bite. Heavenly!!!
